chapter_info.chapter_name_english: Sankhya Yoga – The Yoga of Knowledge
chapter_info.theme: Krishna reveals the nature of the soul, the duty of a warrior, and introduces Karma-yoga and the qualities of a steady, wise person.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
क्लैब्यं मा स्म गमः पार्थ नैतत्त्वय्युपपद्यते ।
क्षुद्रं हृदयदौर्बल्यं त्यक्त्वोत्तिष्ठ परन्तप ॥३॥
verses.transliteration:
klaibyaṁ mā sma gamaḥ pārtha naitat tvayyupapadyate
kṣhudraṁ hṛidaya-daurbalyaṁ tyaktvottiṣhṭha parantapa
verses.translation_full: O Parth, it does not befit you to yield to this unmanliness. Give up such petty weakness of heart and arise, O vanquisher of enemies.
verses.widget_line: Give up this petty weakness of heart, O Partha; rise up and fight.
verses.personalized: Give up this petty weakness of heart, O {name}; rise up and fight.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
श्री भगवानुवाच
अशोच्यानन्वशोचस्त्वं प्रज्ञावादांश्च भाषसे ।
गतासूनगतासूंश्च नानुशोचन्ति पण्डिताः ॥११॥
verses.transliteration:
śhrī bhagavān uvācha
aśhochyān-anvaśhochas-tvaṁ prajñā-vādānśh cha bhāṣhase
gatāsūn-agatāsūnśh-cha nānuśhochanti paṇḍitāḥ
verses.translation_full: While you speak words of wisdom, you are mourning for that which is not worthy of grief. The wise lament neither for the living nor for the dead.
verses.widget_line: The wise lament neither for the living nor the dead.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
न त्वेवाहं जातु नासं न त्वं नेमे जनाधिपाः ।
न चैव न भविष्यामः सर्वे वयमतः परम् ॥१२॥
verses.transliteration:
na tvevāhaṁ jātu nāsaṁ na tvaṁ neme janādhipāḥ
na chaiva na bhaviṣhyāmaḥ sarve vayamataḥ param
verses.translation_full: Never was there a time when I did not exist, nor you, nor all these kings; nor in the future shall any of us cease to be.
verses.widget_line: Never was there a time when I, you, or these kings did not exist, nor will we ever cease.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
देहिनोऽस्मिन्यथा देहे कौमारं यौवनं जरा ।
तथा देहान्तरप्राप्तिर्धीरस्तत्र न मुह्यति ॥१३॥
verses.transliteration:
dehino 'smin yathā dehe kaumāraṁ yauvanaṁ jarā
tathā dehāntara-prāptir dhīras tatra na muhyati
verses.translation_full: Just as the embodied soul continuously passes from childhood to youth to old age, similarly, at the time of death, the soul passes into another body. The wise are not deluded by this.
verses.widget_line: As the embodied soul passes from childhood to youth to old age, it similarly passes to another body.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
मात्रास्पर्शास्तु कौन्तेय शीतोष्णसुखदुःखदाः ।
आगमापायिनोऽनित्यास्तांस्तितिक्षस्व भारत ॥१४॥
verses.transliteration:
mātrā-sparśhās tu kaunteya śhītoṣhṇa-sukha-duḥkha-dāḥ
āgamāpāyino 'nityās tāns-titikṣhasva bhārata
verses.translation_full: O son of Kunti, the contact between the senses and the sense objects gives rise to fleeting perceptions of happiness and distress. These are non-permanent, and come and go like the winter and summer seasons. O descendent of Bharat, one must learn to tolerate them without being disturbed.
verses.widget_line: Cold, heat, pleasure and pain come and go; endure them, O son of Kunti.
verses.personalized: Cold, heat, pleasure and pain come and go; endure them, O {name}.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यं हि न व्यथयन्त्येते पुरुषं पुरुषर्षभ ।
समदुःखसुखं धीरं सोऽमृतत्वाय कल्पते ॥१५॥
verses.transliteration:
yaṁ hi na vyathayantyete puruṣhaṁ puruṣharṣhabha
sama-duḥkha-sukhaṁ dhīraṁ so 'mṛitatvāya kalpate
verses.translation_full: O Arjun, noblest amongst men, that person who is not affected by happiness and distress, and remains steady in both, becomes eligible for liberation.
verses.widget_line: One who is steady in pleasure and pain, O best of men, is fit for immortality.
verses.personalized: One who is steady in pleasure and pain, O {name}, is fit for immortality.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
नासतो विद्यते भावो नाभावो विद्यते सतः ।
उभयोरपि दृष्टोऽन्तस्त्वनयोस्तत्त्वदर्शिभिः ॥१६॥
verses.transliteration:
nāsato vidyate bhāvo nābhāvo vidyate sataḥ
ubhayorapi dṛiṣhṭo 'nta stvanayos tattva-darśhibhiḥ
verses.translation_full: Of the transient there is no endurance, and of the eternal there is no cessation. This has verily been observed and concluded by the seers of the Truth, after studying the nature of both.
verses.widget_line: The unreal has no existence and the real never ceases to be.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अविनाशि तु तद्विद्धि येन सर्वमिदं ततम् ।
विनाशमव्ययस्यास्य न कश्चित्कर्तुमर्हति ॥१७॥
verses.transliteration:
avināśhi tu tadviddhi yena sarvam idaṁ tatam
vināśham avyayasyāsya na kaśhchit kartum arhati
verses.translation_full: That which pervades the entire body, know it to be indestructible. No one can cause the destruction of the imperishable soul.
verses.widget_line: Know that which pervades all to be indestructible; none can destroy it.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अन्तवन्त इमे देहा नित्यस्योक्ताः शरीरिणः ।
अनाशिनोऽप्रमेयस्य तस्माद्युध्यस्व भारत ॥१८॥
verses.transliteration:
antavanta ime dehā nityasyoktāḥ śharīriṇaḥ
anāśhino 'prameyasya tasmād yudhyasva bhārata
verses.translation_full: Only the material body is perishable; the embodied soul within is indestructible, immeasurable, and eternal. Therefore, fight, O descendent of Bharat.
verses.widget_line: Bodies are perishable, but the indwelling soul is eternal; therefore fight, O Bharata.
verses.personalized: Bodies are perishable, but the indwelling soul is eternal; therefore fight, O {name}.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
य एनं वेत्ति हन्तारं यश्चैनं मन्यते हतम् ।
उभौ तौ न विजानीतो नायं हन्ति न हन्यते ॥१९॥
verses.transliteration:
ya enaṁ vetti hantāraṁ yaśh chainaṁ manyate hatam
ubhau tau na vijānīto nāyaṁ hanti na hanyate
verses.translation_full: Neither of them is in knowledge—the one who thinks the soul can slay and the one who thinks the soul can be slain. For truly, the soul neither kills nor can it be killed.
verses.widget_line: One who thinks the soul kills or is killed does not know; it neither kills nor is killed.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
न जायते म्रियते वा कदाचि-
न्नायं भूत्वा भविता वा न भूयः ।
अजो नित्यः शाश्वतोऽयं पुराणो
न हन्यते हन्यमाने शरीरे ॥२०॥
verses.transliteration:
na jāyate mriyate vā kadāchin
nāyaṁ bhūtvā bhavitā vā na bhūyaḥ
ajo nityaḥ śhāśhvato 'yaṁ purāṇo
na hanyate hanyamāne śharīre
verses.translation_full: The soul is neither born, nor does it ever die; nor having once existed, does it ever cease to be. The soul is without birth, eternal, immortal, and ageless. It is not destroyed when the body is destroyed.
verses.widget_line: The soul is unborn, eternal, ever-existing, and is not slain when the body is slain.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
वेदाविनाशिनं नित्यं य एनमजमव्ययम् ।
कथं स पुरुषः पार्थ कं घातयति हन्ति कम् ॥२१॥
verses.transliteration:
vedāvināśhinaṁ nityaṁ ya enam ajam avyayam
kathaṁ sa puruṣhaḥ pārtha kaṁ ghātayati hanti kam
verses.translation_full: O Parth, how can one who knows the soul to be imperishable, eternal, unborn, and immutable kill anyone or cause anyone to kill?
verses.widget_line: One who knows the soul as eternal and unborn, O Partha, how can he kill or cause killing?
verses.personalized: One who knows the soul as eternal and unborn, O {name}, how can he kill or cause killing?

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
वासांसि जीर्णानि यथा विहाय
नवानि गृह्णाति नरोऽपराणि ।
तथा शरीराणि विहाय जीर्णा-
न्यन्यानि संयाति नवानि देही ॥२२॥
verses.transliteration:
vāsānsi jīrṇāni yathā vihāya
navāni gṛihṇāti naro 'parāṇi
tathā śharīrāṇi vihāya jīrṇānya
nyāni sanyāti navāni dehī
verses.translation_full: As a person sheds worn-out garments and wears new ones, likewise, at the time of death, the soul casts off its worn-out body and enters a new one.
verses.widget_line: As a person discards old garments and takes new ones, the soul accepts new bodies.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
नैनं छिन्दन्ति शस्त्राणि नैनं दहति पावकः ।
न चैनं क्लेदयन्त्यापो न शोषयति मारुतः ॥२३॥
verses.transliteration:
nainaṁ chhindanti śhastrāṇi nainaṁ dahati pāvakaḥ
na chainaṁ kledayantyāpo na śhoṣhayati mārutaḥ
verses.translation_full: Weapons cannot shred the soul, nor can fire burn it. Water cannot wet it, nor can the wind dry it.
verses.widget_line: Weapons, fire, water and wind cannot harm the soul.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अच्छेद्योऽयमदाह्योऽयमक्लेद्योऽशोष्य एव च ।
नित्यः सर्वगतः स्थाणुरचलोऽयं सनातनः ॥२४॥
verses.transliteration:
achchhedyo 'yam adāhyo 'yam akledyo 'śhoṣhya eva cha
nityaḥ sarva-gataḥ sthāṇur achalo 'yaṁ sanātanaḥ
verses.translation_full: The soul is unbreakable and incombustible; it can neither be dampened nor dried. It is everlasting, in all places, unalterable, immutable, and primordial.
verses.widget_line: The soul cannot be cut, burnt, wetted or dried; it is eternal and all-pervading.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अव्यक्तोऽयमचिन्त्योऽयमविकार्योऽयमुच्यते ।
तस्मादेवं विदित्वैनं नानुशोचितुमर्हसि ॥२५॥
verses.transliteration:
avyakto 'yam achintyo 'yam avikāryo 'yam uchyate
tasmādevaṁ viditvainaṁ nānuśhochitum arhasi
verses.translation_full: The soul is spoken of as invisible, inconceivable, and unchangeable. Knowing this, you should not grieve for the body.
verses.widget_line: The soul is unmanifest, inconceivable, unchangeable; knowing this, you should not grieve.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अथ चैनं नित्यजातं नित्यं वा मन्यसे मृतम् ।
तथापि त्वं महाबाहो नैवं शोचितुमर्हसि ॥२६॥
verses.transliteration:
atha chainaṁ nitya-jātaṁ nityaṁ vā manyase mṛitam
tathāpi tvaṁ mahā-bāho naivaṁ śhochitum arhasi
verses.translation_full: If, however, you think that the self is subject to constant birth and death, O mighty-armed Arjun, even then you should not grieve like this.
verses.widget_line: Even if you think the soul is repeatedly born and dies, O mighty-armed, still you should not lament.
verses.personalized: Even if you think the soul is repeatedly born and dies, O {name}, still you should not lament.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
जातस्य हि ध्रुवो मृत्युर्ध्रुवं जन्म मृतस्य च ।
तस्मादपरिहार्येऽर्थे न त्वं शोचितुमर्हसि ॥२७॥
verses.transliteration:
jātasya hi dhruvo mṛityur dhruvaṁ janma mṛitasya cha
tasmād aparihārye 'rthe na tvaṁ śhochitum arhasi
verses.translation_full: Death is certain for one who has been born, and rebirth is inevitable for one who has died. Therefore, you should not lament over the inevitable.
verses.widget_line: Death is certain for the born and birth is certain for the dead; do not lament the inevitable.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अव्यक्तादीनि भूतानि व्यक्तमध्यानि भारत ।
अव्यक्तनिधनान्येव तत्र का परिदेवना ॥२८॥
verses.transliteration:
avyaktādīni bhūtāni vyakta-madhyāni bhārata
avyakta-nidhanānyeva tatra kā paridevanā
verses.translation_full: O scion of Bharat, all created beings are unmanifest before birth, manifest in life, and again unmanifest on death. So why grieve?
verses.widget_line: Beings are unmanifest in the beginning and end, manifest in the middle; why lament, O Bharata?
verses.personalized: Beings are unmanifest in the beginning and end, manifest in the middle; why lament, O {name}?

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
आश्चर्यवत्पश्यति कश्चिदेन-
माश्चर्यवद्वदति तथैव चान्यः ।
आश्चर्यवच्चैनमन्यः शृणोति
श्रुत्वाप्येनं वेद न चैव कश्चित् ॥२९॥
verses.transliteration:
āśhcharya-vat paśhyati kaśhchid enam
āśhcharya-vad vadati tathaiva chānyaḥ
āśhcharya-vach chainam anyaḥ śhṛiṇoti
śhrutvāpyenaṁ veda na chaiva kaśhchit
verses.translation_full: Some see the soul as amazing, some describe it as amazing, and some hear of the soul as amazing, while others, even on hearing, cannot understand it at all.
verses.widget_line: Some see the soul as amazing, some speak of it as amazing; even hearing, few truly know it.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
देही नित्यमवध्योऽयं देहे सर्वस्य भारत ।
तस्मात्सर्वाणि भूतानि न त्वं शोचितुमर्हसि ॥३०॥
verses.transliteration:
dehī nityam avadhyo 'yaṁ dehe sarvasya bhārata
tasmāt sarvāṇi bhūtāni na tvaṁ śhochitum arhasi
verses.translation_full: O Arjun, the soul that dwells within the body is immortal; therefore, you should not mourn for anyone.
verses.widget_line: The indwelling soul in everyone's body is never slain; do not grieve for any creature, O Bharata.
verses.personalized: The indwelling soul in everyone's body is never slain; do not grieve for any creature, O {name}.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
स्वधर्ममपि चावेक्ष्य न विकम्पितुमर्हसि ।
धर्म्याद्धि युद्धाच्छ्रेयोऽन्यत्क्षत्रियस्य न विद्यते ॥३१॥
verses.transliteration:
swa-dharmam api chāvekṣhya na vikampitum arhasi
dharmyāddhi yuddhāch chhreyo 'nyat kṣhatriyasya na vidyate
verses.translation_full: Besides, considering your duty as a warrior, you should not waver. Indeed, for a warrior, there is no better engagement than fighting for upholding of righteousness.
verses.widget_line: Considering your own duty, you should not waver; for a warrior there is no better duty than righteous battle.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यदृच्छया चोपपन्नं स्वर्गद्वारमपावृतम् ।
सुखिनः क्षत्रियाः पार्थ लभन्ते युद्धमीदृशम् ॥३२॥
verses.transliteration:
yadṛichchhayā chopapannaṁ swarga-dvāram apāvṛitam
sukhinaḥ kṣhatriyāḥ pārtha labhante yuddham īdṛiśham
verses.translation_full: O Parth, happy are the warriors to whom such opportunities to defend righteousness come unsought, opening for them the stairway to the celestial abodes.
verses.widget_line: O Parth, happy are the warriors to whom such opportunities to defend righteousness come unsought, opening for them the stairway to the celestial abodes.
verses.personalized: O {name}, happy are the warriors to whom such opportunities to defend righteousness come unsought, opening for them the stairway to the celestial abodes.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अथ चेत्त्वमिमं धर्म्यं सङ्ग्रामं न करिष्यसि ।
ततः स्वधर्मं कीर्तिं च हित्वा पापमवाप्स्यसि ॥३३॥
verses.transliteration:
atha chet tvam imaṁ dharmyaṁ saṅgrāmaṁ na kariṣhyasi
tataḥ sva-dharmaṁ kīrtiṁ cha hitvā pāpam avāpsyasi
verses.translation_full: If, however, you refuse to fight this righteous war, abandoning your social duty and reputation, you will certainly incur sin.
verses.widget_line: If, however, you refuse to fight this righteous war, abandoning your social duty and reputation, you will certainly incur sin.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अकीर्तिं चापि भूतानि कथयिष्यन्ति तेऽव्ययाम् ।
सम्भावितस्य चाकीर्तिर्मरणादतिरिच्यते ॥३४॥
verses.transliteration:
akīrtiṁ chāpi bhūtāni kathayiṣhyanti te 'vyayām
sambhāvitasya chākīrtir maraṇād atirichyate
verses.translation_full: People will speak of you as a coward and a deserter. For a respectable person, infamy is worse than death.
verses.widget_line: People will speak of you as a coward and a deserter. For a respectable person, infamy is worse than death.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
भयाद्रणादुपरतं मंस्यन्ते त्वां महारथाः ।
येषां च त्वं बहुमतो भूत्वा यास्यसि लाघवम् ॥३५॥
verses.transliteration:
bhayād raṇād uparataṁ mansyante tvāṁ mahā-rathāḥ
yeṣhāṁ cha tvaṁ bahu-mato bhūtvā yāsyasi lāghavam
verses.translation_full: The great generals who hold you in high esteem will think that you fled from the battlefield out of fear, and thus will lose their respect for you.
verses.widget_line: The great generals who hold you in high esteem will think that you fled from the battlefield out of fear, and thus will lose their respect for you.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अवाच्यवादांश्च बहून्वदिष्यन्ति तवाहिताः ।
निन्दन्तस्तव सामर्थ्यं ततो दुःखतरं नु किम् ॥३६॥
verses.transliteration:
avāchya-vādānśh cha bahūn vadiṣhyanti tavāhitāḥ
nindantastava sāmarthyaṁ tato duḥkhataraṁ nu kim
verses.translation_full: Your enemies will defame and humiliate you with unkind words, disparaging your might. Alas, what could be more painful than that?
verses.widget_line: Your enemies will speak many harsh words and mock your strength—what could be more painful?

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
हतो वा प्राप्स्यसि स्वर्गं जित्वा वा भोक्ष्यसे महीम् ।
तस्मादुत्तिष्ठ कौन्तेय युद्धाय कृतनिश्चयः ॥३७॥
verses.transliteration:
hato vā prāpsyasi swargaṁ jitvā vā bhokṣhyase mahīm
tasmād uttiṣhṭha kaunteya yuddhāya kṛita-niśhchayaḥ
verses.translation_full: If you fight, you will either be slain on the battlefield and go to the celestial abodes, or you will gain victory and enjoy the kingdom on earth. Therefore arise with determination, O son of Kunti, and be prepared to fight.
verses.widget_line: If killed you attain heaven, if victorious you enjoy the earth; therefore stand and fight, O son of Kunti.
verses.personalized: If killed you attain heaven, if victorious you enjoy the earth; therefore stand and fight, O {name}.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
सुखदुःखे समे कृत्वा लाभालाभौ जयाजयौ ।
ततो युद्धाय युज्यस्व नैवं पापमवाप्स्यसि ॥३८॥
verses.transliteration:
sukha-duḥkhe same kṛitvā lābhālābhau jayājayau
tato yuddhāya yujyasva naivaṁ pāpam avāpsyasi
verses.translation_full: Fight for the sake of duty, treating alike happiness and distress, loss and gain, victory and defeat. Fulfilling your responsibility in this way, you will never incur sin.
verses.widget_line: Fight seeing pleasure and pain, gain and loss, victory and defeat as equal, and you will not incur sin.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
एषा तेऽभिहिता साङ्ख्ये बुद्धिर्योगे त्विमां शृणु ।
बुद्ध्या युक्तो यया पार्थ कर्मबन्धं प्रहास्यसि ॥३९॥
verses.transliteration:
eṣhā te 'bhihitā sānkhye buddhir yoge tvimāṁ śhṛiṇu
buddhyā yukto yayā pārtha karma-bandhaṁ prahāsyasi
verses.translation_full: So far, I have explained to you Sānkhya Yog, or analytic knowledge regarding the nature of the soul. Now listen, O Parth, as I reveal Buddhi Yog, or the Yog of Intellect. When you work with such understanding, you will be freed from the bondage of karma.
verses.widget_line: Thus I have explained knowledge; now hear of yoga, O Partha, by which you can be free from karma's bondage.
verses.personalized: Thus I have explained knowledge; now hear of yoga, O {name}, by which you can be free from karma's bondage.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
नेहाभिक्रमनाशोऽस्ति प्रत्यवायो न विद्यते ।
स्वल्पमप्यस्य धर्मस्य त्रायते महतो भयात् ॥४०॥
verses.transliteration:
nehābhikrama-nāśho 'sti pratyavāyo na vidyate
svalpam apyasya dharmasya trāyate mahato bhayāt
verses.translation_full: Working in this state of consciousness, there is no loss or adverse result, and even a little effort saves one from great danger.
verses.widget_line: On this path no effort is lost; even a little protects one from great fear.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
व्यवसायात्मिका बुद्धिरेकेह कुरुनन्दन ।
बहुशाखा ह्यनन्ताश्च बुद्धयोऽव्यवसायिनाम् ॥४१॥
verses.transliteration:
vyavasāyātmikā buddhir ekeha kuru-nandana
bahu-śhākhā hyanantāśh cha buddhayo 'vyavasāyinām
verses.translation_full: O descendent of the Kurus, the intellect of those who are on this path is resolute, and their aim is one-pointed. But the intellect of those who are irresolute is many-branched.
verses.widget_line: O joy of the Kurus, those with resolute intelligence are single-minded; the irresolute have many branching thoughts.
verses.personalized: O {name}, those with resolute intelligence are single-minded; the irresolute have many branching thoughts.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यामिमां पुष्पितां वाचं प्रवदन्त्यविपश्चितः ।
वेदवादरताः पार्थ नान्यदस्तीति वादिनः ॥४२॥
कामात्मानः स्वर्गपरा जन्मकर्मफलप्रदाम् ।
क्रियाविशेषबहुलां भोगैश्वर्यगतिं प्रति ॥४३॥
verses.transliteration:
yāmimāṁ puṣhpitāṁ vāchaṁ pravadanty-avipaśhchitaḥ
veda-vāda-ratāḥ pārtha nānyad astīti vādinaḥ
kāmātmānaḥ swarga-parā janma-karma-phala-pradām
kriyā-viśheṣha-bahulāṁ bhogaiśhwarya-gatiṁ prati
verses.translation_full: Those with limited understanding, get attracted to the flowery words of the Vedas, which advocate ostentatious rituals for elevation to the celestial abodes, and presume no higher principle is described in them. They glorify only those portions of the Vedas that please their senses, and perform pompous ritualistic ceremonies for attaining high birth, opulence, sensual enjoyment, and elevation to the heavenly planets.
verses.widget_line: Those with limited understanding are attracted to the Vedas' flowery words about rituals and heavenly rewards, believing nothing higher exists.
verses.personalized: Those with limited understanding are attracted to the Vedas' flowery words about rituals and heavenly rewards, believing nothing higher exists.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
भोगैश्वर्यप्रसक्तानां तयापहृतचेतसाम् ।
व्यवसायात्मिका बुद्धिः समाधौ न विधीयते ॥४४॥
verses.transliteration:
bhogaiśwvarya-prasaktānāṁ tayāpahṛita-chetasām
vyavasāyātmikā buddhiḥ samādhau na vidhīyate
verses.translation_full: With their minds deeply attached to worldly pleasures and their intellects bewildered by such things, they are unable to possess the resolute determination for success on the path to God.
verses.widget_line: For those attached to enjoyment and opulence, whose minds are stolen, resolute intelligence for samadhi does not arise.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
त्रैगुण्यविषया वेदा निस्त्रैगुण्यो भवार्जुन ।
निर्द्वन्द्वो नित्यसत्त्वस्थो निर्योगक्षेम आत्मवान् ॥४५॥
verses.transliteration:
trai-guṇya-viṣhayā vedā nistrai-guṇyo bhavārjuna
nirdvandvo nitya-sattva-stho niryoga-kṣhema ātmavān
verses.translation_full: The Vedas deal with the three modes of material nature, O Arjun. Rise above the three modes to a state of pure spiritual consciousness. Freeing yourself from dualities, eternally fixed in Truth, and without concern for material gain and safety, be situated in the self.
verses.widget_line: The Vedas deal with the three modes; be beyond them, O Arjuna—free from dualities, fixed in goodness, self-controlled.
verses.personalized: The Vedas deal with the three modes; be beyond them, O {name}—free from dualities, fixed in goodness, self-controlled.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यावानर्थ उदपाने सर्वतः सम्प्लुतोदके ।
तावान्सर्वेषु वेदेषु ब्राह्मणस्य विजानतः ॥४६॥
verses.transliteration:
yāvān artha udapāne sarvataḥ samplutodake
tāvānsarveṣhu vedeṣhu brāhmaṇasya vijānataḥ
verses.translation_full: Whatever purpose is served by a small well of water is naturally served in all respects by a large lake. Similarly, one who realizes the Absolute Truth also fulfills the purpose of all the Vedas.
verses.widget_line: For one who knows the Self, the Vedas are as useful as a small well when a flood covers all.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
कर्मण्येवाधिकारस्ते मा फलेषु कदाचन ।
मा कर्मफलहेतुर्भूर्मा ते सङ्गोऽस्त्वकर्मणि ॥४७॥
verses.transliteration:
karmaṇy-evādhikāras te mā phaleṣhu kadāchana
mā karma-phala-hetur bhūr mā te saṅgo 'stvakarmaṇi
verses.translation_full: You have a right to perform your prescribed duties, but you are not entitled to the fruits of your actions. Never consider yourself to be the cause of the results of your activities, nor be attached to inaction.
verses.widget_line: You have a right to duty, not to its fruits; don't act for reward, nor cling to inaction.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
योगस्थः कुरु कर्माणि सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा धनञ्जय ।
सिद्ध्यसिद्ध्योः समो भूत्वा समत्वं योग उच्यते ॥४८॥
verses.transliteration:
yoga-sthaḥ kuru karmāṇi saṅgaṁ tyaktvā dhanañjaya
siddhy-asiddhyoḥ samo bhūtvā samatvaṁ yoga uchyate
verses.translation_full: Be steadfast in the performance of your duty, O Arjun, abandoning attachment to success and failure. Such equanimity is called Yog.
verses.widget_line: Perform your duties fixed in yoga, O Dhananjaya; be equal in success and failure—such equanimity is yoga.
verses.personalized: Perform your duties fixed in yoga, O {name}; be equal in success and failure—such equanimity is yoga.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
दूरेण ह्यवरं कर्म बुद्धियोगाद्धनञ्जय ।
बुद्धौ शरणमन्विच्छ कृपणाः फलहेतवः ॥४९॥
verses.transliteration:
dūreṇa hy-avaraṁ karma buddhi-yogād dhanañjaya
buddhau śharaṇam anvichchha kṛipaṇāḥ phala-hetavaḥ
verses.translation_full: Seek refuge in divine knowledge and insight, O Arjun, and discard reward-seeking actions that are certainly inferior to works performed with the intellect established in divine knowledge. Miserly are those who seek to enjoy the fruits of their works.
verses.widget_line: Work driven by fruit is far inferior to buddhi-yoga, O Dhananjaya; seek shelter in intelligence, not in results.
verses.personalized: Work driven by fruit is far inferior to buddhi-yoga, O {name}; seek shelter in intelligence, not in results.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
बुद्धियुक्तो जहातीह उभे सुकृतदुष्कृते ।
तस्माद्योगाय युज्यस्व योगः कर्मसु कौशलम् ॥५०॥
verses.transliteration:
buddhi-yukto jahātīha ubhe sukṛita-duṣhkṛite
tasmād yogāya yujyasva yogaḥ karmasu kauśhalam
verses.translation_full: One who prudently practices the science of work without attachment can get rid of both good and bad reactions in this life itself. Therefore, strive for Yog, which is the art of working skillfully (in proper consciousness).
verses.widget_line: One endowed with wisdom gives up both good and bad results; therefore be engaged in yoga—yoga is skill in action.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
कर्मजं बुद्धियुक्ता हि फलं त्यक्त्वा मनीषिणः ।
जन्मबन्धविनिर्मुक्ताः पदं गच्छन्त्यनामयम् ॥५१॥
verses.transliteration:
karma-jaṁ buddhi-yuktā hi phalaṁ tyaktvā manīṣhiṇaḥ
janma-bandha-vinirmuktāḥ padaṁ gachchhanty-anāmayam
verses.translation_full: The wise endowed with equanimity of intellect, abandon attachment to the fruits of actions, which bind one to the cycle of life and death. By working in such consciousness, they attain the state beyond all suffering.
verses.widget_line: The wise, giving up fruits born of action through buddhi-yoga, become free from birth and reach a state beyond misery.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यदा ते मोहकलिलं बुद्धिर्व्यतितरिष्यति ।
तदा गन्तासि निर्वेदं श्रोतव्यस्य श्रुतस्य च ॥५२॥
verses.transliteration:
yadā te moha-kalilaṁ buddhir vyatitariṣhyati
tadā gantāsi nirvedaṁ śhrotavyasya śhrutasya cha
verses.translation_full: When your intellect crosses the quagmire of delusion, you will then acquire indifference to what has been heard and what is yet to be heard (about enjoyments in this world and the next).
verses.widget_line: When your intelligence crosses the forest of delusion, you will become indifferent to what has been heard and is yet to be heard.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
श्रुतिविप्रतिपन्ना ते यदा स्थास्यति निश्चला ।
समाधावचला बुद्धिस्तदा योगमवाप्स्यसि ॥५३॥
verses.transliteration:
śhruti-vipratipannā te yadā sthāsyati niśhchalā
samādhāv-achalā buddhis tadā yogam avāpsyasi
verses.translation_full: When your intellect ceases to be allured by the fruitive sections of the Vedas and remains steadfast in divine consciousness, you will then attain the state of perfect Yog.
verses.widget_line: When your mind, disturbed by conflicting scriptural ideas, becomes steady in samadhi, you will attain yoga.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
श्री भगवानुवाच
प्रजहाति यदा कामान्सर्वान्पार्थ मनोगतान् ।
आत्मन्येवात्मना तुष्टः स्थितप्रज्ञस्तदोच्यते ॥५५॥
verses.transliteration:
śhrī bhagavān uvācha
prajahāti yadā kāmān sarvān pārtha mano-gatān
ātmany-evātmanā tuṣhṭaḥ sthita-prajñas tadochyate
verses.translation_full: O Parth, when one discards all selfish desires and cravings of the senses that torment the mind, and becomes satisfied in the realization of the self, such a person is said to be transcendentally situated.
verses.widget_line: O Partha, when one gives up all mental desires and is satisfied in the Self alone, he is called steady in wisdom.
verses.personalized: O {name}, when one gives up all mental desires and is satisfied in the Self alone, he is called steady in wisdom.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
दुःखेष्वनुद्विग्नमनाः सुखेषु विगतस्पृहः ।
वीतरागभयक्रोधः स्थितधीर्मुनिरुच्यते ॥५६॥
verses.transliteration:
duḥkheṣhv-anudvigna-manāḥ sukheṣhu vigata-spṛihaḥ
vīta-rāga-bhaya-krodhaḥ sthita-dhīr munir uchyate
verses.translation_full: One whose mind remains undisturbed amidst misery, who does not crave for pleasure, and who is free from attachment, fear, and anger, is called a sage of steady wisdom.
verses.widget_line: One undisturbed in sorrow, free from craving in happiness, devoid of attachment, fear and anger is a sage of steady mind.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यः सर्वत्रानभिस्नेहस्तत्तत्प्राप्य शुभाशुभम् ।
नाभिनन्दति न द्वेष्टि तस्य प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठिता ॥५७॥
verses.transliteration:
yaḥ sarvatrānabhisnehas tat tat prāpya śhubhāśhubham
nābhinandati na dveṣhṭi tasya prajñā pratiṣhṭhitā
verses.translation_full: One who remains unattached under all conditions, and is neither delighted by good fortune nor dejected by tribulation, he is a sage with perfect knowledge.
verses.widget_line: One who is unattached and neither rejoices nor hates upon gaining good or bad has steady wisdom.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यदा संहरते चायं कूर्मोऽङ्गानीव सर्वशः ।
इन्द्रियाणीन्द्रियार्थेभ्यस्तस्य प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठिता ॥५८॥
verses.transliteration:
yadā sanharate chāyaṁ kūrmo 'ṅgānīva sarvaśhaḥ
indriyāṇīndriyārthebhyas tasya prajñā pratiṣhṭhitā
verses.translation_full: One who is able to withdraw the senses from their objects, just as a tortoise withdraws its limbs into its shell, is established in divine wisdom.
verses.widget_line: When he withdraws his senses from objects like a tortoise its limbs, his intelligence is firmly fixed.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
विषया विनिवर्तन्ते निराहारस्य देहिनः ।
रसवर्जं रसोऽप्यस्य परं दृष्ट्वा निवर्तते ॥५९॥
verses.transliteration:
viṣhayā vinivartante nirāhārasya dehinaḥ
rasa-varjaṁ raso 'pyasya paraṁ dṛiṣhṭvā nivartate
verses.translation_full: Aspirants may restrain the senses from their objects of enjoyment, but the taste for the sense objects remains. However, even this taste ceases for those who realize the Supreme.
verses.widget_line: Sense objects fall away from one who restrains, but the taste remains; on seeing the Supreme, even that taste departs.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यततो ह्यपि कौन्तेय पुरुषस्य विपश्चितः ।
इन्द्रियाणि प्रमाथीनि हरन्ति प्रसभं मनः ॥६०॥
verses.transliteration:
yatato hyapi kaunteya puruṣhasya vipaśhchitaḥ
indriyāṇi pramāthīni haranti prasabhaṁ manaḥ
verses.translation_full: The senses are so strong and turbulent, O son of Kunti, that they can forcibly carry away the mind even of a person endowed with discrimination who practices self-control.
verses.widget_line: Even for a striving wise person, O son of Kunti, the turbulent senses violently carry away the mind.
verses.personalized: Even for a striving wise person, O {name}, the turbulent senses violently carry away the mind.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
तानि सर्वाणि संयम्य युक्त आसीत मत्परः ।
वशे हि यस्येन्द्रियाणि तस्य प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठिता ॥६१॥
verses.transliteration:
tāni sarvāṇi sanyamya yukta āsīta mat-paraḥ
vaśhe hi yasyendriyāṇi tasya prajñā pratiṣhṭhitā
verses.translation_full: They are established in perfect knowledge, who subdue their senses and keep their minds ever absorbed in Me.
verses.widget_line: Controlling all the senses and being devoted to Me, one whose senses are mastered has steady wisdom.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
ध्यायतो विषयान्पुंसः सङ्गस्तेषूपजायते ।
सङ्गात्सञ्जायते कामः कामात्क्रोधोऽभिजायते ॥६२॥
verses.transliteration:
dhyāyato viṣhayān puṁsaḥ saṅgas teṣhūpajāyate
saṅgāt sañjāyate kāmaḥ kāmāt krodho 'bhijāyate
verses.translation_full: While contemplating on the objects of the senses, one develops attachment to them. Attachment leads to desire, and from desire arises anger.
verses.widget_line: By contemplating sense objects, attachment arises; from attachment comes desire, and from desire anger.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
क्रोधाद्भवति सम्मोहः सम्मोहात्स्मृतिविभ्रमः ।
स्मृतिभ्रंशाद्बुद्धिनाशो बुद्धिनाशात्प्रणश्यति ॥६३॥
verses.transliteration:
krodhād bhavati sammohaḥ sammohāt smṛiti-vibhramaḥ
smṛiti-bhranśhād buddhi-nāśho buddhi-nāśhāt praṇaśhyati
verses.translation_full: Anger leads to clouding of judgment, which results in bewilderment of memory. When memory is bewildered, the intellect gets destroyed; and when the intellect is destroyed, one is ruined.
verses.widget_line: From anger comes delusion, from delusion loss of memory; from loss of memory the destruction of intelligence, and from that one perishes.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
रागद्वेषवियुक्तैस्तु विषयानिन्द्रियैश्चरन् ।
आत्मवश्यैर्विधेयात्मा प्रसादमधिगच्छति ॥६४॥
verses.transliteration:
rāga-dveṣha-viyuktais tu viṣhayān indriyaiśh charan
ātma-vaśhyair-vidheyātmā prasādam adhigachchhati
verses.translation_full: But one who controls the mind, and is free from attachment and aversion, even while using the objects of the senses, attains the Grace of God.
verses.widget_line: Moving among objects with controlled senses, free from attachment and aversion, one attains the Grace of God.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
प्रसादे सर्वदुःखानां हानिरस्योपजायते ।
प्रसन्नचेतसो ह्याशु बुद्धिः पर्यवतिष्ठते ॥६५॥
verses.transliteration:
prasāde sarva-duḥkhānāṁ hānir asyopajāyate
prasanna-chetaso hyāśhu buddhiḥ paryavatiṣhṭhate
verses.translation_full: By divine grace comes the peace in which all sorrows end, and the intellect of such a person of tranquil mind soon becomes firmly established in God.
verses.widget_line: From grace comes the destruction of all sorrows; in a joyful mind, the intellect quickly becomes steady.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
नास्ति बुद्धिरयुक्तस्य न चायुक्तस्य भावना ।
न चाभावयतः शान्तिरशान्तस्य कुतः सुखम् ॥६६॥
verses.transliteration:
nāsti buddhir-ayuktasya na chāyuktasya bhāvanā
na chābhāvayataḥ śhāntir aśhāntasya kutaḥ sukham
verses.translation_full: But an undisciplined person, who has not controlled the mind and senses, can neither have a resolute intellect nor steady contemplation on God. For one who never unites the mind with God there is no peace; and how can one who lacks peace be happy?
verses.widget_line: For one without self-control there is no wisdom or meditation; without peace, how can there be happiness?

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
इन्द्रियाणां हि चरतां यन्मनोऽनुविधीयते ।
तदस्य हरति प्रज्ञां वायुर्नावमिवाम्भसि ॥६७॥
verses.transliteration:
indriyāṇāṁ hi charatāṁ yan mano 'nuvidhīyate
tadasya harati prajñāṁ vāyur nāvam ivāmbhasi
verses.translation_full: Just as a strong wind sweeps a boat off its chartered course on the water, even one of the senses on which the mind focuses can lead the intellect astray.
verses.widget_line: As wind sweeps away a boat on water, so even one wandering sense carries away the mind.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
तस्माद्यस्य महाबाहो निगृहीतानि सर्वशः ।
इन्द्रियाणीन्द्रियार्थेभ्यस्तस्य प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठिता ॥६८॥
verses.transliteration:
tasmād yasya mahā-bāho nigṛihītāni sarvaśhaḥ
indriyāṇīndriyārthebhyas tasya prajñā pratiṣhṭhitā
verses.translation_full: Therefore, one who has restrained the senses from their objects, O mighty armed Arjun, is firmly established in transcendental knowledge.
verses.widget_line: Therefore, O mighty-armed Arjun, one whose senses are completely restrained from objects has steady wisdom.
verses.personalized: Therefore, O {name}, one whose senses are completely restrained from objects has steady wisdom.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
या निशा सर्वभूतानां तस्यां जागर्ति संयमी ।
यस्यां जाग्रति भूतानि सा निशा पश्यतो मुनेः ॥६९॥
verses.transliteration:
yā niśhā sarva-bhūtānāṁ tasyāṁ jāgarti sanyamī
yasyāṁ jāgrati bhūtāni sā niśhā paśhyato muneḥ
verses.translation_full: What all beings consider as day is the night of ignorance for the wise, and what all creatures see as night is the day for the introspective sage.
verses.widget_line: What is night for all beings is day for the self-controlled; what is day for them is night for the sage.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
आपूर्यमाणमचलप्रतिष्ठं
समुद्रमापः प्रविशन्ति यद्वत् ।
तद्वत्कामा यं प्रविशन्ति सर्वे
स शान्तिमाप्नोति न कामकामी ॥७०॥
verses.transliteration:
āpūryamāṇam achala-pratiṣhṭhaṁ
samudram āpaḥ praviśhanti yadvat
tadvat kāmā yaṁ praviśhanti sarve
sa śhāntim āpnoti na kāma-kāmī
verses.translation_full: Just as the ocean remains undisturbed by the incessant flow of waters from rivers merging into it, likewise the sage who is unmoved despite the flow of desirable objects all around him attains peace, and not the person who strives to satisfy desires.
verses.widget_line: As the ocean remains calm despite rivers flowing into it, the sage undisturbed by desires finds peace.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
विहाय कामान्यः सर्वान्पुमांश्चरति निःस्पृहः ।
निर्ममो निरहङ्कारः स शान्तिमधिगच्छति ॥७१॥
verses.transliteration:
vihāya kāmān yaḥ sarvān pumānśh charati niḥspṛihaḥ
nirmamo nirahankāraḥ sa śhāntim adhigachchhati
verses.translation_full: That person, who gives up all material desires and lives free from a sense of greed, proprietorship, and egoism, attains perfect peace.
verses.widget_line: One who abandons all desires, moves without lust, and is free from possessiveness and ego attains peace.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
एषा ब्राह्मी स्थितिः पार्थ नैनां प्राप्य विमुह्यति ।
स्थित्वास्यामन्तकालेऽपि ब्रह्मनिर्वाणमृच्छति ॥७२॥
verses.transliteration:
eṣhā brāhmī sthitiḥ pārtha naināṁ prāpya vimuhyati
sthitvāsyām anta-kāle 'pi brahma-nirvāṇam ṛichchhati
verses.translation_full: O Parth, such is the state of an enlightened soul that having attained it, one is never again deluded. Being established in this consciousness even at the hour of death, one is liberated from the cycle of life and death and reaches the Supreme Abode of God.
verses.widget_line: O Parth, this is the state of brahman; attaining it, one is never deluded. Fixed in it at death, one attains liberation.
verses.personalized: O {name}, this is the state of brahman; attaining it, one is never deluded. Fixed in it at death, one attains liberation.

chapter_info.chapter_name_english: Karma Yoga – The Yoga of Action
chapter_info.theme: Krishna explains the importance of performing one's duty without attachment to results, emphasizing selfless action and the path of Karma Yoga.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
श्री भगवानुवाच
लोकेऽस्मिन्द्विविधा निष्ठा पुरा प्रोक्ता मयानघ ।
ज्ञानयोगेन साङ्ख्यानां कर्मयोगेन योगिनाम् ॥३॥
verses.transliteration:
śhrī bhagavān uvācha
loke 'smin dvividhā niṣhṭhā purā proktā mayānagha
jñāna-yogena sāṅkhyānāṁ karma-yogena yoginām
verses.translation_full: The Supreme Lord said: O sinless one, the two paths leading to enlightenment were previously explained by Me: the path of knowledge, for those inclined toward contemplation, and the path of work for those inclined toward action.
verses.widget_line: O sinless one, there are two paths: knowledge for the contemplative, and action for the active.
verses.personalized: O {name}, there are two paths: knowledge for the contemplative, and action for the active.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
न कर्मणामनारम्भान्नैष्कर्म्यं पुरुषोऽश्नुते ।
न च सन्न्यसनादेव सिद्धिं समधिगच्छति ॥४॥
verses.transliteration:
na karmaṇām anārambhān naiṣhkarmyaṁ puruṣho 'śhnute
na cha sannyasanād eva siddhiṁ samadhigachchhati
verses.translation_full: One cannot achieve freedom from karmic reactions by merely abstaining from work, nor can one attain perfection of knowledge by mere physical renunciation.
verses.widget_line: One cannot achieve freedom from work without work, nor perfection by mere renunciation.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
न हि कश्चित्क्षणमपि जातु तिष्ठत्यकर्मकृत् ।
कार्यते ह्यशः कर्म सर्वः प्रकृतिजैर्गुणैः ॥५॥
verses.transliteration:
na hi kaśhchit kṣhaṇam api jātu tiṣhṭhaty akarmakṛit
kāryate hyavaśhaḥ karma sarvaḥ prakṛiti-jair guṇaiḥ
verses.translation_full: There is no one who can remain without action even for a moment. Indeed, all beings are compelled to act by their qualities born of material nature (the three guṇas).
verses.widget_line: No one can remain without action even for a moment; everyone is forced to act by material nature.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
निराशीर्यतचित्तात्मा त्यक्तसर्वपरिग्रहः ।
शारीरं केवलं कर्म कुर्वन्नाप्नोति किल्बिषम् ॥६॥
verses.transliteration:
nirāśhīr yata-chittātmā tyakta-sarva-parigrahaḥ
śharīraṁ kevalaṁ karma kurvan nāpnoti kilbiṣham
verses.translation_full: Those who restrain the external organs of action, while continuing to dwell on sense objects in the mind, certainly delude themselves and are to be called hypocrites.
verses.widget_line: One who restrains the senses but dwells on sense objects is a pretender.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यस्त्विन्द्रियाणि मनसा नियम्यारभतेऽर्जुन ।
कर्मेन्द्रियैः कर्मयोगमसक्तः स विशिष्यते ॥७॥
verses.transliteration:
yas tv indriyāṇi manasā niyamyārabhate 'rjuna
karmendriyaiḥ karma-yogam asaktaḥ sa viśiṣyate
verses.translation_full: But those karm yogis who control their knowledge senses with the mind, O Arjun, and engage the working senses in working without attachment, are certainly superior.
verses.widget_line: O Arjuna, one who restrains the senses by the mind and acts without attachment excels.
verses.personalized: O {name}, one who restrains the senses by the mind and acts without attachment excels.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
नियतं कुरु कर्म त्वं कर्म ज्यायो ह्यकर्मणः ।
शरीरयात्रापि च ते न प्रसिद्ध्येदकर्मणः ॥८॥
verses.transliteration:
niyataṁ kuru karma tvaṁ karma jyāyo hy akarmaṇaḥ
śarīra-yātrāpi ca te na prasiddhyed akarmaṇaḥ
verses.translation_full: You should thus perform your prescribed Vedic duties, since action is superior to inaction. By ceasing activity, even your bodily maintenance will not be possible.
verses.widget_line: Perform your duty, for action is better than inaction; even the body cannot be maintained without action.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यज्ञार्थात्कर्मणोऽन्यत्र लोकोऽयं कर्मबन्धनः ।
तदर्थं कर्म कौन्तेय मुक्तसङ्गः समाचर ॥९॥
verses.transliteration:
yajñārthāt karmaṇo 'nyatra loko 'yaṁ karma-bandhanaḥ
tad-arthaṁ karma kaunteya mukta-saṅgaḥ samācara
verses.translation_full: Work must be done as a yajna to the Supreme Lord; otherwise, work causes bondage in this material world. Therefore, O son of Kunti, for the satisfaction of God, perform your prescribed duties, without being attached to the results.
verses.widget_line: The world is bound by actions; therefore, O son of Kunti, perform action for sacrifice, free from attachment.
verses.personalized: The world is bound by actions; therefore, O {name}, perform action for sacrifice, free from attachment.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
सहयज्ञाः प्रजाः सृष्ट्वा पुरोवाच प्रजापतिः ।
अनेन प्रसविष्यध्वमेष वोऽस्त्विष्टकामधुक् ॥१०॥
verses.transliteration:
saha-yajñāḥ prajāḥ sṛṣṭvā purovāca prajāpatiḥ
anena prasaviṣyadhvam eṣa vo 'stv iṣṭa-kāmadhuk
verses.translation_full: In the beginning of creation, Brahma created humankind along with duties, and said, "Prosper in the performance of these yajñas (sacrifices), for they shall bestow upon you all you wish to achieve."
verses.widget_line: The Creator created mankind with sacrifice, saying: "By this you shall prosper; this shall fulfill your desires."

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
देवान्भावयतानेन ते देवा भावयन्तु वः ।
परस्परं भावयन्तः श्रेयः परमवाप्स्यथ ॥११॥
verses.transliteration:
devān bhāvayatānena te devā bhāvayantu vaḥ
parasparaṁ bhāvayantaḥ śreyaḥ param avāpsyatha
verses.translation_full: By your sacrifices, the celestial gods will be pleased, and by cooperation between humans and the celestial gods, great prosperity will reign for all.
verses.widget_line: Nourish the gods, and they will nourish you; thus nourishing one another, you attain the highest good.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
इष्टान्भोगान्हि वो देवा दास्यन्ते यज्ञभाविताः ।
तैर्दत्तानप्रदायैभ्यो यो भुङ्क्ते स्तेन एव सः ॥१२॥
verses.transliteration:
iṣṭān bhogān hi vo devā dāsyante yajña-bhāvitāḥ
tair dattān apradāyaibhyo yo bhuṅkte stena eva saḥ
verses.translation_full: The celestial gods, being satisfied by the performance of sacrifice, will grant you all the desired necessities of life. But those who enjoy what is given to them, without making offerings in return, are verily thieves.
verses.widget_line: The gods, nourished by sacrifice, give desired enjoyments. One who enjoys without offering is a thief.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यज्ञशिष्टाशिनः सन्तो मुच्यन्ते सर्वकिल्बिषैः ।
भुञ्जते ते त्वघं पापा ये पचन्त्यात्मकारणात् ॥१३॥
verses.transliteration:
yajña-śiṣṭāśinaḥ santo mucyante sarva-kilbiṣaiḥ
bhuñjate te tv aghaṁ pāpā ye pacanty ātma-kāraṇāt
verses.translation_full: The spiritually-minded, who eat food that is first offered in sacrifice, are released from all kinds of sin. Others, who cook food for their own enjoyment, verily eat only sin.
verses.widget_line: The righteous who eat remnants of sacrifice are freed from sin; those who cook only for themselves eat sin.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अन्नाद्भवन्ति भूतानि पर्जन्यादन्नसम्भवः ।
यज्ञाद्भवति पर्जन्यो यज्ञः कर्मसमुद्भवः ॥१४॥
verses.transliteration:
annād bhavanti bhūtāni parjanyād anna-sambhavaḥ
yajñād bhavati parjanyo yajñaḥ karma-samudbhavaḥ
verses.translation_full: All living beings subsist on food, and food is produced by rains. Rains come from the performance of sacrifice, and sacrifice is produced by the performance of prescribed duties.
verses.widget_line: From food come beings; from rain comes food; from sacrifice comes rain; from action comes sacrifice.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
कर्म ब्रह्मोद्भवं विद्धि ब्रह्माक्षरसमुद्भवम् ।
तस्मात्सर्वगतं ब्रह्म नित्यं यज्ञे प्रतिष्ठितम् ॥१५॥
verses.transliteration:
karma brahmodbhavaṁ viddhi brahmākṣara-samudbhavam
tasmāt sarva-gataṁ brahma nityaṁ yajñe pratiṣṭhitam
verses.translation_full: The duties for human beings are described in the Vedas, and the Vedas are manifested by God Himself. Therefore, the all-pervading Lord is eternally present in acts of sacrifice.
verses.widget_line: Know that action comes from the Vedas, and the Vedas from the Imperishable; the all-pervading is eternally established in sacrifice.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
एवं प्रवर्तितं चक्रं नानुवर्तयतीह यः ।
अघायुरिन्द्रियारामो मोघं पार्थ स जीवति ॥१६॥
verses.transliteration:
evaṁ pravartitaṁ cakraṁ nānuvartayatīha yaḥ
aghāyur indriyārāmo moghaṁ pārtha sa jīvati
verses.translation_full: O Parth, those who do not accept their responsibility in the cycle of sacrifice established by the Vedas are sinful. They live only for the delight of their senses; indeed their lives are in vain.
verses.widget_line: O Partha, one who does not follow this wheel of creation, living in sin and delighting in the senses, lives in vain.
verses.personalized: O {name}, one who does not follow this wheel of creation, living in sin and delighting in the senses, lives in vain.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यस्त्वात्मरतिरेव स्यादात्मतृप्तश्च मानवः ।
आत्मन्येव च सन्तुष्टस्तस्य कार्यं न विद्यते ॥१७॥
verses.transliteration:
yas tv ātma-ratir eva syād ātma-tṛptaś ca mānavaḥ
ātmany eva ca santuṣṭas tasya kāryaṁ na vidyate
verses.translation_full: But those who rejoice in the self, who are illumined and fully satisfied in the self, for them, there is no duty.
verses.widget_line: For one who rejoices in the Self, is satisfied with the Self, and is content in the Self alone, there is no duty.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
नैव तस्य कृतेनार्थो नाकृतेनेह कश्चन ।
न चास्य सर्वभूतेषु कश्चिदर्थव्यपाश्रयः ॥१८॥
verses.transliteration:
naiva tasya kṛtenārtho nākṛteneha kaścana
na cāsya sarva-bhūteṣu kaścid artha-vyapāśrayaḥ
verses.translation_full: Such self-realized souls have nothing to gain or lose either in discharging or renouncing their duties. Nor do they need to depend on other living beings to fulfill their self-interest.
verses.widget_line: For such a one, there is no purpose in action or inaction, nor does he depend on any being.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
तस्मादसक्तः सततं कार्यं कर्म समाचर ।
असक्तो ह्याचरन्कर्म परमाप्नोति पूरुषः ॥१९॥
verses.transliteration:
tasmād asaktaḥ satataṁ kāryaṁ karma samācara
asakto hy ācaran karma param āpnoti pūruṣaḥ
verses.translation_full: Therefore, giving up attachment, perform actions as a matter of duty because by working without being attached to the fruits, one attains the Supreme.
verses.widget_line: Therefore, always perform your duty without attachment; by acting without attachment, one attains the Supreme.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
कर्मणैव हि संसिद्धिमास्थिता जनकादयः ।
लोकसंग्रहमेवापि सम्पश्यन्कर्तुमर्हसि ॥२०॥
verses.transliteration:
karmaṇaiva hi saṁsiddhim āsthitā janakādayaḥ
loka-saṅgraham evāpi sampaśyan kartum arhasi
verses.translation_full: By performing their prescribed duties, King Janak and others attained perfection. You should also perform your duties to set an example for the good of the world.
verses.widget_line: Janaka and others attained perfection by action alone. You should also act for the maintenance of the world.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यद्यदाचरति श्रेष्ठस्तत्तदेवेतरो जनः ।
स यत्प्रमाणं कुरुते लोकस्तदनुवर्तते ॥२१॥
verses.transliteration:
yad yad ācarati śreṣṭhas tat tad evetaro janaḥ
sa yat pramāṇaṁ kurute lokas tad anuvartate
verses.translation_full: Whatever actions great persons perform, common people follow. Whatever standards they set, all the world pursues.
verses.widget_line: Whatever a great person does, others follow; whatever standard he sets, the world follows.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
न मे पार्थास्ति कर्तव्यं त्रिषु लोकेषु किञ्चन ।
नानवाप्तमवाप्तव्यं वर्त एव च कर्मणि ॥२२॥
verses.transliteration:
na me pārthāsti kartavyaṁ triṣu lokeṣu kiñcana
nānavāptam avāptavyaṁ varta eva ca karmaṇi
verses.translation_full: There is no duty for Me to do in all the three worlds, O Parth, nor do I have anything to gain or attain. Yet, I am engaged in prescribed duties.
verses.widget_line: O Partha, there is nothing in the three worlds I need to do, yet I am engaged in action.
verses.personalized: O {name}, there is nothing in the three worlds I need to do, yet I am engaged in action.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यदि ह्यहं न वर्तेयं जातु कर्मण्यतन्द्रितः ।
मम वर्त्मानुवर्तन्ते मनुष्याः पार्थ सर्वशः ॥२३॥
verses.transliteration:
yadi hy ahaṁ na varteyaṁ jātu karmaṇy atandritaḥ
mama vartmānuvartante manuṣyāḥ pārtha sarvaśaḥ
verses.translation_full: For if I did not carefully perform the prescribed duties, O Parth, all men would follow My path in all respects.
verses.widget_line: If I did not act, O Partha, men would follow My path in every way.
verses.personalized: If I did not act, O {name}, men would follow My path in every way.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
उत्सीदेयुरिमे लोका न कुर्यां कर्म चेदहम् ।
सङ्करस्य च कर्ता स्यामुपहन्यामिमाः प्रजाः ॥२४॥
verses.transliteration:
utsīdeyur ime lokā na kuryāṁ karma ced aham
saṅkarasya ca kartā syām upahanyām imāḥ prajāḥ
verses.translation_full: If I ceased to perform prescribed actions, all these worlds would perish. I would be responsible for the pandemonium that would prevail, and would thereby destroy the peace of the human race.
verses.widget_line: These worlds would perish if I did not act; I would cause confusion and destruction of all people.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
सक्ताः कर्मण्यविद्वांसो यथा कुर्वन्ति भारत ।
तथैवासक्तः कर्मणि कुर्याद्विद्वान्मनसा ॥२५॥
verses.transliteration:
saktāḥ karmaṇy avidvāṁso yathā kurvanti bhārata
tathaivāsaktaḥ karmaṇi kuryād vidvān manasā
verses.translation_full: As ignorant people perform their duties with attachment to the results, O scion of Bharat, so should the wise act without attachment, for the sake of leading people on the right path.
verses.widget_line: O Bharata, as the ignorant act with attachment, so should the wise act without attachment, for the welfare of the world.
verses.personalized: O {name}, as the ignorant act with attachment, so should the wise act without attachment, for the welfare of the world.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
न बुद्धिभेदं जनयेदज्ञानां कर्मसङ्गिनाम् ।
जोषयेत्सर्वकर्माणि विद्वान्युक्तः समाचरन् ॥२६॥
verses.transliteration:
na buddhi-bhedaṁ janayed ajñānāṁ karma-saṅginām
joṣayet sarva-karmāṇi vidvān yuktaḥ samācaran
verses.translation_full: The wise should not create discord in the intellects of ignorant people, who are attached to fruitive actions, by inducing them to stop work. Rather, by performing their duties in an enlightened manner, they should inspire the ignorant also to do their prescribed duties.
verses.widget_line: The wise should not unsettle the ignorant who are attached to action; they should inspire them by acting themselves.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
प्रकृतेः क्रियमाणानि गुणैः कर्माणि सर्वशः ।
अहङ्कारविमूढात्मा कर्ताहमिति मन्यते ॥२७॥
verses.transliteration:
prakṛteḥ kriyamāṇāni guṇaiḥ karmāṇi sarvaśaḥ
ahaṅkāra-vimūḍhātmā kartāham iti manyate
verses.translation_full: All activities are carried out by the three modes of material nature. But in ignorance, the soul, deluded by false identification with the body, thinks of itself as the doer.
verses.widget_line: All actions are performed by material nature. One deluded by ego thinks, "I am the doer."

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
तत्त्ववित्तु महाबाहो गुणकर्मविभागयोः ।
गुणा गुणेषु वर्तन्त इति मत्वा न सज्जते ॥२८॥
verses.transliteration:
tattvavit tu mahā-bāho guṇa-karma-vibhāgayoḥ
guṇā guṇeṣu vartanta iti matvā na sajjate
verses.translation_full: O mighty-armed Arjun, illumined persons distinguish the soul as distinct from guṇas and karmas. They perceive that it is only the guṇas (in the shape of the senses, mind, and others) that move among the guṇas (in the shape of the objects of perception), and thus they do not get entangled in them.
verses.widget_line: O mighty-armed, one who knows the truth understands that modes interact with modes; such a person is not attached.
verses.personalized: O {name}, one who knows the truth understands that modes interact with modes; such a person is not attached.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
प्रकृतेर्गुणसम्मूढाः सज्जन्ते गुणकर्मसु ।
तानकृत्स्नविदो मन्दान्कृत्स्नविन्न विचालयेत् ॥२९॥
verses.transliteration:
prakṛter guṇa-sammūḍhāḥ sajjante guṇa-karmasu
tān akṛtsna-vido mandān kṛtsna-vin na vicālayet
verses.translation_full: Those who are deluded by the operation of the guṇas become attached to the results of their actions. But the wise who understand these truths should not unsettle such ignorant people who know very little.
verses.widget_line: Those deluded by material nature become attached to its functions. The wise should not unsettle the ignorant.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
मयि सर्वाणि कर्माणि सन्न्यस्याध्यात्मचेतसा ।
निराशीर्निर्ममो भूत्वा युध्यस्व विगतज्वरः ॥३०॥
verses.transliteration:
mayi sarvāṇi karmāṇi sannyasyādhyātma-cetasā
nirāśhīr nirmamo bhūtvā yudhyasva vigata-jvaraḥ
verses.translation_full: Performing all works as an offering unto Me, constantly meditate on Me as the Supreme. Become free from desire and selfishness, and with your mental grief departed, fight!
verses.widget_line: Dedicate all actions to Me, with mind fixed on the Self. Free from desire and ego, fight without fever.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
ये मे मतमिदं नित्यमनुतिष्ठन्ति मानवाः ।
श्रद्धावन्तोऽनसूयन्तो मुच्यन्ते तेऽपि कर्मभिः ॥३१॥
verses.transliteration:
ye me matam idaṁ nityam anutiṣhṭhanti mānavāḥ
śhraddhāvanto 'nasūyanto mucyante te 'pi karmabhiḥ
verses.translation_full: Those who abide by these teachings of Mine, with profound faith and free from envy, are released from the bondage of karma.
verses.widget_line: Those who follow this teaching with faith and without envy are freed from the bondage of karma.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
ये त्वेतदभ्यसूयन्तो नानुतिष्ठन्ति मे मतम् ।
सर्वज्ञानविमूढांस्तान्विद्धि नष्टानचेतसः ॥३२॥
verses.transliteration:
ye tv etad abhyasūyanto nānutiṣhṭhanti me matam
sarva-jñāna-vimūḍhāṁs tān viddhi naṣṭān acetasaḥ
verses.translation_full: But those who, out of envy, do not follow this teaching of Mine, know them to be bereft of all knowledge, deluded, and doomed to ignorance.
verses.widget_line: Those who, out of envy, do not follow this teaching are bereft of knowledge, deluded, and doomed.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
सदृशं चेष्टते स्वस्याः प्रकृतेर्ज्ञानवानपि ।
प्रकृतिं यान्ति भूतानि निग्रहः किं करिष्यति ॥३३॥
verses.transliteration:
sadṛśaṁ ceṣṭate svasyāḥ prakṛter jñānavān api
prakṛtiṁ yānti bhūtāni nigrahaḥ kiṁ kariṣyati
verses.translation_full: Even wise people act according to their natures, for all living beings are propelled by their natural tendencies. What will one gain by repression?
verses.widget_line: Even a wise person acts according to his nature. Beings follow their nature; what can restraint accomplish?

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
इन्द्रियस्येन्द्रियस्यार्थे रागद्वेषौ व्यवस्थितौ ।
तयोर्न वशमागच्छेत्तौ ह्यस्य परिपन्थिनौ ॥३४॥
verses.transliteration:
indriyasye indriyasyārthe rāga-dveṣau vyavasthitau
tayor na vaśam āgacchet tau hy asya paripanthinau
verses.translation_full: The senses naturally experience attachment and aversion to the sense objects, but do not be controlled by them, for they are way-layers and foes.
verses.widget_line: Attachment and aversion for sense objects are fixed in the senses. Do not come under their control, for they are obstacles.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
श्रेयान्स्वधर्मो विगुणः परधर्मात्स्वनुष्ठितात् ।
स्वधर्मे निधनं श्रेयः परधर्मो भयावहः ॥३५॥
verses.transliteration:
śreyān sva-dharmo viguṇaḥ para-dharmāt sv-anuṣṭhitāt
sva-dharme nidhanaṁ śreyaḥ para-dharmo bhayāvahaḥ
verses.translation_full: Better is one's own duty, though imperfect, than the duty of another well performed. Better is death in one's own duty; the duty of another is fraught with fear.
verses.widget_line: Better is one's own duty, though imperfect, than another's duty well performed. Better is death in one's own duty.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
श्री भगवानुवाच
काम एष क्रोध एष रजोगुणसमुद्भवः ।
महाशनो महापाप्मा विद्ध्येनमिह वैरिणम् ॥३७॥
verses.transliteration:
śhrī bhagavān uvācha
kāma eṣa krodha eṣa rajo-guṇa-samudbhavaḥ
mahāśano mahā-pāpmā viddhy enam iha vairiṇam
verses.translation_full: The Supreme Lord said: It is lust alone, which is born of contact with the mode of passion, and later transformed into anger. Know this as the sinful, all-devouring enemy in the world.
verses.widget_line: It is desire, it is anger, born of passion. Know this to be the all-devouring, all-sinful enemy.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
धूमेनाव्रियते वह्निर्यथादर्शो मलेन च ।
यथोल्बेनावृतो गर्भस्तथा तेनेदमावृतम् ॥३८॥
verses.transliteration:
dhūmenāvriyate vahnir yathādarśo malena ca
yatholbenāvṛto garbhas tathā tenedam āvṛtam
verses.translation_full: As fire is covered by smoke, as a mirror is covered by dust, as an embryo is covered by the womb, so is this knowledge covered by desire.
verses.widget_line: As fire is covered by smoke, as a mirror by dust, as an embryo by the womb, so is knowledge covered by desire.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
आवृतं ज्ञानमेतेन ज्ञानिनो नित्यवैरिणा ।
कामरूपेण कौन्तेय दुष्पूरेणानलेन च ॥३९॥
verses.transliteration:
āvṛtaṁ jñānam etena jñānino nitya-vairiṇā
kāma-rūpeṇa kaunteya duṣpūreṇānalena ca
verses.translation_full: The knowledge of even the most discerning gets covered by this perpetual enemy in the form of insatiable desire, which is never satisfied and burns like fire, O son of Kunti.
verses.widget_line: O son of Kunti, knowledge is covered by this eternal enemy in the form of insatiable desire.
verses.personalized: O {name}, knowledge is covered by this eternal enemy in the form of insatiable desire.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
इन्द्रियाणि मनो बुद्धिरस्याधिष्ठानमुच्यते ।
एतैर्विमोहयत्येष ज्ञानमावृत्य देहिनम् ॥४०॥
verses.transliteration:
indriyāṇi mano buddhir asyādhiṣṭhānam ucyate
etair vimohayaty eṣa jñānam āvṛtya dehinam
verses.translation_full: The senses, mind, and intellect are said to be its abode. Through these, it deludes the embodied soul, veiling its knowledge.
verses.widget_line: The senses, mind, and intellect are its abode. Through these, it deludes the embodied soul, veiling knowledge.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
तस्मात्त्वमिन्द्रियाण्यादौ नियम्य भरतर्षभ ।
प्रजहि ह्येषं कामं मध्यं पाप्मानं विद्धि ॥४१॥
verses.transliteration:
tasmāt tvam indriyāṇy ādau niyamya bharatarṣabha
prajahi hy eṣaṁ kāmaṁ madhyaṁ pāpmānaṁ viddhi
verses.translation_full: Therefore, O best of the Bharatas, in the very beginning bring the senses under control and slay this enemy called desire, which is the embodiment of sin and destroys knowledge and realization.
verses.widget_line: O best of the Bharatas, first control the senses, then slay this enemy known as desire.
verses.personalized: O {name}, first control the senses, then slay this enemy known as desire.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
इन्द्रियाणि पराण्याहुरिन्द्रियेभ्यः परं मनः ।
मनसस्तु परा बुद्धिर्यो बुद्धेः परतस्तु सः ॥४२॥
verses.transliteration:
indriyāṇi parāṇy āhur indriyebhyaḥ paraṁ manaḥ
manasas tu parā buddhir yo buddheḥ paratas tu saḥ
verses.translation_full: The senses are said to be superior to the body; the mind is superior to the senses; the intellect is superior to the mind; and that which is superior to the intellect is the Self.
verses.widget_line: The senses are superior to the body; the mind to the senses; the intellect to the mind; the Self to the intellect.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
एवं बुद्धेः परं बुद्ध्वा संस्तभ्यात्मानमात्मना ।
जहि शत्रुं महाबाहो कामरूपं दुरासदम् ॥४३॥
verses.transliteration:
evaṁ buddheḥ paraṁ buddhvā saṁstabhyātmānam ātmanā
jahi śatruṁ mahā-bāho kāma-rūpaṁ durāsadam
verses.translation_full: Thus knowing the soul to be superior to the material intellect, O mighty armed Arjun, subdue the lower self (senses, mind, and intellect) by the higher self (strength of the soul), and kill this formidable enemy called lust.
verses.widget_line: O mighty-armed, knowing the Self superior to the intellect, control the mind by the Self, and slay this difficult enemy—desire.
verses.personalized: O {name}, knowing the Self superior to the intellect, control the mind by the Self, and slay this difficult enemy—desire.

chapter_info.chapter_name_english: Jñana Yoga – The Yoga of Knowledge
chapter_info.theme: Krishna explains transcendental knowledge, the science of self-realization, and the importance of performing actions in the spirit of sacrifice and devotion.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
श्री भगवानुवाच
इमं विवस्वते योगं प्रोक्तवानहमव्ययम् ।
विवस्वान्मनवे प्राह मनुरिक्ष्वाकवेऽब्रवीत् ॥१॥
verses.transliteration:
śhrī bhagavān uvācha
imaṁ vivasvate yogaṁ proktavān aham avyayam
vivasvān manave prāha manur ikṣhvākave 'bravīt
verses.translation_full: The Supreme Lord Shree Krishna said: I taught this eternal science of Yog to the Sun God, Vivasvan, who passed it on to Manu; and Manu, in turn, instructed it to Ikshvaku.
verses.widget_line: I instructed this imperishable yoga to the sun-god, who taught it to Manu, who taught it to Ikshvaku.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
एवं परम्पराप्राप्तमिमं राजर्षयो विदुः ।
स कालेनेह महता योगो नष्टः परन्तप ॥२॥
verses.transliteration:
evaṁ paramparā-prāptam imaṁ rājarṣhayo viduḥ
sa kāleneha mahatā yogo naṣṭaḥ parantapa
verses.translation_full: O subduer of enemies, the saintly kings thus received this science of Yog in a continuous tradition. But with the long passage of time, it was lost to the world.
verses.widget_line: This yoga was received through disciplic succession by saintly kings, but in time it was lost, O subduer of enemies.
verses.personalized: This yoga was received through disciplic succession by saintly kings, but in time it was lost, O {name}.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
स एवायं मया तेऽद्य योगः प्रोक्तः पुरातनः ।
भक्तोऽसि मे सखा चेति रहस्यं ह्येतदुत्तमम् ॥३॥
verses.transliteration:
sa evāyaṁ mayā te 'dya yogaḥ proktaḥ purātanaḥ
bhakto 'si me sakhā cheti rahasyaṁ hy etad uttamam
verses.translation_full: The same ancient knowledge of Yog, which is the supreme secret, I am today revealing unto you, because you are My friend as well as My devotee, who can understand this transcendental wisdom.
verses.widget_line: That ancient yoga is today told to you because you are My devotee and friend; you can understand this transcendental mystery.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
श्री भगवानुवाच
बहूनि मे व्यतीतानि जन्मानि तव चार्जुन ।
तान्यहं वेद सर्वाणि न त्वं वेत्थ परन्तप ॥५॥
verses.transliteration:
śhrī bhagavān uvācha
bahūni me vyatītāni janmāni tava chārjuna
tāny ahaṁ veda sarvāṇi na tvaṁ vettha parantapa
verses.translation_full: The Supreme Lord said: Both you and I have had many births, O Arjun. You have forgotten them, while I remember them all, O Parantapa.
verses.widget_line: Many births have passed for both of us, O Arjuna. I remember them all, but you do not.
verses.personalized: Many births have passed for both of us, O {name}. I remember them all, but you do not.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अजोऽपि सन्नव्ययात्मा भूतानामीश्वरोऽपि सन् ।
प्रकृतिं स्वामधिष्ठाय सम्भवाम्यात्ममायया ॥६॥
verses.transliteration:
ajo 'pi sann avyayātmā bhūtānām īśhvaro 'pi san
prakṛitiṁ svām adhiṣhṭhāya sambhavāmy ātma-māyayā
verses.translation_full: Although I am unborn, the Lord of all living entities, and have an imperishable nature, yet I appear in this world by virtue of Yogmaya, My divine power.
verses.widget_line: Although I am unborn and imperishable, and the Lord of all beings, I appear in every age in My original form.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यदा यदा हि धर्मस्य ग्लानिर्भवति भारत ।
अभ्युत्थानमधर्मस्य तदात्मानं सृजाम्यहम् ॥७॥
verses.transliteration:
yadā yadā hi dharmasya glānir bhavati bhārata
abhyutthānam adharmasya tadātmānaṁ sṛijāmyaham
verses.translation_full: Whenever there is a decline in righteousness and an increase in unrighteousness, O Arjun, at that time I manifest Myself on earth.
verses.widget_line: Whenever there is a decline in righteousness and a rise of unrighteousness, O Bharata, I manifest Myself.
verses.personalized: Whenever there is a decline in righteousness and a rise of unrighteousness, O {name}, I manifest Myself.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
परित्राणाय साधूनां विनाशाय च दुष्कृताम् ।
धर्मसंस्थापनार्थाय सम्भवामि युगे युगे ॥८॥
verses.transliteration:
paritrāṇāya sādhūnāṁ vināśhāya cha duṣhkṛitām
dharma-saṁsthāpanārthāya sambhavāmi yuge yuge
verses.translation_full: To protect the righteous, to annihilate the wicked, and to reestablish the principles of dharma I appear on this earth, age after age.
verses.widget_line: To protect the righteous, destroy the wicked, and reestablish dharma, I appear age after age.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
जन्म कर्म च मे दिव्यमेवं यो वेत्ति तत्त्वतः ।
त्यक्त्वा देहं पुनर्जन्म नैति मामेति सोऽर्जुन ॥९॥
verses.transliteration:
janma karma cha me divyam evaṁ yo vetti tattvataḥ
tyaktvā dehaṁ punar janma naiti mām eti so 'rjuna
verses.translation_full: Those who understand the divine nature of My birth and activities, O Arjun, upon leaving the body, do not have to take birth again, but come to My eternal abode.
verses.widget_line: One who knows the transcendental nature of My birth and activities, O Arjuna, does not take birth again but attains My eternal abode.
verses.personalized: One who knows the transcendental nature of My birth and activities, O {name}, does not take birth again but attains My eternal abode.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
वीतरागभयक्रोधा मन्मया मामुपाश्रिताः ।
बहवो ज्ञानतपसा पूता मद्भावमागताः ॥१०॥
verses.transliteration:
vīta-rāga-bhaya-krodhā man-mayā mām upāśhritāḥ
bahavo jñāna-tapasā pūtā mad-bhāvam āgatāḥ
verses.translation_full: Being free from attachment, fear, and anger, becoming fully absorbed in Me, and taking refuge in Me, many persons in the past became purified by knowledge of Me, and thus attained My divine love.
verses.widget_line: Freed from attachment, fear and anger, absorbed in Me and taking refuge in Me, many have been purified and attained My nature.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
ये यथा मां प्रपद्यन्ते तांस्तथैव भजाम्यहम् ।
मम वर्त्मानुवर्तन्ते मनुष्याः पार्थ सर्वशः ॥११॥
verses.transliteration:
ye yathā māṁ prapadyante tāṁs tathaiva bhajāmy aham
mama vartmānuvartante manuṣhyāḥ pārtha sarvaśhaḥ
verses.translation_full: In whatever way people surrender unto Me, I reciprocate accordingly. Everyone follows My path, knowingly or unknowingly, O son of Pritha.
verses.widget_line: As all surrender to Me, I reward them accordingly. Everyone follows My path, O Partha.
verses.personalized: As all surrender to Me, I reward them accordingly. Everyone follows My path, O {name}.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
काङ्क्षन्तः कर्मणां सिद्धिं यजन्त इह देवताः ।
क्षिप्रं हि मानुषे लोके सिद्धिर्भवति कर्मजा ॥१२॥
verses.transliteration:
kāṅkṣhantaḥ karmaṇāṁ siddhiṁ yajanta iha devatāḥ
kṣhipraṁ hi mānuṣhe loke siddhir bhavati karma-jā
verses.translation_full: In this world, those desiring success in material activities worship the celestial gods, since material rewards manifest quickly.
verses.widget_line: Those who desire success worship the demigods. Quickly they get results from such work in this world.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
चातुर्वर्ण्यं मया सृष्टं गुणकर्मविभागशः ।
तस्य कर्तारमपि मां विद्ध्यकर्तारमव्ययम् ॥१३॥
verses.transliteration:
chātur-varṇyaṁ mayā sṛiṣhṭaṁ guṇa-karma-vibhāgaśhaḥ
tasya kartāram api māṁ viddhy akartāram avyayam
verses.translation_full: The four categories of occupations were created by Me according to people's qualities and activities. Although I am the Creator of this system, know Me to be the Non-doer and Eternal.
verses.widget_line: I created the four divisions of society according to qualities and work. Although I am the creator, know Me to be the non-doer, unchangeable.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
न मां कर्माणि लिम्पन्ति न मे कर्मफले स्पृहा ।
इति मां योऽभिजानाति कर्मभिर्न स बध्यते ॥१४॥
verses.transliteration:
na māṁ karmāṇi limpanti na me karma-phale spṛihā
iti māṁ yo 'bhijānāti karmabhir na sa badhyate
verses.translation_full: Activities do not taint Me, nor do I desire the fruits of action. One who knows Me in this way is never bound by the karmic reactions of work.
verses.widget_line: No work affects Me, nor do I desire fruits of action. One who understands this is not bound by karma.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
एवं ज्ञात्वा कृतं कर्म पूर्वैरपि मुमुक्षुभिः ।
कुरु कर्मैव तस्मात्त्वं पूर्वैः पूर्वतरं कृतम् ॥१५॥
verses.transliteration:
evaṁ jñātvā kṛitaṁ karma pūrvair api mumukṣhubhiḥ
kuru karmaiva tasmāt tvaṁ pūrvaiḥ pūrvataraṁ kṛitam
verses.translation_full: Knowing this truth, even seekers of liberation in ancient times performed actions. Therefore, following the footsteps of those ancient sages, you too should perform your duty.
verses.widget_line: Knowing this, the liberated souls of old performed work. Therefore, perform work as they did in ancient times.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
किं कर्म किमकर्मेति कवयोऽप्यत्र मोहिताः ।
तत्ते कर्म प्रवक्ष्यामि यज्ज्ञात्वा मोक्ष्यसेऽशुभात् ॥१६॥
verses.transliteration:
kiṁ karma kim akarmeti kavayo 'py atra mohitāḥ
tat te karma pravakṣhyāmi yaj jñātvā mokṣhyase 'śhubhāt
verses.translation_full: What is action and what is inaction? Even the wise are confused in determining this. Now I shall explain to you the secret of action, by knowing which, you may free yourself from material bondage.
verses.widget_line: What is action and inaction? Even the wise are bewildered. I will tell you what action is, knowing which you will be liberated.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
कर्मणो ह्यपि बोद्धव्यं बोद्धव्यं च विकर्मणः ।
अकर्मणश्च बोद्धव्यं गहना कर्मणो गतिः ॥१७॥
verses.transliteration:
karmaṇo hy api boddhavyaṁ boddhavyaṁ cha vikarmaṇaḥ
akarmaṇaśh cha boddhavyaṁ gahanā karmaṇo gatiḥ
verses.translation_full: You must understand the nature of all three—recommended action, wrong action, and inaction. The truth about these is profound and difficult to understand.
verses.widget_line: The intricacies of action are hard to understand. One should know what action is, what forbidden action is, and what inaction is.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
कर्मण्यकर्म यः पश्येदकर्मणि च कर्म यः ।
स बुद्धिमान्मनुष्येषु स युक्तः कृत्स्नकर्मकृत् ॥१८॥
verses.transliteration:
karmaṇy akarma yaḥ paśhyed akarmaṇi cha karma yaḥ
sa buddhimān manuṣhyeṣhu sa yuktaḥ kṛitsna-karmakṛit
verses.translation_full: Those who see action in inaction and inaction in action are truly wise amongst humans. Although performing all kinds of actions, they are yogis and masters of all their actions.
verses.widget_line: One who sees inaction in action, and action in inaction, is wise among men and in the transcendental position.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यस्य सर्वे समारम्भाः कामसङ्कल्पवर्जिताः ।
ज्ञानाग्निदग्धकर्माणं तमाहुः पण्डितं बुधाः ॥१९॥
verses.transliteration:
yasya sarve samārambhāḥ kāma-saṅkalpa-varjitāḥ
jñānāgni-dagdha-karmāṇaṁ tam āhuḥ paṇḍitaṁ budhāḥ
verses.translation_full: The enlightened sages call those persons wise, whose every action is free from the desire for material pleasures and who have burnt the reactions of work in the fire of divine knowledge.
verses.widget_line: One whose undertakings are free from desire, whose works are burned by the fire of knowledge—him the wise call a sage.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
त्यक्त्वा कर्मफलासङ्गं नित्यतृप्तो निराश्रयः ।
कर्मण्यभिप्रवृत्तोऽपि नैव किञ्चित्करोति सः ॥२०॥
verses.transliteration:
tyaktvā karma-phalāsaṅgaṁ nitya-tṛipto nirāśhrayaḥ
karmaṇy abhipravṛitto 'pi naiva kiñchit karoti saḥ
verses.translation_full: Such people, having given up attachment to the fruits of their actions, are always satisfied and not dependent on external things. Despite engaging in activities, they do not do anything at all.
verses.widget_line: Abandoning attachment to results, ever satisfied and independent, he performs no fruitive action, though engaged in all undertakings.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
निराशीर्यतचित्तात्मा त्यक्तसर्वपरिग्रहः ।
शारीरं केवलं कर्म कुर्वन्नाप्नोति किल्बिषम् ॥२१॥
verses.transliteration:
nirāśhīr yata-chittātmā tyakta-sarva-parigrahaḥ
śharīraṁ kevalaṁ karma kurvan nāpnoti kilbiṣham
verses.translation_full: Free from expectations and the sense of ownership, with the mind and intellect fully controlled, they incur no sin even though performing actions by their body.
verses.widget_line: With controlled mind and intelligence, giving up all sense of ownership, acting only for necessities, he incurs no sin.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यदृच्छालाभसन्तुष्टो द्वन्द्वातीतो विमत्सरः ।
समः सिद्धावसिद्धौ च कृत्वापि न निबध्यते ॥२२॥
verses.transliteration:
yadṛichchhā-lābha-santuṣhṭo dvandvātīto vimatsaraḥ
samaḥ siddhau asiddhau cha kṛitvāpi na nibadhyate
verses.translation_full: Content with whatever gain comes of its own accord, and free from envy, they are beyond the dualities of life. Being equipoised in success and failure, they are not bound by their actions, even while performing all kinds of activities.
verses.widget_line: Satisfied with what comes naturally, free from duality and envy, steady in success and failure, he is never bound.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
गतसङ्गस्य मुक्तस्य ज्ञानावस्थितचेतसः ।
यज्ञायाचरतः कर्म समग्रं प्रविलीयते ॥२३॥
verses.transliteration:
gata-saṅgasya muktasya jñānāvasthita-chetasaḥ
yajñāyācharataḥ karma samagraṁ pravilīyate
verses.translation_full: They are released from the bondage of material attachments and their intellect is established in divine knowledge. Since they perform all actions as a sacrifice (to God), they are freed from all karmic reactions.
verses.widget_line: The work of one who is free from attachment, situated in knowledge, and acts for sacrifice merges entirely into transcendence.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
ब्रह्मार्पणं ब्रह्म हविर्ब्रह्माग्नौ ब्रह्मणा हुतम् ।
ब्रह्मैव तेन गन्तव्यं ब्रह्मकर्मसमाधिना ॥२४॥
verses.transliteration:
brahmārpaṇaṁ brahma havir brahmāgnau brahmaṇā hutam
brahmaiva tena gantavyaṁ brahma-karma-samādhinā
verses.translation_full: A person who is fully absorbed in Krishna consciousness is sure to attain the spiritual kingdom because of his full contribution to spiritual activities, in which the consummation is absolute and that which is offered is of the same spiritual nature.
verses.widget_line: Brahman is the offering, Brahman is the oblation, poured by Brahman into the fire of Brahman. One who sees Brahman in all actions attains Brahman.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
दैवमेवापरे यज्ञं योगिनः पर्युपासते ।
ब्रह्माग्नावपरे यज्ञं यज्ञेनैवोपजुह्वति ॥२५॥
verses.transliteration:
daivam evāpare yajñaṁ yoginaḥ paryupāsate
brahmāgnāv apare yajñaṁ yajñenaivopajuhvati
verses.translation_full: Some yogis worship the celestial gods with material offerings unto them. Others worship perfectly who offer the self as sacrifice in the fire of the Supreme Truth.
verses.widget_line: Some yogis worship the demigods by offering sacrifices; others offer sacrifices in the fire of Brahman.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
श्रोत्रादीनीन्द्रियाण्यन्ये संयमाग्निषु जुह्वति ।
शब्दादीन्विषयानन्य इन्द्रियाग्निषु जुह्वति ॥२६॥
verses.transliteration:
śhrotrādīnīndriyāṇy anye saṁyamāgniṣhu juhvati
śhabdādīn viṣhayān anya indriyāgniṣhu juhvati
verses.translation_full: Some sacrifice the hearing process and the senses in the fire of the controlled mind, and others sacrifice the objects of the senses, such as sound, in the fire of sacrifice.
verses.widget_line: Some sacrifice the senses in the fire of control; others sacrifice sense objects in the fire of the senses.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
सर्वाणीन्द्रियकर्माणि प्राणकर्माणि चापरे ।
आत्मसंयमयोगाग्नौ जुह्वति ज्ञानदीपिते ॥२७॥
verses.transliteration:
sarvāṇīndriya-karmāṇi prāṇa-karmāṇi chāpare
ātma-saṁyamayogāgnau juhvati jñāna-dīpite
verses.translation_full: Some, inspired by knowledge, offer the functions of all their senses and their life energy in the fire of the controlled mind.
verses.widget_line: Some sacrifice all functions of the senses and life breath into the fire of controlled mind, kindled by knowledge.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
द्रव्ययज्ञास्तपोयज्ञा योगयज्ञास्तथापरे ।
स्वाध्यायज्ञानयज्ञाश्च यतयः संशितव्रताः ॥२८॥
verses.transliteration:
dravya-yajñās tapo-yajñā yoga-yajñās tathāpare
svādhyāya-jñāna-yajñāśh cha yatayaḥ saṁśhita-vratāḥ
verses.translation_full: Some sacrifice their material possessions, and others perform severe austerities. Some practice the yoga of eightfold mysticism, and others study the Vedas for advancement in transcendental knowledge.
verses.widget_line: Some sacrifice material possessions, others perform austerities, practice yoga, or study the Vedas for knowledge.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अपाने जुह्वति प्राणं प्राणेऽपानं तथापरे ।
प्राणापानगती रुद्ध्वा प्राणायामपरायणाः ॥२९॥
verses.transliteration:
apāne juhvati prāṇaṁ prāṇe 'pānaṁ tathāpare
prāṇāpāna-gatī ruddhvā prāṇāyāma-parāyaṇāḥ
verses.translation_full: Still others offer as sacrifice the outgoing breath in the incoming breath, while some offer the incoming breath into the outgoing breath. Some arduously practice prāṇāyām and restrain the incoming and outgoing breaths, purely absorbed in the regulation of the life-energy.
verses.widget_line: Some offer the incoming breath into the outgoing, and the outgoing into the incoming, restraining the movement of breath.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अपरे नियताहाराः प्राणान्प्राणेषु जुह्वति ।
