सर्वेऽप्येते यज्ञविदो यज्ञक्षपितकल्मषाः ॥३०॥
verses.transliteration:
apare niyatāhārāḥ prāṇān prāṇeṣhu juhvati
sarve 'py ete yajña-vido yajña-kṣhapita-kalmaṣhāḥ
verses.translation_full: All these performers who know the meaning of sacrifice become cleansed of sinful reactions, and, having tasted the nectar of the results of sacrifices, they advance toward the supreme eternal atmosphere.
verses.widget_line: All these who know the meaning of sacrifice become cleansed of sin and advance toward the supreme eternal.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यज्ञशिष्टामृतभुजो यान्ति ब्रह्म सनातनम् ।
नायं लोकोऽस्त्ययज्ञस्य कुतोऽन्यः कुरुसत्तम ॥३१॥
verses.transliteration:
yajña-śhiṣhṭāmṛita-bhujo yānti brahma sanātanam
nāyaṁ loko 'sty ayajñasya kuto 'nyaḥ kurusattama
verses.translation_full: Those who know the secret of sacrifice, and engaging in it, partake of its remnants that are like nectar, advance toward the Absolute Truth. O best of the Kurus, those who perform no sacrifice find no happiness either in this world or the next.
verses.widget_line: O best of the Kurus, those who partake of the remnants of sacrifice go to the eternal Brahman. This world is not for one who performs no sacrifice.
verses.personalized: O {name}, those who partake of the remnants of sacrifice go to the eternal Brahman. This world is not for one who performs no sacrifice.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
एवं बहुविधा यज्ञा वितता ब्रह्मणो मुखे ।
कर्मजान्विद्धि तान्सर्वानेवं ज्ञात्वा विमोक्ष्यसे ॥३२॥
verses.transliteration:
evaṁ bahu-vidhā yajñā vitatā brahmaṇo mukhe
karma-jān viddhi tān sarvān evaṁ jñātvā vimokṣhyase
verses.translation_full: All these different kinds of sacrifice have been described in the Vedas. Know them as originating from different types of work; this understanding cuts the knots of material bondage.
verses.widget_line: All these various sacrifices are described in the Vedas and born of work. Knowing them, you will be liberated.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
श्रेयान्द्रव्यमयाद्यज्ञाज्ज्ञानयज्ञः परन्तप ।
सर्वं कर्माखिलं पार्थ ज्ञाने परिसमाप्यते ॥३३॥
verses.transliteration:
śreyān dravya-mayād yajñāj jñāna-yajñaḥ parantapa
sarvaṁ karmākhilaṁ pārtha jñāne parisamāpyate
verses.translation_full: O subduer of enemies, the sacrifice performed in knowledge is better than the mere sacrifice of material possessions. After all, O son of Pritha, all sacrifices of work culminate in knowledge.
verses.widget_line: O subduer of enemies, the sacrifice of knowledge is better than material sacrifice. All work culminates in knowledge, O Partha.
verses.personalized: O {name}, the sacrifice of knowledge is better than material sacrifice. All work culminates in knowledge.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
तद्विद्धि प्रणिपातेन परिप्रश्नेन सेवया ।
उपदेक्ष्यन्ति ते ज्ञानं ज्ञानिनस्तत्त्वदर्शिनः ॥३४॥
verses.transliteration:
tad viddhi praṇipātena paripraśhnena sevayā
upadekṣhyanti te jñānaṁ jñāninas tattva-darśhinaḥ
verses.translation_full: Learn the Truth by approaching a spiritual master. Inquire from him with reverence and render service unto him. Such an enlightened Saint can impart knowledge unto you because he has seen the Truth.
verses.widget_line: Learn the truth by approaching a spiritual master. Inquire submissively and serve him. The self-realized can impart knowledge.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यज्ज्ञात्वा न पुनर्मोहमेवं यास्यसि पाण्डव ।
येन भावसमाभूतस्तेन मां द्रक्ष्यसि तत्त्वतः ॥३५॥
verses.transliteration:
yaj jñātvā na punar moham evaṁ yāsyasi pāṇḍava
yena bhāva-samābhūtas tena māṁ drakṣhyasi tattvataḥ
verses.translation_full: Following this path and having achieved enlightenment from a Guru, O Arjun, you will no longer fall into delusion. In the light of that knowledge, you will see that all living beings are but parts of the Supreme, and are within Me.
verses.widget_line: Having obtained real knowledge, O Pandava, you will never again be deluded. By this knowledge you will see all beings in Me, and Me in all.
verses.personalized: Having obtained real knowledge, O {name}, you will never again be deluded. By this knowledge you will see all beings in Me, and Me in all.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अपि चेदसि पापेभ्यः सर्वेभ्यः पापकृत्तमः ।
सर्वं ज्ञानप्लवेनैव वृजिनं सन्तरिष्यसि ॥३६॥
verses.transliteration:
api ched asi pāpebhyaḥ sarvebhyaḥ pāpa-kṛittamaḥ
sarvaṁ jñāna-plavenaiva vṛijinaṁ santariṣhyasi
verses.translation_full: Even those who are considered the most immoral of all sinners can cross over this ocean of material existence by seating themselves in the boat of divine knowledge.
verses.widget_line: Even if you are the most sinful of all sinners, you will cross over the ocean of miseries by the boat of knowledge.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यथैधांसि समिद्धोऽग्निर्भस्मसात्कुरुतेऽर्जुन ।
ज्ञानाग्निः सर्वकर्माणि भस्मसात्कुरुते तथा ॥३७॥
verses.transliteration:
yathaidhāṁsi samiddho 'gnir bhasmasāt kurute 'rjuna
jñānāgniḥ sarva-karmāṇi bhasmasāt kurute tathā
verses.translation_full: As a blazing fire turns firewood to ashes, O Arjun, so does the fire of knowledge burn to ashes all reactions to material activities.
verses.widget_line: As a blazing fire turns firewood to ashes, O Arjuna, so does the fire of knowledge burn all reactions to ashes.
verses.personalized: As a blazing fire turns firewood to ashes, O {name}, so does the fire of knowledge burn all reactions to ashes.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
न हि ज्ञानेन सदृशं पवित्रमिह विद्यते ।
तत्स्वयं योगसंसिद्धः कालेनात्मनि विन्दति ॥३८॥
verses.transliteration:
na hi jñānena sadṛiśhaṁ pavitram iha vidyate
tat svayaṁ yoga-saṁsiddhaḥ kālenātmani vindati
verses.translation_full: In this world, there is nothing as purifying as divine knowledge. One who has attained purity of mind through prolonged practice of Yog, receives such knowledge within the heart, in due course of time.
verses.widget_line: In this world, there is nothing so pure as knowledge. One perfected in yoga finds it in the Self in due time.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
श्रद्धावाँल्लभते ज्ञानं तत्परः संयतेन्द्रियः ।
ज्ञानं लब्ध्वा परां शान्तिमचिरेणाधिगच्छति ॥३९॥
verses.transliteration:
śhraddhāvāll labhate jñānaṁ tat-paraḥ saṁyatendriyaḥ
jñānaṁ labdhvā parāṁ śhāntim achireṇādhigachchhati
verses.translation_full: A faithful man who is dedicated to transcendental knowledge and who subdues his senses is eligible to achieve such knowledge, and having achieved it he quickly attains the supreme spiritual peace.
verses.widget_line: One with faith, dedicated to knowledge, and with controlled senses attains knowledge and quickly reaches supreme peace.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अज्ञश्चाश्रद्धानश्च संशयात्मा विनश्यति ।
नायं लोकोऽस्ति न परो न सुखं संशयात्मनः ॥४०॥
verses.transliteration:
ajñaśh chāśhraddhānaśh cha saṁśhayātmā vinaśhyati
nāyaṁ loko 'sti na paro na sukhaṁ saṁśhayātmanaḥ
verses.translation_full: But persons who possess neither faith nor knowledge, and who are of a doubting nature, suffer a downfall. For the skeptical souls, there is no happiness either in this world or the next.
verses.widget_line: The ignorant, faithless, and doubting soul perishes. For the doubting soul there is no happiness in this world or the next.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
योगसन्न्यस्तकर्माणं ज्ञानसञ्छिन्नसंशयम् ।
आत्मवन्तं न कर्माणि निबध्नन्ति धनञ्जय ॥४१॥
verses.transliteration:
yoga-sannyasta-karmāṇaṁ jñāna-sañchhanna-saṁśhayam
ātmavantaṁ na karmāṇi nibadhnanti dhanañjaya
verses.translation_full: One who acts in devotion, who renounces the fruits of action, and whose doubts have been destroyed by transcendental knowledge, is situated factually in the self. Thus he is not bound by the reactions of work, O conqueror of wealth.
verses.widget_line: One who renounces the fruits of action, whose doubts are cut by knowledge, and who is self-situated, O Dhananjaya, is not bound by karma.
verses.personalized: One who renounces the fruits of action, whose doubts are cut by knowledge, and who is self-situated, O {name}, is not bound by karma.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
तस्मादज्ञानसम्भूतं हृत्स्थं ज्ञानासिनात्मनः ।
छित्त्वैनं संशयं योगमातिष्ठोत्तिष्ठ भारत ॥४२॥
verses.transliteration:
tasmād ajñāna-sambhūtaṁ hṛit-sthaṁ jñānāsinātmanaḥ
chhittvainaṁ saṁśhayaṁ yogam ātiṣhṭhottishṭha bhārata
verses.translation_full: Therefore, with the sword of knowledge, cut asunder the doubts that have arisen in your heart. O scion of Bharat, establish yourself in karm yog. Arise, stand up, and take action!
verses.widget_line: Therefore, with the sword of knowledge, cut asunder the doubt born of ignorance in your heart. Armed with yoga, O Bharata, arise and fight.
verses.personalized: Therefore, with the sword of knowledge, cut asunder the doubt born of ignorance in your heart. Armed with yoga, O {name}, arise and fight.

chapter_info.chapter_name_english: Karma Sannyasa Yoga – The Yoga of Renunciation
chapter_info.theme: Krishna explains the path of renunciation and selfless action, showing that both lead to the same goal of liberation when performed with the right understanding.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
श्री भगवानुवाच
संन्यासः कर्मयोगश्च निःश्रेयसकरावुभौ ।
तयोस्तु कर्मसंन्यासात्कर्मयोगो विशिष्यते ॥१॥
verses.transliteration:
śhrī bhagavān uvācha
sannyāsaḥ karma-yogaśh cha niḥśhreyasa-karāv ubhau
tayos tu karma-sannyāsāt karma-yogo viśhiṣhyate
verses.translation_full: Arjun said: O Shree Krishna, You praised karm sanyās (the path of renunciation of actions), and You also advised to do karm yog (work with devotion). Please tell me decisively which of the two is more beneficial?
verses.widget_line: Both renunciation and work in devotion lead to liberation. But work in devotion is better than renunciation.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
ज्ञेयः स नित्यसंन्यासी यो न द्वेष्टि न काङ्क्षति ।
निर्द्वन्द्वो हि महाबाहो सुखं बन्धात्प्रमुच्यते ॥२॥
verses.transliteration:
jñeyaḥ sa nitya-sannyāsī yo na dveṣhṭi na kāṅkṣhati
nirdvandvo hi mahā-bāho sukhaṁ bandhāt pramuchyate
verses.translation_full: The Supreme Lord said: Both the path of karm sanyās (renunciation of actions) and karm yog (working in devotion) lead to the supreme goal. But karm yog is superior to karm sanyās.
verses.widget_line: O mighty-armed, one who neither hates nor desires the fruits of action is always renounced and easily liberated.
verses.personalized: O {name}, one who neither hates nor desires the fruits of action is always renounced and easily liberated.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
साङ्ख्ययोगौ पृथग्बालाः प्रवदन्ति न पण्डिताः ।
एकमप्यास्थितः सम्यगुभयोर्विन्दते फलम् ॥३॥
verses.transliteration:
sāṅkhya-yogau pṛithag bālāḥ pravadanti na paṇḍitāḥ
ekam apy āsthitaḥ samyag ubhayor vindate phalam
verses.translation_full: The karm yogis, who neither desire nor hate anything, should be considered always renounced. Free from all dualities, they are easily liberated from the bonds of material energy.
verses.widget_line: Only the ignorant speak of knowledge and action as different. The wise know that one who applies himself to either path achieves the results of both.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यत्साङ्ख्यैः प्राप्यते स्थानं तद्योगैरपि गम्यते ।
एकं साङ्ख्यं च योगं च यः पश्यति स पश्यति ॥४॥
verses.transliteration:
yat sāṅkhyaiḥ prāpyate sthānaṁ tad yogair api gamyate
ekaṁ sāṅkhyaṁ cha yogaṁ cha yaḥ paśhyati sa paśhyati
verses.translation_full: Only the ignorant speak of sānkhya (renunciation of actions, or karm sanyās) and karm yog (work in devotion) as different. Those who are truly learned say that by applying ourselves to any one of these paths, we can achieve the results of both.
verses.widget_line: The goal reached by knowledge is also reached by action. One who sees knowledge and action as one sees truly.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
संन्यासस्तु महाबाहो दुःखमाप्तुमयोगतः ।
योगयुक्तो मुनिर्ब्रह्म न चिरेणाधिगच्छति ॥५॥
verses.transliteration:
sannyāsas tu mahā-bāho duḥkham āptum ayogataḥ
yoga-yukto munir brahma na chireṇādhigachchhati
verses.translation_full: O mighty-armed, it is indeed very difficult to give up work without devotional service. But the sage who is engaged in devotional service quickly attains the Supreme.
verses.widget_line: O mighty-armed, renunciation without devotion is difficult. But the sage engaged in devotion quickly attains the Supreme.
verses.personalized: O {name}, renunciation without devotion is difficult. But the sage engaged in devotion quickly attains the Supreme.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
योगयुक्तो विशुद्धात्मा विजितात्मा जितेन्द्रियः ।
सर्वभूतात्मभूतात्मा कुर्वन्नपि न लिप्यते ॥६॥
verses.transliteration:
yoga-yukto viśhuddhātmā vijitātmā jitendriyaḥ
sarva-bhūtātma-bhūtātmā kurvan napi na lipyate
verses.translation_full: Perfect renunciation (karm sanyās) is difficult to attain without performing work in devotion (karm yog), O mighty-armed Arjun, but the sage who is adept in karm yog quickly attains the Supreme.
verses.widget_line: One engaged in devotion, pure in soul, controlling mind and senses, is dear to all and never entangled, though always working.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
नैव किञ्चित्करोमीति युक्तो मन्येत तत्त्ववित् ।
पश्यञ्शृण्वन्स्पृशञ्जिघ्रन्नश्नन्गच्छन्स्वपञ्श्वसन् ॥७॥
verses.transliteration:
naiva kiñchit karomīti yukto manyeta tattvavit
paśhyañ śhṛiṇvan spṛiśhañ jighrann aśhnan gachchan svapañ śhvasan
verses.translation_full: One who works in devotion, with pure mind, controlling the body, mind, and senses, and seeing all living beings as equal, does not become entangled, even though engaged in work.
verses.widget_line: One who knows the truth thinks, 'I do nothing at all,' while seeing, hearing, touching, smelling, eating, going, sleeping, breathing.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
प्रलपन्विसृजन्गृह्णन्नुन्मिषन्निमिषन्नपि ।
इन्द्रियाणीन्द्रियार्थेषु वर्तन्त इति धारयन् ॥८॥
verses.transliteration:
pralapan visṛijan gṛihṇann unmiṣhann nimiṣhann api
indriyāṇīndriyārtheṣhu vartanta iti dhārayan
verses.translation_full: Those steadfast in karm yog, always think, "I am not the doer," even while engaged in seeing, hearing, touching, smelling, moving, sleeping, breathing, speaking, excreting, grasping, and opening or closing the eyes.
verses.widget_line: Speaking, letting go, grasping, opening and closing the eyes—one who knows that the senses move among sense objects remains detached.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
सर्वकर्माणि मनसा संन्यस्यास्ते सुखं वशी ।
नवद्वारे पुरे देही नैव कुर्वन्न कारयन् ॥९॥
verses.transliteration:
sarva-karmāṇi manasā sannyasyāste sukhaṁ vaśhī
navadvāre pure dehī naiva kurvan na kārayan
verses.translation_full: With the light of divine knowledge, they see that it is only the material senses that are moving amongst their objects.
verses.widget_line: One who renounces all actions in mind, remaining in the body's city of nine gates, neither acts nor causes action.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
न कर्तृत्वं न कर्माणि लोकस्य सृजति पुरुषः ।
न कर्मफलसंयोगं स्वभावस्तु प्रवर्तते ॥१०॥
verses.transliteration:
na kartṛitvaṁ na karmāṇi lokasya sṛijati puruṣhaḥ
na karma-phala-saṁyogaṁ svabhāvas tu pravartate
verses.translation_full: The embodied soul, by nature, does not create activities, nor does it induce people to act, nor does it create the fruits of action. All this is enacted by the modes of material nature.
verses.widget_line: The soul does not create activities, nor induce action, nor create fruits. All is enacted by material nature.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
नादत्ते कस्यचित्पापं न चैव सुकृतं विभुः ।
अज्ञानेनावृतं ज्ञानं तेन मुह्यन्ति जन्तवः ॥११॥
verses.transliteration:
nādatte kasyachit pāpaṁ na chaiva sukṛitaṁ vibhuḥ
ajñānenāvṛitaṁ jñānaṁ tena muhyanti jantavaḥ
verses.translation_full: The yogis, while giving up attachment, perform actions with their body, senses, mind, and intellect, only for the purpose of self-purification.
verses.widget_line: The Supreme does not take responsibility for good or evil deeds. Beings are deluded because knowledge is covered by ignorance.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
ज्ञानेन तु तज्ज्ञानं येषां नाशितमात्मनः ।
तेषामादित्यवज्ज्ञानं प्रकाशयति तत्परम् ॥१२॥
verses.transliteration:
jñānena tu taj jñānaṁ yeṣhāṁ nāśhitamātmanaḥ
teṣhām āditya-vaj jñānaṁ prakāśhayati tat param
verses.translation_full: When, however, one is enlightened with the knowledge by which nescience is destroyed, then his knowledge reveals everything, as the sun lights up everything in the daytime.
verses.widget_line: When one is enlightened with knowledge that destroys ignorance, then knowledge reveals everything, as the sun lights up all in daytime.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
तद्बुद्धयस्तदात्मानस्तन्निष्ठास्तत्परायणाः ।
गच्छन्त्यपुनरावृत्तिं ज्ञाननिर्धूतकल्मषाः ॥१३॥
verses.transliteration:
tad-buddhayas tad-ātmānas tan-niṣhṭhās tat-parāyaṇāḥ
gachchhanty apunar-āvṛittiṁ jñāna-nirdhūta-kalmaṣhāḥ
verses.translation_full: The embodied beings who are self-controlled and detached reside happily in the city of nine gates free from thoughts that they are the doers or the cause of anything.
verses.widget_line: Those whose intelligence, mind, faith, and refuge are fixed in the Supreme, cleansed of sin by knowledge, go to liberation and never return.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
न द्वेष्टि कुशलं कर्म कुकर्म न करोति यः ।
तस्य ज्ञानं यतं च ज्ञानविमूढचेतसः ॥१४॥
verses.transliteration:
na dveṣhṭi kuśhalaṁ karma kukarma na karoti yaḥ
tasya jñānaṁ yataṁ cha jñāna-vimūḍha-chetasaḥ
verses.translation_full: Neither the sense of doership nor the nature of actions comes from God; nor does He create the fruits of actions. All this is enacted by the modes of material nature (guṇas).
verses.widget_line: One who does not hate good work nor do evil work, whose knowledge is steady, is not deluded.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
नाभिनन्दति न द्वेष्टि कुशलाकुशले कर्मणि ।
तस्य ज्ञानं यतं च ज्ञानविमूढचेतसः ॥१५॥
verses.transliteration:
nābhinandati na dveṣhṭi kuśhalākuśhale karmaṇi
tasya jñānaṁ yataṁ cha jñāna-vimūḍha-chetasaḥ
verses.translation_full: The omnipresent God does not involve Himself in the sinful or virtuous deeds of anyone. The living entities are deluded because their inner knowledge is covered by ignorance.
verses.widget_line: One who neither rejoices nor hates in good or evil work, whose knowledge is steady, is not deluded.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यदा सत्त्वे प्रवृद्धे तु प्रलयं यान्ति देहिनः ।
तदोत्तमविदां लोकानमलान्प्रतिपद्यते ॥१६॥
verses.transliteration:
yadā sattve pravṛiddhe tu pralayaṁ yānti dehinaḥ
tadottama-vidāṁ lokān amalān pratipadyate
verses.translation_full: When one is enlightened with the knowledge by which nescience is destroyed, then his knowledge reveals everything, as the sun lights up everything in the daytime.
verses.widget_line: When the mode of goodness predominates, at death one goes to the pure worlds of the knowers of the Supreme.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
रजसि प्रलयं गत्वा कर्मसङ्गिषु जायते ।
तथा प्रलीनस्तमसि मूढयोनिषु जायते ॥१७॥
verses.transliteration:
rajasi pralayaṁ gatvā karma-saṅgiṣhu jāyate
tathā pralīnas tamasi mūḍha-yoniṣhu jāyate
verses.translation_full: Those whose intellect is fixed in God, who are completely absorbed in God, with firm faith in Him as the supreme goal, such persons quickly reach the state from which there is no return, their sins having been dispelled by the light of knowledge.
verses.widget_line: Those who die in passion are reborn among those attached to action; those who die in ignorance are reborn in animal species.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
कर्मण्यकर्म यः पश्येदकर्मणि च कर्म यः ।
स बुद्धिमान्मनुष्येषु स युक्तः कृत्स्नकर्मकृत् ॥१८॥
verses.transliteration:
karmaṇy akarma yaḥ paśhyed akarmaṇi cha karma yaḥ
sa buddhimān manuṣhyeṣhu sa yuktaḥ kṛitsna-karmakṛit
verses.translation_full: The truly learned, with the eyes of divine knowledge, see with equal vision a Brahmin, a cow, an elephant, a dog, and a dog-eater.
verses.widget_line: One who sees inaction in action, and action in inaction, is wise among men and in the transcendental position.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
सर्वकर्माणि मनसा संन्यस्यास्ते सुखं वशी ।
नवद्वारे पुरे देही नैव कुर्वन्न कारयन् ॥१९॥
verses.transliteration:
sarva-karmāṇi manasā sannyasyāste sukhaṁ vaśhī
navadvāre pure dehī naiva kurvan na kārayan
verses.translation_full: Those whose minds are established in equality of vision conquer the cycle of birth and death in this very life. They possess the flawless qualities of God, and are therefore seated in the Absolute Truth.
verses.widget_line: One whose happiness is within, who is active within, whose aim is inward, is the perfect mystic and attains the Supreme.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
न प्रहृष्येत्प्रियं प्राप्य नोद्विजेत्प्राप्य चाप्रियम् ।
स्थिरबुद्धिरसम्मूढो ब्रह्मविद्ब्रह्मणि स्थितः ॥२०॥
verses.transliteration:
na prahṛiṣhyet priyaṁ prāpya nodvijet prāpya chāpriyam
sthirabuddhir asammūḍho brahma-vid brahmaṇi sthitaḥ
verses.translation_full: Established in God, having a firm understanding of divine knowledge and not hampered by delusion, they neither rejoice in getting something pleasant nor grieve on experiencing the unpleasant.
verses.widget_line: One who does not rejoice in the pleasant nor lament in the unpleasant, with steady intelligence, is situated in Brahman.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
बाह्यस्पर्शेष्वसक्तात्मा विन्दत्यात्मनि यत्सुखम् ।
स ब्रह्मयोगयुक्तात्मा सुखमक्षयमश्नुते ॥२१॥
verses.transliteration:
bāhya-sparśheṣhv asaktātmā vindaty ātmani yat sukham
sa brahma-yoga-yuktātmā sukham akṣhayam aśhnute
verses.translation_full: Those who are not attached to external sense pleasures realize divine bliss in the self. Being united with God through Yog, they experience unending happiness.
verses.widget_line: One unattached to external contacts finds happiness in the Self. United with Brahman, one enjoys eternal happiness.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
ये हि संस्पर्शजा भोगा दुःखयोनय एव ते ।
आद्यन्तवन्तः कौन्तेय न तेषु रमते बुधः ॥२२॥
verses.transliteration:
ye hi saṁsparśha-jā bhogā duḥkha-yonaya eva te
ādyantavantaḥ kaunteya na teṣhu ramate budhaḥ
verses.translation_full: The pleasures that arise from contact with the sense objects, though appearing as enjoyable to worldly-minded people, are verily a source of misery. O son of Kunti, such pleasures have a beginning and an end, so the wise do not delight in them.
verses.widget_line: O Kaunteya, pleasures born of sense contact are sources of suffering. They have a beginning and an end; the wise do not delight in them.
verses.personalized: O {name}, pleasures born of sense contact are sources of suffering. They have a beginning and an end; the wise do not delight in them.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
शक्नोतीहैव यः सोढुं प्राक्शरीरविमोक्षणात् ।
कामक्रोधोद्भवं वेगं स युक्तः स सुखी नरः ॥२३॥
verses.transliteration:
śhaknotīhaiva yaḥ soḍhuṁ prāk śharīra-vimokṣhaṇāt
kāma-krodhodbhavaṁ vegaṁ sa yuktaḥ sa sukhī naraḥ
verses.translation_full: Those persons are yogis, who before giving up the body are able to check the forces of desire and anger; and they alone are happy.
verses.widget_line: One who can withstand the force of desire and anger before giving up the body is united and happy.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
योऽन्तःसुखोऽन्तरारामस्तथान्तर्ज्योतिरेव यः ।
स योगी ब्रह्मनिर्वाणं ब्रह्मभूतोऽधिगच्छति ॥२४॥
verses.transliteration:
yo 'ntaḥ-sukho 'ntar-ārāmas tathāntar-jyotir eva yaḥ
sa yogī brahma-nirvāṇaṁ brahma-bhūto 'dhigachchhati
verses.translation_full: Those who are happy within themselves, enjoying the delight of God within, and are illumined by the inner light, such yogis are united with the Lord and are liberated from material existence.
verses.widget_line: One whose happiness is within, who delights within, whose light is within, is a yogi and attains Brahman-nirvana.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
लभन्ते ब्रह्मनिर्वाणमृषयः क्षीणकल्मषाः ।
छिन्नद्वैधा यतात्मानः सर्वभूतहिते रताः ॥२५॥
verses.transliteration:
labhante brahma-nirvāṇam ṛiṣhayaḥ kṣhīṇa-kalmaṣhāḥ
chhinna-dvaidhā yatātmānaḥ sarva-bhūta-hite ratāḥ
verses.translation_full: Those holy persons, whose sins have been purged, whose doubts are annihilated, whose minds are disciplined, and who are devoted to the welfare of all beings, attain God and are liberated from material existence.
verses.widget_line: Sages free from sin, with doubts cut, self-controlled, engaged in the welfare of all beings, attain Brahman-nirvana.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
कामक्रोधवियुक्तानां यतीनां यतचेतसाम् ।
अभितो ब्रह्मनिर्वाणं वर्तते विदितात्मनाम् ॥२६॥
verses.transliteration:
kāma-krodha-viyuktānāṁ yatīnāṁ yata-chetasām
abhito brahma-nirvāṇaṁ vartate viditātmanām
verses.translation_full: For those sanyāsīs, who have broken out of anger and lust through constant effort, who have subdued their mind, and are self-realized, liberation from material existence is both here and hereafter.
verses.widget_line: For those free from desire and anger, self-controlled, who know the Self, Brahman-nirvana exists all around.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
स्पर्शान्कृत्वा बहिर्बाह्यांश्चक्षुश्चैवान्तरे भ्रुवोः ।
प्राणापानौ समौ कृत्वा नासाभ्यन्तरचारिणौ ॥२७॥
verses.transliteration:
sparśhān kṛitvā bahir bāhyāṁśh chakṣhuśh chaivāntare bhruvoḥ
prāṇāpānau samau kṛitvā nāsābhyantara-chāriṇau
verses.translation_full: Shutting out all thoughts of external enjoyment, with the gaze fixed on the space between the eye-brows, equalizing the flow of the incoming and outgoing breath in the nostrils, and thus controlling the senses, mind, and intellect, the sage who becomes free from desire, fear, and anger, always lives in freedom.
verses.widget_line: Shutting out external sense objects, fixing the gaze between the eyebrows, equalizing the inward and outward breath, one becomes free from desire, fear, and anger.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
युञ्जन्नेवं सदात्मानं योगी विगतकल्मषः ।
सुखेन ब्रह्मसंस्पर्शमत्यन्तं सुखमश्नुते ॥२८॥
verses.transliteration:
yuñjann evaṁ sadātmānaṁ yogī vigata-kalmaṣhaḥ
sukhena brahma-saṁsparśham atyantaṁ sukham aśhnute
verses.translation_full: Shutting out all thoughts of external enjoyment, with the gaze fixed on the space between the eye-brows, equalizing the flow of the incoming and outgoing breath in the nostrils, and thus controlling the senses, mind, and intellect, the sage who becomes free from desire, fear, and anger, always lives in freedom.
verses.widget_line: The yogi, always engaged in this way, free from sin, easily attains the infinite happiness of contact with Brahman.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
सर्वभूतस्थमात्मानं सर्वभूतानि चात्मनि ।
ईक्षते योगयुक्तात्मा सर्वत्र समदर्शनः ॥२९॥
verses.transliteration:
sarva-bhūta-stham ātmānaṁ sarva-bhūtāni chātmani
īkṣhate yoga-yuktātmā sarvatra sama-darśhanaḥ
verses.translation_full: Having realized Me as the enjoyer of all sacrifices and austerities, the Supreme Lord of all the worlds and the selfless friend of all living beings, My devotee attains peace.
verses.widget_line: One united in yoga sees the Self in all beings and all beings in the Self, seeing the same everywhere.

chapter_info.chapter_name_english: Dhyana Yoga – The Yoga of Meditation
chapter_info.theme: Krishna explains the practice of meditation, the characteristics of a yogi, and the path to self-realization through control of the mind and senses.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
श्री भगवानुवाच
अनाश्रितः कर्मफलं कार्यं कर्म करोति यः ।
स संन्यासी च योगी च न निरग्निर्न चाक्रियः ॥१॥
verses.transliteration:
śhrī bhagavān uvācha
anāśhritaḥ karma-phalaṁ kāryaṁ karma karoti yaḥ
sa sannyāsī cha yogī cha na niragnir na chākriyaḥ
verses.translation_full: The Supreme Lord said: Those who perform prescribed duties without desiring the results of their actions are actual sanyāsīs (renunciates) and yogis, not those who have merely ceased performing sacrifices such as Agnihotra yajna or abandoned bodily activities.
verses.widget_line: One who performs duty without attachment to results is a true renunciate and yogi, not one who merely abstains from work.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यं संन्यासमिति प्राहुर्योगं तं विद्धि पाण्डव ।
न ह्यसंन्यस्तसङ्कल्पो योगी भवति कश्चन ॥२॥
verses.transliteration:
yaṁ sannyāsam iti prāhur yogaṁ taṁ viddhi pāṇḍava
na hy asannyasta-saṅkalpo yogī bhavati kaśhchana
verses.translation_full: O Pandava, understand that what is called renunciation is the same as yoga, for no one becomes a yogi without renouncing selfish desires.
verses.widget_line: O Pandava, what is called renunciation is the same as yoga, for no one becomes a yogi without renouncing selfish desires.
verses.personalized: O {name}, what is called renunciation is the same as yoga, for no one becomes a yogi without renouncing selfish desires.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
आरुरुक्षोर्मुनेर्योगं कर्म कारणमुच्यते ।
योगारूढस्य तस्यैव शमः कारणमुच्यते ॥३॥
verses.transliteration:
ārurukṣhor muner yogaṁ karma kāraṇam uchyate
yogārūḍhasya tasyaiva śhamaḥ kāraṇam uchyate
verses.translation_full: To the soul who is aspiring for perfection in Yog, work without attachment is said to be the means; to the sage who is already elevated in Yog, tranquility in meditation is said to be the means.
verses.widget_line: For one seeking to ascend in yoga, action is the means; for one who has attained yoga, tranquility is the means.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यदा हि नेन्द्रियार्थेषु न कर्मस्वनुषज्जते ।
सर्वसङ्कल्पसंन्यासी योगारूढस्तदोच्यते ॥४॥
verses.transliteration:
yadā hi nendriyārtheṣhu na karmasv anuṣhajjate
sarva-saṅkalpa-sannyāsī yogārūḍhas tadochyate
verses.translation_full: When one is not attached to sense objects or actions, having renounced all desires, they are said to have attained yoga.
verses.widget_line: When one is not attached to sense objects or actions, having renounced all desires, they are said to have attained yoga.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
उद्धरेदात्मनाऽऽत्मानं नात्मानमवसादयेत् ।
आत्मैव ह्यात्मनो बन्धुरात्मैव रिपुरात्मनः ॥५॥
verses.transliteration:
uddhared ātmanātmānaṁ nātmānam avasādayet
ātmaiva hyātmano bandhur ātmaiva ripur ātmanaḥ
verses.translation_full: Elevate yourself through the power of your mind, and not degrade yourself, for the mind can be the friend and also the enemy of the self.
verses.widget_line: One should uplift oneself by one's own mind and not degrade oneself; the mind is both friend and enemy of the self.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
बन्धुरात्मात्मनस्तस्य येनात्मैवात्मना जितः ।
अनात्मनस्तु शत्रुत्वे वर्तेतात्मैव शत्रुवत् ॥६॥
verses.transliteration:
bandhur ātmātmanas tasya yenātmaivātmanā jitaḥ
anātmanas tu śhatrutve vartetātmaiva śhatruvat
verses.translation_full: For one who has conquered the mind, the mind is the best of friends; but for one who has failed to do so, the mind will remain the greatest enemy.
verses.widget_line: For one who has conquered the mind, it is the best friend; for one who has not, it remains the greatest enemy.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
जितात्मनः प्रशान्तस्य परमात्मा समाहितः ।
शीतोष्णसुखदुःखेषु तथा मानापमानयोः ॥७॥
verses.transliteration:
jitātmanaḥ praśhāntasya paramātmā samāhitaḥ
śhītoṣhṇa-sukha-duḥkheṣhu tathā mānāpamānayoḥ
verses.translation_full: The yogis who have conquered the mind rise above the dualities of cold and heat, joy and sorrow, and honor and dishonor. Such yogis remain peaceful and steadfast in their devotion to God.
verses.widget_line: The Supreme Self is perfectly situated in one who has conquered the mind, remaining unaffected by heat and cold, pleasure and pain, honor and dishonor.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
ज्ञानविज्ञानतृप्तात्मा कूटस्थो विजितेन्द्रियः ।
युक्त इत्युच्यते योगी समलोष्टाश्मकाञ्चनः ॥८॥
verses.transliteration:
jñāna-vijñāna-tṛiptātmā kūṭa-stho vijitendriyaḥ
yukta ity uchyate yogī sama-loṣhṭāśhma-kāñchanaḥ
verses.translation_full: The yogi who are satisfied by knowledge and discrimination, and have conquered their senses, remain undisturbed in all circumstances. They see everything—dirt, stones, and gold—as the same.
verses.widget_line: A yogi is one who is satisfied by knowledge and realization, unmovable, has conquered the senses, and sees earth, stone, and gold as the same.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
सुहृन्मित्रार्युदासीनमध्यस्थद्वेष्यबन्धुषु ।
साधुष्वपि च पापेषु समबुद्धिर्विशिष्यते ॥९॥
verses.transliteration:
suhṛin-mitrāry-udāsīna-madhyastha-dveṣhya-bandhuṣhu
sādhuṣhv api cha pāpeṣhu sama-buddhir viśhiṣhyate
verses.translation_full: The yogis look upon all—well-wishers, friends, foes, the pious, and the sinners—with an impartial intellect. The yogi who is of equal intellect toward friend, companion, and foe, neutral among enemies and relatives, and unbiased between the righteous and sinful, is considered to be distinguished among humans.
verses.widget_line: One who is equal-minded toward friends, enemies, neutrals, the pious, and sinners is distinguished.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
योगी युञ्जीत सततमात्मानं रहसि स्थितः ।
एकाकी यतचित्तात्मा निराशीरपरिग्रहः ॥१०॥
verses.transliteration:
yogī yuñjīta satatam ātmānaṁ rahasi sthitaḥ
ekākī yata-chittātmā nirāśhīr aparigrahaḥ
verses.translation_full: A yogi should always engage the mind in meditation, remaining in solitude, alone, with a controlled mind and body, free from desires and possessions.
verses.widget_line: A yogi should always engage in meditation, remaining in solitude, alone, with controlled mind and body, free from desires and possessions.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
शुचौ देशे प्रतिष्ठाप्य स्थिरमासनमात्मनः ।
नात्युच्छ्रितं नातिनीचं चैलाजिनकुशोत्तरम् ॥११॥
verses.transliteration:
śhuchau deśhe pratiṣhṭhāpya sthiram āsanam ātmanaḥ
nātyuchchhritaṁ nātinīchaṁ chailājina-kuśhottaram
verses.translation_full: To practice Yog, one should make an āsan (seat) in a sanctified place, by placing Kuśh grass, deer skin, and a cloth, one over the other. The āsan should be neither too high nor too low.
verses.widget_line: In a clean place, establish a firm seat, neither too high nor too low, made of cloth, deer skin, and kusa grass.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
तत्रैकाग्रं मनः कृत्वा यतचित्तेन्द्रियक्रियः ।
उपविश्यासने युञ्ज्याद्योगमात्मविशुद्धये ॥१२॥
verses.transliteration:
tatraikāgraṁ manaḥ kṛitvā yata-chittendriya-kriyaḥ
upaviśhyāsane yuñjyād yogam ātmaviśhuddhaye
verses.translation_full: Seated firmly on it, the yogi should strive to purify the mind by focusing it in meditation with one pointed concentration, controlling all thoughts and activities.
verses.widget_line: There, having made the mind one-pointed, with controlled mind and senses, sit on the seat and practice yoga for self-purification.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
समं कायशिरोग्रीवं धारयन्नचलं स्थिरः ।
सम्प्रेक्ष्य नासिकाग्रं स्वं दिशश्चानवलोकयन् ॥१३॥
verses.transliteration:
samaṁ kāya-śhiro-grīvaṁ dhārayann achalaṁ sthiraḥ
samprekṣhya nāsikāgraṁ svaṁ diśhaśh chānavalokayan
verses.translation_full: He must hold the body, neck, and head firmly in a straight line, and gaze at the tip of the nose, without allowing the eyes to wander.
verses.widget_line: Holding the body, head, and neck erect and still, fixing the eyes on the tip of the nose, not looking in any direction.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
प्रशान्तात्मा विगतभीर्ब्रह्मचारिव्रते स्थितः ।
मनः सनियम्य मच्चित्तो युक्त आसीत मत्परः ॥१४॥
verses.transliteration:
praśhāntātmā vigata-bhīr brahmachāri-vrate sthitaḥ
manaḥ saniyamya mac-chitto yukta āsīta mat-paraḥ
verses.translation_full: With a serene mind, free from fear, established in the vow of celibacy, controlling the mind, thinking of Me, and balanced, let him sit, having Me as the supreme goal.
verses.widget_line: With a serene mind, free from fear, established in celibacy, controlling the mind, thinking of Me, let him sit, having Me as the supreme goal.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
युञ्जन्नेवं सदात्मानं योगी नियतमानसः ।
शान्तिं निर्वाणपरमां मत्संस्थामधिगच्छति ॥१५॥
verses.transliteration:
yuñjann evaṁ sadātmānaṁ yogī niyata-mānasaḥ
śhāntiṁ nirvāṇa-paramāṁ mat-saṁsthām adhigachchhati
verses.translation_full: Thus, constantly keeping the mind absorbed in Me, the yogi of disciplined mind attains nirvāṇ, and abides in Me in supreme peace.
verses.widget_line: The yogi who, with controlled mind, always engages in this way, attains the supreme peace of nirvana, which is in Me.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
नात्यश्नतस्तु योगोऽस्ति न चैकान्तमनश्नतः ।
न चातिस्वप्नशीलस्य जाग्रतो नैव चार्जुन ॥१६॥
verses.transliteration:
nātyaśhnatas tu yogo 'sti na chaikāntam anaśhnataḥ
na chāti-svapna-śhīlasya jāgrato naiva chārjuna
verses.translation_full: O Arjun, those who eat too much or too little, sleep too much or too little, cannot attain success in Yog.
verses.widget_line: O Arjuna, yoga is not for one who eats too much or too little, nor for one who sleeps too much or too little.
verses.personalized: O {name}, yoga is not for one who eats too much or too little, nor for one who sleeps too much or too little.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
युक्ताहारविहारस्य युक्तचेष्टस्य कर्मसु ।
युक्तस्वप्नावबोधस्य योगो भवति दुःखहा ॥१७॥
verses.transliteration:
yuktāhāra-vihārasya yukta-cheṣhṭasya karmasu
yukta-svapnāvabodhasya yogo bhavati duḥkha-hā
verses.translation_full: But those who are temperate in eating and recreation, balanced in work, and regulated in sleep, can mitigate all sorrows by practicing Yog.
verses.widget_line: For one who is moderate in eating and recreation, balanced in actions, regulated in sleep and wakefulness, yoga destroys misery.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यदा विनियतं चित्तमात्मन्येवावतिष्ठते ।
निःस्पृहः सर्वकामेभ्यो युक्त इत्युच्यते तदा ॥१८॥
verses.transliteration:
yadā viniyataṁ chittam ātmany evāvatiṣhṭhate
niḥspṛihaḥ sarva-kāmebhyo yukta ity uchyate tadā
verses.translation_full: When the controlled mind is established in the self alone, free from all material desires, then one is said to be united in yoga.
verses.widget_line: When the controlled mind is established in the self alone, free from all material desires, then one is said to be united in yoga.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यथा दीपो निवातस्थो नेङ्गते सोपमा स्मृता ।
योगिनो यतचित्तस्य युञ्जतो योगमात्मनः ॥१९॥
verses.transliteration:
yathā dīpo nivāta-stho neṅgate sopamā smṛitā
yogino yata-chittasya yuñjato yogam ātmanaḥ
verses.translation_full: Just as a lamp in a windless place does not flicker, so the disciplined mind of a yogi remains steady in meditation on the Supreme.
verses.widget_line: As a lamp in a windless place does not flicker, so the yogi with controlled mind remains steady in meditation on the self.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यत्रोपरमते चित्तं निरुद्धं योगसेवया ।
यत्र चैवात्मनाऽऽत्मानं पश्यन्नात्मनि तुष्यति ॥२०॥
verses.transliteration:
yatroparamate chittaṁ niruddhaṁ yoga-sevayā
yatra chaivātmanātmānaṁ paśhyann ātmani tuṣhyati
verses.translation_full: When the mind, restrained from material activities, becomes still by the practice of Yog, then the yogi is able to behold the soul through the purified mind, and he rejoices in the inner joy.
verses.widget_line: When the mind, restrained by yoga practice, attains tranquility, and when seeing the self by the self, one is satisfied in the self.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
सुखमात्यन्तिकं यत्तद्बुद्धिग्राह्यमतीन्द्रियम् ।
वेत्ति यत्र न चैवायं स्थितश्चलति तत्त्वतः ॥२१॥
verses.transliteration:
sukham ātyantikaṁ yat tad buddhi-grāhyam atīndriyam
vetti yatra na chaivāyaṁ sthitaśh chalati tattvataḥ
verses.translation_full: In that state, one experiences the infinite joy that is beyond the senses and is perceived by the intellect. Established in that, one never deviates from the truth.
verses.widget_line: In that state, one experiences infinite joy beyond the senses, perceived by the intellect. Established in that, one never deviates from the truth.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यं लब्ध्वा चापरं लाभं मन्यते नाधिकं ततः ।
यस्मिन्स्थितो न दुःखेन गुरुणापि विचाल्यते ॥२२॥
verses.transliteration:
yaṁ labdhvā chāparaṁ lābhaṁ manyate nādhikaṁ tataḥ
yasmin sthito na duḥkhena guruṇāpi vichālyate
verses.translation_full: Having gained that state, one does not consider any attainment to be greater. Being thus established, one is not shaken even in the midst of the greatest calamity.
verses.widget_line: Having obtained which, one thinks there is no greater gain, and established in which, one is not shaken even by heavy sorrow.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
तं विद्याद्दुःखसंयोगवियोगं योगसंज्ञितम् ।
स निश्चयेन योक्तव्यो योगोऽनिर्विण्णचेतसा ॥२३॥
verses.transliteration:
taṁ vidyād duḥkha-saṁyoga-viyogaṁ yoga-saṁjñitam
sa niśhchayena yoktavyo yogaḥ anirviṇṇa-chetasā
verses.translation_full: That state of severance from union with misery is known as Yog. This Yog should be resolutely practiced with determination free from pessimism.
verses.widget_line: That which is known as yoga is the severance from the union with pain. This yoga should be practiced with determination and undepressed heart.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
सङ्कल्पप्रभवान्कामांस्त्यक्त्वा सर्वानशेषतः ।
मनसैवेन्द्रियग्रामं विनियम्य समन्ततः ॥२४॥
verses.transliteration:
saṅkalpa-prabhavān kāmāns tyaktvā sarvān aśheṣhataḥ
manasaivendriya-grāmaṁ viniyamya samantataḥ
verses.translation_full: Abandoning all desires born of mental concoctions, and restraining the senses from all sides by the mind alone.
verses.widget_line: Abandoning all desires born of mental concoctions, and restraining the senses from all sides by the mind alone.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
शनैः शनैरुपरमेद्बुद्ध्या धृतिगृहीतया ।
आत्मसंस्थं मनः कृत्वा न किञ्चिदपि चिन्तयेत् ॥२५॥
verses.transliteration:
śhanaiḥ śhanair uparamed buddhyā dhṛiti-gṛihītayā
ātma-saṁsthaṁ manaḥ kṛitvā na kiñchid api chintayet
verses.translation_full: Slowly and steadily, with conviction in the intellect, the mind will become fixed in God alone, and will think of nothing else.
verses.widget_line: Gradually, step by step, one should become situated in trance by means of intelligence sustained by conviction, and thus the mind should be fixed on the self alone.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यतो यतो निश्चरति मनश्चञ्चलमस्थिरम् ।
ततस्ततो नियम्यैतदात्मन्येव वशं नयेत् ॥२६॥
verses.transliteration:
yato yato niśhcharati manaśh chañchalam asthiram
tatas tato niyamyaitad ātmany eva vaśhaṁ nayet
verses.translation_full: From whatever and wherever the mind wanders due to its flickering and unsteady nature, one must certainly withdraw it and bring it back under the control of the self.
verses.widget_line: From wherever the mind wanders due to its flickering nature, one must withdraw it and bring it back under the control of the self.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
प्रशान्तमनसं ह्येनं योगिनं सुखमुत्तमम् ।
उपैति शान्तरजसं ब्रह्मभूतमकल्मषम् ॥२७॥
verses.transliteration:
praśhānta-manasaṁ hy enaṁ yoginaṁ sukham uttamam
upaiti śhānta-rajasaṁ brahma-bhūtam akalmaṣham
verses.translation_full: Great transcendental happiness comes to the yogi whose mind is calm, whose passions are subdued, who is without sin, and who sees everything in connection with God.
verses.widget_line: The yogi whose mind is serene, whose passion is pacified, who is free from sin, and who has become one with Brahman, attains the highest happiness.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
युञ्जन्नेवं सदात्मानं योगी विगतकल्मषः ।
सुखेन ब्रह्मसंस्पर्शमत्यन्तं सुखमश्नुते ॥२८॥
verses.transliteration:
yuñjann evaṁ sadātmānaṁ yogī vigata-kalmaṣhaḥ
sukhena brahma-saṁsparśham atyantaṁ sukham aśhnute
verses.translation_full: The yogi who, always engaging the self in this way, is free from sin, easily attains the infinite happiness of contact with Brahman.
verses.widget_line: The yogi who, always engaging in this way, is free from sin, easily attains the infinite happiness of contact with Brahman.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
सर्वभूतस्थमात्मानं सर्वभूतानि चात्मनि ।
ईक्षते योगयुक्तात्मा सर्वत्र समदर्शनः ॥२९॥
verses.transliteration:
sarva-bhūta-stham ātmānaṁ sarva-bhūtāni chātmani
īkṣhate yoga-yuktātmā sarvatra sama-darśhanaḥ
verses.translation_full: The true yogis, uniting their consciousness with God, see with equal eye, all living beings in God and God in all living beings.
verses.widget_line: One who sees the self in all beings and all beings in the self, with equal vision everywhere, sees Me.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यो मां पश्यति सर्वत्र सर्वं च मयि पश्यति ।
तस्याहं न प्रणश्यामि स च मे न प्रणश्यति ॥३०॥
verses.transliteration:
yo māṁ paśhyati sarvatra sarvaṁ cha mayi paśhyati
tasyāhaṁ na praṇaśhyāmi sa cha me na praṇaśhyati
verses.translation_full: For those who see Me everywhere and see all things in Me, I am never lost, nor are they ever lost to Me.
verses.widget_line: One who sees Me everywhere and sees everything in Me, for such a person I am never lost, nor is he ever lost to Me.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
सर्वभूतस्थितं यो मां भजत्येकत्वमास्थितः ।
सर्वथा वर्तमानोऽपि स योगी मयि वर्तते ॥३१॥
verses.transliteration:
sarva-bhūta-sthitaṁ yo māṁ bhajaty ekatvam āsthitaḥ
sarvathā vartamāno 'pi sa yogī mayi vartate
verses.translation_full: The yogi who, established in oneness, worships Me dwelling in all beings, lives in Me, however he may be engaged.
verses.widget_line: The yogi who, established in oneness, worships Me dwelling in all beings, lives in Me, however he may be engaged.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
आत्मौपम्येन सर्वत्र समं पश्यति योऽर्जुन ।
सुखं वा यदि वा दुःखं स योगी परमो मतः ॥३२॥
verses.transliteration:
ātmaupamyena sarvatra samaṁ paśhyati yo 'rjuna
sukhaṁ vā yadi vā duḥkhaṁ sa yogī paramo mataḥ
verses.translation_full: I regard them to be perfect yogis who see the true equality of all living beings and respond to the joys and sorrows of others as if they were their own.
verses.widget_line: O Arjuna, one who sees with equality everywhere, seeing the self in all beings, whether in happiness or distress, is the highest yogi.
verses.personalized: O {name}, one who sees with equality everywhere, seeing the self in all beings, whether in happiness or distress, is the highest yogi.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
असंशयं महाबाहो मनो दुर्निग्रहं चलम् ।
अभ्यासेन तु कौन्तेय वैराग्येण च गृह्यते ॥३५॥
verses.transliteration:
asaṁśhayaṁ mahā-bāho mano durnigrahaṁ chalam
abhyāsena tu kaunteya vairāgyeṇa cha gṛihyate
verses.translation_full: O mighty-armed son of Kunti, it is undoubtedly very difficult to curb the restless mind, but it is possible by constant practice and by detachment.
verses.widget_line: O mighty-armed son of Kunti, it is undoubtedly very difficult to curb the restless mind, but it is possible by constant practice and detachment.
verses.personalized: O {name}, it is undoubtedly very difficult to curb the restless mind, but it is possible by constant practice and detachment.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
असंयतात्मना योगो दुष्प्राप इति मे मतिः ।
वश्यात्मना तु यतता शक्योऽवाप्तुमुपायतः ॥३६॥
verses.transliteration:
asaṁyatātmanā yogo duṣhprāpa iti me matiḥ
vaśhyātmanā tu yatatā śhakyo 'vāptum upāyataḥ
verses.translation_full: Yog is difficult to attain for one whose mind is unbridled. However, those who have learnt to control the mind, and who strive earnestly by proper means, can attain perfection in Yog. This is My opinion.
verses.widget_line: For one whose mind is unbridled, yoga is difficult to achieve. But one whose mind is controlled and who strives by appropriate means is assured of success.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
श्री भगवानुवाच
पार्थ नैवेह नामुत्र विनाशस्तस्य विद्यते ।
न हि कल्याणकृत्कश्चिद्दुर्गतिं तात गच्छति ॥४०॥
verses.transliteration:
śhrī bhagavān uvācha
pārtha naiveha nāmutra vināśhas tasya vidyate
na hi kalyāṇa-kṛit kaśhchid durgatiṁ tāta gachchhati
verses.translation_full: The Supreme Lord said: O son of Pritha, there is no destruction for one who has taken a step on this path. Neither in this world nor in the next world does he meet with destruction. My dear friend, one who does good, O son of Kunti, never meets with a bad end.
verses.widget_line: O Partha, there is no destruction for one who has taken a step on this path. One who does good never meets with a bad end, O son.
verses.personalized: O {name}, there is no destruction for one who has taken a step on this path. One who does good never meets with a bad end.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
प्राप्य पुण्यकृतां लोकानुषित्वा शाश्वतीः समाः ।
शुचीनां श्रीमतां गेहे योगभ्रष्टोऽभिजायते ॥४१॥
verses.transliteration:
prāpya puṇya-kṛitāṁ lokān uṣhitvā śhāśhvatīḥ samāḥ
śhuchīnāṁ śhrīmatāṁ gehe yoga-bhraṣhṭo 'bhijāyate
verses.translation_full: The unsuccessful yogis, upon death, go to the abodes of the virtuous. After dwelling there for many ages, they are again reborn in the earth plane, into a family of pious and prosperous people.
verses.widget_line: One who falls away from yoga, having attained the worlds of the righteous, is born again in the house of the pure and wealthy.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अथवा योगिनामेव कुले भवति धीमताम् ।
एतद्धि दुर्लभतरं लोके जन्म यदीदृशम् ॥४२॥
verses.transliteration:
athavā yoginām eva kule bhavati dhīmatām
etad dhi durlabhataraṁ loke janma yad īdṛiśham
verses.translation_full: Or he takes birth in a family of wise yogis. Such a birth is indeed very rare in this world.
verses.widget_line: Or he takes birth in a family of wise yogis. Such a birth is indeed very rare in this world.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
तत्र तं बुद्धिसंयोगं लभते पौर्वदेहिकम् ।
यतते च ततो भूयः संसिद्धौ कुरुनन्दन ॥४३॥
verses.transliteration:
tatra taṁ buddhi-saṁyogaṁ labhate paurva-dehikam
yatate cha tato bhūyaḥ saṁsiddhau kurunandana
verses.translation_full: On taking such a birth, O descendant of Kurus, they reawaken the wisdom of their previous lives, and strive even harder toward perfection in Yog.
verses.widget_line: O son of Kuru, on taking such a birth, he again revives the divine consciousness of his previous life, and tries to make further progress.
verses.personalized: O {name}, on taking such a birth, he again revives the divine consciousness of his previous life, and tries to make further progress.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
पूर्वाभ्यासेन तेनैव ह्रियते ह्यवशोऽपि सः ।
जिज्ञासुरपि योगस्य शब्दब्रह्मातिवर्तते ॥४४॥
verses.transliteration:
pūrvābhyāsena tenaiva hriyate hy avaśho 'pi saḥ
jijñāsur api yogasya śhabda-brahmātivartate
verses.translation_full: By virtue of the divine consciousness of his previous life, he automatically becomes attracted to the yogic principles—even without seeking them. Such an inquisitive transcendentalist, striving for yoga, stands always above the ritualistic principles of the scriptures.
verses.widget_line: By virtue of the divine consciousness of his previous life, he automatically becomes attracted to yogic principles, even without seeking them.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
प्रयत्नाद्यतमानस्तु योगी संशुद्धकिल्बिषः ।
अनेकजन्मसंसिद्धस्ततो याति परां गतिम् ॥४५॥
verses.transliteration:
prayatnād yatamānas tu yogī saṁśhuddha-kilbiṣhaḥ
aneka-janma-saṁsiddhas tato yāti parāṁ gatim
verses.translation_full: With the accumulated merits of many past births, when these yogis engage in sincere endeavors to make further progress, they become purified from material desires and attain perfection in this life itself.
verses.widget_line: But when the yogi engages with sincere endeavor, being washed of all contaminations, then ultimately, after many births of practice, he attains the supreme goal.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
तपस्विभ्योऽधिको योगी ज्ञानिभ्योऽपि मतोऽधिकः ।
कर्मिभ्यश्चाधिको योगी तस्माद्योगी भवार्जुन ॥४६॥
verses.transliteration:
tapasvibhyo 'dhiko yogī jñānibhyo 'pi mato 'dhikaḥ
karmibhyaśh chādhiko yogī tasmād yogī bhavārjuna
verses.translation_full: A yogi is superior to the tapasvī (ascetic), superior to the jñānī (a person of learning), and even superior to the karmī (ritualistic performer). Therefore, O Arjun, strive to be a yogi.
verses.widget_line: A yogi is greater than the ascetic, greater than the empiricist, and greater than the fruitive worker. Therefore, O Arjuna, be a yogi.
verses.personalized: O {name}, a yogi is greater than the ascetic, greater than the empiricist, and greater than the fruitive worker. Therefore, be a yogi.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
योगिनामपि सर्वेषां मद्गतेनान्तरात्मना ।
श्रद्धावान्भजते यो मां स मे युक्ततमो मतः ॥४७॥
verses.transliteration:
yoginām api sarveṣhāṁ mad-gatenāntarātmanā
śhraddhāvān bhajate yo māṁ sa me yuktatamo mataḥ
verses.translation_full: Of all yogis, those whose minds are always absorbed in Me, and who engage in devotion to Me with great faith, them I consider to be the highest of all.
verses.widget_line: Of all yogis, the one with great faith who always abides in Me, thinks of Me within, and renders loving service to Me is the most intimately united with Me in yoga and is the highest of all.

chapter_info.chapter_name_english: Jnana Vijnana Yoga – The Yoga of Knowledge and Wisdom
chapter_info.theme: Krishna reveals His divine nature, explaining that He is the source of all material and spiritual energies, and describes the different types of devotees who approach Him.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
श्री भगवानुवाच
मय्यासक्तमनाः पार्थ योगं युञ्जन्मदाश्रयः ।
असंशयं समग्रं मां यथा ज्ञास्यसि तच्छृणु ॥१॥
verses.transliteration:
śhrī bhagavān uvācha
mayyāsakta-manāḥ pārtha yogaṁ yuñjan mad-āśhrayaḥ
asaṁśhayaṁ samagraṁ māṁ yathā jñāsyasi tach chhṛiṇu
verses.translation_full: The Supreme Lord said: Now listen, O Arjun, how, with the mind attached exclusively to Me, and surrendering to Me through the practice of bhakti yog, you can know Me completely, free from doubt.
verses.widget_line: O Partha, hear how by practicing yoga with your mind attached to Me, you can know Me completely, free from doubt.
verses.personalized: O {name}, hear how by practicing yoga with your mind attached to Me, you can know Me completely, free from doubt.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
ज्ञानं तेऽहं सविज्ञानमिदं वक्ष्याम्यशेषतः ।
यज्ज्ञात्वा नेह भूयोऽन्यज्ज्ञातव्यमवशिष्यते ॥२॥
verses.transliteration:
jñānaṁ te 'haṁ sa-vijñānam idaṁ vakṣhyāmy aśheṣhataḥ
yaj jñātvā neha bhūyo 'nyaj jñātavyam avaśhiṣhyate
verses.translation_full: I shall now reveal unto you fully this knowledge and wisdom, knowing which nothing else remains to be known in this world.
verses.widget_line: I shall now declare to you this knowledge together with wisdom, knowing which nothing further remains to be known.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
मनुष्याणां सहस्रेषु कश्चिद्यतति सिद्धये ।
यततामपि सिद्धानां कश्चिन्मां वेत्ति तत्त्वतः ॥३॥
verses.transliteration:
manuṣhyāṇāṁ sahasreṣhu kaśhchid yatati siddhaye
yatatām api siddhānāṁ kaśhchin māṁ vetti tattvataḥ
verses.translation_full: Amongst thousands of persons, hardly one strives for perfection; and amongst those who have achieved perfection, hardly one knows Me in truth.
verses.widget_line: Among thousands of men, one may strive for perfection; and among those who have achieved perfection, hardly one knows Me in truth.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
भूमिरापोऽनलो वायुः खं मनो बुद्धिरेव च ।
अहङ्कार इतीयं मे भिन्ना प्रकृतिरष्टधा ॥४॥
verses.transliteration:
bhūmir āpo 'nalo vāyuḥ khaṁ mano buddhir eva cha
ahaṅkāra itīyaṁ me bhinnā prakṛitir aṣhṭadhā
verses.translation_full: Earth, water, fire, air, space, mind, intellect, and ego—these are eight components of My material energy.
verses.widget_line: Earth, water, fire, air, ether, mind, intellect, and ego—these eight constitute My separated material energies.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अपरेयमितस्त्वन्यां प्रकृतिं विद्धि मे पराम् ।
जीवभूतां महाबाहो ययेदं धार्यते जगत् ॥५॥
verses.transliteration:
apareyam itas tv anyāṁ prakṛitiṁ viddhi me parām
jīva-bhūtāṁ mahā-bāho yayedaṁ dhāryate jagat
verses.translation_full: Beyond this inferior nature, O mighty-armed Arjuna, there is a superior energy of Mine, which comprises the living entities who are sustaining this world.
verses.widget_line: O mighty-armed, beyond this inferior nature, there is a superior energy of Mine, which comprises the living entities who sustain this world.
verses.personalized: O {name}, beyond this inferior nature, there is a superior energy of Mine, which comprises the living entities who sustain this world.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
एतद्योनीनि भूतानि सर्वाणीत्युपधारय ।
अहं कृत्स्नस्य जगतः प्रभवः प्रलयस्तथा ॥६॥
verses.transliteration:
etad-yonīni bhūtāni sarvāṇīty upadhāraya
ahaṁ kṛitsnasya jagataḥ prabhavaḥ pralayas tathā
verses.translation_full: Know that all living beings are manifested by these two energies of Mine. I am the source of the entire creation, and into Me it again dissolves.
verses.widget_line: Understand that all living beings are born of this material and spiritual nature. I am the origin and dissolution of the entire universe.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
मत्तः परतरं नान्यत्किञ्चिदस्ति धनञ्जय ।
मयि सर्वमिदं प्रोतं सूत्रे मणिगणा इव ॥७॥
verses.transliteration:
mattaḥ parataraṁ nānyat kiñchid asti dhanañjaya
mayi sarvam idaṁ protaṁ sūtre maṇi-gaṇā iva
verses.translation_full: There is nothing higher than Me, O Dhananjaya. All this is strung on Me like pearls on a thread.
verses.widget_line: There is nothing higher than Me, O Dhananjaya. All this is strung on Me like pearls on a thread.
verses.personalized: There is nothing higher than Me, O {name}. All this is strung on Me like pearls on a thread.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
रसोऽहमप्सु कौन्तेय प्रभास्मि शशिसूर्ययोः ।
प्रणवः सर्ववेदेषु शब्दः खे पौरुषं नृषु ॥८॥
verses.transliteration:
raso 'ham apsu kaunteya prabhāsmi śhaśhi-sūryayoḥ
praṇavaḥ sarva-vedeṣhu śhabdaḥ khe pauruṣhaṁ nṛiṣhu
verses.translation_full: I am the taste in water, O son of Kunti, and the radiance of the sun and the moon. I am the sacred syllable Om in the Vedic mantras; I am the sound in ether, and the ability in humans.
verses.widget_line: I am the taste in water, O son of Kunti, the light in the sun and moon, the syllable Om in all the Vedas, the sound in ether, and the ability in man.
verses.personalized: I am the taste in water, O {name}, the light in the sun and moon, the syllable Om in all the Vedas, the sound in ether, and the ability in man.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
पुण्यो गन्धः पृथिव्यां च तेजश्चास्मि विभावसौ ।
जीवनं सर्वभूतेषु तपश्चास्मि तपस्विषु ॥९॥
verses.transliteration:
puṇyo gandhaḥ pṛithivyāṁ cha tejaśh chāsmi vibhāvasau
jīvanaṁ sarva-bhūteṣhu tapaśh chāsmi tapasviṣhu
verses.translation_full: I am the original fragrance of the earth, the heat in fire, the life in all beings, and the penance of ascetics.
verses.widget_line: I am the original fragrance of the earth, the heat in fire, the life in all beings, and the penance of ascetics.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
बीजं मां सर्वभूतानां विद्धि पार्थ सनातनम् ।
बुद्धिर्बुद्धिमतामस्मि तेजस्तेजस्विनामहम् ॥१०॥
verses.transliteration:
bījaṁ māṁ sarva-bhūtānāṁ viddhi pārtha sanātanam
buddhir buddhimatām asmi tejas tejasvinām aham
verses.translation_full: O Arjun, know that I am the eternal seed of all beings. I am the intellect of the intelligent, and the splendor of the glorious.
verses.widget_line: Know Me, O Partha, to be the eternal seed of all beings. I am the intelligence of the intelligent, and the brilliance of the brilliant.
verses.personalized: Know Me, O {name}, to be the eternal seed of all beings. I am the intelligence of the intelligent, and the brilliance of the brilliant.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
बलं बलवतां चाहं कामरागविवर्जितम् ।
धर्माविरुद्धो भूतेषु कामोऽस्मि भरतर्षभ ॥११॥
verses.transliteration:
balaṁ balavatāṁ chāhaṁ kāma-rāga-vivarjitam
dharmāviruddho bhūteṣhu kāmo 'smi bharatarṣhabha
verses.translation_full: I am the strength of the strong, devoid of desire and passion. I am sex life which is not contrary to dharma, O chief of the Bharatas.
verses.widget_line: I am the strength of the strong, devoid of desire and passion. I am sex life which is not contrary to dharma, O chief of the Bharatas.
verses.personalized: I am the strength of the strong, devoid of desire and passion. I am sex life which is not contrary to dharma, O {name}.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
ये चैव सात्त्विका भावा राजसास्तामसाश्च ये ।
मत्त एवेति तान्विद्धि न त्वहं तेषु ते मयि ॥१२॥
verses.transliteration:
ye chaiva sāttvikā bhāvā rājasās tāmasāśh cha ye
matta eveti tān viddhi na tvahaṁ teṣhu te mayi
verses.translation_full: The three states of material existence—goodness, passion, and ignorance—are manifested by My energy. They are in Me, but I am beyond them.
verses.widget_line: All states of being—goodness, passion, or ignorance—are manifested by My energy. I am everything, but I am independent and not under the modes of material nature.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
त्रिभिर्गुणमयैर्भावैरेभिः सर्वमिदं जगत् ।
मोहितं नाभिजानाति मामेभ्यः परमव्ययम् ॥१३॥
verses.transliteration:
tribhir guṇa-mayair bhāvair ebhiḥ sarvam idaṁ jagat
mohitaṁ nābhijānāti mām ebhyaḥ param avyayam
verses.translation_full: Deluded by the three modes (goodness, passion, and ignorance), the whole world does not know Me, who am above the modes and inexhaustible.
verses.widget_line: Deluded by the three modes, the whole world does not know Me, who am above the modes and inexhaustible.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
दैवी ह्येषा गुणमयी मम माया दुरत्यया ।
मामेव ये प्रपद्यन्ते मायामेतां तरन्ति ते ॥१४॥
verses.transliteration:
daivī hy eṣhā guṇa-mayī mama māyā duratyayā
mām eva ye prapadyante māyām etāṁ taranti te
verses.translation_full: My divine energy Maya, consisting of the three modes of nature, is very difficult to overcome. But those who surrender unto Me cross over it easily.
verses.widget_line: This divine energy of Mine, consisting of the three modes, is difficult to overcome. But those who have surrendered unto Me can easily cross beyond it.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
न मां दुष्कृतिनो मूढाः प्रपद्यन्ते नराधमाः ।
माययापहृतज्ञाना आसुरं भावमाश्रिताः ॥१५॥
verses.transliteration:
na māṁ duṣhkṛitino mūḍhāḥ prapadyante narādhamāḥ
māyayāpahṛita-jñānā āsuraṁ bhāvam āśhritāḥ
verses.translation_full: Four kinds of people do not surrender unto Me—those ignorant of knowledge, those who lazily follow their lower nature though capable of knowing Me, those with deluded intellect, and those with a demoniac nature.
verses.widget_line: The miscreants, who are grossly foolish, lowest among mankind, whose knowledge is stolen by illusion, do not surrender unto Me.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
चतुर्विधा भजन्ते मां जनाः सुकृतिनोऽर्जुन ।
आर्तो जिज्ञासुरर्थार्थी ज्ञानी च भरतर्षभ ॥१६॥
verses.transliteration:
chatur-vidhā bhajante māṁ janāḥ sukṛitino 'rjuna
ārto jijñāsur arthārthī jñānī cha bharatarṣhabha
verses.translation_full: O best among the Bharatas, four kinds of pious men begin to render devotional service unto Me—the distressed, the desirer of wealth, the inquisitive, and he who is searching for knowledge of the Absolute.
verses.widget_line: O best among the Bharatas, four kinds of pious men render devotional service unto Me—the distressed, the desirer of wealth, the inquisitive, and he who searches for knowledge of the Absolute.
verses.personalized: O {name}, four kinds of pious men render devotional service unto Me—the distressed, the desirer of wealth, the inquisitive, and he who searches for knowledge of the Absolute.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
तेषां ज्ञानी नित्ययुक्त एकभक्तिर्विशिष्यते ।
प्रियो हि ज्ञानिनोऽत्यर्थमहं स च मम प्रियः ॥१७॥
verses.transliteration:
teṣhāṁ jñānī nitya-yukta eka-bhaktir viśhiṣhyate
priyo hi jñānino 'tyartham ahaṁ sa cha mama priyaḥ
verses.translation_full: Amongst these, I consider them to be the highest, who worship Me with knowledge, and are steadfastly and exclusively devoted to Me. I am very dear to them and they are very dear to Me.
verses.widget_line: Of these, the one who is in full knowledge and always engaged in pure devotional service is the best. For I am very dear to him, and he is dear to Me.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
उदाराः सर्व एवैते ज्ञानी त्वात्मैव मे मतम् ।
आस्थितः स हि युक्तात्मा मामेवानुत्तमां गतिम् ॥१८॥
verses.transliteration:
udārāḥ sarva evaite jñānī tv ātmaiva me matam
āsthitaḥ sa hi yuktātmā mām evānuttamāṁ gatim
verses.translation_full: All these devotees are undoubtedly magnanimous souls, but he who is situated in knowledge of Me I consider to be just like My own self. Being engaged in My transcendental service, he attains Me, the highest and most perfect goal.
verses.widget_line: All these devotees are magnanimous souls, but he who is situated in knowledge of Me I consider to be just like My own self. He attains Me, the highest and most perfect goal.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
बहूनां जन्मनामन्ते ज्ञानवान्मां प्रपद्यते ।
वासुदेवः सर्वमिति स महात्मा सुदुर्लभः ॥१९॥
verses.transliteration:
bahūnāṁ janmanām ante jñānavān māṁ prapadyate
vāsudevaḥ sarvam iti sa mahātmā su-durlabhaḥ
verses.translation_full: After many births of spiritual practice, one who is endowed with knowledge surrenders unto Me, knowing Me to be all that is. Such a great soul is indeed very rare.
verses.widget_line: After many births and deaths, he who is actually in knowledge surrenders unto Me, knowing Me to be the cause of all causes. Such a great soul is very rare.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
कामैस्तैस्तैर्हृतज्ञानाः प्रपद्यन्तेऽन्यदेवताः ।
तं तं नियममास्थाय प्रकृत्या नियताः स्वया ॥२०॥
verses.transliteration:
kāmais tais tair hṛita-jñānāḥ prapadyante 'nya-devataḥ
taṁ taṁ niyamam āsthāya prakṛityā niyatāḥ svayā
verses.translation_full: Those whose knowledge has been stolen by various desires surrender unto other demigods, following their own natures, and adopt various rules and regulations.
verses.widget_line: Those whose knowledge has been stolen by various desires surrender unto other demigods, following their own natures.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यो यो यां यां तनुं भक्तः श्रद्धयार्चितुमिच्छति ।
तस्य तस्याचलां श्रद्धां तामेव विदधाम्यहम् ॥२१॥
verses.transliteration:
yo yo yāṁ yāṁ tanuṁ bhaktaḥ śhraddhayārcitum ichchhati
tasya tasyāchalāṁ śhraddhāṁ tām eva vidadhāmy aham
verses.translation_full: Whatever celestial form a devotee seeks to worship with faith, I steady the faith of such a devotee in that form.
verses.widget_line: I am in everyone's heart as the Supersoul. As soon as one desires to worship some demigod, I make his faith steady so that he can devote himself to that particular deity.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
स तया श्रद्धया युक्तस्तस्याराधनमीहते ।
लभते च ततः कामान्मयैव विहितान्हि तान् ॥२२॥
verses.transliteration:
sa tayā śhraddhayā yuktas tasyārādhanam īhate
labhate cha tataḥ kāmān mayaiva vihitān hi tān
verses.translation_full: Endowed with such faith, he endeavors to worship that particular demigod and obtains his desires. But in actuality, these benefits are bestowed by Me alone.
verses.widget_line: Endowed with such faith, he endeavors to worship that particular demigod and obtains his desires. But in actuality, these benefits are bestowed by Me alone.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अन्तवत्तु फलं तेषां तद्भवत्यल्पमेधसाम् ।
देवान्देवयजो यान्ति मद्भक्ता यान्ति मामपि ॥२३॥
verses.transliteration:
antavattu phalaṁ teṣhāṁ tad bhavaty alpa-medhasām
devān deva-yajo yānti mad-bhaktā yānti mām api
verses.translation_full: But the fruit gained by these people of little understanding is perishable. Those who worship the celestial gods go to the celestial abodes, while My devotees come to Me.
verses.widget_line: Men of small intelligence worship the demigods, and their fruits are limited and temporary. Those who worship the demigods go to the planets of the demigods, but My devotees reach My supreme abode.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अव्यक्तं व्यक्तिमापन्नं मन्यन्ते मामबुद्धयः ।
परं भावमजानन्तो ममाव्ययमनुत्तमम् ॥२४॥
verses.transliteration:
avyaktaṁ vyaktim āpannaṁ manyante mām abuddhayaḥ
paraṁ bhāvam ajānanto mamāvyayam anuttamam
verses.translation_full: Unintelligent men, who do not know Me perfectly, think that I, the Supreme Personality of Godhead, Krishna, was impersonal before and have now assumed this personality. Due to their small knowledge, they do not know My higher nature, which is imperishable and supreme.
verses.widget_line: Unintelligent men, who do not know Me perfectly, think that I was impersonal before and have now assumed this personality. They do not know My higher nature, which is imperishable and supreme.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
नाहं प्रकाशः सर्वस्य योगमायासमावृतः ।
मूढोऽयं नाभिजानाति लोको मामजमव्ययम् ॥२५॥
verses.transliteration:
nāhaṁ prakāśhaḥ sarvasya yoga-māyā-samāvṛitaḥ
mūḍho 'yaṁ nābhijānāti loko mām ajam avyayam
verses.translation_full: I am not manifest to everyone, being veiled by My divine Yogmaya energy. Hence, those without knowledge do not know that I am without birth and changeless.
verses.widget_line: I am never manifest to the foolish and unintelligent. For them I am covered by My internal potency, and therefore they do not know that I am unborn and infallible.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
वेदाहं समतीतानि वर्तमानानि चार्जुन ।
भविष्याणि च भूतानि मां तु वेद न कश्चन ॥२६॥
verses.transliteration:
vedāhaṁ samatītāni vartamānāni chārjuna
bhaviṣhyāṇi cha bhūtāni māṁ tu veda na kaśhchana
verses.translation_full: O Arjun, I know of past, present, and future, and I also know all living beings; but Me no one knows.
verses.widget_line: O Arjuna, I know everything that has happened in the past, all that is happening in the present, and all things that are yet to come. But Me no one knows.
verses.personalized: O {name}, I know everything that has happened in the past, all that is happening in the present, and all things that are yet to come. But Me no one knows.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
इच्छाद्वेषसमुत्थेन द्वन्द्वमोहेन भारत ।
सर्वभूतानि सम्मोहं सर्गे यान्ति परन्तप ॥२७॥
verses.transliteration:
ichchhā-dveṣha-samutthena dvandva-mohena bhārata
sarva-bhūtāni sammohaṁ sarge yānti parantapa
verses.translation_full: O descendant of Bharat, the dualities of desire and aversion arise from illusion. O conqueror of enemies, all living beings in the material realm are deluded by these.
verses.widget_line: O scion of Bharata, O conqueror of the foe, all living entities are born into delusion, overcome by the dualities of desire and hate.
verses.personalized: O {name}, all living entities are born into delusion, overcome by the dualities of desire and hate.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
येषां त्वन्तगतं पापं जनानां पुण्यकर्मणाम् ।
ते द्वन्द्वमोहनिर्मुक्ता भजन्ते मां दृढव्रताः ॥२८॥
verses.transliteration:
yeṣhāṁ tv anta-gataṁ pāpaṁ janānāṁ puṇya-karmaṇām
te dvandva-moha-nirmuktā bhajante māṁ dṛiḍha-vratāḥ
verses.translation_full: But persons, whose sins have been destroyed by engaging in pious activities, become free from the illusion of dualities. Such persons worship Me with determination.
verses.widget_line: Persons who have acted piously, whose sinful actions are completely eradicated and who are freed from the duality of delusion, engage themselves in My service with determination.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
जरामरणमोक्षाय मामाश्रित्य यतन्ति ये ।
ते ब्रह्म तद्विदुः कृत्स्नमध्यात्मं कर्म चाखिलम् ॥२९॥
verses.transliteration:
jarā-maraṇa-mokṣhāya mām āśhritya yatanti ye
te brahma tad viduḥ kṛitsnam adhyātmaṁ karma chākhilam
verses.translation_full: Those who take shelter in Me, striving for liberation from old-age and death, come to know the Brahman, the individual self, and the entire field of karmic action.
verses.widget_line: Intelligent persons who are endeavoring for liberation from old age and death take refuge in Me in devotional service. They are actually Brahman because they entirely know everything about transcendental and fruitive activities.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
साधिभूताधिदैवं मां साधियज्ञं च ये विदुः ।
प्रयाणकालेऽपि च मां ते विदुर्युक्तचेतसः ॥३०॥
verses.transliteration:
sādhibhūtādhidaivaṁ māṁ sādhiyajñaṁ cha ye viduḥ
prayāṇa-kāle 'pi cha māṁ te vidur yukta-chetasaḥ
verses.translation_full: Those who know Me as the governing principle of the adhibhūta (field of matter) and the adhidaiva (the celestial gods), and as adhiyajña (the Lord of all sacrificial performances), such enlightened souls are in full consciousness of Me even at the time of death.
verses.widget_line: Those who know Me as the Supreme Lord of all worlds, as the one controller, as the friend of all living entities, and as the enjoyer of all sacrifices, can understand and know Me even at the time of death.

chapter_info.chapter_name_english: Aksara Brahma Yoga – The Yoga of the Imperishable Brahman
chapter_info.theme: Krishna explains the nature of the imperishable Brahman, the process of remembering the Supreme at the time of death, and the paths that lead to liberation or material existence.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
श्री भगवानुवाच
अक्षरं ब्रह्म परमं स्वभावोऽध्यात्ममुच्यते ।
भूतभावोद्भवकरो विसर्गः कर्मसञ्ज्ञितः ॥३॥
verses.transliteration:
śhrī bhagavān uvācha
akṣharaṁ brahma paramaṁ svabhāvo 'dhyātmam uchyate
bhūta-bhāvodbhava-karo visargaḥ karma-sañjñitaḥ
verses.translation_full: The Lord said: The Supreme Indestructible Entity is called Brahman; one's own self is called adhyatma. Actions pertaining to the material personality of living beings, and its development are called karma, or fruitive activities.
verses.widget_line: The indestructible, transcendental living entity is called Brahman, and his eternal nature is called the self. Action pertaining to the development of material bodies is called karma.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अधिभूतं क्षरो भावः पुरुषश्चाधिदैवतम् ।
अधियज्ञोऽहमेवात्र देहे देहभृतां वर ॥४॥
verses.transliteration:
adhibhūtaṁ kṣharo bhāvaḥ puruṣhaśh chādhidaivatam
adhiyajño 'ham evātra dehe deha-bhṛitāṁ vara
verses.translation_full: O best of the embodied souls, the physical manifestation that is constantly changing is called adhibhūta; the universal form of God, which presides over the celestial gods in this creation, is called Adhidaiva; I, who dwell in the heart of every living being, am called Adhiyajna, or the Lord of all sacrifices.
verses.widget_line: O best of the embodied beings, the physical nature is called adhibhuta. The universal form of the Lord is called adhidaiva. And I, the Supersoul in the heart, am called adhiyajna.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अन्तकाले च मामेव स्मरन्मुक्त्वा कलेवरम् ।
यः प्रयाति स मद्भावं याति नास्त्यत्र संशयः ॥५॥
verses.transliteration:
anta-kāle cha mām eva smaran muktvā kalevaram
yaḥ prayāti sa mad-bhāvaṁ yāti nāsty atra saṁśhayaḥ
verses.translation_full: Those who relinquish the body while remembering Me at the moment of death will come to Me. There is certainly no doubt about this.
verses.widget_line: Whoever, at the end of his life, quits his body remembering Me alone at once attains My nature. Of this there is no doubt.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यं यं वापि स्मरन्भावं त्यजत्यन्ते कलेवरम् ।
तं तमेवैति कौन्तेय सदा तद्भावभावितः ॥६॥
verses.transliteration:
yaṁ yaṁ vāpi smaran bhāvaṁ tyajaty ante kalevaram
taṁ tam evaiti kaunteya sadā tad-bhāva-bhāvitaḥ
verses.translation_full: Whatever one remembers upon giving up the body at the time of death, O son of Kunti, one attains that state, being always absorbed in such contemplation.
verses.widget_line: Whatever state of being one remembers when he quits his body, O son of Kunti, that state he will attain without fail.
verses.personalized: Whatever state of being one remembers when he quits his body, O {name}, that state he will attain without fail.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
तस्मात्सर्वेषु कालेषु मामनुस्मर युध्य च ।
मय्यर्पितमनोबुद्धिर्मामेवैष्यस्यसंशयः ॥७॥
verses.transliteration:
tasmāt sarveṣhu kāleṣhu mām anusmara yudhya cha
mayyarpita-mano-buddhir mām evaiṣhyasy asaṁśhayaḥ
verses.translation_full: Therefore, always remember Me and also do your duty of fighting the war. With mind and intellect surrendered to Me, you will definitely attain Me; of this, there is no doubt.
verses.widget_line: Therefore, always think of Me and at the same time carry out your prescribed duty. With your activities dedicated to Me and your mind fixed on Me, you will attain Me without doubt.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अभ्यासयोगयुक्तेन चेतसा नान्यगामिना ।
परमं पुरुषं दिव्यं याति पार्थानुचिन्तयन् ॥८॥
verses.transliteration:
abhyāsa-yoga-yuktena chetasā nānya-gāminā
paramaṁ puruṣhaṁ divyaṁ yāti pārthānuchintayan
verses.translation_full: With practice, O Parth, when you constantly engage the mind in remembering Me, the Supreme Divine Personality, without deviating, you will certainly attain Me.
verses.widget_line: He who meditates on Me as the Supreme Personality of Godhead, his mind constantly engaged in remembering Me, O Partha, is sure to reach Me.
verses.personalized: He who meditates on Me as the Supreme Personality of Godhead, his mind constantly engaged in remembering Me, O {name}, is sure to reach Me.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
कविं पुराणमनुशासितारमणोरणीयांसमनुस्मरेद्यः ।
सर्वस्य धातारमचिन्त्यरूपमादित्यवर्णं तमसः परस्तात् ॥९॥
verses.transliteration:
kaviṁ purāṇam anuśhāsitāram aṇor aṇīyāṁsam anusmared yaḥ
sarvasya dhātāram achintya-rūpam āditya-varṇaṁ tamasaḥ parastāt
verses.translation_full: God is Omniscient, the most ancient One, the Controller, subtler than the subtlest, the Support of all, and the possessor of an inconceivable divine form; He is brighter than the sun, and beyond all darkness of ignorance.
verses.widget_line: One should meditate upon the Supreme Person as the one who knows everything, who is the oldest, the controller, smaller than the smallest, the maintainer of everything, luminous like the sun, and transcendental.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
प्रयाणकाले मनसाऽचलेन भक्त्या युक्तो योगबलेन चैव ।
भ्रुवोर्मध्ये प्राणमावेश्य सम्यक् स तं परं पुरुषमुपैति दिव्यम् ॥१०॥
verses.transliteration:
prayāṇa-kāle manasā 'chalena bhaktyā yukto yoga-balena chaiva
bhruvor madhye prāṇam āveśhya samyak sa taṁ paraṁ puruṣham upaiti divyam
verses.translation_full: One who at the time of death, with unmoving mind attained by the practice of Yog, fixes the prāṇ (life-airs) between the eyebrows, and steadily remembers the Divine Lord with great devotion, certainly attains Him.
verses.widget_line: One who, at the time of death, fixes his life air between the eyebrows and, by the strength of yoga, engages himself in remembering the Supreme Lord in full devotion, will certainly attain the Supreme Personality of Godhead.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यदक्षरं वेदविदो वदन्ति विशन्ति यद्यतयो वीतरागाः ।
यदिच्छन्तो ब्रह्मचर्यं चरन्ति तत्ते पदं सङ्ग्रहेण प्रवक्ष्ये ॥११॥
verses.transliteration:
yad akṣharaṁ veda-vido vadanti viśhanti yad yatayo vīta-rāgāḥ
yad ichchhanto brahmacharyaṁ charanti tat te padaṁ saṅgraheṇa pravakṣhye
verses.translation_full: Scholars of the Vedas describe Him as Imperishable; great ascetics practice the vow of celibacy and renounce worldly pleasures to enter into Him. I shall now explain to you briefly the path to that goal.
verses.widget_line: Persons who are learned in the Vedas, who utter Omkara and who are great sages enter into Brahman. Desiring such perfection, one practices celibacy. I shall now briefly explain this process.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
