सर्वद्वाराणि संयम्य मनो हृदि निरुध्य च ।
मूर्ध्न्याधायात्मनः प्राणमास्थितो योगधारणाम् ॥१२॥
verses.transliteration:
sarva-dvārāṇi saṁyamya mano hṛidi nirudhya cha
mūrdhny ādhāyātmanaḥ prāṇam āsthito yoga-dhāraṇām
verses.translation_full: Restraining all the gates of the body and fixing the mind in the heart region, and then drawing the life-breath to the head, one should get established in steadfast yogic concentration.
verses.widget_line: The yogic situation is detachment from all sensual engagements. Closing all the doors of the senses and fixing the mind on the heart and the life air at the top of the head, one establishes himself in yoga.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
ओमित्येकाक्षरं ब्रह्म व्याहरन्मामनुस्मरन् ।
यः प्रयाति त्यजन्देहं स याति परमां गतिम् ॥१३॥
verses.transliteration:
om ity ekākṣharaṁ brahma vyāharan mām anusmaran
yaḥ prayāti tyajan dehaṁ sa yāti paramāṁ gatim
verses.translation_full: One who departs from the body while remembering Me, the Supreme Personality, and chanting the syllable Om, will attain the supreme goal.
verses.widget_line: After being situated in this yoga practice and vibrating the sacred syllable Om, if one thinks of the Supreme Personality of Godhead and quits his body, he will certainly reach the spiritual planets.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अनन्यचेताः सततं यो मां स्मरति नित्यशः ।
तस्याहं सुलभः पार्थ नित्ययुक्तस्य योगिनः ॥१४॥
verses.transliteration:
ananya-chetāḥ satataṁ yo māṁ smarati nityaśhaḥ
tasyāhaṁ sulabhaḥ pārtha nitya-yuktasya yoginaḥ
verses.translation_full: For one who remembers Me without deviation, I am easy to obtain, O son of Pritha, because of his constant engagement in devotional service.
verses.widget_line: For one who remembers Me without deviation, I am easy to obtain, O son of Pritha, because of his constant engagement in devotional service.
verses.personalized: For one who remembers Me without deviation, I am easy to obtain, O {name}, because of his constant engagement in devotional service.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
मामुपेत्य पुनर्जन्म दुःखालयमशाश्वतम् ।
नाप्नुवन्ति महात्मानः संसिद्धिं परमां गताः ॥१५॥
verses.transliteration:
mām upetya punar janma duḥkhālayam aśhāśhvatam
nāpnuvanti mahātmānaḥ saṁsiddhiṁ paramāṁ gatāḥ
verses.translation_full: Having attained Me, the great souls are no more subject to rebirth in this world, which is transient and full of misery, because they have attained the highest perfection.
verses.widget_line: After attaining Me, the great souls, who are yogis in devotion, never return to this temporary world, which is full of miseries, because they have attained the highest perfection.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
आब्रह्मभुवनाल्लोकाः पुनरावर्तिनोऽर्जुन ।
मामुपेत्य तु कौन्तेय पुनर्जन्म न विद्यते ॥१६॥
verses.transliteration:
ā-brahma-bhuvanāl lokāḥ punar āvartino 'rjuna
mām upetya tu kaunteya punar janma na vidyate
verses.translation_full: In all the worlds of this material creation, up to the highest abode of Brahma, you will be subject to rebirth, O Arjun. But on attaining My Abode, O son of Kunti, there is no further rebirth.
verses.widget_line: From the highest planet in the material world down to the lowest, all are places of misery wherein repeated birth and death take place. But one who attains to My abode, O son of Kunti, never takes birth again.
verses.personalized: From the highest planet in the material world down to the lowest, all are places of misery. But one who attains to My abode, O {name}, never takes birth again.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
सहस्रयुगपर्यन्तमहर्यद्ब्रह्मणो विदुः ।
रात्रिं युगसहस्रान्तां तेऽहोरात्रविदो जनाः ॥१७॥
verses.transliteration:
sahasra-yuga-paryantam ahar yad brahmaṇo viduḥ
rātriṁ yuga-sahasrāntāṁ te 'horātra-vido janāḥ
verses.translation_full: One day of Brahma (kalp) lasts a thousand cycles of the four ages (mahā yug) and his night also extends for the same span of time. The wise who know this understand the reality about day and night.
verses.widget_line: By human calculation, a thousand ages taken together form the duration of Brahma's one day. And such also is the duration of his night.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अव्यक्ताद्व्यक्तयः सर्वाः प्रभवन्त्यहरागमे ।
रात्र्यागमे प्रलीयन्ते तत्रैवाव्यक्तसंज्ञके ॥१८॥
verses.transliteration:
avyaktād vyaktayaḥ sarvāḥ prabhavanty ahar-āgame
rātry-āgame pralīyante tatraivāvyakta-sañjñake
verses.translation_full: At the advent of Brahma's day, all living beings emanate from the unmanifest source. And at the fall of his night, all embodied beings again merge into their unmanifest source.
verses.widget_line: When Brahma's day is manifest, this multitude of living entities comes into being, and at the arrival of Brahma's night they are all annihilated.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
भूतग्रामः स एवायं भूत्वा भूत्वा प्रलीयते ।
रात्र्यागमेऽवशः पार्थ प्रभवत्यहरागमे ॥१९॥
verses.transliteration:
bhūta-grāmaḥ sa evāyaṁ bhūtvā bhūtvā pralīyate
rātry-āgame 'vaśhaḥ pārtha prabhavaty ahar-āgame
verses.translation_full: Multitudes of beings repeatedly take birth with the advent of Brahma's day, and are reabsorbed on the arrival of the cosmic night, to manifest again automatically on the advent of the next cosmic day.
verses.widget_line: Again and again, when Brahma's day arrives, all living entities come into being, and with the arrival of Brahma's night they are helplessly annihilated.
verses.personalized: Again and again, when Brahma's day arrives, all living entities come into being, and with the arrival of Brahma's night they are helplessly annihilated, O {name}.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
परस्तस्मात्तु भावोऽन्योऽव्यक्तोऽव्यक्तात्सनातनः ।
यः स सर्वेषु भूतेषु नश्यत्सु न विनश्यति ॥२०॥
verses.transliteration:
paras tasmāt tu bhāvo 'nyo 'vyakto 'vyaktāt sanātanaḥ
yaḥ sa sarveṣhu bhūteṣhu naśhyatsu na vinaśhyati
verses.translation_full: Yet there is another unmanifest nature, which is eternal and is transcendental to this manifested and unmanifested matter. It is supreme and is never annihilated. When all in this world is annihilated, that part remains as it is.
verses.widget_line: Yet there is another unmanifest nature, which is eternal and transcendental. It is supreme and is never annihilated. When all in this world is annihilated, that part remains as it is.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अव्यक्तोऽक्षर इत्युक्तस्तमाहुः परमां गतिम् ।
यं प्राप्य न निवर्तन्ते तद्धाम परमं मम ॥२१॥
verses.transliteration:
avyakto 'kṣhara ity uktas tam āhuḥ paramāṁ gatim
yaṁ prāpya na nivartante tad dhāma paramaṁ mama
verses.translation_full: That unmanifest dimension is the supreme goal, and upon reaching it, one never returns to this mortal world. That is My Supreme Abode.
verses.widget_line: That which the Vedas describe as unmanifest and infallible, which is known as the supreme destination, and from which one never returns after attaining it—that is My supreme abode.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
पुरुषः स परः पार्थ भक्त्या लभ्यस्त्वनन्यया ।
यस्यान्तःस्थानि भूतानि येन सर्वमिदं ततम् ॥२२॥
verses.transliteration:
puruṣhaḥ sa paraḥ pārtha bhaktyā labhyas tv ananyayā
yasyāntaḥ-sthāni bhūtāni yena sarvam idaṁ tatam
verses.translation_full: The Supreme Personality of Godhead, who is greater than all, is attainable by unalloyed devotion. Although He is present in His abode, He is all-pervading, and everything is situated within Him.
verses.widget_line: The Supreme Personality of Godhead, who is greater than all, is attainable by unalloyed devotion. Although He is present in His abode, He is all-pervading, and everything is situated within Him.
verses.personalized: The Supreme Personality of Godhead, who is greater than all, is attainable by unalloyed devotion, O {name}. Although He is present in His abode, He is all-pervading, and everything is situated within Him.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यत्र काले त्वनावृत्तिमावृत्तिं चैव योगिनः ।
प्रयाता यान्ति तं कालं वक्ष्यामि भरतर्षभ ॥२३॥
verses.transliteration:
yatra kāle tv anāvṛittim āvṛittiṁ chaiva yoginaḥ
prayātā yānti taṁ kālaṁ vakṣhyāmi bharatarṣhabha
verses.translation_full: I shall now describe to you the different paths of passing away from this world, O best of the Bharatas, one of which leads to liberation and the other leads to rebirth.
verses.widget_line: O best of the Bharatas, I shall now explain to you the different times at which, passing away from this world, the yogi does or does not come back.
verses.personalized: O {name}, I shall now explain to you the different times at which, passing away from this world, the yogi does or does not come back.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अग्निर्ज्योतिरहः शुक्लः षण्मासा उत्तरायणम् ।
तत्र प्रयाता गच्छन्ति ब्रह्म ब्रह्मविदो जनाः ॥२४॥
verses.transliteration:
agnir jyotir ahaḥ śhuklaḥ ṣhaṇ-māsā uttarāyaṇam
tatra prayātā gachchhanti brahma brahma-vido janāḥ
verses.translation_full: Those who know the Supreme Brahman and who depart from this world, during the six months of the sun's northern course, the bright fortnight of the moon, and the bright part of the day, attain the supreme destination.
verses.widget_line: Those who know the Supreme Brahman attain that Supreme by passing away during the influence of the fiery god, in the light, at an auspicious moment, during the fortnight of the moon and the six months when the sun travels in the north.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
धूमो रात्रिस्तथा कृष्णः षण्मासा दक्षिणायनम् ।
तत्र चान्द्रमसं ज्योतिर्योगी प्राप्य निवर्तते ॥२५॥
verses.transliteration:
dhūmo rātris tathā kṛiṣhṇaḥ ṣhaṇ-māsā dakṣhiṇāyanam
tatra chāndramasaṁ jyotir yogī prāpya nivartate
verses.translation_full: The practitioners of Vedic rituals, who pass away during the six months of the sun's southern course, the dark fortnight of the moon, the time of smoke, the night, attain the celestial abodes. After enjoying celestial pleasures, they again return to the earth.
verses.widget_line: The mystic who passes away during the smoke, the night, the moonless fortnight, or in the six months when the sun passes to the south reaches the moon planet but again comes back.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
शुक्लकृष्णे गती ह्येते जगतः शाश्वते मते ।
एकया यात्यनावृत्तिमन्ययावर्तते पुनः ॥२६॥
verses.transliteration:
śhukla-kṛiṣhṇe gatī hy ete jagataḥ śhāśhvate mate
ekayā yāty anāvṛittim anyayāvartate punaḥ
verses.translation_full: These two, bright and dark paths, always exist in this world. The way of light leads to liberation and the way of darkness leads to rebirth.
verses.widget_line: According to Vedic opinion, there are two ways of passing from this world—one in light and one in darkness. When one passes in light, he does not come back; but when one passes in darkness, he returns.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
नैते सृती पार्थ जानन्योगी मुह्यति कश्चन ।
तस्मात्सर्वेषु कालेषु योगयुक्तो भवार्जुन ॥२७॥
verses.transliteration:
naite sṛitī pārtha jānan yogī muhyati kaśhchana
tasmāt sarveṣhu kāleṣhu yoga-yukto bhavārjuna
verses.translation_full: Although the devotees know these two paths, O Arjuna, they are never bewildered. Therefore be always fixed in devotion.
verses.widget_line: Although the devotees know these two paths, O Arjuna, they are never bewildered. Therefore be always fixed in devotion, O Partha.
verses.personalized: Although the devotees know these two paths, O {name}, they are never bewildered. Therefore be always fixed in devotion.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
वेदेषु यज्ञेषु तपःसु चैव दानेषु यत्पुण्यफलं प्रदिष्टम् ।
अत्येति तत्सर्वमिदं विदित्वा योगी परं स्थानमुपैति चाद्यम् ॥२८॥
verses.transliteration:
vedeṣhu yajñeṣhu tapaḥsu chaiva dāneṣhu yat puṇya-phalaṁ pradiṣhṭam
atyeti tat sarvam idaṁ viditvā yogī paraṁ sthānam upaiti chādyam
verses.translation_full: The yogis, who know this secret, gain merit far beyond the fruits of Vedic rituals, the study of the Vedas, performance of sacrifices, austerities, and charities. Such yogis reach the Supreme Abode.
verses.widget_line: A person who accepts the path of devotional service is not bereft of the results derived from studying the Vedas, performing sacrifices, undergoing austerities, giving charity. Simply by performing devotional service, he attains all these, and at the end he reaches the supreme eternal abode.

chapter_info.chapter_name_english: Raja Vidya Raja Guhya Yoga – The Yoga of Royal Knowledge and Royal Secret
chapter_info.theme: Krishna reveals the most confidential knowledge about devotion, explaining how He pervades everything, how devotees are dear to Him, and the importance of offering everything to Him.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
श्री भगवानुवाच
इदं तु ते गुह्यतमं प्रवक्ष्याम्यनसूयवे ।
ज्ञानं विज्ञानसहितं यज्ज्ञात्वा मोक्ष्यसेऽशुभात् ॥१॥
verses.transliteration:
śhrī bhagavān uvācha
idaṁ tu te guhyatamaṁ pravakṣhyāmy anasūyave
jñānaṁ vijñāna-sahitaṁ yaj jñātvā mokṣhyase 'śhubhāt
verses.translation_full: The Supreme Lord said: O Arjun, because you are not envious of Me, I shall now impart to you this very confidential knowledge and wisdom, upon knowing which you will be released from the miseries of material existence.
verses.widget_line: Because you are never envious of Me, I shall impart to you this most secret wisdom, knowing which you shall be relieved of the miseries of material existence.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
राजविद्या राजगुह्यं पवित्रमिदमुत्तमम् ।
प्रत्यक्षावगमं धर्म्यं सुसुखं कर्तुमव्ययम् ॥२॥
verses.transliteration:
rāja-vidyā rāja-guhyaṁ pavitram idam uttamam
pratyakṣhāvagamaṁ dharmyaṁ susukhaṁ kartum avyayam
verses.translation_full: This knowledge is the king of sciences and the most profound of all secrets. It purifies those who hear it. It is directly realizable, in accordance with dharma, easy to practice, and everlasting in effect.
verses.widget_line: This knowledge is the king of education, the most secret of all secrets. It is the purest knowledge, and because it gives direct perception of the self, it is the perfection of religion.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अश्रद्धया हुतं दत्तं तपस्तप्तं कृतं च यत् ।
असदित्युच्यते पार्थ न च तत्प्रेत्य नो इह ॥३॥
verses.transliteration:
aśhraddhayā hutaṁ dattaṁ tapas taptaṁ kṛitaṁ cha yat
asad ity uchyate pārtha na cha tat pretya no iha
verses.translation_full: People who have no faith in this dharma are unable to attain Me, O conqueror of enemies. They repeatedly come back to this world in the cycle of birth and death.
verses.widget_line: Those who are not faithful in this devotional service cannot attain Me, O Partha. Therefore they return to the path of birth and death in this material world.
verses.personalized: Those who are not faithful in this devotional service cannot attain Me, O {name}. Therefore they return to the path of birth and death in this material world.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
मया ततमिदं सर्वं जगदव्यक्तमूर्तिना ।
मत्स्थानि सर्वभूतानि न चाहं तेष्ववस्थितः ॥४॥
verses.transliteration:
mayā tatam idaṁ sarvaṁ jagad avyakta-mūrtinā
mat-sthāni sarva-bhūtāni na chāhaṁ teṣhv avasthitaḥ
verses.translation_full: By Me, in My unmanifested form, this entire universe is pervaded. All beings are in Me, but I am not in them.
verses.widget_line: By Me, in My unmanifested form, this entire universe is pervaded. All beings are in Me, but I am not in them.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
न च मत्स्थानि भूतानि पश्य मे योगमैश्वरम् ।
भूतभृन्न च भूतस्थो ममात्मा भूतभावनः ॥५॥
verses.transliteration:
na cha mat-sthāni bhūtāni paśhya me yogam aiśhwaram
bhūta-bhṛinn na cha bhūta-stho mamātmā bhūta-bhāvanaḥ
verses.translation_full: And yet, the living beings do not abide in Me. Behold the mystery of My divine energy! Although I am the Creator and Sustainer of all living beings, I am not influenced by them or by material nature.
verses.widget_line: And yet everything that is created does not rest in Me. Behold My mystic opulence! Although I am the maintainer of all living entities, and although I am everywhere, My Self is the very source of creation.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यथाकाशस्थितो नित्यं वायुः सर्वत्रगो महान् ।
तथा सर्वाणि भूतानि मत्स्थानीत्युपधारय ॥६॥
verses.transliteration:
yathākāśha-sthito nityaṁ vāyuḥ sarvatra-go mahān
tathā sarvāṇi bhūtāni mat-sthānīty upadhāraya
verses.translation_full: Understand that as the mighty wind, blowing everywhere, always rests in the sky, all created beings rest in Me.
verses.widget_line: Understand that as the mighty wind, blowing everywhere, always rests in the sky, all created beings rest in Me.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
सर्वभूतानि कौन्तेय प्रकृतिं यान्ति मामिकाम् ।
कल्पक्षये पुनस्तानि कल्पादौ विसृजाम्यहम् ॥७॥
verses.transliteration:
sarva-bhūtāni kaunteya prakṛitiṁ yānti māmikām
kalpa-kṣhaye punas tāni kalpādau visṛijāmy aham
verses.translation_full: At the end of one kalp, all living beings merge into My primordial material energy. At the beginning of the next creation, O son of Kunti, I manifest them again.
verses.widget_line: O son of Kunti, at the end of the millennium all material manifestations enter into My nature, and at the beginning of another millennium, by My potency, I create them again.
verses.personalized: O {name}, at the end of the millennium all material manifestations enter into My nature, and at the beginning of another millennium, by My potency, I create them again.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
प्रकृतिं स्वामवष्टभ्य विसृजामि पुनः पुनः ।
भूतग्राममिमं कृत्स्नमवशं प्रकृतेर्वशात् ॥८॥
verses.transliteration:
prakṛitiṁ svām avaṣhṭabhya visṛijāmi punaḥ punaḥ
bhūta-grāmam imaṁ kṛitsnam avaśhaṁ prakṛiter vaśhāt
verses.translation_full: The whole cosmic order is under Me. Under My will it is automatically manifested again and again, and under My will it is annihilated at the end.
verses.widget_line: The whole cosmic order is under Me. Under My will it is automatically manifested again and again, and under My will it is annihilated at the end.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
न च मां तानि कर्माणि निबध्नन्ति धनञ्जय ।
उदासीनवदासीनमसक्तं तेषु कर्मसु ॥९॥
verses.transliteration:
na cha māṁ tāni karmāṇi nibadhnanti dhanañjaya
udāsīna-vad āsīnam asaktaṁ teṣhu karmasu
verses.translation_full: O conqueror of wealth, none of these actions bind Me. I remain like a neutral observer, ever detached from these actions.
verses.widget_line: O Dhananjaya, all this work cannot bind Me. I am ever situated in detachment from these activities, seated as though neutral.
verses.personalized: O {name}, all this work cannot bind Me. I am ever situated in detachment from these activities, seated as though neutral.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
मयाध्यक्षेण प्रकृतिः सूयते सचराचरम् ।
हेतुनानेन कौन्तेय जगद्विपरिवर्तते ॥१०॥
verses.transliteration:
mayādhyakṣheṇa prakṛitiḥ sūyate sa-charācharam
hetunānena kaunteya jagad viparivartate
verses.translation_full: This material nature, which is one of My energies, is working under My direction, O son of Kunti, producing all moving and nonmoving beings. Under its rule this manifestation is created and annihilated again and again.
verses.widget_line: This material nature, which is one of My energies, is working under My direction, O son of Kunti, producing all moving and nonmoving beings. Under its rule this manifestation is created and annihilated again and again.
verses.personalized: This material nature, which is one of My energies, is working under My direction, O {name}, producing all moving and nonmoving beings. Under its rule this manifestation is created and annihilated again and again.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अवजानन्ति मां मूढा मानुषीं तनुमाश्रितम् ।
परं भावमजानन्तो मम भूतमहेश्वरम् ॥११॥
verses.transliteration:
avajānanti māṁ mūḍhā mānuṣhīṁ tanum āśhritam
paraṁ bhāvam ajānanto mama bhūta-maheśhvaram
verses.translation_full: When I descend in My personal form deluded persons are unable to recognize Me. They do not know the divinity of My personality, as the Supreme Lord of all beings.
verses.widget_line: Fools deride Me when I descend in the human form. They do not know My transcendental nature and My supreme dominion over all that be.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
मोघाशा मोघकर्माणो मोघज्ञाना विचेतसः ।
राक्षसीमासुरीं चैव प्रकृतिं मोहिनीं श्रिताः ॥१२॥
verses.transliteration:
moghāśhā mogha-karmāṇo mogha-jñānā vichetasaḥ
rākṣhasīm āsurīṁ chaiva prakṛitiṁ mohinīṁ śhritāḥ
verses.translation_full: Those who are thus bewildered are attracted by demonic and atheistic views. In that deluded condition, their hopes for liberation, their fruitive activities, and their culture of knowledge are all defeated.
verses.widget_line: Those who are thus bewildered are attracted by demonic and atheistic views. In that deluded condition, their hopes for liberation, their fruitive activities, and their culture of knowledge are all defeated.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
महात्मानस्तु मां पार्थ दैवीं प्रकृतिमाश्रिताः ।
भजन्त्यनन्यमनसो ज्ञात्वा भूतादिमव्ययम् ॥१३॥
verses.transliteration:
mahātmānas tu māṁ pārtha daivīṁ prakṛitim āśhritāḥ
bhajanty ananya-manaso jñātvā bhūtādim avyayam
verses.translation_full: But the great souls, who take shelter of My divine energy, O Parth, know Me, Lord Krishna, as the origin of all creation. They engage in My devotion with their minds fixed exclusively on Me.
verses.widget_line: O son of Pritha, those who are not deluded, the great souls, are under the protection of My divine nature. They are fully engaged in devotional service because they know Me as the Supreme Personality of Godhead, original and inexhaustible.
verses.personalized: O {name}, those who are not deluded, the great souls, are under the protection of My divine nature. They are fully engaged in devotional service because they know Me as the Supreme Personality of Godhead, original and inexhaustible.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
सततं कीर्तयन्तो मां यतन्तश्च दृढव्रताः ।
नमस्यन्तश्च मां भक्त्या नित्ययुक्ता उपासते ॥१४॥
verses.transliteration:
satataṁ kīrtayanto māṁ yatantaśh cha dṛiḍha-vratāḥ
namasyantaśh cha māṁ bhaktyā nitya-yuktā upāsate
verses.translation_full: Always singing My divine glories, striving with great determination, and humbly bowing down before Me, they constantly worship Me in loving devotion.
verses.widget_line: Always chanting My glories, endeavoring with great determination, bowing down before Me, these great souls perpetually worship Me with devotion.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
ज्ञानयज्ञेन चाप्यन्ये यजन्तो मामुपासते ।
एकत्वेन पृथक्त्वेन बहुधा विश्वतोमुखम् ॥१५॥
verses.transliteration:
jñāna-yajñena chāpy anye yajanto mām upāsate
ekatvena pṛithaktvena bahudhā viśhvato-mukham
verses.translation_full: Others, engaging in the yajña of cultivating knowledge, worship Me by many methods. Some see Me as undifferentiated oneness that is non-different from them, while others see Me as separate from them. Still others worship Me in the infinite manifestations of My cosmic form.
verses.widget_line: Others, who engage in the sacrifice of knowledge, worship Me, the Supreme Lord, as one without a second, as distinct, or as the one facing in all directions.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अहं क्रतुरहं यज्ञः स्वधाहमहमौषधम् ।
मन्त्रोऽहमहमेवाज्यमहमग्निरहं हुतम् ॥१६॥
verses.transliteration:
ahaṁ kratur ahaṁ yajñaḥ svadhāham aham auṣhadham
mantro 'ham aham evājyam aham agnir ahaṁ hutam
verses.translation_full: It is I who am the Vedic ritual, I am the sacrifice, and I am the oblation offered to the ancestors. I am the medicinal herb, and I am the Vedic mantra. I am the clarified butter, I am the fire and the act of offering.
verses.widget_line: I am the ritual, I am the sacrifice, I am the offering to the ancestors, I am the healing herb, I am the transcendental chant. I am the clarified butter, I am the fire, and I am the offering.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
पिताहमस्य जगतो माता धाता पितामहः ।
वेद्यं पवित्रमोङ्कार ऋक्साम यजुरेव च ॥१७॥
verses.transliteration:
pitāham asya jagato mātā dhātā pitāmahaḥ
vedyaṁ pavitram oṅkāra ṛik sāma yajur eva cha
verses.translation_full: I am the father of this universe, the mother, the support, and the grandsire. I am the object of knowledge, the purifier, and the syllable Om. I am also the Rig, Sama, and Yajur Vedas.
verses.widget_line: I am the father of this universe, the mother, the support, and the grandsire. I am the object of knowledge, the purifier, and the syllable Om. I am also the Rig, Sama, and Yajur Vedas.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
गतिर्भर्ता प्रभुः साक्षी निवासः शरणं सुहृत् ।
प्रभवः प्रलयः स्थानं निधानं बीजमव्ययम् ॥१८॥
verses.transliteration:
gatir bhartā prabhuḥ sākṣhī nivāsaḥ śharaṇaṁ suhṛit
prabhavaḥ pralayaḥ sthānaṁ nidhānaṁ bījam avyayam
verses.translation_full: I am the Supreme Goal of all living beings, and I am also their Sustainer, Master, Witness, Abode, Shelter, and Friend. I am the Origin, End, and Resting Place of creation; I am the Repository and Eternal Seed.
verses.widget_line: I am the goal, the sustainer, the master, the witness, the abode, the refuge, and the most dear friend. I am the creation and the annihilation, the basis of everything, the resting place, and the eternal seed.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
तपाम्यहमहं वर्षं निगृह्णाम्युत्सृजामि च ।
अमृतं चैव मृत्युश्च सदसच्चाहमर्जुन ॥१९॥
verses.transliteration:
tapāmy aham ahaṁ varṣhaṁ nigṛihṇāmy utsṛijāmi cha
amṛitaṁ chaiva mṛityuśh cha sad asach chāham arjuna
verses.translation_full: O Arjuna, I give heat, and I withhold and send forth the rain. I am immortality, and I am also death personified. Both spirit and matter are in Me.
verses.widget_line: O Arjuna, I give heat, and I withhold and send forth the rain. I am immortality, and I am also death personified. Both spirit and matter are in Me.
verses.personalized: O {name}, I give heat, and I withhold and send forth the rain. I am immortality, and I am also death personified. Both spirit and matter are in Me.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
त्रैविद्या मां सोमपाः पूतपापा यज्ञैरिष्ट्वा स्वर्गतिं प्रार्थयन्ते ।
ते पुण्यमासाद्य सुरेन्द्रलोकमश्नन्ति दिव्यान्दिवि देवभोगान् ॥२०॥
verses.transliteration:
trai-vidyā māṁ soma-pāḥ pūta-pāpā yajñair iṣhṭvā svarga-tiṁ prārthayante
te puṇyam āsādya surendra-lokam aśhnanti divyān divi deva-bhogān
verses.translation_full: Those who are inclined to the fruitive activity described in the Vedas worship Me through ritualistic sacrifices. Being purified from sin by drinking the Soma juice, which is the remnant of the yajñas, they seek to go to heaven. By virtue of their pious deeds, they go to the abode of Indra, the king of heaven, and enjoy the pleasures of the celestial gods.
verses.widget_line: Those who study the Vedas and drink the soma juice, seeking the heavenly planets, worship Me indirectly. Purified of sinful reactions, they take birth on the pious, heavenly planet of Indra, where they enjoy godly delights.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
ते तं भुक्त्वा स्वर्गलोकं विशालं क्षीणे पुण्ये मर्त्यलोकं विशन्ति ।
एवं त्रयीधर्ममनुप्रपन्ना गतागतं कामकामा लभन्ते ॥२१॥
verses.transliteration:
te taṁ bhuktvā svarga-lokaṁ viśhālaṁ kṣhīṇe puṇye martya-lokaṁ viśhanti
evaṁ trayī-dharmam anuprapannā gatāgataṁ kāma-kāmā labhante
verses.translation_full: When they have enjoyed the vast pleasures of heaven, the stock of their merits being exhausted, they return to the earthly plane. Thus, those who follow the Vedic rituals, desiring objects of enjoyment, repeatedly come and go in this world.
verses.widget_line: When they have thus enjoyed vast heavenly sense pleasure and the fruits of their work are exhausted, they return to this mortal planet again. Thus those who seek sense enjoyment achieve only repeated birth and death.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अनन्याश्चिन्तयन्तो मां ये जनाः पर्युपासते ।
तेषां नित्याभियुक्तानां योगक्षेमं वहाम्यहम् ॥२२॥
verses.transliteration:
ananyāśh chintayanto māṁ ye janāḥ paryupāsate
teṣhāṁ nityābhiyuktānāṁ yoga-kṣhemaṁ vahāmy aham
verses.translation_full: To those who are constantly devoted and who worship Me with love, I give the understanding by which they can come to Me.
verses.widget_line: To those who are constantly devoted and who worship Me with love, I give the understanding by which they can come to Me.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
येऽप्यन्यदेवताभक्ता यजन्ते श्रद्धयान्विताः ।
तेऽपि मामेव कौन्तेय यजन्त्यविधिपूर्वकम् ॥२३॥
verses.transliteration:
ye 'py anya-devata-bhaktā yajante śhraddhayānvitāḥ
te 'pi mām eva kaunteya yajanty avidhi-pūrvakam
verses.translation_full: O son of Kunti, even those devotees who faithfully worship other gods also worship Me. But they do so by the wrong method.
verses.widget_line: Those who are devotees of other gods and who worship them with faith actually worship only Me, O son of Kunti, but they do so in a wrong way.
verses.personalized: Those who are devotees of other gods and who worship them with faith actually worship only Me, O {name}, but they do so in a wrong way.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अहं हि सर्वयज्ञानां भोक्ता च प्रभुरेव च ।
न तु मामभिजानन्ति तत्त्वेनातश्च्यवन्ति ते ॥२४॥
verses.transliteration:
ahaṁ hi sarva-yajñānāṁ bhoktā cha prabhur eva cha
na tu mām abhijānanti tattvenātaśh chyavanti te
verses.translation_full: I am the only enjoyer and master of all sacrifices. Therefore, those who do not recognize My true transcendental nature fall down.
verses.widget_line: I am the only enjoyer and master of all sacrifices. Therefore, those who do not recognize My true transcendental nature fall down.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यान्ति देवव्रता देवान्पितृ़न्यान्ति पितृव्रताः ।
भूतानि यान्ति भूतेज्या यान्ति मद्याजिनोऽपि माम् ॥२५॥
verses.transliteration:
yānti deva-vratā devān pitṛīn yānti pitṛi-vratāḥ
bhūtāni yānti bhūtejyā yānti mad-yājino 'pi mām
verses.translation_full: Worshippers of the celestial gods take birth amongst the celestial gods, worshippers of the ancestors go to the ancestors, worshippers of ghosts take birth amongst such beings, and My devotees come to Me alone.
verses.widget_line: Those who worship the demigods will take birth among the demigods; those who worship the ancestors go to the ancestors; those who worship ghosts will take birth among such beings; and those who worship Me will live with Me.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
पत्रं पुष्पं फलं तोयं यो मे भक्त्या प्रयच्छति ।
तदहं भक्त्युपहृतमश्नामि प्रयतात्मनः ॥२६॥
verses.transliteration:
patraṁ puṣhpaṁ phalaṁ toyaṁ yo me bhaktyā prayachchhati
tad ahaṁ bhakty-upahṛitam aśhnāmi prayatātmanaḥ
verses.translation_full: If one offers Me with love and devotion a leaf, a flower, fruit, or water, I will accept it.
verses.widget_line: If one offers Me with love and devotion a leaf, a flower, fruit, or water, I will accept it.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यत्करोषि यदश्नासि यज्जुहोषि ददासि यत् ।
यत्तपस्यसि कौन्तेय तत्कुरुष्व मदर्पणम् ॥२७॥
verses.transliteration:
yat karoṣhi yad aśhnāsi yaj juhoṣhi dadāsi yat
yat tapasyasi kaunteya tat kuruṣhva mad-arpaṇam
verses.translation_full: Whatever you do, whatever you eat, whatever you offer as oblation to the sacred fire, whatever you bestow as a gift, and whatever austerities you perform, O son of Kunti, do them as an offering to Me.
verses.widget_line: Whatever you do, whatever you eat, whatever you offer or give away, and whatever austerities you perform—do that, O son of Kunti, as an offering to Me.
verses.personalized: Whatever you do, whatever you eat, whatever you offer or give away, and whatever austerities you perform—do that, O {name}, as an offering to Me.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
शुभाशुभफलैरेवं मोक्ष्यसे कर्मबन्धनैः ।
संन्यासयोगयुक्तात्मा विमुक्तो मामुपैष्यसि ॥२८॥
verses.transliteration:
śhubhāśhubha-phalair evaṁ mokṣhyase karma-bandhanaiḥ
sannyāsa-yoga-yuktātmā vimukto mām upaiṣhyasi
verses.translation_full: In this way you will be freed from bondage to the fruits of action, which are good and bad. With your mind attached to Me through the practice of renunciation, you will be liberated and will come to Me.
verses.widget_line: In this way you will be freed from bondage to the fruits of action, which are good and bad. With your mind attached to Me through renunciation, you will be liberated and will come to Me.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
समोऽहं सर्वभूतेषु न मे द्वेष्योऽस्ति न प्रियः ।
ये भजन्ति तु मां भक्त्या मयि ते तेषु चाप्यहम् ॥२९॥
verses.transliteration:
samo 'haṁ sarva-bhūteṣhu na me dveṣhyo 'sti na priyaḥ
ye bhajanti tu māṁ bhaktyā mayi te teṣhu chāpy aham
verses.translation_full: I am equally disposed to all living beings; I am neither inimical nor partial to anyone. But the devotees who worship Me with love reside in Me and I reside in them.
verses.widget_line: I am equally disposed to all living entities; neither am I hostile to anyone nor am I partial to anyone. But the devotees who always worship Me with devotion reside in Me, and I also reside in them.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अपि चेत्सुदुराचारो भजते मामनन्यभाक् ।
साधुरेव स मन्तव्यः सम्यग्व्यवसितो हि सः ॥३०॥
verses.transliteration:
api chet su-durāchāro bhajate mām ananya-bhāk
sādhur eva sa mantavyaḥ samyag vyavasito hi saḥ
verses.translation_full: Even if one commits the most abominable actions, if he is engaged in devotional service, he is to be considered saintly because he is properly situated.
verses.widget_line: Even if one commits the most abominable actions, if he is engaged in devotional service, he is to be considered saintly because he is properly situated.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
क्षिप्रं भवति धर्मात्मा शश्वच्छान्तिं निगच्छति ।
कौन्तेय प्रतिजानीहि न मे भक्तः प्रणश्यति ॥३१॥
verses.transliteration:
kṣhipraṁ bhavati dharmātmā śhaśhvach-chhāntiṁ nigachchhati
kaunteya pratijānīhi na me bhaktaḥ praṇaśhyati
verses.translation_full: Quickly they become virtuous, and attain lasting peace. O son of Kunti, declare it boldly that no devotee of Mine is ever lost.
verses.widget_line: He quickly becomes righteous and attains lasting peace. O son of Kunti, declare it boldly that My devotee never perishes.
verses.personalized: He quickly becomes righteous and attains lasting peace. O {name}, declare it boldly that My devotee never perishes.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
मां हि पार्थ व्यपाश्रित्य येऽपि स्युः पापयोनयः ।
स्त्रियो वैश्यास्तथा शूद्रास्तेऽपि यान्ति परां गतिम् ॥३२॥
verses.transliteration:
māṁ hi pārtha vyapāśhritya ye 'pi syuḥ pāpa-yonayaḥ
striyo vaiśhyās tathā śhūdrās te 'pi yānti parāṁ gatim
verses.translation_full: All those who take refuge in Me, whatever their birth, race, gender, or caste, even those whom society scorns, will attain the supreme destination.
verses.widget_line: O son of Pritha, those who take shelter in Me, though they be of lower birth—women, vaishyas, as well as shudras—can approach the supreme destination.
verses.personalized: O {name}, those who take shelter in Me, though they be of lower birth—women, vaishyas, as well as shudras—can approach the supreme destination.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
किं पुनर्ब्राह्मणाः पुण्या भक्ता राजर्षयस्तथा ।
अनित्यमसुखं लोकमिमं प्राप्य भजस्व माम् ॥३३॥
verses.transliteration:
kiṁ punar brāhmaṇāḥ puṇyā bhaktā rājarṣhayas tathā
anityam asukhaṁ lokam imaṁ prāpya bhajasva mām
verses.translation_full: How much more this is so of the righteous brahmanas, the devotees, and the saintly kings. Therefore, having come to this temporary, miserable world, engage in loving service unto Me.
verses.widget_line: How much more this is so of the righteous brahmanas, the devotees, and the saintly kings. Therefore, having come to this temporary, miserable world, engage in loving service unto Me.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
मन्मना भव मद्भक्तो मद्याजी मां नमस्कुरु ।
मामेवैष्यसि युक्त्वैवमात्मानं मत्परायणः ॥३४॥
verses.transliteration:
man-manā bhava mad-bhakto mad-yājī māṁ namaskuru
mām evaiṣhyasi yuktvai vam ātmānaṁ mat-parāyaṇaḥ
verses.translation_full: Always think of Me, be devoted to Me, worship Me, and offer obeisance to Me. Having dedicated your mind and body to Me, you will certainly come to Me.
verses.widget_line: Engage your mind always in thinking of Me, become My devotee, offer obeisances to Me, and worship Me. Being completely absorbed in Me, surely you will come to Me.

chapter_info.chapter_name_english: Vibhuti Yoga – The Yoga of Divine Glories
chapter_info.theme: Krishna reveals His divine manifestations and opulences, explaining how He is the source of all creation and the essence of everything in the universe.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
श्री भगवानुवाच
भूय एव महाबाहो शृणु मे परमं वचः ।
यत्तेऽहं प्रीयमाणाय वक्ष्यामि हितकाम्यया ॥१॥
verses.transliteration:
śhrī bhagavān uvācha
bhūya eva mahā-bāho śhṛiṇu me paramaṁ vachaḥ
yat te 'haṁ prīyamāṇāya vakṣhyāmi hita-kāmyayā
verses.translation_full: The Lord said: Listen again to My divine teachings, O mighty armed one. Desiring your welfare because you are My beloved friend, I shall reveal them to you.
verses.widget_line: Again, O mighty-armed, listen to My supreme word, which I shall reveal to you, for you are dear to Me and this is for your benefit.
verses.personalized: Again, O {name}, listen to My supreme word, which I shall reveal to you, for you are dear to Me and this is for your benefit.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
न मे विदुः सुरगणाः प्रभवं न महर्षयः ।
अहमादिर्हि देवानां महर्षीणां च सर्वशः ॥२॥
verses.transliteration:
na me viduḥ sura-gaṇāḥ prabhavaṁ na maharṣhayaḥ
aham ādir hi devānāṁ maharṣhīṇāṁ cha sarvaśhaḥ
verses.translation_full: Neither the hosts of gods nor the great sages know My origin; for, in every way, I am the source of all the gods and the great sages.
verses.widget_line: Neither the hosts of gods nor the great sages know My origin; for, in every way, I am the source of all the gods and the great sages.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यो मामजमनादिं च वेत्ति लोकमहेश्वरम् ।
असंमूढः स मर्त्येषु सर्वपापैः प्रमुच्यते ॥३॥
verses.transliteration:
yo mām ajam anādiṁ cha vetti loka-maheśhvaram
asaṁmūḍhaḥ sa martyeṣhu sarva-pāpaiḥ pramuchyate
verses.translation_full: Those who know Me as unborn and beginningless, and as the Supreme Lord of the universe, they among mortals are free from illusion and released from all evils.
verses.widget_line: He who knows Me as unborn and without beginning, as the great Lord of the worlds, he, among mortals, is undeluded and is liberated from all sins.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
बुद्धिर्ज्ञानमसंमोहः क्षमा सत्यं दमः शमः ।
सुखं दुःखं भवोऽभावो भयं चाभयमेव च ॥४॥
verses.transliteration:
buddhir jñānam asaṁmohaḥ kṣhamā satyaṁ damaḥ śhamaḥ
sukhaṁ duḥkhaṁ bhavo 'bhāvo bhayaṁ chābhayam eva cha
verses.translation_full: From Me alone arise the varieties of qualities in humans, such as intellect, knowledge, clarity of thought, forgiveness, truthfulness, control over the senses and mind, joy and sorrow, birth and death, fear and courage, non-violence, equanimity, contentment, austerity, charity, fame, and infamy.
verses.widget_line: Intelligence, wisdom, non-delusion, forgiveness, truth, self-restraint, calmness, happiness, pain, birth, death, fear, and also fearlessness—all these qualities arise from Me alone.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अहिंसा समता तुष्टिस्तपो दानं यशोऽयशः ।
भवन्ति भावा भूतानां मत्त एव पृथग्विधाः ॥५॥
verses.transliteration:
ahiṁsā samatā tuṣhṭis tapo dānaṁ yaśho 'yaśhaḥ
bhavanti bhāvā bhūtānāṁ matta eva pṛithag-vidhāḥ
verses.translation_full: Non-injury, equanimity, contentment, austerity, charity, fame, and infamy—these various dispositions of beings arise from Me alone.
verses.widget_line: Non-injury, equanimity, contentment, austerity, charity, fame, and infamy—these various dispositions of beings arise from Me alone.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
महर्षयः सप्त पूर्वे चत्वारो मनवस्तथा ।
मद्भावा मानसा जाता येषां लोक इमाः प्रजाः ॥६॥
verses.transliteration:
maharṣhayaḥ sapta pūrve chatvāro manavas tathā
mad-bhāvā mānasā jātā yeṣhāṁ loka imāḥ prajāḥ
verses.translation_full: The seven great Sages, the four great Saints before them, and the fourteen Manus, are all born from My mind. From them, all the people in the world have descended.
verses.widget_line: The seven great sages, the ancient four, and the Manus, possessing powers like Mine, were born from My mind; from them, these creatures have been born in this world.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
एतां विभूतिं योगं च मम यो वेत्ति तत्त्वतः ।
सोऽविकम्पेन योगेन युज्यते नात्र संशयः ॥७॥
verses.transliteration:
etāṁ vibhūtiṁ yogaṁ cha mama yo vetti tattvataḥ
so 'vikampena yogena yujyate nātra saṁśhayaḥ
verses.translation_full: He who truly knows these manifold manifestations of My Being and this Yoga-power of Mine becomes established in unshakable Yoga; there is no doubt about it.
verses.widget_line: He who truly knows these manifold manifestations of My Being and this Yoga-power of Mine becomes established in unshakable Yoga; there is no doubt about it.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अहं सर्वस्य प्रभवो मत्तः सर्वं प्रवर्तते ।
इति मत्वा भजन्ते मां बुधा भावसमन्विताः ॥८॥
verses.transliteration:
ahaṁ sarvasya prabhavo mattaḥ sarvaṁ pravartate
iti matvā bhajante māṁ budhā bhāva-samanvitāḥ
verses.translation_full: I am the origin of all creation. Everything proceeds from Me. The wise who know this perfectly worship Me with great faith and devotion.
verses.widget_line: I am the source of all; from Me everything evolves; understanding this, the wise, endowed with meditation, worship Me.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
मच्चित्ता मद्गतप्राणा बोधयन्तः परस्परम् ।
कथयन्तश्च मां नित्यं तुष्यन्ति च रमन्ति च ॥९॥
verses.transliteration:
mac-chittā mad-gata-prāṇā bodhayantaḥ parasparam
kathayantaśh cha māṁ nityaṁ tuṣhyanti cha ramanti cha
verses.translation_full: With their minds fixed on Me and their lives surrendered to Me, My devotees remain ever content in Me. They derive great satisfaction and bliss in enlightening one another about Me and in conversing about My glories.
verses.widget_line: With their minds and lives wholly absorbed in Me, they enlighten each other and ever speak of Me, being satisfied and delighted.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
तेषां सततयुक्तानां भजतां प्रीतिपूर्वकम् ।
ददामि बुद्धियोगं तं येन मामुपयान्ति ते ॥१०॥
verses.transliteration:
teṣhāṁ satata-yuktānāṁ bhajatāṁ prīti-pūrvakam
dadāmi buddhi-yogaṁ taṁ yena mām upayānti te
verses.translation_full: To those who are ever steadfast, worshipping Me with love, I give the yoga of discrimination, by which they come to Me.
verses.widget_line: To those who are ever steadfast, worshipping Me with love, I give the yoga of discrimination, by which they come to Me.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
तेषामेवानुकम्पार्थमहमज्ञानजं तमः ।
नाशयाम्यात्मभावस्थो ज्ञानदीपेन भास्वता ॥११॥
verses.transliteration:
teṣhām evānukampārtham aham ajñāna-jaṁ tamaḥ
nāśhayāmy ātma-bhāva-stho jñāna-dīpena bhāsvatā
verses.translation_full: Out of compassion for them, I, who dwell within their hearts, destroy the darkness born of ignorance, with the luminous lamp of knowledge.
verses.widget_line: Out of mere compassion for them, I, dwelling within their selves, destroy the darkness born of ignorance with the luminous lamp of knowledge.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
श्री भगवानुवाच
हन्त ते कथयिष्यामि दिव्या ह्यात्मविभूतयः ।
प्राधान्यतः कुरुश्रेष्ठ नास्त्यन्तो विस्तरस्य मे ॥१९॥
verses.transliteration:
śhrī bhagavān uvācha
hanta te kathayiṣhyāmi divyā hy ātma-vibhūtayaḥ
prādhānyataḥ kuru-śhreṣhṭha nāsty anto vistarasya me
verses.translation_full: The Supreme Lord said: Yes, I will tell you of My divine glories, but only of those which are prominent, O best of the Kurus; for there is no end to the details of My extent.
verses.widget_line: Yes, I will tell you of My divine glories, but only of those which are prominent, O best of the Kurus; for there is no end to the details of My extent.
verses.personalized: Yes, I will tell you of My divine glories, but only of those which are prominent, O {name}; for there is no end to the details of My extent.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अहमात्मा गुडाकेश सर्वभूताशयस्थितः ।
अहमादिश्च मध्यं च भूतानामन्त एव च ॥२०॥
verses.transliteration:
aham ātmā guḍākeśha sarva-bhūtāśhaya-sthitaḥ
aham ādiśh cha madhyaṁ cha bhūtānām anta eva cha
verses.translation_full: O Arjun, I am seated in the heart of all living entities. I am the beginning, middle, and end of all beings.
verses.widget_line: I am the Self, O Gudakesha, seated in the hearts of all creatures; I am the beginning, the middle, and the end of all beings.
verses.personalized: I am the Self, O {name}, seated in the hearts of all creatures; I am the beginning, the middle, and the end of all beings.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
आदित्यानामहं विष्णुर्ज्योतिषां रविरंशुमान् ।
मरीचिर्मरुतामस्मि नक्षत्राणामहं शशी ॥२१॥
verses.transliteration:
ādityānām ahaṁ viṣhṇur jyotiṣhāṁ ravir aṁśhumān
marīchir marutām asmi nakṣhatrāṇām ahaṁ śhaśhī
verses.translation_full: Amongst the twelve sons of Aditi I am Vishnu; amongst luminous objects I am the sun. Know Me to be Marichi amongst the maruts, and the moon amongst the stars in the night sky.
verses.widget_line: Among the Adityas, I am Vishnu; among luminaries, the radiant Sun; among the Maruts, I am Marichi; among the stars, I am the Moon.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
वेदानां सामवेदोऽस्मि देवानामस्मि वासवः ।
इन्द्रियाणां मनश्चास्मि भूतानामस्मि चेतना ॥२२॥
verses.transliteration:
vedānāṁ sāma-vedo 'smi devānām asmi vāsavaḥ
indriyāṇāṁ manaśh chāsmi bhūtānām asmi chetanā
verses.translation_full: Among the Vedas, I am the Sama Veda; among the gods, I am Indra; among the senses, I am the mind; and among living beings, I am consciousness.
verses.widget_line: Among the Vedas, I am the Sama Veda; among the gods, I am Indra; among the senses, I am the mind; and among living beings, I am consciousness.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
रुद्राणां शङ्करश्चास्मि वित्तेशो यक्षरक्षसाम् ।
वसूनां पावकश्चास्मि मेरुश्च गिरिणामहम् ॥२३॥
verses.transliteration:
rudrāṇāṁ śhaṅkaraśh chāsmi vitteśho yakṣha-rakṣhasām
vasūnāṁ pāvakaśh chāsmi meruśh cha giriṇām aham
verses.translation_full: Amongst the rudras know Me to be Shankar; amongst the semi-celestial beings and demons I am Kuber. I am Agni amongst the vasus and Meru amongst the mountains.
verses.widget_line: Among the Rudras, I am Shankara; among the Yakshas and Rakshasas, I am the Lord of wealth; among the Vasus, I am fire; and among mountains, I am Meru.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
पुरोधसां च मुख्यं मां विद्धि पार्थ बृहस्पतिम् ।
सेनानीनामहं स्कन्दः सरसामस्मि सागरः ॥२४॥
verses.transliteration:
purodhasāṁ cha mukhyaṁ māṁ viddhi pārtha bṛihaspatim
senānīnām ahaṁ skandaḥ sarasām asmi sāgaraḥ
verses.translation_full: Among priests, O Partha, know Me to be the chief, Brihaspati. Among generals, I am Skanda; among bodies of water, I am the ocean.
verses.widget_line: Among priests, O Partha, know Me to be the chief, Brihaspati. Among generals, I am Skanda; among bodies of water, I am the ocean.
verses.personalized: Among priests, O {name}, know Me to be the chief, Brihaspati. Among generals, I am Skanda; among bodies of water, I am the ocean.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
महर्षीणां भृगुरहं गिरामस्म्येकमक्षरम् ।
यज्ञानां जपयज्ञोऽस्मि स्थावराणां हिमालयः ॥२५॥
verses.transliteration:
maharṣhīṇāṁ bhṛigur ahaṁ girām asmy ekam akṣharam
yajñānāṁ japa-yajño 'smi sthāvarāṇāṁ himālayaḥ
verses.translation_full: I am Bhrigu amongst the great seers and the transcendental Om amongst sounds. Amongst chants know Me to be the repetition of the Holy Name; amongst immovable things I am the Himalayas.
verses.widget_line: Among the great sages, I am Bhrigu; among words, I am the single syllable Om; among sacrifices, I am the chanting of the holy names; among immovable things, I am the Himalayas.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अश्वत्थः सर्ववृक्षाणां देवर्षीणां च नारदः ।
गन्धर्वाणां चित्ररथः सिद्धानां कपिलो मुनिः ॥२६॥
verses.transliteration:
aśhvatthaḥ sarva-vṛikṣhāṇāṁ devarṣhīṇāṁ cha nāradaḥ
gandharvāṇāṁ chitrarathaḥ siddhānāṁ kapilo muniḥ
verses.translation_full: Among all trees, I am the sacred fig tree; among the divine sages, I am Narada; among the Gandharvas, I am Chitraratha; among the perfected ones, I am the sage Kapila.
verses.widget_line: Among all trees, I am the sacred fig tree; among the divine sages, I am Narada; among the Gandharvas, I am Chitraratha; among the perfected ones, I am the sage Kapila.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
उच्चैःश्रवसमश्वानां विद्धि माममृतोद्भवम् ।
ऐरावतं गजेन्द्राणां नराणां च नराधिपम् ॥२७॥
verses.transliteration:
ucchaiḥ-śhravasam aśhvānāṁ viddhi mām amṛitod-bhavam
airāvataṁ gajendrāṇāṁ narāṇāṁ cha narādhipam
verses.translation_full: Amongst horses know Me to be Ucchaihshrava, begotten from the churning of the ocean of nectar. I am Airavata amongst all lordly elephants, and the king amongst humans.
verses.widget_line: Among horses, know Me to be Uchchhaisravas, born of nectar; among lordly elephants, I am Airavata; and among men, I am the monarch.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
आयुधानामहं वज्रं धेनूनामस्मि कामधुक् ।
प्रजनश्चास्मि कन्दर्पः सर्पाणामस्मि वासुकिः ॥२८॥
verses.transliteration:
āyudhānām ahaṁ vajraṁ dhenūnām asmi kāmadhuk
prajanaśh chāsmi kandarpaḥ sarpāṇām asmi vāsukiḥ
verses.translation_full: Among weapons, I am the thunderbolt; among cows, I am Kamadhenu, the wish-fulfilling cow; among progenitors, I am Kandarpa, the god of love; and among serpents, I am Vasuki.
verses.widget_line: Among weapons, I am the thunderbolt; among cows, I am Kamadhenu, the wish-fulfilling cow; among progenitors, I am Kandarpa, the god of love; and among serpents, I am Vasuki.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अनन्तश्चास्मि नागानां वरुणो यादसामहम् ।
पितॄणामर्यमा चास्मि यमः संयमतामहम् ॥२९॥
verses.transliteration:
anantaśh chāsmi nāgānāṁ varuṇo yādasām aham
pitṛīṇām aryamā chāsmi yamaḥ saṁyamatām aham
verses.translation_full: Amongst the snakes I am Anant; amongst aquatics I am Varun. Amongst the departed ancestors I am Aryama; amongst dispensers of law I am Yamraj, the lord of death.
verses.widget_line: Among the Nagas, I am Ananta; among the aquatic beings, I am Varuna; among the departed ancestors, I am Aryama; and among the controllers, I am Yama, the lord of death.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
प्रह्लादश्चास्मि दैत्यानां कालः कलयतामहम् ।
मृगाणां च मृगेन्द्रोऽहं वैनतेयश्च पक्षिणाम् ॥३०॥
verses.transliteration:
prahlādaśh chāsmi daityānāṁ kālaḥ kalayatām aham
mṛigāṇāṁ cha mṛigendro 'haṁ vainateyaśh cha pakṣhiṇām
verses.translation_full: Among the Daityas, I am Prahlada; among calculators, I am time; among beasts, I am the lion; and among birds, I am Garuda.
verses.widget_line: Among the Daityas, I am Prahlada; among calculators, I am time; among beasts, I am the lion; and among birds, I am Garuda.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
पवनः पवतामस्मि रामः शस्त्रभृतामहम् ।
झषाणां मकरश्चास्मि स्रोतसामस्मि जाह्नवी ॥३१॥
verses.transliteration:
pavanaḥ pavatām asmi rāmaḥ śhastra-bhṛitām aham
jhaṣhāṇāṁ makaraśh chāsmi srotasām asmi jāhnavī
verses.translation_full: Amongst purifiers, I am the wind, and amongst wielders of weapons, I am Lord Ram. Of water creatures, I am the crocodile, and of flowing rivers, I am the Ganges.
verses.widget_line: Among purifiers, I am the wind; among warriors, I am Rama; among fishes, I am the shark; and among flowing rivers, I am the Ganges.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
सर्गाणामादिरन्तश्च मध्यं चैवाहमर्जुन ।
अध्यात्मविद्या विद्यानां वादः प्रवदतामहम् ॥३२॥
verses.transliteration:
sargāṇām ādir antaśh cha madhyaṁ chaivāham arjuna
adhyātma-vidyā vidyānāṁ vādaḥ pravadatām aham
verses.translation_full: Among all creations, I am the beginning, the middle, and the end, O Arjuna. Among sciences, I am the science of the self; and among logicians, I am the conclusive truth.
verses.widget_line: Among all creations, I am the beginning, the middle, and the end, O Arjuna. Among sciences, I am the science of the self; and among logicians, I am the conclusive truth.
verses.personalized: Among all creations, I am the beginning, the middle, and the end, O {name}. Among sciences, I am the science of the self; and among logicians, I am the conclusive truth.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अक्षराणामकारोऽस्मि द्वन्द्वः सामासिकस्य च ।
अहमेवाक्षयः कालो धाताहं विश्वतोमुखः ॥३३॥
verses.transliteration:
akṣharāṇām akāro 'smi dvandvaḥ sāmāsikasya cha
aham evākṣhayaḥ kālo dhātāham viśhvato-mukhaḥ
verses.translation_full: I am the beginning "A" amongst all letters; I am the dual word in grammatical compounds. I am the endless Time, and amongst creators I am Brahma.
verses.widget_line: Among letters, I am the letter A; among compound words, I am the dual compound; I am also inexhaustible time; and I am the creator whose faces are turned in all directions.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
मृत्युः सर्वहरश्चाहमुद्भवश्च भविष्यताम् ।
कीर्तिः श्रीर्वाक्च नारीणां स्मृतिर्मेधा धृतिः क्षमा ॥३४॥
verses.transliteration:
mṛityuḥ sarva-haraśh chāham udbhavaśh cha bhaviṣhyatām
kīrtiḥ śhrīr vāk cha nārīṇāṁ smṛitir medhā dhṛitiḥ kṣhamā
verses.translation_full: I am all-devouring death, and I am the generator of all things yet to be. Among women, I am fame, fortune, speech, memory, intelligence, steadfastness, and forgiveness.
verses.widget_line: I am all-devouring death, and I am the generator of all things yet to be. Among women, I am fame, fortune, speech, memory, intelligence, steadfastness, and forgiveness.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
बृहत्साम तथा साम्नां गायत्री छन्दसामहम् ।
मासानां मार्गशीर्षोऽहमृतूनां कुसुमाकरः ॥३५॥
verses.transliteration:
bṛihat-sāma tathā sāmnāṁ gāyatrī chhandasām aham
māsānāṁ mārga-śhīrṣho 'ham ṛitūnāṁ kusumākaraḥ
verses.translation_full: Amongst the hymns in the Samaveda know me to be the Brihatsama; amongst poetic meters I am the Gayatri. Of the twelve months of the Hindu calendar I am Margsheersh, and of seasons I am spring, which brings forth flowers.
verses.widget_line: Among the hymns of the Sama Veda, I am the Brihat-sama; among poetic meters, I am the Gayatri; among months, I am Margashirsha; and among seasons, I am spring.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
द्यूतं छलयतामस्मि तेजस्तेजस्विनामहम् ।
जयोऽस्मि व्यवसायोऽस्मि सत्त्वं सत्त्ववतामहम् ॥३६॥
verses.transliteration:
dyūtaṁ chhalayatām asmi tejas tejasvinām aham
jayo 'smi vyavasāyo 'smi sattvaṁ sattvavatām aham
verses.translation_full: Among cheats, I am gambling; among the splendid, I am splendor; I am victory, I am adventure, and I am the strength of the strong.
verses.widget_line: Among cheats, I am gambling; among the splendid, I am splendor; I am victory, I am adventure, and I am the strength of the strong.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
वृष्णीनां वासुदेवोऽस्मि पाण्डवानां धनञ्जयः ।
मुनीनामप्यहं व्यासः कवीनामुशना कविः ॥३७॥
verses.transliteration:
vṛiṣhṇīnāṁ vāsudevo 'smi pāṇḍavānāṁ dhanañjayaḥ
munīnām apy ahaṁ vyāsaḥ kavīnām uśhanā kaviḥ
verses.translation_full: Amongst the descendants of Vrishni, I am Krishna, and amongst the Pandavas I am Arjun. Know me to be Ved Vyas amongst the sages, and Shukracharya amongst the great thinkers.
verses.widget_line: Among the descendants of Vrishni, I am Vasudeva; among the Pandavas, I am Arjuna; among the sages, I am Vyasa; and among the poets, I am Ushana, the seer.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
दण्डो दमयतामस्मि नीतिरस्मि जिगीषताम् ।
मौनं चैवास्मि गुह्यानां ज्ञानं ज्ञानवतामहम् ॥३८॥
verses.transliteration:
daṇḍo damayatām asmi nītir asmi jigīṣhatām
maunaṁ chaivāsmi guhyānāṁ jñānaṁ jñānavatām aham
verses.translation_full: Among punishers, I am the scepter; among those who seek victory, I am morality; among secrets, I am silence; and among the wise, I am wisdom.
verses.widget_line: Among punishers, I am the scepter; among those who seek victory, I am morality; among secrets, I am silence; and among the wise, I am wisdom.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यच्चापि सर्वभूतानां बीजं तदहमर्जुन ।
न तदस्ति विना यत्स्यान्मया भूतं चराचरम् ॥३९॥
verses.transliteration:
yach chāpi sarva-bhūtānāṁ bījaṁ tad aham arjuna
na tad asti vinā yat syān mayā bhūtaṁ charācharam
verses.translation_full: I am the generating seed of all living beings, O Arjun. No creature moving or non-moving can exist without Me.
verses.widget_line: Furthermore, O Arjuna, I am the generating seed of all existences. There is no being—moving or nonmoving—that can exist without Me.
verses.personalized: Furthermore, O {name}, I am the generating seed of all existences. There is no being—moving or nonmoving—that can exist without Me.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
नान्तोऽस्ति मम दिव्यानां विभूतीनां परन्तप ।
एष तूद्देशतः प्रोक्तो विभूतेर्विस्तरो मया ॥४०॥
verses.transliteration:
nānto 'sti mama divyānāṁ vibhūtīnāṁ parantapa
eṣha tūddeśhataḥ prokto vibhūter vistaro mayā
verses.translation_full: O mighty conqueror of enemies, there is no end to My divine manifestations. What I have spoken to you is but a mere indication of My infinite opulences.
verses.widget_line: O mighty conqueror of enemies, there is no end to My divine manifestations. What I have spoken to you is but a mere indication of My infinite opulences.
verses.personalized: O {name}, there is no end to My divine manifestations. What I have spoken to you is but a mere indication of My infinite opulences.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यद्यद्विभूतिमत्सत्त्वं श्रीमदूर्जितमेव वा ।
तत्तदेवावगच्छ त्वं मम तेजोऽंशसंभवम् ॥४१॥
verses.transliteration:
yad yad vibhūtimat sattvaṁ śhrīmad ūrjitam eva vā
tat tad evāvagachchha tvaṁ mama tejo 'ṁśha-sambhavam
verses.translation_full: Whatever you see as beautiful, glorious, or powerful, know it to spring from but a spark of My splendor.
verses.widget_line: Know that all opulent, beautiful, and glorious creations spring from but a spark of My splendor.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अथवा बहुनैतेन किं ज्ञातेन तवार्जुन ।
विष्टभ्याहमिदं कृत्स्नमेकांशेन स्थितो जगत् ॥४२॥
verses.transliteration:
athavā bahunaitena kiṁ jñātena tavārjuna
viṣhṭabhyāham idaṁ kṛitsnam ekāṁśhena sthito jagat
verses.translation_full: What need is there for all this detailed knowledge, O Arjun? Simply know that by one fraction of My being, I pervade and support this entire creation.
verses.widget_line: But what need is there, Arjuna, for all this detailed knowledge? With a single fragment of Myself, I pervade and support this entire universe.
verses.personalized: But what need is there, O {name}, for all this detailed knowledge? With a single fragment of Myself, I pervade and support this entire universe.

chapter_info.chapter_name_english: Vishvarupa Darshana Yoga – The Yoga of the Vision of the Universal Form
chapter_info.theme: Krishna reveals His universal cosmic form to Arjuna, showing His infinite manifestations and divine opulences, and explains His role as Time, the destroyer of all.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
श्रीभगवानुवाच
पश्य मे पार्थ रूपाणि शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः ।
नानाविधानि दिव्यानि नानावर्णाकृतीनि च ॥५॥
verses.transliteration:
śhrī-bhagavān uvācha
paśhya me pārtha rūpāṇi śhataśho 'tha sahasraśhaḥ
nānā-vidhāni divyāni nānā-varṇākṛitīni cha
verses.translation_full: The Supreme Lord said: Behold, O Parth, My hundreds and thousands of wonderful forms of various shapes, sizes, and colors.
verses.widget_line: Behold, O Partha, My hundreds and thousands of multifarious divine forms.
verses.personalized: Behold, O {name}, My hundreds and thousands of multifarious divine forms.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
पश्यादित्यान्वसून्रुद्रानश्विनौ मरुतस्तथा ।
बहून्यदृष्टपूर्वाणि पश्याश्चर्याणि भारत ॥६॥
verses.transliteration:
paśhyādityān vasūn rudrān aśhvinau marutas tathā
bahūny adṛiṣhṭa-pūrvāṇi paśhyāśhcharyāṇi bhārata
verses.translation_full: Behold in Me, O scion of the Bharatas, the (twelve) sons of Aditi, the (eight) vasus, the (eleven) rudras, the (twin) Ashwini Kumars, as well as the (forty-nine) maruts and many more marvels never revealed before.
verses.widget_line: Behold the Adityas, Vasus, Rudras, Ashvins, and Maruts—many wonders never seen before.
verses.personalized: Behold, O {name}, many wonders never seen before.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
इहैकस्थं जगत्कृत्स्नं पश्याद्य सचराचरम् ।
मम देहे गुडाकेश यच्चान्यद्द्रष्टुमिच्छसि ॥७॥
verses.transliteration:
ihaika-sthaṁ jagat kṛitsnaṁ paśhyādya sa-carācaram
mama dehe guḍākeśha yach chānyad draṣhṭum ichchhasi
verses.translation_full: Behold now, Arjun, the entire universe, with everything moving and non-moving, assembled together in My universal form. Whatever else you wish to see, observe it all within this universal form.
verses.widget_line: See the entire universe, moving and non-moving, in My body, O Gudakesha.
verses.personalized: See the entire universe, moving and non-moving, in My body, O {name}.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
न तु मां शक्यसे द्रष्टुमनेनैव स्वचक्षुषा ।
दिव्यं ददामि ते चक्षुः पश्य मे योगमैश्वरम् ॥८॥
verses.transliteration:
na tu māṁ śhakyase draṣhṭum anenaiva sva-chakṣhuṣhā
divyaṁ dadāmi te chakṣhuḥ paśhya me yogam aiśhvaram
verses.translation_full: But you cannot see My cosmic form with these physical eyes of yours. Therefore, I grant you divine vision. Behold My majestic opulence!
verses.widget_line: I give you divine eyes to behold My majestic opulence.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
श्रीभगवानुवाच
कालोऽस्मि लोकक्षयकृत्प्रवृद्धो
लोकान्समाहर्तुमिह प्रवृत्तः ।
ऋतेऽपि त्वां न भविष्यन्ति सर्वे
येऽवस्थिताः प्रत्यनीकेषु योधाः ॥३२॥
verses.transliteration:
śhrī-bhagavān uvācha
kālo 'smi loka-kṣhaya-kṛit pravṛiddho
lokān samāhartum iha pravṛittaḥ
ṛite 'pi tvāṁ na bhaviṣhyanti sarve
ye 'vasthitāḥ pratyanīkeṣhu yodhāḥ
verses.translation_full: The Supreme Lord said: I am mighty Time, the source of destruction that comes forth to annihilate the worlds. Even without your participation, the warriors arrayed in the opposing army shall cease to exist.
verses.widget_line: I am Time, the great destroyer of the worlds, and I have come here to engage all people.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
तस्मात्त्वमुत्तिष्ठ यशो लभस्व
जित्वा शत्रून्भुङ्क्ष्व राज्यं समृद्धम् ।
मयैवैते निहताः पूर्वमेव
निमित्तमात्रं भव सव्यसाचिन् ॥३३॥
verses.transliteration:
tasmāt tvam uttiṣhṭha yaśho labhasva
jitvā śhatrūn bhuṅkṣhva rājyaṁ samṛiddham
mayaivaite nihatāḥ pūrvam eva
nimitta-mātraṁ bhava savya-sāchin
verses.translation_full: Therefore, arise and attain honor! Conquer your foes and enjoy prosperous rulership. These warriors stand already slain by Me, and you will only be an instrument of My work, O expert archer.
verses.widget_line: Get up and prepare to fight. By My arrangement, these warriors have already been slain.
verses.personalized: Get up and prepare to fight, O {name}. By My arrangement, these warriors have already been slain.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
द्रोणं च भीष्मं च जयद्रथं च
कर्णं तथान्यानपि योधवीरान् ।
मया हतांस्त्वं जहि मा व्यथिष्ठा
युध्यस्व जेतासि रणे सपत्नान् ॥३४॥
verses.transliteration:
droṇaṁ cha bhīṣhmaṁ cha jayadrathaṁ cha
karṇaṁ tathānyān api yodha-vīrān
mayā hatāṁs tvaṁ jahi mā vyathiṣhṭhā
yudhyasva jetāsi raṇe sapatnān
verses.translation_full: Dronacharya, Bheeshma, Jayadratha, Karn, and other brave warriors have already been killed by Me. Therefore, slay them without being disturbed. Just fight and you will be victorious over your enemies in battle.
verses.widget_line: Drona, Bhishma, Jayadratha, Karna, and other warriors have already been slain by Me. Simply fight.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
श्रीभगवानुवाच
मया प्रसन्नेन तवार्जुनेदं
रूपं परं दर्शितमात्मयोगात् ।
तेजोमयं विश्वमनन्तमाद्यं
यन्मे त्वदन्येन न दृष्टपूर्वम् ॥४७॥
verses.transliteration:
śhrī-bhagavān uvācha
mayā prasannena tavārjunedaṁ
rūpaṁ paraṁ darśhitam ātma-yogāt
tejo-mayaṁ viśhvam anantam ādyaṁ
yan me tvad anyena na dṛiṣhṭa-pūrvam
verses.translation_full: The Lord said: Arjun, being pleased with you, by My Yogmaya power, I gave you a vision of My resplendent, unlimited, and primeval cosmic form. No one before you has ever seen it.
verses.widget_line: Being pleased with you, O Arjuna, I have shown you this supreme universal form.
verses.personalized: Being pleased with you, O {name}, I have shown you this supreme universal form.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
न वेदयज्ञाध्ययनैर्न दानै-
र्न च क्रियाभिर्न तपोभिरुग्रैः ।
एवंरूपः शक्य अहं नृलोके
द्रष्टुं त्वदन्येन कुरुप्रवीर ॥४८॥
verses.transliteration:
na veda-yajñādhyayanair na dānair
na cha kriyābhir na tapobhir ugraiḥ
evaṁ-rūpaḥ śhakya ahaṁ nṛi-loke
draṣhṭuṁ tvad anyena kuru-pravīra
verses.translation_full: Not by study of the Vedas, nor by the performance of sacrifice, rituals, or charity, nor even by practicing severe austerities, has any mortal ever seen what you have seen, O best of the Kuru warriors.
verses.widget_line: Neither by studying the Vedas, nor by sacrifices, nor by charity can I be seen in this form by anyone other than you.
verses.personalized: Neither by studying the Vedas, nor by sacrifices, nor by charity can I be seen in this form by anyone other than you, O {name}.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
मा ते व्यथा मा च विमूढभावो
दृष्ट्वा रूपं घोरमीदृङ्ममेदम् ।
व्यपेतभीः प्रीतमनाः पुनस्त्वं
तदेव मे रूपमिदं प्रपश्य ॥४९॥
verses.transliteration:
mā te vyathā mā cha vimūḍha-bhāvo
dṛiṣhṭvā rūpaṁ ghoram īdṛiṅ mamedam
vyapeta-bhīḥ prīta-manāḥ punas tvaṁ
tad eva me rūpam idaṁ prapaśhya
verses.translation_full: Be neither afraid nor bewildered on seeing this terrible form of Mine. Be free from fear and with a cheerful heart, behold Me once again in My personal form.
verses.widget_line: Do not be perturbed by seeing this terrible form. With fears dispelled, behold again this form.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
श्रीभगवानुवाच
सुदुर्दर्शमिदं रूपं दृष्टवानसि यन्मम ।
देवा अप्यस्य रूपस्य नित्यं दर्शनकाङ्क्षिणः ॥५२॥
verses.transliteration:
śhrī-bhagavān uvācha
su-durdarśham idaṁ rūpaṁ dṛiṣhṭavān asi yan mama
devā apy asya rūpasya nityaṁ darśhana-kāṅkṣhiṇaḥ
verses.translation_full: The Supreme Lord said: This form of Mine that you are seeing is exceedingly difficult to behold. Even the celestial gods are eager to see it.
verses.widget_line: This form is exceedingly difficult to behold. Even the celestial gods are ever eager to see it.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
नाहं वेदैर्न तपसा न दानेन न चेज्यया ।
शक्य एवंविधो द्रष्टुं दृष्टवानसि मां यथा ॥५३॥
verses.transliteration:
nāhaṁ vedair na tapasā na dānena na chejyayā
śhakya evaṁ-vidho draṣhṭuṁ dṛiṣhṭavān asi māṁ yathā
verses.translation_full: Neither by the study of the Vedas, nor by penance, charity, or fire sacrifices, can I be seen as you have seen Me.
verses.widget_line: This form cannot be understood by studying the Vedas, penances, charity, or worship.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
भक्त्या त्वनन्यया शक्य अहमेवंविधोऽर्जुन ।
ज्ञातुं द्रष्टुं च तत्त्वेन प्रवेष्टुं च परन्तप ॥५४॥
verses.transliteration:
bhaktyā tv ananyayā śhakya aham evaṁ-vidho 'rjuna
jñātuṁ draṣhṭuṁ cha tattvena praveṣhṭuṁ cha parantapa
verses.translation_full: O Arjun, by unalloyed devotion alone can I be known as I am, standing before you. Thereby, on receiving My divine vision, O scorcher of foes, one can enter into union with Me.
verses.widget_line: Only through unalloyed devotion can I be truly known, seen, and entered into, O Arjuna.
verses.personalized: Only through unalloyed devotion can I be truly known, seen, and entered into, O {name}.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
मत्कर्मकृन्मत्परमो मद्भक्तः सङ्गवर्जितः ।
निर्वैरः सर्वभूतेषु यः स मामेति पाण्डव ॥५५॥
verses.transliteration:
mat-karma-kṛin mat-paramo mad-bhaktaḥ saṅga-varjitaḥ
nirvairaḥ sarva-bhūteṣhu yaḥ sa mām eti pāṇḍava
verses.translation_full: Those who perform all their duties for My sake, who depend upon Me and are devoted to Me, who are free from attachment, and are without malice toward all beings, such devotees certainly come to Me.
verses.widget_line: One who works for Me, is devoted to Me, free from enmity, and equipoised—comes to Me, O Pandava.
verses.personalized: One who works for Me, is devoted to Me, free from enmity, and equipoised—comes to Me, O {name}.

chapter_info.chapter_name_english: Bhakti Yoga – The Yoga of Devotion
chapter_info.theme: Krishna explains the path of devotion, describing the qualities of His devotees and the various ways to attain Him through unwavering devotion and selfless service.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
श्रीभगवानुवाच
मय्यावेश्य मनो ये मां नित्ययुक्ता उपासते ।
श्रद्धया परयोपेतास्ते मे युक्ततमा मताः ॥२॥
verses.transliteration:
śhrī-bhagavān uvācha
mayy āveśhya mano ye māṁ nitya-yuktā upāsate
śhraddhayā parayopetās te me yuktatamā matāḥ
verses.translation_full: The Lord said: Those who fix their minds on Me and always engage in My devotion with steadfast faith, I consider them to be the best yogis.
verses.widget_line: Those who fix their minds on Me with great faith are most perfect.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
ये त्वक्षरमनिर्देश्यमव्यक्तं पर्युपासते ।
सर्वत्रगमचिन्त्यं च कूटस्थमचलं ध्रुवम् ॥३॥
verses.transliteration:
ye tv akṣharam anirdeśhyam avyaktaṁ paryupāsate
sarvatra-gam achintyaṁ cha kūṭa-stham achalaṁ dhruvam
verses.translation_full: But those who worship the formless aspect of the Absolute Truth—the imperishable, the indefinable, the unmanifest, the all-pervading, the unthinkable, the unchanging, the eternal, and the immoveable—
verses.widget_line: Those who worship the unmanifest, imperishable, all-pervading formless aspect—

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
सन्नियम्येन्द्रियग्रामं सर्वत्र समबुद्धयः ।
ते प्राप्नुवन्ति मामेव सर्वभूतहिते रताः ॥४॥
verses.transliteration:
sanniyamyendriya-grāmaṁ sarvatra sama-buddhayaḥ
te prāpnuvanti mām eva sarva-bhūta-hite ratāḥ
verses.translation_full: by restraining their senses and being even-minded everywhere, such persons, engaged in the welfare of all beings, also attain Me.
verses.widget_line: Controlling all senses, even-minded, engaged in the welfare of all—they also attain Me.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
क्लेशोऽधिकतरस्तेषामव्यक्तासक्तचेतसाम् ।
अव्यक्ता हि गतिर्दुःखं देहवद्भिरवाप्यते ॥५॥
verses.transliteration:
kleśho 'dhikataras teṣhām avyaktāsakta-chetasām
avyaktā hi gatir duḥkhaṁ dehavadbhir avāpyate
verses.translation_full: For those whose minds are attached to the unmanifest, the path of realization is full of tribulations. Worship of the unmanifest is exceedingly difficult for embodied beings.
verses.widget_line: The path of the unmanifest is full of tribulations and difficult for embodied beings.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
ये तु सर्वाणि कर्माणि मयि संन्यस्य मत्पराः ।
अनन्येनैव योगेन मां ध्यायन्त उपासते ॥६॥
verses.transliteration:
ye tu sarvāṇi karmāṇi mayi sannyasya mat-parāḥ
ananyenaiva yogena māṁ dhyāyanta upāsate
verses.translation_full: But those who dedicate all their actions to Me, regarding Me as the Supreme goal, worshiping Me and meditating on Me with exclusive devotion, O Parth,
verses.widget_line: Those who dedicate all actions to Me and meditate on Me with exclusive devotion—

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
तेषामहं समुद्धर्ता मृत्युसंसारसागरात् ।
भवामि नचिरात्पार्थ मय्यावेशितचेतसाम् ॥७॥
verses.transliteration:
teṣhām ahaṁ samuddhartā mṛityu-saṁsāra-sāgarāt
bhavāmi na chirāt pārtha mayy āveśhita-chetasām
verses.translation_full: I swiftly deliver them from the ocean of birth and death, for their consciousness is united with Me.
verses.widget_line: I become the deliverer from the ocean of birth and death, O Partha, for those whose minds are fixed on Me.
verses.personalized: I become the deliverer from the ocean of birth and death, O {name}, for those whose minds are fixed on Me.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
मय्येव मन आधत्स्व मयि बुद्धिं निवेशय ।
निवसिष्यसि मय्येव अत ऊर्ध्वं न संशयः ॥८॥
verses.transliteration:
mayy eva mana ādhatsva mayi buddhiṁ niveśhaya
nivasiṣhyasi mayy eva ata ūrdhvaṁ na sanśhayaḥ
verses.translation_full: Fix your mind on Me alone and surrender your intellect to Me. There upon, you will always live in Me. Of this, there is no doubt.
verses.widget_line: Fix your mind on Me alone, and rest your intellect on Me. Thereafter, you will certainly live in Me.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अथ चित्तं समाधातुं न शक्नोषि मयि स्थिरम् ।
अभ्यासयोगेन ततो मामिच्छाप्तुं धनञ्जय ॥९॥
verses.transliteration:
atha chittaṁ samādhātuṁ na śhaknoṣhi mayi sthiram
abhyāsa-yogena tato mām ichchhāptuṁ dhanañjaya
verses.translation_full: If you are unable to fix your mind steadily on Me, then seek to reach Me by the practice of constant remembrance, O Dhananjaya.
verses.widget_line: If unable to fix your mind on Me, practice constant remembrance, O Dhananjaya.
verses.personalized: If unable to fix your mind on Me, practice constant remembrance, O {name}.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अभ्यासेऽप्यसमर्थोऽसि मत्कर्मपरमो भव ।
मदर्थमपि कर्माणि कुर्वन्सिद्धिमवाप्स्यसि ॥१०॥
verses.transliteration:
abhyāse 'py asamartho 'si mat-karma-paramo bhava
mad-artham api karmāṇi kurvan siddhim avāpsyasi
verses.translation_full: If you cannot practice remembering Me with devotion, then just try to work for Me. Thus performing devotional service to Me, you shall achieve the stage of perfection.
verses.widget_line: If unable to practice remembrance, work for Me. By working for Me, you will attain perfection.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अथैतदप्यशक्तोऽसि कर्तुं मद्योगमाश्रितः ।
सर्वकर्मफलत्यागं ततः कुरु यतात्मवान् ॥११॥
verses.transliteration:
athaitad apy aśhakto 'si kartuṁ mad-yogam āśhritaḥ
sarva-karma-phala-tyāgaṁ tataḥ kuru yatātmavān
verses.translation_full: If you are unable to even work for Me in devotion, then try to renounce the fruits of your actions and be situated in the self.
verses.widget_line: If unable to do even this, renounce the fruits of all actions, taking refuge in Me.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
श्रेयो हि ज्ञानमभ्यासाज्ज्ञानाद्ध्यानं विशिष्यते ।
ध्यानात्कर्मफलत्यागस्त्यागाच्छान्तिरनन्तरम् ॥१२॥
verses.transliteration:
śhreyo hi jñānam abhyāsāj jñānād dhyānaṁ viśhiṣhyate
dhyānāt karma-phala-tyāgas tyāgāc chhāntir anantaram
verses.translation_full: Better than mechanical practice is knowledge; better than knowledge is meditation. Better than meditation is renunciation of the fruits of actions, for peace immediately follows such renunciation.
verses.widget_line: Knowledge is better than practice; meditation is better than knowledge; renunciation brings peace.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अद्वेष्टा सर्वभूतानां मैत्रः करुण एव च ।
निर्ममो निरहङ्कारः समदुःखसुखः क्षमी ॥१३॥
verses.transliteration:
adveṣhṭā sarva-bhūtānāṁ maitraḥ karuṇa eva cha
nirmamo nirahaṅkāraḥ sama-duḥkha-sukhaḥ kṣhamī
verses.translation_full: Those devotees are very dear to Me who are free from malice toward all living beings, who are friendly, and compassionate. They are free from attachment to possessions and egotism, equipoised in happiness and distress, and ever-forgiving.
verses.widget_line: One who is not envious, a friend to all, merciful, free from ego, equipoised, and forgiving—

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
सन्तुष्टः सततं योगी यतात्मा दृढनिश्चयः ।
मय्यर्पितमनोबुद्धिर्यो मद्भक्तः स मे प्रियः ॥१४॥
verses.transliteration:
santuṣhṭaḥ satataṁ yogī yatātmā dṛiḍha-niśhchayaḥ
mayy arpita-mano-buddhir yo mad-bhaktaḥ sa me priyaḥ
verses.translation_full: They are ever-content, steadily united with Me in devotion, self-controlled, of firm resolve, and dedicated to Me in mind and intellect.
verses.widget_line: Always satisfied, self-controlled, resolute, with mind fixed on Me—such a devotee is dear to Me.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यस्मान्नोद्विजते लोको लोकान्नोद्विजते च यः ।
हर्षामर्षभयोद्वेगैर्मुक्तो यः स च मे प्रियः ॥१५॥
verses.transliteration:
yasmān nodvijate loko lokān nodvijate cha yaḥ
harṣhāmarṣha-bhayodvegair mukto yaḥ sa cha me priyaḥ
verses.translation_full: Those who are not a source of annoyance to anyone and who in turn are not agitated by anyone, who are equal in pleasure and pain, and free from fear and anxiety, such devotees of Mine are very dear to Me.
verses.widget_line: One who does not disturb the world and is not disturbed by it, free from joy, envy, fear, and anxiety—is dear to Me.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अनपेक्षः शुचिर्दक्ष उदासीनो गतव्यथः ।
सर्वारम्भपरित्यागी यो मद्भक्तः स मे प्रियः ॥१६॥
verses.transliteration:
anapekṣhaḥ śhuchir dakṣha udāsīno gata-vyathaḥ
sarvārambha-parityāgī yo mad-bhaktaḥ sa me priyaḥ
verses.translation_full: Those who are indifferent to worldly gains, externally and internally pure, skillful, without cares, untroubled, and free from selfishness in all undertakings, such devotees of Mine are very dear to Me.
verses.widget_line: Free from expectations, pure, skillful, unconcerned, renouncing all undertakings—such a devotee is dear to Me.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यो न हृष्यति न द्वेष्टि न शोचति न काङ्क्षति ।
शुभाशुभपरित्यागी भक्तिमान्यः स मे प्रियः ॥१७॥
verses.transliteration:
yo na hṛiṣhyati na dveṣhṭi na śhochati na kāṅkṣhati
śhubhāśhubha-parityāgī bhaktimān yaḥ sa me priyaḥ
verses.translation_full: Those who neither rejoice in mundane pleasures nor despair in worldly sorrows, who neither lament for any loss nor hanker for any gain, who renounce both good and evil deeds, such persons who are full of devotion are very dear to Me.
verses.widget_line: One who neither rejoices nor grieves, who renounces both auspicious and inauspicious—is dear to Me.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
समः शत्रौ च मित्रे च तथा मानापमानयोः ।
शीतोष्णसुखदुःखेषु समः सङ्गविवर्जितः ॥१८॥
verses.transliteration:
samaḥ śhatrau cha mitre cha tathā mānāpamānayoḥ
śhītoṣhṇa-sukha-duḥkheṣhu samaḥ saṅga-vivarjitaḥ
verses.translation_full: Those, who are alike to friend and foe, equipoised in honor and dishonor, cold and heat, joy and sorrow, and are free from all unfavorable association;
verses.widget_line: Equal to friends and enemies, equipoised in honor and dishonor, heat and cold, happiness and distress—

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
तुल्यनिन्दास्तुतिर्मौनी सन्तुष्टो येन केनचित् ।
अनिकेतः स्थिरमतिर्भक्तिमान्मे प्रियो नरः ॥१९॥
verses.transliteration:
tulya-nindā-stutir maunī santuṣhṭo yena kenachit
aniketaḥ sthira-matir bhaktimān me priyo naraḥ
verses.translation_full: those who take praise and reproach alike, who are given to silent contemplation, content with what comes their way, without attachment to the place of residence, whose intellect is firmly fixed in Me, and who are full of devotion to Me, such persons are very dear to Me.
verses.widget_line: Equal in censure and praise, silent, satisfied with anything, fixed in knowledge, and devoted—is dear to Me.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
ये तु धर्म्यामृतमिदं यथोक्तं पर्युपासते ।
श्रद्दधाना मत्परमा भक्तास्तेऽतीव मे प्रियाः ॥२०॥
verses.transliteration:
ye tu dharmyāmṛitam idaṁ yathoktaṁ paryupāsate
śhraddadhānā mat-paramā bhaktās te 'tīva me priyāḥ
verses.translation_full: Those who honor this nectar of wisdom declared here, have faith in Me, and are devoted and intent on Me as the supreme goal, they are exceedingly dear to Me.
verses.widget_line: Those who follow this immortal dharma with faith, making Me their supreme goal—are very dear to Me.

chapter_info.chapter_name_english: Kshetra Kshetrajna Vibhaga Yoga – The Yoga of the Field and the Knower of the Field
chapter_info.theme: Krishna explains the distinction between the physical body (Kshetra) and the soul (Kshetrajna), describes the nature of true knowledge, and discusses the characteristics of the Supreme Reality.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
श्रीभगवानुवाच
