क्षेत्रज्ञं चापि मां विद्धि सर्वक्षेत्रेषु भारत ।
क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञयोर्ज्ञानं यत्तज्ज्ञानं मतं मम ॥२॥
verses.transliteration:
śhrī-bhagavān uvācha
kṣhetrajñaṁ chāpi māṁ viddhi sarva-kṣhetreṣhu bhārata
kṣhetra-kṣhetrajñayor jñānaṁ yat taj jñānaṁ mataṁ mama
verses.translation_full: The Supreme Divine Lord said: O Arjun, this body is termed as kṣhetra (the field of activities), and the one who knows this body is called kṣhetrajña (the knower of the field) by the sages who discern the truth about both.
verses.widget_line: Know Me to be the Knower of the field in all fields, O Bharata. The knowledge of both the field and the Knower is true knowledge.
verses.personalized: Know Me to be the Knower of the field in all fields, O {name}. The knowledge of both the field and the Knower is true knowledge.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
तत्क्षेत्रं यच्च यादृक्च यद्विकारि यतश्च यत् ।
स च यो यत्प्रभावश्च तत्समासेन मे शृणु ॥३॥
verses.transliteration:
tat kṣhetraṁ yach cha yādṛik cha yad vikāri yataśh cha yat
sa cha yo yat prabhāvaśh cha tat samāsena me śhṛiṇu
verses.translation_full: What the field is, what its nature is, what its modifications are, whence it is, who He is, and what His powers are—hear all this from Me in brief.
verses.widget_line: What the field is, its nature, modifications, and the Knower—hear all this from Me in brief.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
ऋषिभिर्बहुधा गीतं छन्दोभिर्विविधैः पृथक् ।
ब्रह्मसूत्रपदैश्चैव हेतुमद्भिर्विनिश्चितैः ॥४॥
verses.transliteration:
ṛiṣhibhir bahudhā gītaṁ chandobhir vividhaiḥ pṛithak
brahma-sūtra-padaiśh chaiva hetumadbhir viniśhchitaiḥ
verses.translation_full: Listen and I will explain to you what that field is and what its nature is. I will also explain how change takes place within it, from what it was created, who the knower of the field of activities is, and what his powers are.
verses.widget_line: This has been sung by sages in various ways, in Vedic hymns, and in the Brahma Sutras.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
महाभूतान्यहङ्कारो बुद्धिरव्यक्तमेव च ।
इन्द्रियाणि दशैकं च पञ्च चेन्द्रियगोचराः ॥५॥
verses.transliteration:
mahā-bhūtāny ahaṅkāro buddhir avyaktam eva cha
indriyāṇi daśhaikaṁ cha pañcha chendriya-gocharāḥ
verses.translation_full: The field consists of the five great elements, false ego, intellect, the unmanifest, the ten senses, the mind, and the five objects of the senses.
verses.widget_line: The field consists of the five elements, ego, intellect, unmanifest, ten senses, mind, and sense objects.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
इच्छा द्वेषः सुखं दुःखं सङ्घातश्चेतना धृतिः ।
एतत्क्षेत्रं समासेन सविकारमुदाहृतम् ॥६॥
verses.transliteration:
ichchhā dveṣhaḥ sukhaṁ duḥkhaṁ saṅghātaśh chetanā dhṛitiḥ
etat kṣhetraṁ samāsena sa-vikāram udāhṛitam
verses.translation_full: The field of activities is composed of the five great elements, the ego, the intellect, the unmanifest primordial matter, the eleven senses (five knowledge senses, five working senses, and mind), and the five objects of the senses.
verses.widget_line: Desire, hatred, happiness, distress, consciousness, and fortitude—this field with its modifications.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अमानित्वमदम्भित्वमहिंसा क्षान्तिरार्जवम् ।
आचार्योपासनं शौचं स्थैर्यमात्मविनिग्रहः ॥७॥
verses.transliteration:
amānitvam adambhitvam ahiṁsā kṣhāntir ārjavam
āchāryopāsanaṁ śhauchaṁ sthairyam ātma-vinigrahaḥ
verses.translation_full: Humility, absence of pride, nonviolence, tolerance, simplicity, approaching a bona fide spiritual master, cleanliness, steadiness, self-control—
verses.widget_line: Humility, absence of pride, nonviolence, tolerance, simplicity, approaching a spiritual master, cleanliness, steadiness, and self-control—these are the divine qualities.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
इन्द्रियार्थेषु वैराग्यमनहङ्कार एव च ।
जन्ममृत्युजराव्याधिदुःखदोषानुदर्शनम् ॥८॥
verses.transliteration:
indriyārtheṣhu vairāgyam anahaṅkāra eva cha
janma-mṛityu-jarā-vyādhi-duḥkha-doṣhānudarśhanam
verses.translation_full: Humbleness; freedom from hypocrisy; non-violence; forgiveness; simplicity; service of the Guru; cleanliness of body and mind; steadfastness; and self-control; dispassion toward the objects of the senses; absence of egotism; keeping in mind the evils of birth, disease, old age, and death;
verses.widget_line: Detachment from sense objects, absence of false ego, perception of the evil of birth, death, old age, and disease—

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
असक्तिरनभिष्वङ्गः पुत्रदारगृहादिषु ।
नित्यं च समचित्तत्वमिष्टानिष्टोपपत्तिषु ॥९॥
verses.transliteration:
asaktir anabhiṣhvaṅgaḥ putra-dāra-gṛihādiṣhu
nityaṁ cha sama-chittatvam iṣhṭāniṣhṭopapattiṣhu
verses.translation_full: Non-attachment, non-identification of the self with son, wife, home, and the rest, and constant even-mindedness on the attainment of the desirable and the undesirable—
verses.widget_line: Non-attachment, non-identification with family and home, constant even-mindedness in desirable and undesirable—

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
मयि चानन्ययोगेन भक्तिरव्यभिचारिणी ।
विविक्तदेशसेवित्वमरतिर्जनसंसदि ॥१०॥
verses.transliteration:
mayi chānanya-yogena bhaktir avyabhicāriṇī
vivikta-deśha-sevitvam aratir jana-saṁsadi
verses.translation_full: constant and exclusive devotion toward Me; an inclination for solitary places and an aversion for mundane society; constancy in spiritual knowledge; and philosophical pursuit of the Absolute Truth—
verses.widget_line: Unflinching devotion to Me by the yoga of non-separation, resorting to solitary places, distaste for the society of men—

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अध्यात्मज्ञाननित्यत्वं तत्त्वज्ञानार्थदर्शनम् ।
एतज्ज्ञानमिति प्रोक्तमज्ञानं यदतोऽन्यथा ॥११॥
verses.transliteration:
adhyātma-jñāna-nityatvaṁ tattva-jñānārtha-darśhanam
etaj jñānam iti proktam ajñānaṁ yad ato 'nyathā
verses.translation_full: Constancy in self-knowledge, perception of the end of true knowledge—this is declared to be knowledge, and what is contrary to this is ignorance.
verses.widget_line: Constancy in self-knowledge, perception of the end of true knowledge—this is knowledge, and what is contrary is ignorance.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
ज्ञेयं यत्तत्प्रवक्ष्यामि यज्ज्ञात्वाऽमृतमश्नुते ।
अनादिमत्परं ब्रह्म न सत्तन्नासदुच्यते ॥१२॥
verses.transliteration:
jñeyaṁ yat tat pravakṣhyāmi yaj jñātvāmṛitam aśhnute
anādi-mat paraṁ brahma na sat tan nāsad uchyate
verses.translation_full: I shall now reveal to you that which ought to be known, and by knowing which, one attains immortality. It is the beginningless Brahman, which lies beyond existence and non-existence.
verses.widget_line: I shall explain the knowable, knowing which you will taste the eternal. This is the beginningless Supreme Brahman.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
सर्वतः पाणिपादं तत्सर्वतोऽक्षिशिरोमुखम् ।
सर्वतः श्रुतिमल्लोके सर्वमावृत्य तिष्ठति ॥१३॥
verses.transliteration:
sarvataḥ pāṇi-pādaṁ tat sarvato 'kṣhi-śhiro-mukham
sarvataḥ śhrutimalloke sarvam āvṛitya tiṣhṭhati
verses.translation_full: With hands and feet everywhere, with eyes, heads, and mouths everywhere, with ears everywhere, He exists in the world, enveloping all.
verses.widget_line: With hands and feet everywhere, with eyes, heads, and mouths everywhere, He exists in the world, enveloping all.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
सर्वेन्द्रियगुणाभासं सर्वेन्द्रियविवर्जितम् ।
असक्तं सर्वभृच्चैव निर्गुणं गुणभोक्तृ च ॥१४॥
verses.transliteration:
sarvendriya-guṇābhāsaṁ sarvendriya-vivarjitam
asaktaṁ sarva-bhṛich chaiva nirguṇaṁ guṇa-bhoktṛi cha
verses.translation_full: Though He perceives all sense-objects, yet He is devoid of the senses. He is unattached to everything, and yet He is the sustainer of all. Although He is without attributes, yet He is the enjoyer of the three modes of material nature.
verses.widget_line: Appearing to have the qualities of all senses, yet without senses; unattached, yet supporting all; devoid of qualities, yet their experiencer—

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
बहिरन्तश्च भूतानामचरं चरमेव च ।
सूक्ष्मत्वात्तदविज्ञेयं दूरस्थं चान्तिके च तत् ॥१५॥
verses.transliteration:
bahir antaśh cha bhūtānām acharaṁ charam eva cha
sūkṣhmatvāt tad avijñeyaṁ dūrasthaṁ chāntike cha tat
verses.translation_full: Without and within all beings, unmoving and moving; because of His subtlety, unknowable; far away, yet near—
verses.widget_line: Without and within all beings, unmoving and moving; because of His subtlety, unknowable; far away, yet near—

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अविभक्तं च भूतेषु विभक्तमिव च स्थितम् ।
भूतभर्तृ च तज्ज्ञेयं ग्रसिष्णु प्रभविष्णु च ॥१६॥
verses.transliteration:
avibhaktaṁ cha bhūteṣhu vibhaktam iva cha sthitam
bhūta-bhartṛi cha taj jñeyaṁ grasiṣhṇu prabhaviṣhṇu cha
verses.translation_full: He is indivisible, yet He appears to be divided amongst living beings. Know the Supreme Entity to be the Sustainer, Annihilator, and Creator of all beings.
verses.widget_line: Undivided, yet appearing as divided in beings; He is the supporter, destroyer, and creator of beings.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
ज्योतिषामपि तज्ज्योतिस्तमसः परमुच्यते ।
ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं ज्ञानगम्यं हृदि सर्वस्य विष्ठितम् ॥१७॥
verses.transliteration:
jyotiṣhām api taj jyotis tamasaḥ param uchyate
jñānaṁ jñeyaṁ jñāna-gamyaṁ hṛidi sarvasya viṣhṭhitam
verses.translation_full: The light of all lights, He is said to be beyond darkness. He is knowledge, the object of knowledge, and the goal of knowledge. He is seated in everyone's heart.
verses.widget_line: The light of all lights, beyond darkness. He is knowledge, the object of knowledge, and the goal of knowledge. He is seated in everyone's heart.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
इति क्षेत्रं तथा ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं चोक्तं समासतः ।
मद्भक्त एतद्विज्ञाय मद्भावायोपपद्यते ॥१८॥
verses.transliteration:
iti kṣhetraṁ tathā jñānaṁ jñeyaṁ choktaṁ samāsataḥ
mad-bhakta etad vijñāya mad-bhāvāyopapadyate
verses.translation_full: I have thus revealed to you the nature of the field, the meaning of knowledge, and the object of knowledge. Only My devotees can understand this in reality, and by doing so, they attain My divine nature.
verses.widget_line: The field, knowledge, and the knowable have been briefly described. My devotee, knowing this, becomes fit for My state.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
प्रकृतिं पुरुषं चैव विद्ध्यनादी उभावपि ।
विकारांश्च गुणांश्चैव विद्धि प्रकृतिसम्भवान् ॥१९॥
verses.transliteration:
prakṛitiṁ puruṣhaṁ chaiva viddhy anādī ubhāv api
vikārāṁśh cha guṇāṁśh chaiva viddhi prakṛiti-sambhavān
verses.translation_full: Know both Prakriti and Purusha to be beginningless. And know also that all transformations and qualities are born of Prakriti.
verses.widget_line: Know both Prakriti and Purusha to be beginningless. All transformations and qualities are born of Prakriti.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
कार्यकारणकर्तृत्वे हेतुः प्रकृतिरुच्यते ।
पुरुषः सुखदुःखानां भोक्तृत्वे हेतुरुच्यते ॥२०॥
verses.transliteration:
kārya-kāraṇa-kartṛitve hetuḥ prakṛitir uchyate
puruṣhaḥ sukha-duḥkhānāṁ bhoktṛitve hetur uchyate
verses.translation_full: In the matter of creation, the material energy is responsible for cause and effect; in the matter of experiencing happiness and distress, the individual soul is declared responsible.
verses.widget_line: Prakriti is the cause of the body and organs. Purusha is the cause of experiencing happiness and distress.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
पुरुषः प्रकृतिस्थो हि भुङ्क्ते प्रकृतिजान्गुणान् ।
कारणं गुणसङ्गोऽस्य सदसद्योनिजन्मसु ॥२१॥
verses.transliteration:
puruṣhaḥ prakṛiti-stho hi bhuṅkte prakṛiti-jān guṇān
kāraṇaṁ guṇa-saṅgo 'sya sad-asad-yoni-janmasu
verses.translation_full: The Purusha, seated in Prakriti, experiences the qualities born of Prakriti. Attachment to the qualities is the cause of his birth in good and evil wombs.
verses.widget_line: The Purusha, seated in Prakriti, experiences the qualities. Attachment to the qualities is the cause of birth in good and evil wombs.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
उपद्रष्टानुमन्ता च भर्ता भोक्ता महेश्वरः ।
परमात्मेति चाप्युक्तो देहेऽस्मिन्पुरुषः परः ॥२२॥
verses.transliteration:
upadraṣhṭānumantā cha bhartā bhoktā maheśhvaraḥ
paramātmeti chāpy ukto dehe 'smin puruṣhaḥ paraḥ
verses.translation_full: Within the body also resides the Supreme Lord. He is said to be the Witness, the Permitter, the Supporter, Transcendental Enjoyer, the ultimate Controller, and the Paramātmā (Supreme Soul).
verses.widget_line: The Supreme Lord in this body is the Witness, Permitter, Supporter, Experiencer, Great Lord, and Supreme Self.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
य एवं वेत्ति पुरुषं प्रकृतिं च गुणैः सह ।
सर्वथा वर्तमानोऽपि न स भूयोऽभिजायते ॥२३॥
verses.transliteration:
ya evaṁ vetti puruṣhaṁ prakṛitiṁ cha guṇaiḥ saha
sarvathā vartamāno 'pi na sa bhūyo 'bhijāyate
verses.translation_full: One who thus knows the Purusha and Prakriti together with the qualities, in whatever condition he may be, he is not born again.
verses.widget_line: One who thus knows the Purusha and Prakriti with the qualities, in whatever condition, is not born again.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
ध्यानेनात्मनि पश्यन्ति केचिदात्मानमात्मना ।
अन्ये साङ्ख्येन योगेन कर्मयोगेन चापरे ॥२४॥
verses.transliteration:
dhyānenātmani paśhyanti kechid ātmānam ātmanā
anye sāṅkhyena yogena karma-yogena chāpare
verses.translation_full: Some try to perceive the Supreme Soul within their hearts through meditation, and others try to do so through the cultivation of knowledge, while still others strive to attain that realization by the path of action.
verses.widget_line: Some perceive the Self through meditation, others through the yoga of knowledge, and still others through the yoga of action.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अन्ये त्वेवमजानन्तः श्रुत्वान्येभ्य उपासते ।
तेऽपि चातितरन्त्येव मृत्युं श्रुतिपरायणाः ॥२५॥
verses.transliteration:
anye tv evam ajānantaḥ śhrutvānyebhya upāsate
te 'pi chātitaranty eva mṛityuṁ śhruti-parāyaṇāḥ
verses.translation_full: Others, not knowing this, worship after hearing from others. They, too, transcend death by their devotion to what they have heard.
verses.widget_line: Others, not knowing this, worship after hearing from others. They, too, transcend death by devotion to what they have heard.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यावत्सञ्जायते किञ्चित्सत्त्वं स्थावरजङ्गमम् ।
क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञसंयोगात्तद्विद्धि भरतर्षभ ॥२६॥
verses.transliteration:
yāvat sañjāyate kiñchit sattvaṁ sthāvara-jaṅgamam
kṣhetra-kṣhetrajña-saṁyogāt tad viddhi bharatarṣhabha
verses.translation_full: O best of the Bharatas, whatever moving or unmoving being you see in existence, know it to be a combination of the field of activities and the knower of the field.
verses.widget_line: Whatever being is born, moving or non-moving, know it to be from the union of the field and the Knower, O best of the Bharatas.
verses.personalized: Whatever being is born, moving or non-moving, know it to be from the union of the field and the Knower, O {name}.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
समं सर्वेषु भूतेषु तिष्ठन्तं परमेश्वरम् ।
विनश्यत्स्वविनश्यन्तं यः पश्यति स पश्यति ॥२७॥
verses.transliteration:
samaṁ sarveṣhu bhūteṣhu tiṣhṭhantaṁ parameśhvaram
vinaśhyatsv avinaśhyantaṁ yaḥ paśhyati sa paśhyati
verses.translation_full: One who sees the Supreme Lord existing equally in all beings, the unperishing within the perishing, sees truly.
verses.widget_line: One who sees the Supreme Lord existing equally in all beings, the unperishing within the perishing, sees truly.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
समं पश्यन्हि सर्वत्र समवस्थितमीश्वरम् ।
न हिनस्त्यात्मनात्मानं ततो याति परां गतिम् ॥२८॥
verses.transliteration:
samaṁ paśhyan hi sarvatra samavasthitam īśhvaram
na hinasty ātmanātmānaṁ tato yāti parāṁ gatim
verses.translation_full: Those, who see God as the Supreme Soul equally present everywhere and in all living beings, do not degrade themselves by their mind. Thereby, they reach the supreme destination.
verses.widget_line: One who sees the Lord equally present everywhere, in every living being, does not degrade himself. Thus he approaches the transcendental destination.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
प्रकृत्यैव च कर्माणि क्रियमाणानि सर्वशः ।
यः पश्यति तथात्मानमकर्तारं स पश्यति ॥२९॥
verses.transliteration:
prakṛityaiva ca karmāṇi kriyamāṇāni sarvaśhaḥ
yaḥ paśhyati tathātmānam akartāraṁ sa paśhyati
verses.translation_full: One who sees that all actions are performed by Prakriti alone, and that the Self is actionless, sees truly.
verses.widget_line: One who sees that all actions are performed by Prakriti alone, and that the Self is actionless, sees truly.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यदा भूतपृथग्भावमेकस्थमनुपश्यति ।
तत एव च विस्तारं ब्रह्म सम्पद्यते तदा ॥३०॥
verses.transliteration:
yadā bhūta-pṛithag-bhāvam ekastham anupaśhyati
tata eva cha vistāraṁ brahma sampadyate tadā
verses.translation_full: When they see the diverse variety of living beings situated in the same material nature, and understand all of them to be born from it, they attain the realization of the Brahman.
verses.widget_line: When one sees the diversity of existence as rooted in the One, and the expansion from That, then one attains Brahman.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अनादित्वान्निर्गुणत्वात्परमात्मायमव्ययः ।
शरीरस्थोऽपि कौन्तेय न करोति न लिप्यते ॥३१॥
verses.transliteration:
anāditvān nirguṇatvāt paramātmāyam avyayaḥ
śharīrastho 'pi kaunteya na karoti na lipyate
verses.translation_full: Because of being beginningless and attributeless, this Supreme Self, imperishable, though dwelling in the body, O son of Kunti, neither acts nor is tainted.
verses.widget_line: Because of being beginningless and attributeless, this Supreme Self, imperishable, though dwelling in the body, neither acts nor is tainted, O son of Kunti.
verses.personalized: Because of being beginningless and attributeless, this Supreme Self, imperishable, though dwelling in the body, neither acts nor is tainted, O {name}.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यथा सर्वगतं सौक्ष्म्यादाकाशं नोपलिप्यते ।
सर्वत्रावस्थितो देहे तथात्मा नोपलिप्यते ॥३२॥
verses.transliteration:
yathā sarvagataṁ saukṣhmyād ākāśhaṁ nopalipyate
sarvatrāvasthito dehe tathātmā nopalipyate
verses.translation_full: Space holds everything within it, but being subtle, does not get contaminated by what it holds. Similarly, though its consciousness pervades the body, the soul is not affected by the attributes of the body.
verses.widget_line: Just as the all-pervading space is never tainted, so the Self, seated everywhere in the body, is never tainted.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यथा प्रकाशयत्येकः कृत्स्नं लोकमिमं रविः ।
क्षेत्रं क्षेत्री तथा कृत्स्नं प्रकाशयति भारत ॥३३॥
verses.transliteration:
yathā prakāśhayaty ekaḥ kṛitsnaṁ lokam imaṁ raviḥ
kṣhetraṁ kṣhetrī tathā kṛitsnaṁ prakāśhayati bhārata
verses.translation_full: Just as the one sun illuminates the entire world, so does the Knower of the field illuminate the entire field, O Bharata.
verses.widget_line: Just as the one sun illuminates the entire world, so does the Knower of the field illuminate the entire field, O Bharata.
verses.personalized: Just as the one sun illuminates the entire world, so does the Knower of the field illuminate the entire field, O {name}.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञयोरेवमन्तरं ज्ञानचक्षुषा ।
भूतप्रकृतिमोक्षं च ये विदुर्यान्ति ते परम् ॥३४॥
verses.transliteration:
kṣhetra-kṣhetrajñayor evam antaraṁ jñāna-chakṣhuṣhā
bhūta-prakṛiti-mokṣhaṁ cha ye vidur yānti te param
verses.translation_full: Those who perceive with the eyes of knowledge the difference between the body and the knower of the body, and the process of release from material nature, attain the supreme destination.
verses.widget_line: Those who see with the eye of knowledge the distinction between the field and the Knower, and the liberation from material nature, go to the Supreme.

chapter_info.chapter_name_english: Gunatraya Vibhaga Yoga – The Yoga of the Division of the Three Gunas
chapter_info.theme: Krishna explains the three modes of material nature—Sattva (goodness), Rajas (passion), and Tamas (ignorance)—their influence on human behavior, and how to transcend them to achieve liberation.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
श्रीभगवानुवाच
परं भूयः प्रवक्ष्यामि ज्ञानानां ज्ञानमुत्तमम् ।
यज्ज्ञात्वा मुनयः सर्वे परां सिद्धिमितो गताः ॥१॥
verses.transliteration:
śhrī-bhagavān uvācha
paraṁ bhūyaḥ pravakṣhyāmi jñānānāṁ jñānam uttamam
yaj jñātvā munayaḥ sarve parāṁ siddhim ito gatāḥ
verses.translation_full: The Divine Lord said: I shall once again explain to you the supreme wisdom, the best of all knowledge; by knowing which, all the great saints attained the highest perfection.
verses.widget_line: I shall again declare that supreme knowledge, knowing which all sages have attained the highest perfection.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
इदं ज्ञानमुपाश्रित्य मम साधर्म्यमागताः ।
सर्गेऽपि नोपजायन्ते प्रलये न व्यथन्ति च ॥२॥
verses.transliteration:
idaṁ jñānam upāśhritya mama sādharmyam āgatāḥ
sarge 'pi nopajāyante pralaye na vyathanti cha
verses.translation_full: Those who take refuge in this wisdom will be united with Me. They will not be reborn at the time of creation nor destroyed at the time of dissolution.
verses.widget_line: Those who take refuge in this knowledge become one with Me. They are not born at creation, nor disturbed at dissolution.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
मम योनिर्महद्ब्रह्म तस्मिन्गर्भं दधाम्यहम् ।
संभवः सर्वभूतानां ततो भवति भारत ॥३॥
verses.transliteration:
mama yonir mahad brahma tasmin garbhaṁ dadhāmy aham
saṁbhavaḥ sarva-bhūtānāṁ tato bhavati bhārata
verses.translation_full: The total material substance, called Brahman, is the source of birth, and it is that Brahman that I impregnate, making possible the births of all living beings, O son of Bharat.
verses.widget_line: The total material substance, called Brahman, is the source of birth, and it is that Brahman that I impregnate, making possible the births of all living beings, O Bharata.
verses.personalized: The total material substance, called Brahman, is the source of birth, and it is that Brahman that I impregnate, making possible the births of all living beings, O {name}.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
सर्वयोनिषु कौन्तेय मूर्तयः सम्भवन्ति याः ।
तासां ब्रह्म महद्योनिरहं बीजप्रदः पिता ॥४॥
verses.transliteration:
sarva-yoniṣhu kaunteya mūrtayaḥ sambhavanti yāḥ
tāsāṁ brahma mahad yonir ahaṁ bīja-pradaḥ pitā
verses.translation_full: O son of Kunti, for all species of life that are produced, the material nature is the womb, and I am the seed-giving Father.
verses.widget_line: All species of life are made possible by birth in this material nature, and I am the seed-giving father, O son of Kunti.
verses.personalized: All species of life are made possible by birth in this material nature, and I am the seed-giving father, O {name}.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
सत्त्वं रजस्तम इति गुणाः प्रकृतिसम्भवाः ।
निबध्नन्ति महाबाहो देहे देहिनमव्ययम् ॥५॥
verses.transliteration:
sattvaṁ rajas tama iti guṇāḥ prakṛiti-sambhavāḥ
nibadhnanti mahā-bāho dehe dehinam avyayam
verses.translation_full: Material nature consists of three modes—Sattva (goodness), Rajas (passion), and Tamas (ignorance). When the eternal living entity comes in contact with nature, O mighty-armed one, he becomes conditioned by these modes.
verses.widget_line: Material nature consists of three modes—Sattva, Rajas, and Tamas. When the eternal living entity comes in contact with nature, he becomes conditioned by these modes, O mighty-armed one.
verses.personalized: Material nature consists of three modes—Sattva, Rajas, and Tamas. When the eternal living entity comes in contact with nature, he becomes conditioned by these modes, O {name}.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
तत्र सत्त्वं निर्मलत्वात्प्रकाशकमनामयम् ।
सुखसङ्गेन बध्नाति ज्ञानसङ्गेन चानघ ॥६॥
verses.transliteration:
tatra sattvaṁ nirmalatvāt prakāśhakam anāmayam
sukha-saṅgena badhnāti jñāna-saṅgena chānagha
verses.translation_full: Amongst these, sattva guṇa, the mode of goodness, being purer than the others, is illuminating and full of well-being. O sinless one, it binds the soul by creating attachment for a sense of happiness and knowledge.
verses.widget_line: The mode of goodness is illuminating and frees one from sinful reactions. Those situated in it become conditioned by happiness and knowledge, O sinless one.
verses.personalized: The mode of goodness is illuminating and frees one from sinful reactions. Those situated in it become conditioned by happiness and knowledge, O {name}.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
रजो रागात्मकं विद्धि तृष्णासङ्गसमुद्भवम् ।
तन्निबध्नाति कौन्तेय कर्मसङ्गेन देहिनम् ॥७॥
verses.transliteration:
rajo rāgātmakaṁ viddhi tṛiṣhṇā-saṅga-samudbhavam
tan nibadhnāti kaunteya karma-saṅgena dehinam
verses.translation_full: O Arjun, rajo guṇa is of the nature of passion. It arises from worldly desires and affections, and binds the soul through attachment to fruitive actions.
verses.widget_line: The mode of passion is born of unlimited desires and longings, and because of this, the embodied being is bound to material fruitive actions, O son of Kunti.
verses.personalized: The mode of passion is born of unlimited desires and longings, and because of this, the embodied being is bound to material fruitive actions, O {name}.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
तमस्त्वज्ञानजं विद्धि मोहनं सर्वदेहिनाम् ।
प्रमादालस्यनिद्राभिस्तन्निबध्नाति भारत ॥८॥
verses.transliteration:
tamas tv ajñāna-jaṁ viddhi mohanaṁ sarva-dehinām
pramādālasya-nidrābhis tan nibadhnāti bhārata
verses.translation_full: Know that the mode of darkness, born of ignorance, is the delusion of all embodied living entities. The results of this mode are madness, indolence, and sleep, which bind the conditioned soul, O son of Bharat.
verses.widget_line: The mode of darkness, born of ignorance, is the delusion of all embodied beings. It binds through madness, indolence, and sleep, O Bharata.
verses.personalized: The mode of darkness, born of ignorance, is the delusion of all embodied beings. It binds through madness, indolence, and sleep, O {name}.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
सत्त्वं सुखे सञ्जयति रजः कर्मणि भारत ।
ज्ञानमावृत्य तु तमः प्रमादे सञ्जयत्युत ॥९॥
verses.transliteration:
sattvaṁ sukhe sañjayati rajaḥ karmaṇi bhārata
jñānam āvṛitya tu tamaḥ pramāde sañjayaty uta
verses.translation_full: Sattva binds one to material happiness; rajas conditions the soul toward actions; and tamas clouds wisdom and binds one to delusion.
verses.widget_line: The mode of goodness conditions one to happiness; passion conditions one to fruitive action; and ignorance binds one to madness, O Bharata.
verses.personalized: The mode of goodness conditions one to happiness; passion conditions one to fruitive action; and ignorance binds one to madness, O {name}.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
रजस्तमश्चाभिभूय सत्त्वं भवति भारत ।
रजः सत्त्वं तमश्चैव तमः सत्त्वं रजस्तथा ॥१०॥
verses.transliteration:
rajas tamaśh chābhibhūya sattvaṁ bhavati bhārata
rajaḥ sattvaṁ tamaśh chaiva tamaḥ sattvaṁ rajas tathā
verses.translation_full: Sometimes the mode of goodness becomes prominent, defeating the modes of passion and ignorance, O son of Bharat. Sometimes the mode of passion defeats goodness and ignorance, and at other times darkness defeats goodness and passion.
verses.widget_line: Sometimes goodness defeats passion and ignorance; sometimes passion defeats goodness and ignorance; sometimes darkness defeats goodness and passion, O Bharata.
verses.personalized: Sometimes goodness defeats passion and ignorance; sometimes passion defeats goodness and ignorance; sometimes darkness defeats goodness and passion, O {name}.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
सर्वद्वारेषु देहेऽस्मिन्प्रकाश उपजायते ।
ज्ञानं यदा तदा विद्याद्विवृद्धं सत्त्वमित्युत ॥११॥
verses.transliteration:
sarva-dvāreṣhu dehe 'smin prakāśha upajāyate
jñānaṁ yadā tadā vidyād vivṛiddhaṁ sattvam ity uta
verses.translation_full: When all the gates of the body are illumined by knowledge, know it to be a manifestation of the mode of goodness.
verses.widget_line: When all the gates of the body are illumined by knowledge, it should be understood that goodness is predominant.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
लोभः प्रवृत्तिरारम्भः कर्मणामशमः स्पृहा ।
रजस्येतानि जायन्ते विवृद्धे भरतर्षभ ॥१२॥
verses.transliteration:
lobhaḥ pravṛittir ārambhaḥ karmaṇām aśhamaḥ spṛihā
rajasy etāni jāyante vivṛiddhe bharatarṣhabha
verses.translation_full: When the mode of passion predominates, O Arjun, the symptoms of greed, exertion for worldly gain, restlessness, and craving develop.
verses.widget_line: When passion increases, symptoms of great attachment, fruitive activity, intense endeavor, and uncontrollable desire develop, O chief of the Bharatas.
verses.personalized: When passion increases, symptoms of great attachment, fruitive activity, intense endeavor, and uncontrollable desire develop, O {name}.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अप्रकाशोऽप्रवृत्तिश्च प्रमादो मोह एव च ।
तमस्येतानि जायन्ते विवृद्धे कुरुनन्दन ॥१३॥
verses.transliteration:
aprakāśho 'pravṛittiśh cha pramādo moha eva cha
tamasy etāni jāyante vivṛiddhe kurunandana
verses.translation_full: When there is an increase in the mode of ignorance, O son of Kuru, darkness, inertia, madness, and illusion are manifested.
verses.widget_line: When ignorance increases, darkness, inertia, madness, and illusion are manifested, O son of Kuru.
verses.personalized: When ignorance increases, darkness, inertia, madness, and illusion are manifested, O {name}.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यदा सत्त्वे प्रवृद्धे तु प्रलयं याति देहभृत् ।
तदोत्तमविदां लोकानमलान्प्रतिपद्यते ॥१४॥
verses.transliteration:
yadā sattve pravṛiddhe tu pralayaṁ yāti deha-bhṛit
tadottamavidāṁ lokān amalān pratipadyate
verses.translation_full: Those who die with predominance of sattva reach the pure abodes (which are free from rajas and tamas) of the learned.
verses.widget_line: When one dies in the mode of goodness, he attains to the pure higher planets of the great sages.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
रजसि प्रलयं गत्वा कर्मसङ्गिषु जायते ।
तथा प्रलीनस्तमसि मूढयोनिषु जायते ॥१५॥
verses.transliteration:
rajasi pralayaṁ gatvā karma-saṅgiṣhu jāyate
tathā pralīnas tamasi mūḍha-yoniṣhu jāyate
verses.translation_full: Those who die with prevalence of the mode of passion are born among people driven by work, while those dying in the mode of ignorance take birth in the animal kingdom.
verses.widget_line: When one dies in passion, he takes birth among those engaged in fruitive activities; when he dies in ignorance, he takes birth in the animal kingdom.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
कर्मणः सुकृतस्याहुः सात्त्विकं निर्मलं फलम् ।
रजसस्तु फलं दुःखमज्ञानं तमसः फलम् ॥१६॥
verses.transliteration:
karmaṇaḥ sukṛitasya āhuḥ sāttvikaṁ nirmalaṁ phalam
rajasas tu phalaṁ duḥkham ajñānaṁ tamasaḥ phalam
verses.translation_full: It is said the fruit of actions performed in the mode of goodness bestow pure results. Actions done in the mode of passion result in pain, while those performed in the mode of ignorance result in darkness.
verses.widget_line: The result of pious action is pure and in the mode of goodness. Action in passion results in misery, and action in ignorance results in foolishness.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
सत्त्वात्सञ्जायते ज्ञानं रजसो लोभ एव च ।
प्रमादमोहौ तमसो भवतोऽज्ञानमेव च ॥१७॥
verses.transliteration:
sattvāt sañjāyate jñānaṁ rajaso lobha eva cha
pramāda-mohau tamaso bhavato 'jñānam eva cha
verses.translation_full: From the mode of goodness, real knowledge develops; from the mode of passion, greed develops; and from the mode of ignorance develop foolishness, madness, and illusion.
verses.widget_line: From goodness, real knowledge develops; from passion, greed develops; from ignorance develop foolishness, madness, and illusion.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
ऊर्ध्वं गच्छन्ति सत्त्वस्था मध्ये तिष्ठन्ति राजसाः ।
जघन्यगुणवृत्तिस्था अधो गच्छन्ति तामसाः ॥१८॥
verses.transliteration:
ūrdhvaṁ gachchhanti sattva-sthā madhye tiṣhṭhanti rājasāḥ
jaghanya-guṇa-vṛitti-sthā adho gachchhanti tāmasāḥ
verses.translation_full: Those situated in the mode of goodness rise upward; those in the mode of passion stay in the middle; and those in the mode of ignorance go downward.
verses.widget_line: Those in goodness go upward to higher planets; those in passion live on earthly planets; those in ignorance go down to hellish worlds.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
नान्यं गुणेभ्यः कर्तारं यदा द्रष्टानुपश्यति ।
गुणेभ्यश्च परं वेत्ति मद्भावं सोऽधिगच्छति ॥१९॥
verses.transliteration:
nānyaṁ guṇebhyaḥ kartāraṁ yadā draṣhṭānupaśhyati
guṇebhyaśh cha paraṁ vetti mad-bhāvaṁ so 'dhigachchhati
verses.translation_full: When you see that there is nothing beyond these modes of nature in all activities and that the Supreme Lord is transcendental to all these modes, then you can know My spiritual nature.
verses.widget_line: When you see that there is nothing beyond these modes of nature and that the Supreme Lord is transcendental to all these modes, then you can know My spiritual nature.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
गुणानेतानतीत्य त्रीन्देही देहसमुद्भवान् ।
जन्ममृत्युजरादुःखैर्विमुक्तोऽमृतमश्नुते ॥२०॥
verses.transliteration:
guṇān etān atītya trīn dehī deha-samudbhavān
janma-mṛityu-jarā-duḥkhair vimukto 'mṛitam aśhnute
verses.translation_full: By transcending the three modes of material nature associated with the body, one becomes free from birth, death, old age, and misery, and attains immortality.
verses.widget_line: When the embodied being transcends these three modes, he becomes free from birth, death, old age, and distresses and can enjoy nectar even in this life.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
श्रीभगवानुवाच
प्रकाशं च प्रवृत्तिं च मोहमेव च पाण्डव ।
न द्वेष्टि सम्प्रवृत्तानि न निवृत्तानि काङ्क्षति ॥२२॥
verses.transliteration:
śhrī-bhagavān uvācha
prakāśhaṁ cha pravṛittiṁ cha moham eva cha pāṇḍava
na dveṣhṭi sampravṛittāni na nivṛittāni kāṅkṣhati
verses.translation_full: The Supreme Divine Personality said: O Arjun, The persons who are transcendental to the three guṇas neither hate illumination (which is born of sattva), nor activity (which is born of rajas), nor even delusion (which is born of tamas), when these are abundantly present, nor do they long for them when they are absent.
verses.widget_line: He who does not hate illumination, attachment, and delusion when present, nor longs for them when they disappear, O Pandava—
verses.personalized: He who does not hate illumination, attachment, and delusion when present, nor longs for them when they disappear, O {name}—

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
उदासीनवदासीनो गुणैर्यो न विचाल्यते ।
गुणा वर्तन्त इत्येवं योऽवतिष्ठति नेङ्गते ॥२३॥
verses.transliteration:
udāsīna-vad āsīno guṇair yo na vicālyate
guṇā vartanta ity evaṁ yo 'vatiṣhṭhati neṅgate
verses.translation_full: They remain neutral to the modes of nature and are not disturbed by them. Knowing it is only the guṇas that act, they stay established in the self, without wavering.
verses.widget_line: He who sits like one unconcerned, who is not disturbed by the modes of nature, who knows that the modes alone are active, and who remains situated in the self is said to be in transcendence.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
समदुःखसुखः स्वस्थः समलोष्टाश्मकाञ्चनः ।
तुल्यप्रियाप्रियो धीरस्तुल्यनिन्दात्मसंस्तुतिः ॥२४॥
verses.transliteration:
sama-duḥkha-sukhaḥ sva-sthaḥ sama-loṣhṭāśhma-kāñchanaḥ
tulya-priyāpriyo dhīras tulya-nindātma-saṁstutiḥ
verses.translation_full: He who is equal in happiness and distress, who is established in the self, who looks upon a clod, a stone, and a piece of gold with an equal eye, who is equal toward the desirable and the undesirable, who is steady, and who is equal in censure and praise—
verses.widget_line: Equal in happiness and distress, established in the self, looking upon a clod, stone, and gold with an equal eye, steady in censure and praise—

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
मानापमानयोस्तुल्यस्तुल्यो मित्रारिपक्षयोः ।
सर्वारम्भपरित्यागी गुणातीतः स उच्यते ॥२५॥
verses.transliteration:
mānāpamānayos tulyas tulyo mitrāri-pakṣhayoḥ
sarvārambha-parityāgī guṇātītaḥ sa uchyate
verses.translation_full: they are said to have risen above the three guṇas.
verses.widget_line: Equal in honor and dishonor, equal to friend and enemy, having renounced all material undertakings—such a person has transcended the modes of nature.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
मां च योऽव्यभिचारेण भक्तियोगेन सेवते ।
स गुणान्समतीत्यैतान्ब्रह्मभूयाय कल्पते ॥२६॥
verses.transliteration:
māṁ cha yo 'vyabhicāreṇa bhakti-yogena sevate
sa guṇān samatītyaitān brahma-bhūyāya kalpate
verses.translation_full: One who engages in full devotional service, unfailing in all circumstances, at once transcends the modes of material nature and thus comes to the level of Brahman.
verses.widget_line: One who engages in full devotional service, unfailing in all circumstances, transcends the modes of material nature and comes to the level of Brahman.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
ब्रह्मणो हि प्रतिष्ठाहममृतस्याव्ययस्य च ।
शाश्वतस्य च धर्मस्य सुखस्यैकान्तिकस्य च ॥२७॥
verses.transliteration:
brahmaṇo hi pratiṣhṭhāham amṛitasyāvyayasya cha
śhāśhvatasya cha dharmasya sukhasyaikāntikasya cha
verses.translation_full: I am the basis of the formless Brahman, the immortal and imperishable, of eternal dharma, and of unending divine bliss.
verses.widget_line: And I am the basis of the impersonal Brahman, which is immortal, imperishable, and eternal and is the constitutional position of ultimate happiness.

chapter_info.chapter_name_english: Purushottama Yoga – The Yoga of the Supreme Person
chapter_info.theme: Krishna describes the material world as an inverted tree, explains the nature of the eternal soul, and reveals Himself as the Supreme Person (Purushottama) who transcends both the perishable and imperishable.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
श्रीभगवानुवाच
ऊर्ध्वमूलमधःशाखमश्वत्थं प्राहुरव्ययम् ।
छन्दांसि यस्य पर्णानि यस्तं वेद स वेदवित् ॥१॥
verses.transliteration:
śhrī-bhagavān uvācha
ūrdhva-mūlam adhaḥ-śhākham aśhvatthaṁ prāhur avyayam
chandāṁsi yasya parṇāni yas taṁ veda sa veda-vit
verses.translation_full: The Supreme Divine Personality said: They speak of an eternal aśhvatth tree with its roots above and branches below. Its leaves are the Vedic hymns, and one who knows the secret of this tree is the knower of the Vedas.
verses.widget_line: There is an imperishable banyan tree with roots upward and branches down, whose leaves are the Vedic hymns. One who knows this tree is the knower of the Vedas.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अधश्चोर्ध्वं प्रसृतास्तस्य शाखा गुणप्रवृद्धा विषयप्रवालाः ।
अधश्च मूलान्यनुसन्ततानि कर्मानुबन्धीनि मनुष्यलोके ॥२॥
verses.transliteration:
adhaśh chordhvaṁ prasṛitās tasya śhākhā guṇa-pravṛiddhā viṣhaya-pravālāḥ
adhaśh cha mūlāny anusantatāni karmānubandhīni manuṣhya-loke
verses.translation_full: The branches of this tree extend downward and upward, nourished by the three modes of material nature. The twigs are the objects of the senses. This tree also has roots going down, and these are bound to the fruitive actions of human society.
verses.widget_line: The branches extend downward and upward, nourished by the three modes. The twigs are the objects of the senses. The roots are bound to fruitive actions.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
न रूपमस्येह तथोपलभ्यते नान्तो न चादिर्न च संप्रतिष्ठा ।
अश्वत्थमेनं सुविरूढमूलमसङ्गशस्त्रेण दृढेन छित्त्वा ॥३॥
verses.transliteration:
na rūpam asyeha tathopalabhyate nānto na chādir na cha saṁpratiṣhṭhā
aśhvattham enaṁ su-virūḍha-mūlam asaṅga-śhastreṇa dṛiḍhena chhittvā
verses.translation_full: The real form of this tree is not perceived in this world, neither its beginning nor end, nor its continued existence. But this deep-rooted aśhvatth tree must be cut down with a strong axe of detachment.
verses.widget_line: The real form of this tree cannot be perceived. No one can understand where it ends or begins. Cut down this strongly rooted tree with the weapon of detachment.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
ततः पदं तत्परिमार्गितव्यं यस्मिन्गता न निवर्तन्ति भूयः ।
तमेव चाद्यं पुरुषं प्रपद्ये यतः प्रवृत्तिः प्रसृता पुराणी ॥४॥
verses.transliteration:
tataḥ padaṁ tat parimārgitavyaṁ yasmin gatā na nivartanti bhūyaḥ
tam eva chādyaṁ puruṣhaṁ prapadye yataḥ pravṛittiḥ prasṛitā purāṇī
verses.translation_full: Thereafter, one must seek that place from which, having gone, one never returns, and there surrender to that Supreme Personality of Godhead from whom everything began and from whom everything has extended since time immemorial.
verses.widget_line: Thereafter, seek that place from which, having gone, one never returns, and surrender to that Supreme Personality of Godhead from whom everything began.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
निर्मानमोहा जितसङ्गदोषा अध्यात्मनित्या विनिवृत्तकामाः ।
द्वन्द्वैर्विमुक्ताः सुखदुःखसंज्ञैर्गच्छन्त्यमूढाः पदमव्ययं तत् ॥५॥
verses.transliteration:
nir-māna-mohā jita-saṅga-doṣhā adhyātma-nityā vinivṛitta-kāmāḥ
dvandvair vimuktāḥ sukha-duḥkha-saṁjñair gachchhanty amūḍhāḥ padam avyayaṁ tat
verses.translation_full: Those who are free from vanity and delusion, who have overcome the evil of attachment, who dwell constantly on the self and on God, who are free from the desire to enjoy the senses, and are beyond the dualities of pleasure and pain, such liberated personalities attain My eternal Abode.
verses.widget_line: Those who are free from false prestige, illusion, and false association, who are done with material lust, freed from dualities, and know how to surrender—attain that eternal kingdom.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
न तद्भासयते सूर्यो न शशाङ्को न पावकः ।
यद्गत्वा न निवर्तन्ते तद्धाम परमं मम ॥६॥
verses.transliteration:
na tad bhāsayate sūryo na śhaśhāṅko na pāvakaḥ
yad gatvā na nivartante tad dhāma paramaṁ mama
verses.translation_full: Neither the sun nor the moon, nor fire can illumine that Supreme Abode of Mine. Having gone There, one does not return to this material world again.
verses.widget_line: That supreme abode of Mine is not illumined by the sun or moon, nor by fire or electricity. Those who reach it never return.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
ममैवांशो जीवलोके जीवभूतः सनातनः ।
मनःषष्ठानीन्द्रियाणि प्रकृतिस्थानि कर्षति ॥७॥
verses.transliteration:
mamaivāṁśho jīva-loke jīva-bhūtaḥ sanātanaḥ
manaḥ-ṣhaṣhṭhānīndriyāṇi prakṛiti-sthāni karṣhati
verses.translation_full: The living entities in this conditioned world are My eternal, fragmental parts. Due to conditioned life, they are struggling very hard with the six senses, which include the mind.
verses.widget_line: The living entities in this conditioned world are My eternal, fragmental parts. They struggle with the six senses, which include the mind.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
शरीरं यदवाप्नोति यच्चाप्युत्क्रामतीश्वरः ।
गृहीत्वैतानि संयाति वायुर्गन्धानिवाशयात् ॥८॥
verses.transliteration:
śharīraṁ yad avāpnoti yach chāpy utkrāmatīśhvaraḥ
gṛihītvaitāni saṁyāti vāyur gandhān ivāśhayāt
verses.translation_full: As the air carries fragrance from place to place, so does the embodied soul carry the mind and senses with it, when it leaves an old body and enters a new one.
verses.widget_line: The living entity carries his different conceptions of life from one body to another, as the air carries aromas. Thus he takes one kind of body and again quits it.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
श्रोत्रं चक्षुः स्पर्शनं च रसनं घ्राणमेव च ।
अधिष्ठाय मनश्चायं विषयानुपसेवते ॥९॥
verses.transliteration:
śhrotraṁ chakṣhuḥ sparśhanaṁ cha rasanaṁ ghrāṇam eva cha
adhiṣhṭhāya manaśh chāyaṁ viṣhayān upasevate
verses.translation_full: The living entity, thus taking another gross body, obtains a certain type of ear, eye, tongue, nose, and sense of touch, which are grouped about the mind. He thus enjoys a particular set of sense objects.
verses.widget_line: The living entity, taking another gross body, obtains a certain type of ear, eye, tongue, nose, and sense of touch, grouped about the mind. He thus enjoys sense objects.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
उत्क्रामन्तं स्थितं वापि भुञ्जानं वा गुणान्वितम् ।
विमूढा नानुपश्यन्ति पश्यन्ति ज्ञानचक्षुषः ॥१०॥
verses.transliteration:
utkrāmantaṁ sthitaṁ vāpi bhuñjānaṁ vā guṇānvitam
vimūḍhā nānupaśhyanti paśhyanti jñāna-chakṣhuṣhaḥ
verses.translation_full: The ignorant do not perceive the soul as it resides in the body, and as it enjoys sense objects; nor do they perceive it when it departs. But those who possess the eyes of knowledge can behold it.
verses.widget_line: The foolish cannot understand how a living entity can quit his body, nor what sort of body he enjoys. But one whose eyes are trained in knowledge can see all this.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यतन्तो योगिनश्चैनं पश्यन्त्यात्मन्यवस्थितम् ।
यतन्तोऽप्यकृतात्मानो नैनं पश्यन्त्यचेतसः ॥११॥
verses.transliteration:
yatanto yoginaśh chainaṁ paśhyanty ātmany avasthitam
yatanto 'py akṛitātmāno nainaṁ paśhyanty achetasaḥ
verses.translation_full: The endeavoring transcendentalists, who are situated in self-realization, can see all this clearly. But those whose minds are not developed and who are not situated in self-realization cannot see what is taking place, though they may try to.
verses.widget_line: The endeavoring transcendentalists, situated in self-realization, can see all this clearly. But those whose minds are not developed cannot see, though they may try.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यदादित्यगतं तेजो जगद्भासयतेऽखिलम् ।
यच्चन्द्रमसि यच्चाग्नौ तत्तेजो विद्धि मामकम् ॥१२॥
verses.transliteration:
yad āditya-gataṁ tejo jagad bhāsayate 'khilam
yach chandramasi yach chāgnau tat tejo viddhi māmakam
verses.translation_full: Know that I am like the brilliance of the sun that illuminates the entire solar system. The radiance of the moon and the brightness of the fire also come from Me.
verses.widget_line: The splendor of the sun, which dissipates the darkness of this whole world, comes from Me. And the splendor of the moon and fire are also from Me.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
गामाविश्य च भूतानि धारयाम्यहमोजसा ।
पुष्णामि चौषधीः सर्वाः सोमो भूत्वा रसात्मकः ॥१३॥
verses.transliteration:
gām āviśhya cha bhūtāni dhārayāmy aham ojasā
puṣhṇāmi chauṣhadhīḥ sarvāḥ somo bhūtvā rasātmakaḥ
verses.translation_full: I enter into each planet, and by My energy they stay in orbit. I become the moon and thereby supply the juice of life to all vegetables.
verses.widget_line: I enter into each planet, and by My energy they stay in orbit. I become the moon and supply the juice of life to all vegetables.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अहं वैश्वानरो भूत्वा प्राणिनां देहमाश्रितः ।
प्राणापानसमायुक्तः पचाम्यन्नं चतुर्विधम् ॥१४॥
verses.transliteration:
ahaṁ vaiśhvānaro bhūtvā prāṇināṁ deham āśhritaḥ
prāṇāpāna-samāyuktaḥ pacāmy annaṁ chatur-vidham
verses.translation_full: It is I who take the form of the fire of digestion in the stomachs of all living beings, and combine with the incoming and outgoing breaths, to digest and assimilate the four kinds of foods.
verses.widget_line: I am the fire of digestion in the bodies of all living entities, and I join with the air of life to digest the four kinds of foodstuff.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
सर्वस्य चाहं हृदि सन्निविष्टो मत्तः स्मृतिर्ज्ञानमपोहनं च ।
वेदैश्च सर्वैरहमेव वेद्यो वेदान्तकृद्वेदविदेव चाहम् ॥१५॥
verses.transliteration:
sarvasya chāhaṁ hṛidi sanniviṣhṭo mattaḥ smṛitir jñānam apohanaṁ cha
vedaiśh cha sarvair aham eva vedyo vedānta-kṛid veda-vid eva chāham
verses.translation_full: I am seated in everyone's heart, and from Me come remembrance, knowledge, and forgetfulness. By all the Vedas, I am to be known. Indeed, I am the compiler of Vedanta, and I am the knower of the Vedas.
verses.widget_line: I am seated in everyone's heart, and from Me come remembrance, knowledge, and forgetfulness. By all the Vedas, I am to be known. I am the compiler of Vedanta, and I am the knower of the Vedas.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
द्वाविमौ पुरुषौ लोके क्षरश्चाक्षर एव च ।
क्षरः सर्वाणि भूतानि कूटस्थोऽक्षर उच्यते ॥१६॥
verses.transliteration:
dvāv imau puruṣhau loke kṣharaśh chākṣhara eva cha
kṣharaḥ sarvāṇi bhūtāni kūṭa-stho 'kṣhara uchyate
verses.translation_full: There are two kinds of beings in creation, the kṣhar (perishable) and the akṣhar (imperishable). The perishable are all beings in the material realm. The imperishable are the the liberated beings.
verses.widget_line: There are two classes of beings—the fallible and the infallible. In the material world every living entity is fallible, and in the spiritual world every living entity is infallible.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
उत्तमः पुरुषस्त्वन्यः परमात्मेत्युधाहृतः ।
यो लोकत्रयमाविश्य बिभर्त्यव्यय ईश्वरः ॥१७॥
verses.transliteration:
uttamaḥ puruṣhas tv anyaḥ paramātmety udāhṛitaḥ
yo loka-trayam āviśhya bibharty avyaya īśhvaraḥ
verses.translation_full: Besides these two, there is the greatest living personality, the Supreme Soul, the imperishable Lord Himself, who has entered the three worlds and is maintaining them.
verses.widget_line: Besides these two, there is the greatest living personality, the Supreme Soul, the imperishable Lord Himself, who has entered the three worlds and is maintaining them.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यस्मात्क्षरमतीतोऽहमक्षरादपि चोत्तमः ।
अतोऽस्मि लोके वेदे च प्रथितः पुरुषोत्तमः ॥१८॥
verses.transliteration:
yasmāt kṣharam atīto 'ham akṣharād api chottamaḥ
ato 'smi loke vede cha prathitaḥ puruṣhottamaḥ
verses.translation_full: I am transcendental to the perishable world of matter, and even to the imperishable soul; hence I am celebrated, both in the Vedas and the Smṛitis, as the Supreme Divine Personality.
verses.widget_line: Because I am transcendental, beyond both the fallible and the infallible, and because I am the greatest, I am celebrated as that Supreme Person.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यो मामेवमसम्मूढो जानाति पुरुषोत्तमम् ।
स सर्वविद्भजति मां सर्वभावेन भारत ॥१९॥
verses.transliteration:
yo mām evam asammūḍho jānāti puruṣhottamam
sa sarva-vid bhajati māṁ sarva-bhāvena bhārata
verses.translation_full: Whoever knows Me as the Supreme Personality of Godhead, without doubting, is the knower of everything. He therefore engages himself in full devotional service to Me, O son of Bharat.
verses.widget_line: Whoever knows Me as the Supreme Personality of Godhead, without doubting, is the knower of everything. He therefore engages in full devotional service to Me, O Bharata.
verses.personalized: Whoever knows Me as the Supreme Personality of Godhead, without doubting, is the knower of everything. He therefore engages in full devotional service to Me, O {name}.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
इति गुह्यतमं शास्त्रमिदमुक्तं मयानघ ।
एतद्बुद्ध्वा बुद्धिमान्स्यात्कृतकृत्यश्च भारत ॥२०॥
verses.transliteration:
iti guhyatamaṁ śhāstram idam uktaṁ mayānagha
etad buddhvā buddhimān syāt kṛita-kṛityasḥ cha bhārata
verses.translation_full: I have shared this most secret principle of the Vedic scriptures with you, O sinless Arjun. By understanding this, a person becomes enlightened, and fulfills all that is to be accomplished.
verses.widget_line: This is the most confidential part of the Vedic scriptures, O sinless one, and it is disclosed now by Me. Whoever understands this will become wise, and his endeavors will know perfection, O Bharata.
verses.personalized: This is the most confidential part of the Vedic scriptures, O {name}, and it is disclosed now by Me. Whoever understands this will become wise, and his endeavors will know perfection.

chapter_info.chapter_name_english: Daivasura Sampad Vibhaga Yoga – The Yoga of the Division Between the Divine and Demoniac Natures
chapter_info.theme: Krishna describes the divine and demoniac natures, listing the qualities of each and explaining their consequences. He emphasizes the importance of following scriptural injunctions and avoiding the three gates to hell: lust, anger, and greed.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
श्रीभगवानुवाच
अभयं सत्त्वसंशुद्धिर्ज्ञानयोगव्यवस्थितिः ।
दानं दमश्च यज्ञश्च स्वाध्यायस्तप आर्जवम् ॥१॥
verses.transliteration:
śhrī-bhagavān uvācha
abhayaṁ sattva-saṁśhuddhir jñāna-yoga-vyavasthitiḥ
dānaṁ damaśh cha yajñaśh cha svādhyāyas tapa ārjavam
verses.translation_full: The Supreme Divine Personality said: O scion of Bharat, these are the saintly virtues of those endowed with a divine nature—fearlessness, purity of mind, steadfastness in spiritual knowledge, charity, control of the senses, sacrifice, study of the sacred books, austerity, and straightforwardness; non-violence, truthfulness, absence of anger, renunciation, peacefulness, restraint from fault-finding, compassion toward all living beings, absence of covetousness, gentleness, modesty, and lack of fickleness; vigor, forgiveness, fortitude, cleanliness, bearing enmity toward none, and absence of vanity.
verses.widget_line: Fearlessness, purification, spiritual knowledge, charity, self-control, sacrifice, study of the Vedas, austerity, and simplicity—these are the divine qualities of those endowed with a divine nature.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अहिंसा सत्यमक्रोधस्त्यागः शान्तिरपैशुनम् ।
दया भूतेष्वलोलुप्त्वं मार्दवं ह्रीरचापलम् ॥२॥
verses.transliteration:
ahiṁsā satyam akrodhas tyāgaḥ śhāntir apaiśhunam
dayā bhūteṣhvaloluptvaṁ mārdavaṁ hrīr achāpalam
verses.translation_full: The Supreme Divine Personality said: O scion of Bharat, these are the saintly virtues of those endowed with a divine nature—fearlessness, purity of mind, steadfastness in spiritual knowledge, charity, control of the senses, sacrifice, study of the sacred books, austerity, and straightforwardness; non-violence, truthfulness, absence of anger, renunciation, peacefulness, restraint from fault-finding, compassion toward all living beings, absence of covetousness, gentleness, modesty, and lack of fickleness; vigor, forgiveness, fortitude, cleanliness, bearing enmity toward none, and absence of vanity.
verses.widget_line: Nonviolence, truthfulness, freedom from anger, renunciation, tranquility, compassion, freedom from covetousness, gentleness, modesty, and steadiness—these are the divine qualities.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
तेजः क्षमा धृतिः शौचमद्रोहो नातिमानिता ।
भवन्ति सम्पदं दैवीमभिजातस्य भारत ॥३॥
verses.transliteration:
tejaḥ kṣhamā dhṛitiḥ śhaucham adroho nātimānitā
bhavanti sampadaṁ daivīm abhijātasya bhārata
verses.translation_full: The Supreme Divine Personality said: O scion of Bharat, these are the saintly virtues of those endowed with a divine nature—fearlessness, purity of mind, steadfastness in spiritual knowledge, charity, control of the senses, sacrifice, study of the sacred books, austerity, and straightforwardness; non-violence, truthfulness, absence of anger, renunciation, peacefulness, restraint from fault-finding, compassion toward all living beings, absence of covetousness, gentleness, modesty, and lack of fickleness; vigor, forgiveness, fortitude, cleanliness, bearing enmity toward none, and absence of vanity.
verses.widget_line: Vigor, forgiveness, fortitude, cleanliness, freedom from envy, and absence of pride—these are the qualities of those with divine nature, O Bharata.
verses.personalized: Vigor, forgiveness, fortitude, cleanliness, freedom from envy, and absence of pride—these are the qualities of those with divine nature, O {name}.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
दम्भो दर्पोऽभिमानश्च क्रोधः पारुष्यमेव च ।
अज्ञानं चाभिजातस्य पार्थ सम्पदमासुरीम् ॥४॥
verses.transliteration:
dambho darpo 'bhimānaśh cha krodhaḥ pāruṣhyam eva cha
ajñānaṁ chābhijātasya pārtha sampadam āsurīm
verses.translation_full: O Parth, the qualities of those who possess a demoniac nature are hypocrisy, arrogance, conceit, anger, harshness, and ignorance.
verses.widget_line: Pride, arrogance, conceit, anger, harshness, and ignorance—these qualities belong to those of demoniac nature, O Partha.
verses.personalized: Pride, arrogance, conceit, anger, harshness, and ignorance—these qualities belong to those of demoniac nature, O {name}.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
दैवी सम्पद्विमोक्षाय निबन्धायासुरी मता ।
मा शुचः सम्पदं दैवीमभिजातोऽसि पाण्डव ॥५॥
verses.transliteration:
daivī sampad vimokṣhāya nibandhāyāsurī matā
mā śhuchaḥ sampadaṁ daivīm abhijāto 'si pāṇḍava
verses.translation_full: The divine qualities lead to liberation, while the demoniac qualities are the cause for a continuing destiny of bondage. Grieve not, O Arjun, as you were born with saintly virtues.
verses.widget_line: The divine qualities lead to liberation, whereas the demoniac qualities cause bondage. Do not worry, O Pandava, for you are born with divine qualities.
verses.personalized: The divine qualities lead to liberation, whereas the demoniac qualities cause bondage. Do not worry, O {name}, for you are born with divine qualities.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
द्वौ भूतसर्गौ लोकेऽस्मिन्दैव आसुर एव च ।
दैवो विस्तरशः प्रोक्त आसुरं पार्थ मे शृणु ॥६॥
verses.transliteration:
dvau bhūta-sargau loke 'smin daiva āsura eva cha
daivo vistaraśhaḥ prokta āsuraṁ pārtha me śhṛiṇu
verses.translation_full: There are two kinds of beings in this world—those endowed with a divine nature and those possessing a demoniac nature. I have described the divine qualities in detail, O Arjun. Now hear from me about the demoniac nature.
verses.widget_line: In this world there are two kinds of created beings—the divine and the demoniac. I have explained the divine qualities. Now hear of the demoniac, O Partha.
verses.personalized: In this world there are two kinds of created beings—the divine and the demoniac. I have explained the divine qualities. Now hear of the demoniac, O {name}.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
प्रवृत्तिं च निवृत्तिं च जना न विदुरासुराः ।
न शौचं नापि चाचारो न सत्यं तेषु विद्यते ॥७॥
verses.transliteration:
pravṛittiṁ cha nivṛittiṁ cha janā na vidur āsurāḥ
na śhauchaṁ nāpi chāchāro na satyaṁ teṣhu vidyate
verses.translation_full: Those possessing a demoniac nature do not comprehend which actions are proper and which are improper. Hence, they possess neither purity, nor good conduct, nor even truthfulness.
verses.widget_line: Those who are demoniac do not know what is to be done and what is not to be done. Neither cleanliness nor proper behavior nor truth is found in them.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
असत्यमप्रतिष्ठं ते जगदाहुरनीश्वरम् ।
अपरस्परसम्भूतं किमन्यत्कामहैतुकम् ॥८॥
verses.transliteration:
asatyam apratiṣhṭhaṁ te jagad āhur anīśhvaram
aparaspara-sambhūtaṁ kim anyat kāma-haitukam
verses.translation_full: They say, "The world is without Absolute Truth, without any basis (for moral order), and without a God (who has created or is controlling it). It is created from the combination of the two sexes, and has no purpose other than sexual gratification."
verses.widget_line: They say that this world is unreal, that there is no foundation, and that there is no God in control. It is produced of sex desire, and has no cause other than lust.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
एतां दृष्टिमवष्टभ्य नष्टात्मानोऽल्पबुद्धयः ।
प्रभवन्त्युग्रकर्माणः क्षयाय जगतोऽहिताः ॥९॥
verses.transliteration:
etāṁ dṛiṣhṭim avaṣhṭabhya naṣhṭātmāno 'lpa-buddhayaḥ
prabhavanty ugra-karmāṇaḥ kṣhayāya jagato 'hitāḥ
verses.translation_full: Holding fast to such views, these misdirected souls, with small intellect and cruel actions, arise as enemies of the world threatening its destruction.
verses.widget_line: Following such conclusions, the demoniac, who are lost to themselves, engage in unbeneficial, horrible works meant to destroy the world.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
काममाश्रित्य दुष्पूरं दम्भमानमदान्विताः ।
मोहाद्गृहीत्वासद्ग्राहान्प्रवर्तन्तेऽशुचिव्रताः ॥१०॥
verses.transliteration:
kāmam āśhritya duṣhpūraṁ dambha-māna-madānvitāḥ
mohād gṛihītvāsad-grāhān pravartante 'śhuchi-vratāḥ
verses.translation_full: Harboring insatiable lust, full of hypocrisy, pride and arrogance, the demoniac cling to their false tenets. Thus illusioned, they are attracted to the impermanent and work with impure resolve.
verses.widget_line: The demoniac, taking shelter of insatiable lust, pride, and false prestige, are always sworn to unclean work, attracted by the impermanent.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
चिन्तामपरिमेयां च प्रलयान्तामुपाश्रिताः ।
कामोपभोगपरमा एतावदिति निश्चिताः ॥११॥
verses.transliteration:
chintām aparimeyāṁ cha pralayāntām upāśhritāḥ
kāmopabhoga-paramā etāvad iti niśhchitāḥ
verses.translation_full: They are obsessed with endless anxieties that end only with death. Still, they maintain with complete assurance that gratification of desires and accumulation of wealth is the highest purpose of life.
verses.widget_line: They believe that to gratify the senses until the end of life is the prime necessity. Thus there is no end to their anxiety. Being bound by desires, they secure money by illegal means.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
आशापाशशतैर्बद्धाः कामक्रोधपरायणाः ।
ईहन्ते कामभोगार्थमन्यायेनार्थसञ्चयान् ॥१२॥
verses.transliteration:
āśhā-pāśha-śhatair baddhāḥ kāma-krodha-parāyaṇāḥ
īhante kāma-bhogārtham anyāyenārtha-sañchayān
verses.translation_full: Held in bondage by hundreds of desires, and driven by lust and anger, they strive to accumulate wealth by unjust means, all for the gratification of their senses.
verses.widget_line: Bound by hundreds and thousands of desires, absorbed in lust and anger, they secure money by illegal means for sense gratification.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
इदमद्य मया लब्धमिमं प्राप्स्ये मनोरथम् ।
इदमस्तीदमपि मे भविष्यति पुनर्धनम् ॥१३॥
verses.transliteration:
idam adya mayā labdham imaṁ prāpsye manoratham
idam astīdam api me bhaviṣhyati punar dhanam
verses.translation_full: The demoniac persons think, "I have gained so much wealth today, and I shall now fulfill this desire of mine. This is mine, and tomorrow I shall have even more. That enemy has been destroyed by me, and I shall destroy the others too! I am like God Himself, I am the enjoyer, I am perfect, I am powerful, and I am happy. I am wealthy and I have highly placed relatives. Who else is equal to me? I shall perform sacrifices (to the celestial gods); I shall give alms; I shall rejoice." In this way, they are deluded by ignorance.
verses.widget_line: The demoniac person thinks: 'So much wealth do I have today, and I will gain more. So much is mine now, and it will increase in the future.'

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
असौ मया हतः शत्रुर्हनिष्ये चापरानपि ।
ईश्वरोऽहमहं भोगी सिद्धोऽहं बलवान्सुखी ॥१४॥
verses.transliteration:
asau mayā hataḥ śhatrur haniṣhye chāparān api
īśhvaro 'ham ahaṁ bhogī siddho 'haṁ balavān sukhī
verses.translation_full: The demoniac persons think, "I have gained so much wealth today, and I shall now fulfill this desire of mine. This is mine, and tomorrow I shall have even more. That enemy has been destroyed by me, and I shall destroy the others too! I am like God Himself, I am the enjoyer, I am perfect, I am powerful, and I am happy. I am wealthy and I have highly placed relatives. Who else is equal to me? I shall perform sacrifices (to the celestial gods); I shall give alms; I shall rejoice." In this way, they are deluded by ignorance.
verses.widget_line: I am the lord of everything, I am the enjoyer, I am perfect, powerful, and happy.'

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
आढ्योऽभिजनवानस्मि कोऽन्योऽस्ति सदृशो मया ।
यक्ष्ये दास्यामि मोदिष्य इत्यज्ञानविमोहिताः ॥१५॥
verses.transliteration:
āḍhyo 'bhijanavān asmi ko 'nyo 'sti sadṛiśho mayā
yakṣhye dāsyāmi modiṣhya ity ajñāna-vimohitāḥ
verses.translation_full: The demoniac persons think, "I have gained so much wealth today, and I shall now fulfill this desire of mine. This is mine, and tomorrow I shall have even more. That enemy has been destroyed by me, and I shall destroy the others too! I am like God Himself, I am the enjoyer, I am perfect, I am powerful, and I am happy. I am wealthy and I have highly placed relatives. Who else is equal to me? I shall perform sacrifices (to the celestial gods); I shall give alms; I shall rejoice." In this way, they are deluded by ignorance.
verses.widget_line: I am rich and well-born. Who else is equal to me? I will sacrifice, I will give charity, and I will rejoice.' Thus deluded by ignorance.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अनेकचित्तविभ्रान्ता मोहजालसमावृताः ।
प्रसक्ताः कामभोगेषु पतन्ति नरकेऽशुचौ ॥१६॥
verses.transliteration:
aneka-chitta-vibhrāntā moha-jāla-samāvṛitāḥ
prasaktāḥ kāma-bhogeṣhu patanti narake 'śhuchau
verses.translation_full: Possessed and led astray by such imaginings, enveloped in a mesh of delusion, and addicted to the gratification of sensuous pleasures, they descend to the murkiest hell.
verses.widget_line: Thus perplexed by various anxieties and bound by a network of illusions, they become too strongly attached to sense enjoyment and fall down into hell.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
आत्मसम्भाविताः स्तब्धा धनमानमदान्विताः ।
यजन्ते नामयज्ञैस्ते दम्भेनाविधिपूर्वकम् ॥१७॥
verses.transliteration:
ātma-sambhāvitāḥ stabdhā dhana-māna-madānvitāḥ
yajante nāma-yajñais te dambhenāvidhi-pūrvakam
verses.translation_full: Such self-conceited and stubborn people, full of pride and arrogant in their wealth, perform ostentatious sacrifices in name only, with no regard to the rules of the scriptures.
verses.widget_line: Self-complacent and always impudent, deluded by wealth and false prestige, they sometimes perform sacrifices in name only without following rules.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अहङ्कारं बलं दर्पं कामं क्रोधं च संश्रिताः ।
मामात्मपरदेहेषु प्रद्विषन्तोऽभ्यसूयकाः ॥१८॥
verses.transliteration:
ahaṅkāraṁ balaṁ darpaṁ kāmaṁ krodhaṁ cha saṁśhritāḥ
mām ātma-para-deheṣhu pradviṣhanto 'bhyasūyakāḥ
verses.translation_full: Blinded by egotism, strength, arrogance, desire, and anger, the demonic abuse Me, who am present in their own body and in the bodies of others.
verses.widget_line: Bewildered by false ego, strength, pride, lust, and anger, the demoniac become envious of the Supreme Personality of Godhead and blaspheme against the real religion.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
तानहं द्विषतः क्रूरान्संसारेषु नराधमान् ।
क्षिपाम्यजस्रमशुभानासुरीष्वेव योनिषु ॥१९॥
verses.transliteration:
tān ahaṁ dviṣhataḥ krūrān saṁsāreṣhu narādhamān
kṣhipāmy ajasram aśhubhān āsurīṣhv eva yoniṣhu
verses.translation_full: These cruel and hateful persons, the vile and vicious of humankind, I constantly hurl into the wombs of those with similar demoniac natures in the cycle of rebirth in the material world. These ignorant souls take birth again and again in demoniac wombs. Failing to reach Me, O Arjun, they gradually sink to the most abominable type of existence.
verses.widget_line: Those who are envious and mischievous, who are the lowest among men, I perpetually cast into the ocean of material existence, into various demoniac species of life.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
आसुरीं योनिमापन्ना मूढा जन्मनि जन्मनि ।
मामप्राप्यैव कौन्तेय ततो यान्त्यधमां गतिम् ॥२०॥
verses.transliteration:
āsurīṁ yonim āpannā mūḍhā janmani janmani
mām aprāpyaiva kaunteya tato yānty adhamāṁ gatim
verses.translation_full: These cruel and hateful persons, the vile and vicious of humankind, I constantly hurl into the wombs of those with similar demoniac natures in the cycle of rebirth in the material world. These ignorant souls take birth again and again in demoniac wombs. Failing to reach Me, O Arjun, they gradually sink to the most abominable type of existence.
verses.widget_line: Attaining repeated birth among the species of demoniac life, such persons can never approach Me. Gradually they sink down to the most abominable type of existence, O son of Kunti.
verses.personalized: Attaining repeated birth among the species of demoniac life, such persons can never approach Me. Gradually they sink down to the most abominable type of existence, O {name}.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
त्रिविधं नरकस्येदं द्वारं नाशनमात्मनः ।
कामः क्रोधस्तथा लोभस्तस्मादेतत्त्रयं त्यजेत् ॥२१॥
verses.transliteration:
tri-vidhaṁ narakasyedaṁ dvāraṁ nāśhanam ātmanaḥ
kāmaḥ krodhas tathā lobhas tasmād etat trayaṁ tyajet
verses.translation_full: There are three gates leading to the hell of self-destruction for the soul—lust, anger, and greed. Therefore, one should abandon all three.
verses.widget_line: There are three gates leading to the hell of material life—lust, anger, and greed. Every sane person should give these up, for they lead to degradation.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
एतैर्विमुक्तः कौन्तेय तमोद्वारैस्त्रिभिर्नरः ।
आचरत्यात्मनः श्रेयस्ततो याति परां गतिम् ॥२२॥
verses.transliteration:
etair vimuktaḥ kaunteya tamo-dvārais tribhir naraḥ
ācharaty ātmanaḥ śhreyas tato yāti parāṁ gatim
verses.translation_full: Those who are free from the three gates to darkness endeavor for the welfare of their soul, and thereby attain the supreme goal.
verses.widget_line: The man who has escaped these three gates of darkness performs acts conducive to self-realization and thus gradually attains the supreme destination, O son of Kunti.
verses.personalized: The man who has escaped these three gates of darkness performs acts conducive to self-realization and thus gradually attains the supreme destination, O {name}.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यः शास्त्रविधिमुत्सृज्य वर्तते कामकारतः ।
न स सिद्धिमवाप्नोति न सुखं न परां गतिम् ॥२३॥
verses.transliteration:
yaḥ śhāstra-vidhim utsṛijya vartate kāma-kārataḥ
na sa siddhim avāpnoti na sukhaṁ na parāṁ gatim
verses.translation_full: Those who act under the impulse of desire, discarding the injunctions of the scriptures, attain neither perfection, nor happiness, nor the supreme goal in life.
verses.widget_line: He who discards scriptural injunctions and acts according to his own whims attains neither perfection, nor happiness, nor the supreme destination.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
तस्माच्छास्त्रं प्रमाणं ते कार्याकार्यव्यवस्थितौ ।
ज्ञात्वा शास्त्रविधानोक्तं कर्म कर्तुमिहार्हसि ॥२४॥
verses.transliteration:
tasmāc chāstraṁ pramāṇaṁ te kāryākārya-vyavasthitau
jñātvā śhāstra-vidhānoktaṁ karma kartum ihārhasi
verses.translation_full: Therefore, let the scriptures be your authority in determining what should be done and what should not be done. Understand the scriptural injunctions and teachings, and then perform your actions in this world accordingly.
verses.widget_line: Therefore one should understand what is duty and what is not duty by the regulations of the scriptures. Knowing such rules, one should act so that he may gradually be elevated.

chapter_info.chapter_name_english: Shraddhatraya Vibhaga Yoga – The Yoga of the Threefold Division of Faith
chapter_info.theme: Krishna explains the three types of faith—sattvic (goodness), rajasic (passion), and tamasic (ignorance)—and their manifestations in worship, food, sacrifice, austerity, and charity.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
श्रीभगवानुवाच
त्रिविधा भवति श्रद्धा देहिनां सा स्वभावजा ।
सात्त्विकी राजसी चैव तामसी चेति तां शृणु ॥२॥
verses.transliteration:
śhrī-bhagavān uvācha
tri-vidhā bhavati śhraddhā dehināṁ sā svabhāva-jā
sāttvikī rājasī chaiva tāmasī cheti tāṁ śhṛiṇu
verses.translation_full: The Supreme Divine Personality said: Every human being is born with innate faith, which can be of three kinds—sāttvic, rājasic, or tāmasic. Now hear about this from Me.
verses.widget_line: According to the modes of nature, one's faith can be of three kinds—in goodness, in passion, or in ignorance. Now hear about this.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
सत्त्वानुरूपा सर्वस्य श्रद्धा भवति भारत ।
श्रद्धामयोऽयं पुरुषो यो यच्छ्रद्धः स एव सः ॥३॥
verses.transliteration:
sattvānurūpā sarvasya śhraddhā bhavati bhārata
śhraddhāmayo 'yaṁ puruṣho yo yach-chhraddhaḥ sa eva saḥ
verses.translation_full: The faith of all humans conforms to the nature of their mind. All people possess faith, and whatever the nature of their faith, that is verily what they are.
verses.widget_line: O Bharata, the faith of all beings conforms to their nature. Whatever the nature of one's faith, that is what they are.
verses.personalized: O {name}, the faith of all beings conforms to their nature. Whatever the nature of one's faith, that is what they are.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यजन्ते सात्त्विका देवान्यक्षरक्षांसि राजसाः ।
प्रेतान्भूतगणांश्चान्ये यजन्ते तामसा जनाः ॥४॥
verses.transliteration:
yajante sāttvikā devān yakṣha-rakṣhāṁsi rājasāḥ
pretān bhūta-gaṇāṁśh chānye yajante tāmasā janāḥ
verses.translation_full: Those in the mode of goodness worship the celestial gods; those in the mode of passion worship the yakṣhas and rākṣhasas; those in the mode of ignorance worship ghosts and spirits.
verses.widget_line: Men in goodness worship the demigods; those in passion worship the demons; and those in ignorance worship ghosts and spirits.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अशास्त्रविहितं घोरं तप्यन्ते ये तपो जनाः ।
दम्भाहंकारसंयुक्ताः कामरागबलान्विताः ॥५॥
verses.transliteration:
aśhāstra-vihitaṁ ghoraṁ tapyante ye tapo janāḥ
dambhāhaṅkāra-saṁyuktāḥ kāma-rāga-balānvitāḥ
verses.translation_full: Some people perform stern austerities that are not enjoined by the scriptures, but rather motivated by hypocrisy and egotism. Impelled by desire and attachment, they torment not only the elements of their body, but also I who dwell within them as the Supreme Soul. Know these senseless people to be of demoniacal resolves.
verses.widget_line: Those who undergo severe austerities not recommended in the scriptures, performing them out of pride and egoism, impelled by lust and attachment—

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
कर्षयन्तः शरीरस्थं भूतग्राममचेतसः ।
मां चैवान्तःशरीरस्थं तान्विद्ध्यासुरनिश्चयान् ॥६॥
verses.transliteration:
karṣhayantaḥ śharīra-sthaṁ bhūta-grāmam achetasaḥ
māṁ chaivāntaḥ-śharīra-sthaṁ tān viddhy āsura-niśhchayān
verses.translation_full: Some people perform stern austerities that are not enjoined by the scriptures, but rather motivated by hypocrisy and egotism. Impelled by desire and attachment, they torment not only the elements of their body, but also I who dwell within them as the Supreme Soul. Know these senseless people to be of demoniacal resolves.
verses.widget_line: Know them to be demoniac in their resolves, who torture the material elements of the body as well as the Supersoul dwelling within.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
आहारस्त्वपि सर्वस्य त्रिविधो भवति प्रियः ।
यज्ञस्तपस्तथा दानं तेषां भेदमिमं शृणु ॥७॥
verses.transliteration:
āhāras tv api sarvasya tri-vidho bhavati priyaḥ
yajñas tapas tathā dānaṁ teṣhāṁ bhedam imaṁ śhṛiṇu
verses.translation_full: The food that people prefer is according to their dispositions. The same is true for the sacrifice, austerity, and charity they are inclined (or predisposed) toward. Now hear of the distinctions from Me.
verses.widget_line: Even the food each person prefers is of three kinds, according to the three modes. The same is true of sacrifices, austerities, and charity. Now hear of the distinctions.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
आयुःसत्त्वबलारोग्यसुखप्रीतिविवर्धनाः ।
रस्याः स्निग्धाः स्थिरा हृद्याः आहाराः सात्त्विकप्रियाः ॥८॥
verses.transliteration:
āyuḥ-sattva-bala-ārogya-sukha-prīti-vivardhanāḥ
rasyāḥ snigdhāḥ sthirā hṛidyāḥ āhārāḥ sāttvika-priyāḥ
verses.translation_full: Persons in the mode of goodness prefer foods that promote life span, and increase virtue, strength, health, happiness, and satisfaction. Such foods are juicy, succulent, nourishing, and naturally tasteful.
verses.widget_line: Foods dear to those in goodness increase the duration of life, purify existence, and give strength, health, happiness, and satisfaction. Such foods are juicy, fatty, wholesome, and pleasing.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
कट्वम्ललवणात्युष्णतीक्ष्णरूक्षविदाहिनः ।
आहारा राजसस्येष्टा दुःखशोकामयप्रदाः ॥९॥
verses.transliteration:
kaṭv-amla-lavaṇāty-uṣhṇa-tīkṣhṇa-rūkṣha-vidāhinaḥ
āhārā rājasasyeṣhṭā duḥkha-śhokāmaya-pradāḥ
verses.translation_full: Foods that are too bitter, too sour, salty, very hot, pungent, dry, and full of chillies, are dear to persons in the mode of passion. Such foods produce pain, grief, and disease.
verses.widget_line: Foods that are too bitter, too sour, salty, hot, pungent, dry, and burning are dear to those in passion. Such foods cause distress, misery, and disease.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यातयामं गतरसं पूति पर्युषितं च यत् ।
उच्छिष्टमपि चामेध्यं भोजनं तामसप्रियम् ॥१०॥
verses.transliteration:
yāta-yāmaṁ gata-rasaṁ pūti paryuṣhitaṁ cha yat
uchchhiṣhṭam api chāmedhyaṁ bhojanaṁ tāmasa-priyam
verses.translation_full: Foods that are overcooked, stale, putrid, polluted, and impure are dear to persons in the mode of ignorance.
verses.widget_line: Food prepared more than three hours before, food that is tasteless, decomposed and putrid, and food consisting of remnants is dear to those in darkness.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अफलाकाङ्क्षिभिर्यज्ञो विधिदृष्टो य इज्यते ।
यष्टव्यमेवेति मनः समाधाय स सात्त्विकः ॥११॥
verses.transliteration:
aphalākāṅkṣhibhir yajño vidhi-dṛiṣhṭo ya ijyate
yaṣhṭavyam eveti manaḥ samādhāya sa sāttvikaḥ
verses.translation_full: Sacrifice that is performed according to scriptural injunctions without expectation of rewards, with the firm conviction of the mind that it is a matter of duty, is of the nature of goodness.
verses.widget_line: Of sacrifices, the sacrifice performed according to the directions of scripture, as a matter of duty, by those who desire no reward, is of the nature of goodness.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अभिसंधाय तु फलं दम्भार्थमपि चैव यत् ।
इज्यते भरतश्रेष्ठ तं यज्ञं विद्धि राजसम् ॥१२॥
verses.transliteration:
abhisandhāya tu phalaṁ dambhārtham api chaiva yat
ijyate bharata-śhreṣhṭha taṁ yajñaṁ viddhi rājasam
verses.translation_full: O best of the Bharatas, know that sacrifice performed for material benefit, or with a hypocritical aim, is in the mode of passion.
verses.widget_line: The sacrifice performed for some material benefit, or for the sake of pride, is in the mode of passion, O chief of the Bharatas.
verses.personalized: The sacrifice performed for some material benefit, or for the sake of pride, is in the mode of passion, O {name}.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
विधिहीनमसृष्टान्नं मन्त्रहीनमदक्षिणम् ।
श्रद्धाविरहितं यज्ञं तामसं परिचक्षते ॥१३॥
verses.transliteration:
vidhi-hīnam asṛiṣhṭānnaṁ mantra-hīnam adakṣhiṇam
śhraddhā-virahitaṁ yajñaṁ tāmasaṁ parichakṣhate
verses.translation_full: Sacrifice devoid of faith and contrary to the injunctions of the scriptures, in which no food is offered, no mantras chanted, and no donation made, is to be considered in the mode of ignorance.
verses.widget_line: Any sacrifice performed without regard for the directions of scripture, without distribution of prasadam, without chanting of Vedic hymns, and without faith, is in the mode of ignorance.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
देवद्विजगुरुप्राज्ञपूजनं शौचमार्जवम् ।
ब्रह्मचर्यमहिंसा च शारीरं तप उच्यते ॥१४॥
verses.transliteration:
deva-dvija-guru-prājña-pūjanaṁ śhaucham ārjavam
brahmacharyam ahiṁsā cha śhārīraṁ tapa uchyate
verses.translation_full: When worship of the Supreme Lord, the Brahmins, the spiritual master, the wise, and the elders is done with the observance of cleanliness, simplicity, celibacy, and non-violence then this worship is declared as the austerity of the body.
