verses.widget_line: Austerity of the body consists of worship of the Supreme Lord, brahmanas, the spiritual master, and superiors, and in cleanliness, simplicity, celibacy, and nonviolence.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अनुद्वेगकरं वाक्यं सत्यं प्रियहितं च यत् ।
स्वाध्यायाभ्यसनं चैव वाङ्मयं तप उच्यते ॥१५॥
verses.transliteration:
anudvega-karaṁ vākyaṁ satyaṁ priya-hitaṁ cha yat
svādhyāyābhyasanaṁ chaiva vāṅ-mayaṁ tapa uchyate
verses.translation_full: Words that do not cause distress, are truthful, inoffensive, and beneficial, as well as regular recitation of the Vedic scriptures—these are declared as austerity of speech.
verses.widget_line: Austerity of speech consists in speaking words that are truthful, pleasing, beneficial, and not agitating, and also in regularly reciting Vedic literature.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
मनःप्रसादः सौम्यत्वं मौनमात्मविनिग्रहः ।
भावसंशुद्धिरित्येतत्तपो मानसमुच्यते ॥१६॥
verses.transliteration:
manaḥ-prasādaḥ saumyatvaṁ maunam ātma-vinigrahaḥ
bhāva-saṁśhuddhir ity etat tapo mānasam uchyate
verses.translation_full: Serenity of thought, gentleness, silence, self-control, and purity of purpose—all these are declared as austerity of the mind.
verses.widget_line: Satisfaction, simplicity, gravity, self-control, and purification of one's existence are the austerities of the mind.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
श्रद्धया परया तप्तं तपस्तत्त्रिविधं नरैः ।
अफलाकाङ्क्षिभिर्युक्तैः सात्त्विकं परिचक्षते ॥१७॥
verses.transliteration:
śhraddhayā parayā taptaṁ tapas tat-tri-vidhaṁ naraiḥ
aphalākāṅkṣhibhir yuktaiḥ sāttvikaṁ parichakṣhate
verses.translation_full: When devout persons with ardent faith practice these three-fold austerities without yearning for material rewards, they are designated as austerities in the mode of goodness.
verses.widget_line: This threefold austerity, performed with transcendental faith by men not expecting material benefits but engaged only for the sake of the Supreme, is called austerity in goodness.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
सत्कारमानपूजार्थं तपो दम्भेन चैव यत् ।
क्रियते तदिह प्रोक्तं राजसं चलमध्रुवम् ॥१८॥
verses.transliteration:
satkāra-māna-pūjārthaṁ tapo dambhena chaiva yat
kriyate tad iha proktaṁ rājasaṁ chalam adhruvam
verses.translation_full: Austerity that is performed with ostentation for the sake of gaining honor, respect, and adoration is in the mode of passion. Its benefits are unstable and transitory.
verses.widget_line: Austerity performed out of pride and for the sake of gaining respect, honor, and worship is in the mode of passion. It is neither stable nor permanent.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
मूढग्राहेणात्मनो यत्पीडया क्रियते तपः ।
परस्योत्सादनार्थं वा तत्तामसमुदाहृतम् ॥१९॥
verses.transliteration:
mūḍha-grāheṇātmano yat pīḍayā kriyate tapaḥ
parasyotsādanārthaṁ vā tat tāmasam udāhṛitam
verses.translation_full: Austerity that is performed by those with confused notions, and which involves torturing the self or harming others, is described to be in the mode of ignorance.
verses.widget_line: Austerity performed out of foolishness, with self-torture, or to destroy or injure others, is in the mode of ignorance.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
दातव्यमिति यद्दानं दीयतेऽनुपकारिणे ।
देशे काले च पात्रे च तद्दानं सात्त्विकं स्मृतम् ॥२०॥
verses.transliteration:
dātavyam iti yad dānaṁ dīyate 'nupakāriṇe
deśhe kāle cha pātre cha tad dānaṁ sāttvikaṁ smṛitam
verses.translation_full: Charity given to a worthy person simply because it is right to give, without consideration of anything in return, at the proper time and in the proper place, is stated to be in the mode of goodness.
verses.widget_line: Charity given out of duty, without expectation of return, at the proper time and place, and to a worthy person is in the mode of goodness.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यत्तु प्रत्युपकारार्थं फलमुद्दिश्य वा पुनः ।
दीयते च परिक्लिष्टं तद्दानं राजसं स्मृतम् ॥२१॥
verses.transliteration:
yat tu pratyupakārārthaṁ phalam uddiśhya vā punaḥ
dīyate cha parikliṣhṭaṁ tad dānaṁ rājasaṁ smṛitam
verses.translation_full: But charity given with reluctance, with the hope of a return or in expectation of a reward, is said to be in the mode of passion.
verses.widget_line: Charity performed with the expectation of some return, or with a desire for fruitive results, or in a grudging mood, is in the mode of passion.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अदेशकाले यद्दानमपात्रेभ्यश्च दीयते ।
असत्कृतमवज्ञातं तत्तामसमुदाहृतम् ॥२२॥
verses.transliteration:
adeśha-kāle yad dānam apātrebhyaśh cha dīyate
asat-kṛitam avajñātaṁ tat tāmasam udāhṛitam
verses.translation_full: And that charity, which is given at the wrong place and wrong time to unworthy persons, without showing respect, or with contempt, is held to be of the nature of nescience.
verses.widget_line: Charity performed at an impure place, at an improper time, to unworthy persons, or without proper attention and respect is in the mode of ignorance.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
ॐतत्सदिति निर्देशो ब्रह्मणस्त्रिविधः स्मृतः ।
ब्राह्मणास्तेन वेदाश्च यज्ञाश्च विहिताः पुरा ॥२३॥
verses.transliteration:
oṁ tat sad iti nirdeśho brahmaṇas tri-vidhaḥ smṛitaḥ
brāhmaṇās tena vedāśh cha yajñāśh cha vihitāḥ purā
verses.translation_full: The words "Om Tat Sat" have been declared as symbolic representations of the Supreme Absolute Truth, from the beginning of creation. From them came the priests, scriptures, and sacrifice.
verses.widget_line: From the beginning of creation, the three words—om tat sat—have been used to indicate the Supreme Absolute Truth. They were uttered by brahmanas while offering sacrifices.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
तस्मादोमित्युदाहृत्य यज्ञदानतपःक्रियाः ।
प्रवर्तन्ते विधानोक्ताः सततं ब्रह्मवादिनाम् ॥२४॥
verses.transliteration:
tasmād om ity udāhṛitya yajña-dāna-tapaḥ-kriyāḥ
pravartante vidhānoktāḥ satataṁ brahma-vādinām
verses.translation_full: Therefore, when performing acts of sacrifice, offering charity, or undertaking penance, expounders of the Vedas always begin by uttering "Om" according to the prescriptions of Vedic injunctions.
verses.widget_line: Therefore, transcendentalists undertaking performances of sacrifice, charity, and penance in accordance with scriptural regulations begin always with om, to attain the Supreme.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
तदित्यनभिसन्धाय फलं यज्ञतपःक्रियाः ।
दानक्रियाश्च विविधाः क्रियन्ते मोक्षकाङ्क्षिभिः ॥२५॥
verses.transliteration:
tad ity anabhisandhāya phalaṁ yajña-tapaḥ-kriyāḥ
dāna-kriyāśh cha vividhāḥ kriyante mokṣha-kāṅkṣhibhiḥ
verses.translation_full: Persons who do not desire fruitive rewards, but seek to be free from material entanglements, utter the word "Tat" along with acts of austerity, sacrifice, and charity.
verses.widget_line: Without desiring fruitive results, one should perform various kinds of sacrifice, penance, and charity with the word tat. The purpose is to get free from material entanglement.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
सद्भावे साधुभावे च सदित्येतत्प्रयुज्यते ।
प्रशस्ते कर्मणि तथा सच्छब्दः पार्थ युज्यते ॥२६॥
verses.transliteration:
sad-bhāve sādhu-bhāve cha sad ity etat prayujyate
praśhaste karmaṇi tathā sac-chabdaḥ pārtha yujyate
verses.translation_full: The word "Sat" means eternal existence and goodness. O Arjun, it is also used to describe an auspicious action. Being established in the performance of sacrifice, penance, and charity, is also described by the word "Sat." And so any act for such purposes is named "Sat."
verses.widget_line: The Absolute Truth is the objective of devotional sacrifice, and it is indicated by the word sat. The performer of such sacrifice is also called sat, O Partha.
verses.personalized: The Absolute Truth is the objective of devotional sacrifice, and it is indicated by the word sat. The performer of such sacrifice is also called sat, O {name}.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यज्ञे तपसि दाने च स्थितिः सदिति चोच्यते ।
कर्म चैव तदर्थीयं सदित्येवाभिधीयते ॥२७॥
verses.transliteration:
yajñe tapasi dāne cha sthitiḥ sad iti cocyate
karma chaiva tad-arthīyaṁ sad ity evābhidhīyate
verses.translation_full: The word "Sat" means eternal existence and goodness. O Arjun, it is also used to describe an auspicious action. Being established in the performance of sacrifice, penance, and charity, is also described by the word "Sat." And so any act for such purposes is named "Sat."
verses.widget_line: Anything done as sacrifice, charity, or penance without faith in the Supreme is called asat. It has no value here or hereafter.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अश्रद्धया हुतं दत्तं तपस्तप्तं कृतं च यत् ।
असदित्युच्यते पार्थ न च तत्प्रेत्य नो इह ॥२८॥
verses.transliteration:
aśhraddhayā hutaṁ dattaṁ tapas taptaṁ kṛitaṁ cha yat
asad ity uchyate pārtha na cha tat pretya no iha
verses.translation_full: O son of Pritha, whatever acts of sacrifice, charity, or penance are done without faith, are termed as "Asat." They are useless both in this world and the next.
verses.widget_line: Whatever is done as sacrifice, charity, or penance, without faith, is called asat. It is useless both in this life and the next, O Partha.
verses.personalized: Whatever is done as sacrifice, charity, or penance, without faith, is called asat. It is useless both in this life and the next, O {name}.

chapter_info.chapter_name_english: Moksha Sannyasa Yoga – The Yoga of Liberation and Renunciation
chapter_info.theme: Krishna concludes the Gita by explaining renunciation, the three types of knowledge, action, and doer according to the gunas, the duties of different varnas, the path to liberation through devotion, and the ultimate message of surrendering to the Supreme Lord.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
श्रीभगवानुवाच
काम्यानां कर्मणां न्यासं सन्न्यासं कवयो विदुः ।
सर्वकर्मफलत्यागं प्राहुस्त्यागं विचक्षणाः ॥२॥
verses.transliteration:
śhrī-bhagavān uvācha
kāmyānāṁ karmaṇāṁ nyāsaṁ sannyāsaṁ kavayo viduḥ
sarva-karma-phala-tyāgaṁ prāhus tyāgaṁ vichakṣhaṇāḥ
verses.translation_full: The Supreme Divine Personality said: Giving up of actions motivated by desire is what the learned understand as sanyās. Relinquishing the fruits of all actions is what the wise declare to be tyāg.
verses.widget_line: The giving up of activities based on material desire is renunciation. Giving up the results of all activities is what the wise call renunciation.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
त्याज्यं दोषवदित्येके कर्म प्राहुर्मनीषिणः ।
यज्ञदानतपःकर्म न त्याज्यमिति चापरे ॥३॥
verses.transliteration:
tyājyaṁ doṣha-vad ity eke karma prāhur manīṣhiṇaḥ
yajña-dāna-tapaḥ-karma na tyājyam iti chāpare
verses.translation_full: Some learned people declare that all kinds of actions should be given up as evil, while others maintain that acts of sacrifice, charity, and penance should never be abandoned.
verses.widget_line: Some learned men declare that all kinds of fruitive activities should be given up as faulty, yet other sages maintain that acts of sacrifice, charity, and penance should never be abandoned.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
निश्चयं श्रृणु मे तत्र त्यागे भरतसत्तम ।
त्यागो हि पुरुषव्याघ्र त्रिविधः सम्प्रकीर्तितः ॥४॥
verses.transliteration:
niśhchayaṁ śhṛiṇu me tatra tyāge bharata-sattama
tyāgo hi puruṣha-vyāghra tri-vidhaḥ samprakīrtitaḥ
verses.translation_full: Now hear My conclusion on the subject of renunciation, O tiger amongst men, for renunciation has been declared to be of three kinds.
verses.widget_line: O best of the Bharatas, hear from Me now about renunciation. O tiger among men, there are three kinds of renunciation declared in the scriptures.
verses.personalized: O {name}, hear from Me now about renunciation. O tiger among men, there are three kinds of renunciation declared in the scriptures.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यज्ञदानतपःकर्म न त्याज्यं कार्यमेव तत् ।
यज्ञो दानं तपश्चैव पावनानि मनीषिणाम् ॥५॥
verses.transliteration:
yajña-dāna-tapaḥ-karma na tyājyaṁ kāryam eva tat
yajño dānaṁ tapaśh chaiva pāvanāni manīṣhiṇām
verses.translation_full: Actions based upon sacrifice, charity, and penance should never be abandoned; they must certainly be performed. Indeed, acts of sacrifice, charity, and penance are purifying even for those who are wise.
verses.widget_line: Acts of sacrifice, charity, and penance are not to be given up; they must be performed. Indeed, sacrifice, charity, and penance purify even the great souls.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
एतान्यपि तु कर्माणि सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा फलानि च ।
कर्तव्यानीति मे पार्थ निश्चितं मतमुत्तमम् ॥६॥
verses.transliteration:
etāny api tu karmāṇi saṅgaṁ tyaktvā phalāni cha
kartavyānīti me pārtha niśhchitaṁ matam uttamam
verses.translation_full: These activities must be performed without attachment and expectation for rewards. This is My definite and supreme verdict, O Arjun.
verses.widget_line: All these activities should be performed without attachment or any expectation of result. They should be performed as a matter of duty, O Partha. That is My final opinion.
verses.personalized: All these activities should be performed without attachment or any expectation of result. They should be performed as a matter of duty, O {name}. That is My final opinion.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
नियतस्य तु सन्न्यासः कर्मणो नोपपद्यते ।
मोहात्तस्य परित्यागस्तामसः परिकीर्तितः ॥७॥
verses.transliteration:
niyatasya tu sannyāsaḥ karmaṇo nopapadyate
mohāt tasya parityāgas tāmasaḥ parikīrtitaḥ
verses.translation_full: Prescribed duties should never be renounced. Such deluded renunciation is said to be in the mode of ignorance.
verses.widget_line: Prescribed duties should never be renounced. If one gives up his prescribed duties because of illusion, such renunciation is in the mode of ignorance.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
दुःखमित्येव यत्कर्म कायक्लेशभयात्त्यजेत् ।
स कृत्वा राजसं त्यागं नैव त्यागफलं लभेत् ॥८॥
verses.transliteration:
duḥkham ity eva yat karma kāya-kleśha-bhayāt tyajet
sa kṛitvā rājasaṁ tyāgaṁ naiva tyāga-phalaṁ labhet
verses.translation_full: To give up prescribed duties because they are troublesome or cause bodily discomfort is renunciation in the mode of passion. Such renunciation is never beneficial or elevating.
verses.widget_line: Anyone who gives up prescribed duties as troublesome or out of fear of bodily discomfort is said to have renounced in the mode of passion. Such action never leads to the elevation of renunciation.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
कार्यमित्येव यत्कर्म नियतं क्रियतेऽर्जुन ।
सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा फलं चैव स त्यागः सात्त्विको मतः ॥९॥
verses.transliteration:
kāryam ity eva yat karma niyataṁ kriyate 'rjuna
saṅgaṁ tyaktvā phalaṁ chaiva sa tyāgaḥ sāttviko mataḥ
verses.translation_full: When actions are undertaken in response to duty, and one relinquishes attachment to any reward, O Arjun, it is considered renunciation in the nature of goodness.
verses.widget_line: When one performs his prescribed duty only because it ought to be done, and renounces all material association and all attachment to the fruit, his renunciation is in the mode of goodness, O Arjuna.
verses.personalized: When one performs his prescribed duty only because it ought to be done, and renounces all material association and all attachment to the fruit, his renunciation is in the mode of goodness, O {name}.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
न द्वेष्ट्यकुशलं कर्म कुशले नानुषज्जते ।
त्यागी सत्त्वसमाविष्टो मेधावी छिन्नसंशयः ॥१०॥
verses.transliteration:
na dveṣhṭy akuśhalaṁ karma kuśhale nānuṣhajjate
tyāgī sattva-samāviṣhṭo medhāvī chinna-saṁśhayaḥ
verses.translation_full: Those who neither avoid disagreeable work nor seek work because it is agreeable are persons of true renunciation. They are endowed with the quality of the mode of goodness and have no doubts (about the nature of work).
verses.widget_line: The intelligent renouncer situated in the mode of goodness, neither hateful of inauspicious work nor attached to auspicious work, has no doubts about work.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
न हि देहभृता शक्यं त्यक्तुं कर्माण्यशेषतः ।
यस्तु कर्मफलत्यागी स त्यागीत्यभिधीयते ॥११॥
verses.transliteration:
na hi deha-bhṛitā śakyaṁ tyaktuṁ karmāṇy aśheṣhataḥ
yas tu karma-phala-tyāgī sa tyāgīty abhidhīyate
verses.translation_full: For the embodied being, it is impossible to give up activities entirely. But those who relinquish the fruits of their actions are said to be truly renounced.
verses.widget_line: It is indeed impossible for an embodied being to give up all activities. But he who renounces the fruits of action is called one who has truly renounced.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अनिष्टमिष्टं मिश्रं च त्रिविधं कर्मणः फलम् ।
भवत्यत्यागिनां प्रेत्य न तु सन्न्यासिनां क्वचित् ॥१२॥
verses.transliteration:
aniṣhṭam iṣhṭaṁ miśhraṁ cha tri-vidhaṁ karmaṇaḥ phalam
bhavaty atyāgināṁ pretya na tu sannyāsināṁ kvachit
verses.translation_full: The three-fold fruits of actions—pleasant, unpleasant, and mixed—accrue even after death to those who are attached to personal reward. But, for those who renounce the fruits of their actions, there are no such results in the here or hereafter.
verses.widget_line: For one who is not renounced, the threefold fruits of action—desirable, undesirable, and mixed—accrue after death. But those who are in the renounced order have no such results to suffer or enjoy.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
पञ्चैतानि महाबाहो कारणानि निबोध मे ।
साङ्ख्ये कृतान्ते प्रोक्तानि सिद्धये सर्वकर्मणाम् ॥१३॥
verses.transliteration:
pañchaitāni mahā-bāho kāraṇāni nibodha me
sāṅkhye kṛitānte proktāni siddhaye sarva-karmaṇām
verses.translation_full: O Arjun, now learn from Me about the five factors that have been mentioned for the accomplishment of all actions in the doctrine of Sānkhya, which explains how to stop the reactions of karmas.
verses.widget_line: O mighty-armed one, learn from Me the five factors for the accomplishment of all action. These are declared in the sankhya philosophy to be the completion of all action.
verses.personalized: O {name}, learn from Me the five factors for the accomplishment of all action. These are declared in the sankhya philosophy to be the completion of all action.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अधिष्ठानं तथा कर्ता करणं च पृथग्विधम् ।
विविधाश्च पृथक्चेष्टा दैवं चैवात्र पञ्चमम् ॥१४॥
verses.transliteration:
adhiṣhṭhānaṁ tathā kartā karaṇaṁ cha pṛithag-vidham
vividhāśh cha pṛithak cheṣhṭā daivaṁ chaivātra pañchamam
verses.translation_full: The body, the doer (soul), the various senses, the many kinds of efforts, and Divine Providence—these are the five factors of action.
verses.widget_line: The place of action, the performer, the various senses, the many different kinds of endeavor, and ultimately the Supersoul—these are the five factors of action.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
शरीरवाङ्मनोभिर्यत्कर्म प्रारभते नरः ।
न्याय्यं वा विपरीतं वा पञ्चैते तस्य हेतवः ॥१५॥
verses.transliteration:
śharīra-vāṅ-manobhir yat karma prārabhate naraḥ
nyāyyaṁ vā viparītaṁ vā pañchaite tasya hetavaḥ
verses.translation_full: These five are the contributory factors for whatever action is performed, whether proper or improper, with body, speech, or mind. Those who do not understand this regard the soul as the only doer. With their impure intellects they cannot see things as they are.
verses.widget_line: Whatever right or wrong action a man performs by body, mind, or speech is caused by these five factors.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
तत्रैवं सति कर्तारमात्मानं केवलं तु यः ।
पश्यत्यकृतबुद्धित्वान्न स पश्यति दुर्मतिः ॥१६॥
verses.transliteration:
tatraivaṁ sati kartāram ātmānaṁ kevalaṁ tu yaḥ
paśhyaty akṛita-buddhitvān na sa paśhyati durmatiḥ
verses.translation_full: These five are the contributory factors for whatever action is performed, whether proper or improper, with body, speech, or mind. Those who do not understand this regard the soul as the only doer. With their impure intellects they cannot see things as they are.
verses.widget_line: Therefore one who thinks himself the only doer, not considering the five factors, is certainly not very intelligent and cannot see things as they are.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यस्य नाहङ्कृतो भावो बुद्धिर्यस्य न लिप्यते ।
हत्वाऽपि स इमाँल्लोकान्न हन्ति न निबध्यते ॥१७॥
verses.transliteration:
yasya nāhaṅkṛito bhāvo buddhir yasya na lipyate
hatvā 'pi sa imāṁl lokān na hanti na nibadhyate
verses.translation_full: Those who are free from the ego of being the doer, and whose intellect is unattached, though they may slay living beings, they neither kill nor are they bound by actions.
verses.widget_line: One who is not motivated by false ego, whose intelligence is not entangled, though he kills men in this world, does not kill. Nor is he bound by his actions.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं परिज्ञाता त्रिविधा कर्मचोदना ।
करणं कर्म कर्तेति त्रिविधः कर्मसङ्ग्रहः ॥१८॥
verses.transliteration:
jñānaṁ jñeyaṁ parijñātā tri-vidhā karma-chodanā
karaṇaṁ karma karteti tri-vidhaḥ karma-saṅgrahaḥ
verses.translation_full: Knowledge, the object of knowledge, and the knower—these are the three factors that induce action. The instrument of action, the act itself, and the doer—these are the three constituents of action.
verses.widget_line: Knowledge, the object of knowledge, and the knower are the three factors that motivate action; the senses, the work, and the doer are the three constituents of action.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
ज्ञानं कर्म च कर्ता च त्रिधैव गुणभेदतः ।
प्रोच्यते गुणसङ्ख्याने यथावच्छृणु तान्यपि ॥१९॥
verses.transliteration:
jñānaṁ karma cha kartā cha tridhaiva guṇa-bhedataḥ
prochyate guṇa-saṅkhyāne yathāvach chhṛiṇu tāny api
verses.translation_full: Knowledge, action, and the doer are declared to be of three kinds in the Sānkhya philosophy, distinguished according to the three modes of material nature. Listen, and I will explain their distinctions to you.
verses.widget_line: According to the three different modes of material nature, there are three kinds of knowledge, action, and performer of action. Now hear of them from Me.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
सर्वभूतेषु येनैकं भावमव्ययमीक्षते ।
अविभक्तं विभक्तेषु तज्ज्ञानं विद्धि सात्त्विकम् ॥२०॥
verses.transliteration:
sarva-bhūteṣhu yenaikaṁ bhāvam avyayam īkṣhate
avibhaktaṁ vibhakteṣhu taj jñānaṁ viddhi sāttvikam
verses.translation_full: Understand that knowledge to be in the mode of goodness by which a person sees one undivided imperishable reality within all diverse living beings.
verses.widget_line: That knowledge by which one undivided spiritual nature is seen in all living entities, though they are divided into innumerable forms, you should understand to be in the mode of goodness.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
पृथक्त्वेन तु यज्ज्ञानं नानाभावान्पृथग्विधान् ।
वेत्ति सर्वेषु भूतेषु तज्ज्ञानं विद्धि राजसम् ॥२१॥
verses.transliteration:
pṛithaktvena tu yaj jñānaṁ nānā-bhāvān pṛithag-vidhān
vetti sarveṣhu bhūteṣhu taj jñānaṁ viddhi rājasam
verses.translation_full: That knowledge is to be considered in the mode of passion by which one sees manifold living entities in diverse bodies as individual and unconnected.
verses.widget_line: That knowledge by which one sees that in every different body there is a different type of living entity you should understand to be in the mode of passion.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यत्तु कृत्स्नवदेकस्मिन्कार्ये सक्तमहैतुकम् ।
अतत्त्वार्थवदल्पं च तत्तामसमुदाहृतम् ॥२२॥
verses.transliteration:
yat tu kṛitsna-vad ekasmin kārye saktam ahaitukam
atattvārtha-vad alpaṁ cha tat tāmasam udāhṛitam
verses.translation_full: That knowledge is said to be in the mode of ignorance where one is engrossed in a fragmental concept as if it encompasses the whole, and which is neither grounded in reason nor based on the truth.
verses.widget_line: That knowledge by which one is attached to one kind of work as the all in all, without knowledge of the truth, and which is very meager, is in the mode of darkness.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
नियतं सङ्गरहितमरागद्वेषतः कृतम् ।
अफलप्रेप्सुना कर्म यत्तत्सात्त्विकमुच्यते ॥२३॥
verses.transliteration:
niyataṁ saṅga-rahitam arāga-dveṣhataḥ kṛitam
aphala-prepsunā karma yat tat sāttvikam uchyate
verses.translation_full: Action that is in accordance with the scriptures, free from attachment and aversion, and done without desire for rewards, is in the mode of goodness.
verses.widget_line: That action which is regulated and which is performed without attachment, without love or hatred, and without desire for fruitive results is in the mode of goodness.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यत्तु कामेप्सुना कर्म साहङ्कारेण वा पुनः ।
क्रियते बहुलायासं तद्राजसमुदाहृतम् ॥२४॥
verses.transliteration:
yat tu kāmepsunā karma sāhaṅkāreṇa vā punaḥ
kriyate bahulāyāsaṁ tad rājasam udāhṛitam
verses.translation_full: Action that is prompted by selfish desire, enacted with pride, and full of stress, is in the nature of passion.
verses.widget_line: Action performed with great effort by one seeking to gratify his desires, and enacted from a sense of false ego, is in the mode of passion.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अनुबन्धं क्षयं हिंसामनपेक्ष्य च पौरुषम् ।
मोहादारभ्यते कर्म यत्तत्तामसमुच्यते ॥२५॥
verses.transliteration:
anubandhaṁ kṣhayaṁ hiṁsām anapekṣhya cha pauruṣham
mohād ārabhyate karma yat tat tāmasam uchyate
verses.translation_full: That action is declared to be in the mode of ignorance, which is begun out of delusion, without thought to one's own ability, and disregarding consequences, loss, and injury to others.
verses.widget_line: That action performed in illusion, in disregard of scriptural injunctions, and without concern for future bondage or for violence or distress caused to others is in the mode of ignorance.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
मुक्तसङ्गोऽनहंवादी धृत्युत्साहसमन्वितः ।
सिद्ध्यसिद्ध्योर्निर्विकारः कर्ता सात्त्विक उच्यते ॥२६॥
verses.transliteration:
mukta-saṅgo 'nahaṁ-vādī dhṛity-utsāha-samanvitaḥ
siddhy-asiddhyor nirvikāraḥ kartā sāttvika uchyate
verses.translation_full: The performer is said to be in the mode of goodness, when he or she is free from egotism and attachment, endowed with enthusiasm and determination, and equipoised in success and failure.
verses.widget_line: The worker who is free from all material attachments and false ego, who is enthusiastic and resolute and who is indifferent to success or failure, is a worker in the mode of goodness.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
रागी कर्मफलप्रेप्सुर्लुब्धो हिंसात्मकोऽशुचिः ।
हर्षशोकान्वितः कर्ता राजसः परिकीर्तितः ॥२७॥
verses.transliteration:
rāgī karma-phala-prepsur lubdho hiṁsātmako 'śhuchiḥ
harṣha-śhokānvitaḥ kartā rājasaḥ parikīrtitaḥ
verses.translation_full: The performer is considered in the mode of passion when he or she craves the fruits of the work, is covetous, violent-natured, impure, and moved by joy and sorrow.
verses.widget_line: The worker who is attached to work and the fruits of work, desiring to enjoy those fruits, and who is greedy, always envious, impure, and moved by joy and sorrow, is in the mode of passion.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अयुक्तः प्राकृतः स्तब्धः शठो नैष्कृतिकोऽलसः ।
विषादी दीर्घसूत्री च कर्ता तामस उच्यते ॥२८॥
verses.transliteration:
ayuktaḥ prākṛitaḥ stabdhaḥ śhaṭho naiṣhkṛitiko 'lasaḥ
viṣhādī dīrgha-sūtrī cha kartā tāmasa uchyate
verses.translation_full: A performer in the mode of ignorance is one who is undisciplined, vulgar, stubborn, deceitful, slothful, despondent, and a procrastinator.
verses.widget_line: The worker who is always engaged in work against the injunctions of scripture, who is materialistic, obstinate, cheating, and expert in insulting others, and who is lazy, morose, and procrastinating is in the mode of ignorance.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
बुद्धेर्भेदं धृतेश्चैव गुणतस्त्रिविधं शृणु ।
प्रोच्यमानमशेषेण पृथक्त्वेन धनञ्जय ॥२९॥
verses.transliteration:
buddher bhedaṁ dhṛiteśh chaiva guṇatas tri-vidhaṁ śhṛiṇu
prochyamānam aśheṣheṇa pṛithaktvena dhanañjaya
verses.translation_full: Hear now, O Arjun, of the distinctions of intellect and determination, according to the three modes of material nature, as I describe them in detail.
verses.widget_line: O winner of wealth, now please listen as I describe to you in detail the different kinds of understanding and determination, according to the three modes of material nature.
verses.personalized: O {name}, now please listen as I describe to you in detail the different kinds of understanding and determination, according to the three modes of material nature.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
प्रवृत्तिं च निवृत्तिं च कार्याकार्ये भयाभये ।
बन्धं मोक्षं च या वेत्ति बुद्धिः सा पार्थ सात्त्विकी ॥३०॥
verses.transliteration:
pravṛittiṁ cha nivṛittiṁ cha kāryākārye bhayābhaye
bandhaṁ mokṣhaṁ cha yā vetti buddhiḥ sā pārtha sāttvikī
verses.translation_full: The intellect is said to be in the nature of goodness, O Parth, when it understands what is proper action and improper action, what is duty and non-duty, what is to be feared and what is not to be feared, what is binding and what is liberating.
verses.widget_line: That understanding by which one knows what ought to be done and what ought not to be done, what is to be feared and what is not to be feared, what is binding and what is liberating, is understanding in the mode of goodness, O Partha.
verses.personalized: That understanding by which one knows what ought to be done and what ought not to be done, what is to be feared and what is not to be feared, what is binding and what is liberating, is understanding in the mode of goodness, O {name}.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यया धर्ममधर्मं च कार्यं चाकार्यमेव च ।
अयथावत्प्रजानाति बुद्धिः सा पार्थ राजसी ॥३१॥
verses.transliteration:
yayā dharmam adharmaṁ cha kāryaṁ chākāryam eva cha
ayathāvat prajānāti buddhiḥ sā pārtha rājasī
verses.translation_full: The intellect is considered in the mode of passion when it is confused between righteousness and unrighteousness, and cannot distinguish between right and wrong conduct, O Parth.
verses.widget_line: That understanding which cannot distinguish between religion and irreligion, between action that should be done and action that should not be done, is in the mode of passion, O Partha.
verses.personalized: That understanding which cannot distinguish between religion and irreligion, between action that should be done and action that should not be done, is in the mode of passion, O {name}.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अधर्मं धर्ममिति या मन्यते तमसावृता ।
सर्वार्थान्विपरीतांश्च बुद्धिः सा पार्थ तामसी ॥३२॥
verses.transliteration:
adharmaṁ dharmam iti yā manyate tamasāvṛitā
sarvārthān viparītāṁśh cha buddhiḥ sā pārtha tāmasī
verses.translation_full: That intellect which is shrouded in darkness, imagining irreligion to be religion, and perceiving untruth to be the truth, is of the nature of ignorance, O Parth.
verses.widget_line: That understanding which considers irreligion to be religion and religion to be irreligion, under the spell of illusion and darkness, and strives always in the wrong direction, is in the mode of ignorance, O Partha.
verses.personalized: That understanding which considers irreligion to be religion and religion to be irreligion, under the spell of illusion and darkness, and strives always in the wrong direction, is in the mode of ignorance, O {name}.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
धृत्या यया धारयते मनःप्राणेन्द्रियक्रियाः ।
योगेनाव्यभिचारिण्या धृतिः सा पार्थ सात्त्विकी ॥३३॥
verses.transliteration:
dhṛityā yayā dhārayate manaḥ-prāṇendriya-kriyāḥ
yogenāvyabhicāriṇyā dhṛitiḥ sā pārtha sāttvikī
verses.translation_full: The steadfast willpower that is developed through Yog, and which sustains the activities of the mind, the life-airs, and the senses, O Parth, is said to be determination in the mode of goodness.
verses.widget_line: That determination which is unbreakable, sustained with steadfastness through yoga practice, and which controls the activities of the mind, life, and senses is determination in the mode of goodness, O Partha.
verses.personalized: That determination which is unbreakable, sustained with steadfastness through yoga practice, and which controls the activities of the mind, life, and senses is determination in the mode of goodness, O {name}.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यया तु धर्मकामार्थान्धृत्या धारयतेऽर्जुन ।
प्रसङ्गेन फलाकाङ्क्षी धृतिः सा पार्थ राजसी ॥३४॥
verses.transliteration:
yayā tu dharma-kāmārthān dhṛityā dhārayate 'rjuna
prasaṅgena phalākāṅkṣhī dhṛitiḥ sā pārtha rājasī
verses.translation_full: The steadfast willpower by which one holds on to duty, pleasures, and wealth, out of attachment and desire for rewards, O Arjun, is determination in the mode of passion.
verses.widget_line: That determination by which one holds fast to fruitive results in religion, economic development, and sense gratification is of the nature of passion, O Arjuna.
verses.personalized: That determination by which one holds fast to fruitive results in religion, economic development, and sense gratification is of the nature of passion, O {name}.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यया स्वप्नं भयं शोकं विषादं मदमेव च ।
न विमुञ्चति दुर्मेधा धृतिः सा पार्थ तामसी ॥३५॥
verses.transliteration:
yayā svapnaṁ bhayaṁ śhokaṁ viṣhādaṁ madam eva cha
na vimuñchati durmedhā dhṛitiḥ sā pārtha tāmasī
verses.translation_full: That unintelligent resolve is said to be determination in the mode of ignorance, in which one does not give up dreaming, fearing, grieving, despair, and conceit.
verses.widget_line: That determination which cannot go beyond dreaming, fearfulness, lamentation, moroseness, and illusion—such unintelligent determination is in the mode of darkness, O Partha.
verses.personalized: That determination which cannot go beyond dreaming, fearfulness, lamentation, moroseness, and illusion—such unintelligent determination is in the mode of darkness, O {name}.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
सुखं त्विदानीं त्रिविधं श्रृणु मे भरतर्षभ ।
अभ्यासाद्रमते यत्र दुःखान्तं च निगच्छति ॥३६॥
verses.transliteration:
sukhaṁ tv idānīṁ tri-vidhaṁ śhṛiṇu me bharatarṣhabha
abhyāsād ramate yatra duḥkhāntaṁ cha nigachchhati
verses.translation_full: Now hear from Me, O Arjun, of the three kinds of happiness in which the embodied soul rejoices, and can even reach the end of all suffering.
verses.widget_line: O Arjun, now please hear from Me about the three kinds of happiness by which the conditioned soul enjoys, and by which he sometimes comes to the end of all distress.
verses.personalized: O {name}, now please hear from Me about the three kinds of happiness by which the conditioned soul enjoys, and by which he sometimes comes to the end of all distress.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यत्तदग्रे विषमिव परिणामेऽमृतोपमम् ।
तत्सुखं सात्त्विकं प्रोक्तमात्मबुद्धिप्रसादजम् ॥३७॥
verses.transliteration:
yat tad agre viṣham iva pariṇāme 'mṛitopamam
tat sukhaṁ sāttvikaṁ proktam ātma-buddhi-prasādajam
verses.translation_full: That which seems like poison at first, but tastes like nectar in the end, is said to be happiness in the mode of goodness. It is generated by the pure intellect that is situated in self-knowledge.
verses.widget_line: That which in the beginning may be just like poison but at the end is just like nectar and which awakens one to self-realization is happiness in the mode of goodness.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
विषयेन्द्रियसंयोगाद्यत्तदग्रेऽमृतोपमम् ।
परिणामे विषमिव तत्सुखं राजसं स्मृतम् ॥३८॥
verses.transliteration:
viṣhayendriya-saṁyogād yat tad agre 'mṛitopamam
pariṇāme viṣham iva tat sukhaṁ rājasaṁ smṛitam
verses.translation_full: Happiness is said to be in the mode of passion when it is derived from the contact of the senses with their objects. Such happiness is like nectar at first but poison at the end.
verses.widget_line: That happiness which is derived from contact of the senses with their objects and which appears like nectar at first but poison at the end is of the nature of passion.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यदग्रे चानुबन्धे च सुखं मोहनमात्मनः ।
निद्रालस्यप्रमादोत्थं तत्तामसमुदाहृतम् ॥३९॥
verses.transliteration:
yad agre chānubandhe cha sukhaṁ mohanam ātmanaḥ
nidrālasya-pramādotthaṁ tat tāmasam udāhṛitam
verses.translation_full: That happiness which covers the nature of the self from beginning to end, and which is derived from sleep, indolence, and negligence, is said to be in the mode of ignorance.
verses.widget_line: That happiness which is blind to self-realization, which is delusion from beginning to end, and which arises from sleep, laziness, and illusion is of the nature of ignorance.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
न तदस्ति पृथिव्यां वा दिवि देवेषु वा पुनः ।
सत्त्वं प्रकृतिजैर्मुक्तं यदेभिः स्यात्त्रिभिर्गुणैः ॥४०॥
verses.transliteration:
na tad asti pṛithivyāṁ vā divi deveṣhu vā punaḥ
sattvaṁ prakṛiti-jair muktaṁ yad ebhiḥ syāt tribhir guṇaiḥ
verses.translation_full: No living being on earth or the higher celestial abodes of this material realm is free from the influence of these three modes of nature.
verses.widget_line: There is no being existing, either here or among the demigods in the higher planetary systems, which is freed from these three modes born of material nature.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
ब्राह्मणक्षत्रियविशां शूद्राणां च परन्तप ।
कर्माणि प्रविभक्तानि स्वभावप्रभवैर्गुणैः ॥४१॥
verses.transliteration:
brāhmaṇa-kṣhatriya-viśhāṁ śhūdrāṇāṁ cha parantapa
karmāṇi pravibhaktāni svabhāva-prabhavair guṇaiḥ
verses.translation_full: The duties of the Brahmins, Kshatriyas, Vaishyas, and Shudras—are distributed according to their qualities, in accordance with their guṇas (and not by birth).
verses.widget_line: O chastiser of the enemy, the duties of brahmanas, kshatriyas, vaishyas, and shudras are distributed according to the qualities born of their own natures in accordance with the material modes.
verses.personalized: O {name}, the duties of brahmanas, kshatriyas, vaishyas, and shudras are distributed according to the qualities born of their own natures in accordance with the material modes.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
शमो दमस्तपः शौचं क्षान्तिरार्जवमेव च ।
ज्ञानं विज्ञानमास्तिक्यं ब्रह्मकर्म स्वभावजम् ॥४२॥
verses.transliteration:
śhamo damas tapaḥ śhauchaṁ kṣhāntir ārjavam eva cha
jñānaṁ vijñānam āstikyaṁ brahma-karma svabhāva-jam
verses.translation_full: Tranquility, restraint, austerity, purity, patience, integrity, knowledge, wisdom, and belief in a hereafter—these are the intrinsic qualities of work for Brahmins.
verses.widget_line: Peacefulness, self-control, austerity, purity, tolerance, honesty, knowledge, actual realization, and belief in a future life—these are the natural qualities by which the brahmanas work.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
शौर्यं तेजो धृतिर्दाक्ष्यं युद्धे चाप्यपलायनम् ।
दानमीश्वरभावश्च क्षात्रं कर्म स्वभावजम् ॥४३॥
verses.transliteration:
śhauryaṁ tejo dhṛitir dākṣhyaṁ yuddhe chāpy apalāyanam
dānam īśhvara-bhāvaśh cha kṣhātraṁ karma svabhāva-jam
verses.translation_full: Valor, strength, fortitude, skill in weaponry, resolve never to retreat from battle, large-heartedness in charity, and leadership abilities, these are the natural qualities of work for Kshatriyas.
verses.widget_line: Heroism, power, determination, resourcefulness, courage in battle, generosity, and leadership are the natural qualities of work for the kshatriyas.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
कृषिगौरक्ष्यवाणिज्यं वैश्यकर्म स्वभावजम् ।
परिचर्यात्मकं कर्म शूद्रस्यापि स्वभावजम् ॥४४॥
verses.transliteration:
kṛiṣhi-gau-rakṣhya-vāṇijyaṁ vaiśhya-karma svabhāva-jam
paricharyātmakaṁ karma śhūdrasyāpi svabhāva-jam
verses.translation_full: Agriculture, dairy farming, and commerce are the natural works for those with the qualities of Vaishyas. Serving through work is the natural duty for those with the qualities of Shudras.
verses.widget_line: Farming, cow protection, and business are the natural work for the vaishyas, and for the shudras there is labor and service to others.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
स्वे स्वे कर्मण्यभिरतः संसिद्धिं लभते नरः ।
स्वकर्मनिरतः सिद्धिं यथा विन्दति तच्छृणु ॥४५॥
verses.transliteration:
sve sve karmaṇy abhirataḥ saṁsiddhiṁ labhate naraḥ
sva-karma-nirataḥ siddhiṁ yathā vindati tac chhṛiṇu
verses.translation_full: By fulfilling their duties, born of their innate qualities, human beings can attain perfection. Now hear from Me how one can become perfect by discharging one's prescribed duties.
verses.widget_line: By following his qualities of work, every man can become perfect. Now please hear from Me how this can be done.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यतः प्रवृत्तिर्भूतानां येन सर्वमिदं ततम् ।
स्वकर्मणा तमभ्यर्च्य सिद्धिं विन्दति मानवः ॥४६॥
verses.transliteration:
yataḥ pravṛittir bhūtānāṁ yena sarvam idaṁ tatam
sva-karmaṇā tam abhyarchya siddhiṁ vindati mānavaḥ
verses.translation_full: By performing one's natural occupation, one worships the Creator from whom all living entities have come into being, and by whom the whole universe is pervaded. By such performance of work, a person easily attains perfection.
verses.widget_line: By worship of the Lord, who is the source of all beings and who is all-pervading, a man can attain perfection through performing his own work.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
श्रेयान्स्वधर्मो विगुणः परधर्मात्स्वनुष्ठितात् ।
स्वभावनियतं कर्म कुर्वन्नाप्नोति किल्बिषम् ॥४७॥
verses.transliteration:
śhreyān sva-dharmo viguṇaḥ para-dharmāt sv-anuṣhṭhitāt
svabhāva-niyataṁ karma kurvan nāpnoti kilbiṣham
verses.translation_full: It is better to do one's own dharma, even though imperfectly, than to do another's dharma, even though perfectly. By doing one's innate duties, a person does not incur sin.
verses.widget_line: It is better to engage in one's own occupation, even though one may perform it imperfectly, than to accept another's occupation and perform it perfectly. Duties prescribed according to one's nature are never affected by sinful reactions.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
सहजं कर्म कौन्तेय सदोषमपि न त्यजेत् ।
सर्वारम्भा हि दोषेण धूमेनाग्निरिवावृताः ॥४८॥
verses.transliteration:
sahajaṁ karma kaunteya sa-doṣham api na tyajet
sarvārambhā hi doṣheṇa dhūmenāgnir ivāvṛitāḥ
verses.translation_full: One should not abandon duties born of one's nature, even if one sees defects in them, O son of Kunti. Indeed, all endeavors are veiled by some evil, as fire is by smoke.
verses.widget_line: Every endeavor is covered by some fault, just as fire is covered by smoke. Therefore one should not give up the work born of his nature, O son of Kunti, even if such work is full of fault.
verses.personalized: Every endeavor is covered by some fault, just as fire is covered by smoke. Therefore one should not give up the work born of his nature, O {name}, even if such work is full of fault.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
असक्तबुद्धिः सर्वत्र जितात्मा विगतस्पृहः ।
नैष्कर्म्यसिद्धिं परमां संन्यासेनाधिगच्छति ॥४९॥
verses.transliteration:
asakta-buddhiḥ sarvatra jitātmā vigata-spṛihaḥ
naiṣhkarmya-siddhiṁ paramāṁ sannyāsenādhigachchhati
verses.translation_full: Those whose intellect is unattached everywhere, who have mastered the mind, and are free from desires by the practice of renunciation, attain the highest perfection of freedom from action.
verses.widget_line: One who is self-controlled and unattached and who disregards all material enjoyments can obtain, by practice of renunciation, the highest perfect stage of freedom from reaction.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
सिद्धिं प्राप्तो यथा ब्रह्म तथाप्नोति निबोध मे ।
समासेनैव कौन्तेय निष्ठा ज्ञानस्य या परा ॥५०॥
verses.transliteration:
siddhiṁ prāpto yathā brahma tathāpnoti nibodha me
samāsenaiva kaunteya niṣhṭhā jñānasya yā parā
verses.translation_full: Hear from Me briefly, O Arjun, and I shall explain how one, who has attained perfection (of cessation of actions), can also attain Brahman by being firmly fixed in transcendental knowledge.
verses.widget_line: O son of Kunti, learn from Me how one who has achieved this perfection can attain to the supreme stage of knowledge, the stage of Brahman, by acting in the way I shall now summarize.
verses.personalized: O {name}, learn from Me how one who has achieved this perfection can attain to the supreme stage of knowledge, the stage of Brahman, by acting in the way I shall now summarize.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
बुद्ध्या विशुद्धया युक्तो धृत्यात्मानं नियम्य च ।
शब्दादीन्विषयांस्त्यक्त्वा रागद्वेषौ व्युदस्य च ॥५१॥
verses.transliteration:
buddhyā viśhuddhayā yukto dhṛityātmānaṁ niyamya cha
śhabdādīn viṣhayāṁs tyaktvā rāga-dveṣhau vyudasya cha
verses.translation_full: One becomes fit to attain Brahman when he or she possesses a purified intellect and firmly restrains the senses, abandoning sound and other objects of the senses, casting aside attraction and aversion.
verses.widget_line: Being purified by his intelligence and controlling the mind with determination, giving up the objects of sense gratification, being freed from attachment and hatred, one who lives in a secluded place is always situated in transcendence.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
विविक्तसेवी लघ्वाशी यतवाक्कायमानसः ।
ध्यानयोगपरो नित्यं वैराग्यं समुपाश्रितः ॥५२॥
verses.transliteration:
vivikta-sevī laghv-āśhī yata-vāk-kāya-mānasaḥ
dhyāna-yoga-paro nityaṁ vairāgyaṁ samupāśhritaḥ
verses.translation_full: Such a person relishes solitude, eats lightly, controls body, mind, and speech, is ever engaged in meditation, and practices dispassion.
verses.widget_line: One who is thus transcendentally situated at once realizes the Supreme Brahman and becomes fully joyful. He never laments or desires to have anything. He is equally disposed toward every living entity.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अहङ्कारं बलं दर्पं कामं क्रोधं परिग्रहम् ।
विमुच्य निर्ममः शान्तो ब्रह्मभूयाय कल्पते ॥५३॥
verses.transliteration:
ahaṅkāraṁ balaṁ darpaṁ kāmaṁ krodhaṁ parigraham
vimucya nirmamaḥ śhānto brahma-bhūyāya kalpate
verses.translation_full: Free from egotism, violence, arrogance, desire, possessiveness of property, and selfishness, such a person, situated in tranquility, is fit for union with Brahman (i.e., realization of the Absolute Truth as Brahman).
verses.widget_line: By devotion he knows Me in truth, who and what I am. Then knowing Me in truth, he immediately enters into Me. One can never become perfect by renouncing work alone.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
ब्रह्मभूतः प्रसन्नात्मा न शोचति न काङ्क्षति ।
समः सर्वेषु भूतेषु मद्भक्तिं लभते पराम् ॥५४॥
verses.transliteration:
brahma-bhūtaḥ prasannātmā na śhochati na kāṅkṣhati
samaḥ sarveṣhu bhūteṣhu mad-bhaktiṁ labhate parām
verses.translation_full: One situated in the transcendental Brahman realization becomes mentally serene, neither grieving nor desiring. Being equitably disposed toward all living beings, such a yogi attains supreme devotion unto Me.
verses.widget_line: One who is thus transcendentally situated realizes the Supreme Brahman and becomes fully joyful. He never laments or desires to have anything. He is equally disposed toward every living entity.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
भक्त्या मामभिजानाति यावान्यश्चास्मि तत्त्वतः ।
ततो मां तत्त्वतो ज्ञात्वा विशते तदनन्तरम् ॥५५॥
verses.transliteration:
bhaktyā mām abhijānāti yāvān yaśh chāsmi tattvataḥ
tato māṁ tattvato jñātvā viśhate tad-anantaram
verses.translation_full: Only by loving devotion to Me does one come to know who I am in Truth. Then, having come to know Me, My devotee enters into full consciousness of Me.
verses.widget_line: By devotional service one can understand Me as I am, who and what I am. Then understanding Me in truth, one immediately enters into Me.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
सर्वकर्माण्यपि सदा कुर्वाणो मद्व्यपाश्रयः ।
मत्प्रसादादवाप्नोति शाश्वतं पदमव्ययम् ॥५६॥
verses.transliteration:
sarva-karmāṇy api sadā kurvāṇo mad-vyapāśhrayaḥ
mat-prasādād avāpnoti śhāśhvataṁ padam avyayam
verses.translation_full: My devotees, though performing all kinds of actions, take full refuge in Me. By My grace, they attain the eternal and imperishable abode.
verses.widget_line: Although engaged in all kinds of activities, My pure devotee, under My protection, reaches the eternal and imperishable abode by My grace.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
सर्वकर्माणि मनसा संन्यस्यास्ते सुखं वशी ।
नवद्वारे पुरे देही नैव कुर्वन्न कारयन् ॥५७॥
verses.transliteration:
sarva-karmāṇi manasā sannyasyāste sukhaṁ vaśhī
navadvāre pure dehī naiva kurvan na kārayan
verses.translation_full: Dedicate your every activity to Me, making Me your supreme goal. Taking shelter of the Yog of the intellect, keep your consciousness absorbed in Me always.
verses.widget_line: In all activities just depend upon Me and work always under My protection. In such devotional service, be fully conscious of Me.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यस्य मानसि कर्माणि मामकर्मानुपासिनः ।
असङ्कल्पसमुद्धारः जहात्याशु भवबन्धनात् ॥५८॥
verses.transliteration:
yasya mānasi karmāṇi māmakarmānupāsinaḥ
asaṅkalpa-samuddhāraḥ jahāty āśhu bhava-bandhanāt
verses.translation_full: If you always remember Me, by My grace you shall overcome all obstacles and difficulties. But if, due to pride, you do not listen to My advice, you will perish.
verses.widget_line: If you become conscious of Me, you will pass over all the obstacles of conditional life by My grace. If, however, you do not work in such consciousness but act through false ego, you will be lost.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
यदहङ्कारमाश्रित्य न योत्स्य इति मन्यसे ।
मिथ्यैष व्यवसायस्ते प्रकृतिस्त्वां नियोक्ष्यति ॥५९॥
verses.transliteration:
yad ahaṅkāram āśhritya na yotsya iti manyase
mithyaiṣha vyavasāyas te prakṛitis tvāṁ niyokṣhyati
verses.translation_full: If, motivated by pride, you think, "I shall not fight," your decision will be in vain. Your own nature will compel you to fight.
verses.widget_line: If you do not act according to My direction and do not fight, then you will be falsely directed. By your nature, you will have to be engaged in warfare.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
स्वभावजेन कौन्तेय निबद्धः स्वेन कर्मणा ।
कर्तुं नेच्छसि यन्मोहात्करिष्यस्यवशोऽपि तत् ॥६०॥
verses.transliteration:
svabhāva-jena kaunteya nibaddhaḥ svena karmaṇā
kartuṁ nechchhasi yan mohāt kariṣhyasy avaśho 'pi tat
verses.translation_full: O Arjun, that action which out of delusion you do not wish to do, you will be driven to do it by your own inclination, born of your own material nature.
verses.widget_line: O son of Kunti, by the delusion of duality you are now being influenced. From fear you do not want to fight, but your own nature will compel you to fight.
verses.personalized: O {name}, by the delusion of duality you are now being influenced. From fear you do not want to fight, but your own nature will compel you to fight.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
ईश्वरः सर्वभूतानां हृद्देशेऽर्जुन तिष्ठति ।
भ्रामयन्सर्वभूतानि यन्त्रारूढानि मायया ॥६१॥
verses.transliteration:
īśhvaraḥ sarva-bhūtānāṁ hṛid-deśhe 'rjuna tiṣhṭhati
bhrāmayan sarva-bhūtāni yantrārūḍhāni māyayā
verses.translation_full: The Supreme Lord dwells in the hearts of all living beings, O Arjun. According to their karmas, He directs the wanderings of the souls, who are seated on a machine made of material energy.
verses.widget_line: The Supreme Lord is situated in everyone's heart, O Arjuna, and is directing the wanderings of all living entities, who are seated as on a machine, made of the material energy.
verses.personalized: The Supreme Lord is situated in everyone's heart, O {name}, and is directing the wanderings of all living entities, who are seated as on a machine, made of the material energy.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
तमेव शरणं गच्छ सर्वभावेन भारत ।
तत्प्रसादात्परां शान्तिं स्थानं प्राप्स्यसि शाश्वतम् ॥६२॥
verses.transliteration:
tam eva śharaṇaṁ gaccha sarva-bhāvena bhārata
tat-prasādāt parāṁ śhāntiṁ sthānaṁ prāpsyasi śhāśhvatam
verses.translation_full: Surrender exclusively unto Him with your whole being, O Bharat. By His grace, you will attain perfect peace and the eternal abode.
verses.widget_line: O scion of Bharata, surrender unto Him utterly. By His grace you will attain transcendental peace and the supreme and eternal abode.
verses.personalized: O {name}, surrender unto Him utterly. By His grace you will attain transcendental peace and the supreme and eternal abode.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
इति ते ज्ञानमाख्यातं गुह्याद्गुह्यतरं मया ।
विमृश्यैतदशेषेण यथेच्छसि तथा कुरु ॥६३॥
verses.transliteration:
iti te jñānam ākhyātaṁ guhyād guhyataraṁ mayā
vimṛiśhyaitad aśheṣheṇa yathecchasi tathā kuru
verses.translation_full: Thus, I have explained to you this knowledge that is more secret than all secrets. Ponder over it deeply, and then do as you wish.
verses.widget_line: Thus I have explained to you knowledge still more confidential. Deliberate on this fully, and then do what you wish to do.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
सर्वगुह्यतमं भूयः शृणु मे परमं वचः ।
इष्टोऽसि मे दृढमिति ततो वक्ष्यामि ते हितम् ॥६४॥
verses.transliteration:
sarva-guhyatamaṁ bhūyaḥ śhṛiṇu me paramaṁ vachaḥ
iṣhṭo 'si me dṛiḍham iti tato vakṣhyāmi te hitam
verses.translation_full: Hear again My supreme instruction, the most confidential of all knowledge. I am revealing this for your benefit because you are very dear to Me.
verses.widget_line: Because you are very dear to Me, I am revealing to you My supreme instruction, the most confidential knowledge of all. Hear this from Me, for it is for your benefit.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
मन्मना भव मद्भक्तो मद्याजी मां नमस्कुरु ।
मामेवैष्यसि सत्यं ते प्रतिजाने प्रियोऽसि मे ॥६५॥
verses.transliteration:
man-manā bhava mad-bhakto mad-yājī māṁ namaskuru
mām evaiṣhyasi satyaṁ te pratijāne priyo 'si me
verses.translation_full: Always think of Me, be devoted to Me, worship Me, and offer obeisance to Me. Doing so, you will certainly come to Me. This is My pledge to you, for you are very dear to Me.
verses.widget_line: Always think of Me, become My devotee, worship Me, and offer your homage unto Me. Thus you will come to Me without fail. I promise you this because you are My very dear friend.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
सर्वधर्मान्परित्यज्य मामेकं शरणं व्रज ।
अहं त्वां सर्वपापेभ्यो मोक्षयिष्यामि मा शुचः ॥६६॥
verses.transliteration:
sarva-dharmān parityajya mām ekaṁ śharaṇaṁ vraja
ahaṁ tvāṁ sarva-pāpebhyo mokṣhayiṣhyāmi mā śhuchaḥ
verses.translation_full: Abandon all varieties of dharmas and simply surrender unto Me alone. I shall liberate you from all sinful reactions; do not fear.
verses.widget_line: Abandon all varieties of religion and just surrender unto Me. I shall deliver you from all sinful reactions. Do not fear.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
इदं ते नातपस्काय नाभक्ताय कदाचन ।
न चाशुश्रूषवे वाच्यं न च मां योऽभ्यसूयति ॥६७॥
verses.transliteration:
idaṁ te nātapaskāya nābhaktāya kadāchana
na chāśhuśhrūṣhave vāchyaṁ na cha māṁ yo 'bhyasūyati
verses.translation_full: This instruction should never be explained to those who are not austere or to those who are not devoted. It should also not be spoken to those who are averse to listening (to spiritual topics), and especially not to those who are envious of Me.
verses.widget_line: This confidential knowledge may never be explained to those who are not austere, or devoted, or engaged in devotional service, nor to one who is envious of Me.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
य इमं परमं गुह्यं मद्भक्तेष्वभिधास्यति ।
भक्तिं मयि परां कृत्वा मामेवैष्यत्यसंशयः ॥६८॥
verses.transliteration:
ya imaṁ paramaṁ guhyaṁ mad-bhakteṣhv abhidhāsyati
bhaktiṁ mayi parāṁ kṛitvā mām evaiṣhyaty asaṁśhayaḥ
verses.translation_full: Amongst My devotees, those who teach this most confidential knowledge perform the greatest act of love. They will come to Me, without doubt.
verses.widget_line: For one who explains this supreme secret to the devotees, pure devotional service is guaranteed, and at the end he will come back to Me.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
न च तस्मान्मनुष्येषु कश्चिन्मे प्रियकृत्तमः ।
भविता न च मे तस्मादन्यः प्रियतरो भुवि ॥६९॥
verses.transliteration:
na cha tasmān manuṣhyeṣhu kaśhchin me priya-kṛittamaḥ
bhavitā na cha me tasmād anyaḥ priyataro bhuvi
verses.translation_full: No human being does more loving service to Me than they; nor shall there ever be anyone on this earth more dear to Me.
verses.widget_line: There is no servant in this world more dear to Me than he, nor will there ever be one more dear.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
अध्येष्यते च य इमं धर्म्यं संवादमावयोः ।
ज्ञानयज्ञेन तेनाहमिष्टः स्यामिति मे मतिः ॥७०॥
verses.transliteration:
adhyeṣhyate cha ya imaṁ dharmyaṁ saṁvādam āvayoḥ
jñāna-yajñena tenāham iṣhṭaḥ syām iti me matiḥ
verses.translation_full: And I proclaim that those who study this sacred dialogue of ours will worship Me (with their intellect) through the sacrifice of knowledge; such is My view.
verses.widget_line: And I declare that one who studies this sacred conversation of ours worships Me by his intelligence.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
श्रद्धावाननसूयश्च शृणुयादपि यो नरः ।
सोऽपि मुक्तः शुभाँल्लोकान्प्राप्नुयात्पुण्यकर्मणाम् ॥७१॥
verses.transliteration:
śhraddhāvān anasūyaśh cha śhṛiṇuyād api yo naraḥ
so 'pi muktaḥ śhubhāṁl lokān prāpnuyāt puṇya-karmaṇām
verses.translation_full: Even those who only listen to this knowledge with faith and without envy will be liberated from sins and attain the auspicious abodes where the pious dwell.
verses.widget_line: And one who listens with faith and without envy becomes free from sinful reactions and attains to the auspicious planets where the pious dwell.

verses.speaker: Krishna
verses.sanskrit:
कच्चिदेतच्छ्रुतं पार्थ त्वयैकाग्रेण चेतसा ।
कच्चिदज्ञानसम्मोहः प्रनष्टस्ते धनञ्जय ॥७२॥
verses.transliteration:
kaccid etac chhrutaṁ pārtha tvayaikāgreṇa cetasā
kaccid ajñāna-sammohaḥ pranaṣhṭas te dhanañjaya
verses.translation_full: O son of Pritha, O conqueror of wealth, have you heard this with an attentive mind? And are your ignorance and illusions now dispelled?
verses.widget_line: O son of Pritha, O conqueror of wealth, have you heard this with an attentive mind? And are your ignorance and illusions now dispelled?
verses.personalized: O {name}, have you heard this with an attentive mind? And are your ignorance and illusions now dispelled?

verses.speaker: Arjuna
verses.translation_full: Arjun said: O Infallible One, by Your grace my illusion has been dispelled, and I am situated in knowledge. I am now free from doubts, and I shall act according to Your instructions.
verses.widget_line: Arjun said: O Infallible One, by Your grace my illusion has been dispelled, and I am situated in knowledge. I am now free from doubts, and I shall act according to Your instructions.

verses.speaker: Sanjay
verses.translation_full: Sanjay said: Thus, have I heard this wonderful conversation between Shree Krishna, the Son of Vasudev, and Arjun, the noble-hearted son of Pritha. So thrilling is the message that my hair is standing on end.
verses.widget_line: Sanjay said: Thus, have I heard this wonderful conversation between Shree Krishna, the Son of Vasudev, and Arjun, the noble-hearted son of Pritha. So thrilling is the message that my hair is standing on end.

verses.speaker: Sanjay
verses.translation_full: By the grace of Veda Vyas, I have heard this supreme and most secret Yog from the Lord of Yog, Shree Krishna Himself.
verses.widget_line: By the grace of Veda Vyas, I have heard this supreme and most secret Yog from the Lord of Yog, Shree Krishna Himself.

verses.speaker: Sanjay
verses.translation_full: As I repeatedly recall this astonishing and wonderful dialogue between the Supreme Lord Shree Krishna and Arjun, O King, I rejoice again and again.
verses.widget_line: As I repeatedly recall this astonishing and wonderful dialogue between the Supreme Lord Shree Krishna and Arjun, O King, I rejoice again and again.

verses.speaker: Sanjay
verses.translation_full: And remembering that most astonishing and wonderful cosmic form of Lord Krishna, great is my astonishment, and I am thrilled with joy over and over again.
verses.widget_line: And remembering that most astonishing and wonderful cosmic form of Lord Krishna, great is my astonishment, and I am thrilled with joy over and over again.

verses.speaker: Sanjay
verses.translation_full: Wherever there is Shree Krishna, the Lord of all Yog, and wherever there is Arjun, the supreme archer, there will also certainly be unending opulence, victory, prosperity, and righteousness. Of this, I am certain.
verses.widget_line: Wherever there is Shree Krishna, the Lord of all Yog, and wherever there is Arjun, the supreme archer, there will also certainly be unending opulence, victory, prosperity, and righteousness. Of this, I am certain.
